kanji:古
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[ふる（い・びる・めかしい）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 古 combines 口 mouth + an object filling it → expectorate *old*, *dried out*, *hard* food → *dry up*; *stale* → *used*; *old-fashioned*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:苦
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[くる（しい・しみ・しむ・しめる）, にが（い）]
raw_etymology:古# hard; dried out + 艸 grass/plant → *bitter* plant that makes the mouth go dry → *stubborn*; *pain*; *agony*; *suffering*; *hardship*; *trying* (experience); *exert oneself*; *worry*; *distress*; *pressure*; *torment*; *torture*; *be at a loss*; *embarrassment*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:固
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[かた（い・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:古# hard; dried out + 囗 circular enclosure → harden about an object → *hard/harden*; *stiff/stiffen* → *resolute*; *stubborn*. Other extended meanings include *tight*, *firm*, *rigid*, *strict*, *solid*, *jell*, *fortify*, *collect*, *settle*, and *settle down*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:個
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ, カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 固# (hardened/hard object) + 人 person → objects and people distinguished one by one (compare 箇 as well as 各) → *individual*; *item* → *counter*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:箇
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 固# (hardened/hard object) + 竹 bamboo → hard pieces of bamboo → *counter* (← bamboo pieces used as counters) → *this*; *that* (← count this piece, count that piece).
tags:[]
___
kanji:个
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The left-hand portion of the character 竹 bamboo, serving as an abbreviated form of 箇 *counter*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:故
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[ゆえ]
raw_etymology:古# hard; dried out + 攵 action indicator → harden into fixed reality → *old*; *die*; *the late* (referring to a deceased person) → *old acquaintance*; *reason*; *cause*; *circumstances*; *past* (← by reason of past circumstances ← stand firm upon established premises, for example, "because such and such is so, therefore X").
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[か（らす・れる）]
raw_etymology:古# hard; dried out + 木 tree/wood → *dried out* tree/wood → *wither*; *die*; *be seasoned*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:居
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[い（る）]
raw_etymology:古# hard + 尸 buttocks → seat oneself on a hard surface → settle/set in place → *be present* → *exist* (compare 有, 在, and 存) → *stay*; *live*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:据
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[す（える・わる）]
raw_etymology:As per 居# (settle/set in place) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → *set*; *place*; *settle down to*; *settle upon*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:湖
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[みずうみ]
raw_etymology:As per 胡# (rough, covering substance) + 水 water → (originally, a silted) *lake*. Now a lake in the general sense of the word.
tags:[]
___
kanji:戸
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[と]
raw_etymology:Originally the left half of 門 gate, representing a rectangular *door* → *household*; *counter for houses*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:雇
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[やと（い・う）]
raw_etymology:戸# door + 隹 short, squat bird → caged bird → *employ*; *hire* (← workers likened to caged birds). *Pay* is an extended meaning (← provide funds to keep the services of an employee).
tags:[]
___
kanji:顧
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[かえり（みる）]
raw_etymology:As per 雇# (caged bird) + 頁 head → caged bird looking about nervously (compare 瞿) → *look back* → *consider*; *review*; *reflect on*; *take note of*; *pay attention to*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:姑
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[しゅうとめ]
raw_etymology:古# old + 女 woman → aged woman → *mother-in-law* (mother of one's husband); *aunt* (sister of one's father). *For the time being* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:胡
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ, コ, ウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:古# hard; dried out + 肉 flesh → rough, dry beard covering the jowls → *barbarian* (← bearded foreigner) → *of foreign origin* (← barbarian foreigners). Compare 蕃.
tags:[]
___
kanji:葫

onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[にんにく]
raw_etymology:As per 胡# (rough, covering substance) + 艸 grass/plant → type of vegetation with a rough surface. In Japanese, 葫 refers to *garlic*.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:貉

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[むじな]
raw_etymology:As per 各# (hard) + 豸 animal that ambles along the ground → slow-moving animal with a ferocious (= hard) bite → *badger*. The variant form 狢 replaces 豸 with 犬 dog/beast.

kanji:祜
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[さいわ（い）]
raw_etymology:古# old + 示 altar/the supernatural → *prosperity* and *happiness* bestowed by the heavens (accruing from proper veneration of ancestors).
tags:[]
___
kanji:呉
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 口# mouth + a head leaning forward → mouths figuratively intersecting in rowdy conversation. The pronunciation of the character simulates the sound of animated conversation, or quarreling. The ancient Chinese kingdom of Wu (Japanese: *Go*) is a borrowed meaning → *China*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:娯
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 呉# (rowdy) + 女 woman → enjoy a woman in rowdy circumstances → *pleasure*; *enjoyment*. 娯 was devised to replace 呉.
tags:[]
___
kanji:虞
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[グ]
kunyomi:[おそれ]
raw_etymology:As per 呉# (rowdy) + 虍 tiger → tigers locked in combat (compare 麌 and 牾). *Give careful thought to* is a borrowed meaning, as are *be anxious about*, *fear*, *apprehension* and *concern*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:誤
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[あやま（り・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 呉# (rowdy) + 言 words → quarrel involving a *mistake* → *err*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:五
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[いつ, いつ（つ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows two crossing lines between two parallel lines. The meaning *five* may be connected with the idea that, when counting to ten on one hand, a person first counts to five, then crosses back the other way to reach ten.
tags:[]
___
kanji:悟
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[さと（り・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 吾# (crossing) + 心 heart/emotions → crossing point between ignorance and *understanding*, *enlightenment* or *comprehension* (compare 晤) → *perception*; *realization*; *notice*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:語
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[かた（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 吾# (crossing of words) + 言 words → the crossing of words in conversation → *converse*; *talk*; *tell* → *narrate*; *saying*; *word*; *language*. 語 was devised to replace 吾.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芽
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガ]
kunyomi:[め, め（ぐむ）]
raw_etymology:As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 艸 grass/plant → buds that mesh → *bud* → *sprout*; *shoot* → *sign*; *beginnings*; *omen* (← buds, sprouts or shoots as harbingers of something new).
tags:[]
___
kanji:邪
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 邑 village/settlement → a crossroads settlement → *evil* (← superstitious association of crossroads with misfortune) → *wrong*; *illness*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:與
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:与
shinjitai_stroke_count:3
onyomi:[ヨ]
kunyomi:[あた（える）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows two objects meshing, to which a seal inscription form adds two pairs of hands → raise an object in unison (compare 擎) → *work jointly*; *participate*. *Give* and *grant* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:擧
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:挙
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[あ（がる・げて・げる）]
raw_etymology:As per 與# (raise in unison) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → *raise*; *action*; *pick up*; *do/perform*; *all/all together*; *in a body*. Also, *indicate* and *demonstrate* (← raise significant points), along with *nominate*, *arrest* and *hold* (a ceremony) (← group actions).
tags:[]
___
kanji:譽
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:誉
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[ヨ]
kunyomi:[ほま（れ）]
raw_etymology:As per 與# (raise in unison) + 言 words → raise words of *praise* in unison → *honor*; *glory*; *fame*; *renown*; *reputation*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:虛
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:虚
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 盧 (sunken) + an element deriving from a seal inscription form of 丘 (geologic basin) → basin notably sunken in the middle (e.g., for the foundation of a building; compare 亞) → *hollow*; *empty* → *false*; *untrue*; *fool*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:御
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ, ギョ]
kunyomi:[お, おん, み]
raw_etymology:As per 卸# (whip) + 彳 movement → whip a horse in driving a chariot → *manage*; *control*; *tame*. Also, *honorary prefix* (originally, with reference to one who manages/controls). *Defend* is a borrowed meaning via 禦.
tags:[]
___
kanji:塑
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 朔# (conjunction of beginning and end points) + 土 earth → *clay figure*; *model* (that returns to clay when destroyed).
tags:[]
___
kanji:互
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[たが（い）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of two notched sticks that fit together in crossing → *mutual*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:兒
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:児
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[ジ, ニ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows, as depicted in 思, a profusion of fine bones in fontanels (open spaces in an infant's skull over which the skull bones eventually fuse) + 儿 person → *infant*; (very young) *child*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:家
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ケ]
kunyomi:[いえ, や]
raw_etymology:宀 roof/building + 豕 pig/boar, here a variant form of 亥# (pig/boar stretched taut for slaughter) → pigs/boars confined in a hut or shed and awaiting slaughter → *house*/*household* → *home*; *family*; *shop*; *store*; *business* → *dealer*; *seller*; *specialist* (← tradesman operating a particular business).
tags:[]
___
kanji:嫁
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[とつ（ぐ）, よめ]
raw_etymology:家# household + 女 woman → woman sent to another household → *marry* (off a daughter) → *bride*; *one's wife*; *one's daughter-in-law*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:稼
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[かせ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 家# (hut/shed) + 禾 grain/rice → *harvested crops* in a storehouse → *plant crops*; *earn a living*; *work* → *gain* (← work).
tags:[]
___
kanji:車
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャ]
kunyomi:[くるま]
raw_etymology:A depiction of the frame of a *vehicle* with dual seats → *wheel*; *wheel-shaped object*; *automobile*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:庫
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:車# vehicle + 广 building → *storehouse* for covering vehicles.
tags:[]
___
kanji:處
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:処
shinjitai_stroke_count:5
onyomi:[ショ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:夂 leg/foot pointed downward + 几# desk/table → stop and rest on/against a desk, chair, or other furniture (compare 居) → *place*; *point in time* (place an object where it belongs). Later, 虍 tiger was appended to suggest the pronunciation, but the present form reverts to the original.
tags:[]
___
kanji:據
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:拠
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[キョ, コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 豦# as described in 劇 (fierce) + 手 hand/action indicator → fierce martial activity resulting in occupation of an enemy position → *base* → *point of origin*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:假
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:仮
shinjitai_stroke_count:6
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[かり]
raw_etymology:叚# false + 人: *false*; *deceptive*; *artificial*; *fake* → *temporary*; *provisional* (← false condition that is only temporary) → *lend*; *borrow* (← temporary loan as opposed to a permanent gift/grant). *Leisure* is a borrowed meaning, via 暇. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character emphasizing the "false" rather than the "conceal" aspect of overlaying the body with a garment, the original sense of 叚.
tags:[]
___
kanji:暇
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[ひま]
raw_etymology:As per 叚# (overlay) + 日 sun/day → figurative overlaying of days/time, creating a surplus → *leisure* (time).
tags:[]
___
kanji:下
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ゲ]
kunyomi:[お（りる・ろす）, くだ（さる・す・る）, さ（がる・げる）, した, しも]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of one line below another, suggesting the idea of *under* (contrast 上) → *low*; *lower*; *below*; *down*; *subordinate*; *descend*. Extended meanings from "down" or "below" include *come/go down*; *fall*; *drop*; *hang* (down/from); *hand down*; *younger*; *have diarrhea*; *abort* (a fetus); *step/move back*; *withdraw*; *leave the capital*; *retire* and *surrender*. By further extension are *carry*, *remove* and *clear a table* (← take down from a table); *grate* (← grated shavings that fall below); *give* and *do someone the favor of *(← hand ← hand down); *obtain* (← be handed/given); and *latter half* (← bottom/lower of two halves).
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:価
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[あたい]
raw_etymology:賈# buy; trade + 人 person → merchant evaluating (= setting a *price/value* on) commodities.
tags:[]
___
kanji:夏
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ゲ]
kunyomi:[なつ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a dancer whose face is covered by a large, square mask (compare 欺). *Summer* is an extended meaning (dance performed in celebration of summer).
tags:[]
___
kanji:亞
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:亜
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[ア]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a square or rectangular foundation, *subordinate* to and pressured by the structure that fills it (compare 虛) → *sub*. *Asia* is via the phonetic construction 亞細亞.
tags:[]
___
kanji:去
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[さ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 囗 circular enclosure + 大 stand outstretched. However, the phonetic evidence suggests that 大 was originally 屰# reverse, suggesting "reverse course and *withdraw* from a particular place" → *leave*; *go*; *pass* (away from); *disappear* → *last* (October etc.) (← past ← pass). Also, *resign* (a post) and *divorce* (← take leave of). Recall that although the modern forms are distinct, the earliest form of 屰 is 大 written in reverse.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a large/great framing square (carpenter's tool), with arms at distant ends → *ruler*; *large/huge* → *much/many*.
tags:[]

kanji:拒

kunyomi:[こば（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 巨# (distant) + 手 hand/action indicator → keep another person at a distance in defending oneself → *defend*; *refuse*; *deny*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:距
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 巨# (distant) + 足 leg/foot → *spur* (that keeps the digits of a fighting cock separated/at a distance from each other) → *distance*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:午
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a square-headed mallet, two or more of which would be used in alternation when pounding grain in the mortar framing the mallets. Latter half of a unit of measurement (e.g., for a group of twelve, 午 covers 7-12) as well as *11 A.M. to 1 P.M.* and *noon* are associated meanings in the sense of the alternating point of a given day. *Horse* (as the seventh sign of the Chinese zodiac) and *south* are borrowed meanings. In derivative characters such as 忤 and 許, 午 exerts the conceptual influence "yield," via the image of yielding so another person can carry out a task such as pounding grain.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 午# (yield) + 言 words → yielding words → *allow*; *accept*; *acknowledge*; *admit*; *permit* → *forgive*; *pardon*; *excuse*.
tags:[]

kanji:碁
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 其# (square/rectangular) + 石 stone → game in which stone pieces are used on a rectangular board/table → (the game of) *go*. Unlike 棋, which can refer to both go and shogi, 碁 refers only to go.

kanji:示
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[しめ（す）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a frame-shaped altar, where the *gods* *manifest* their will → *show*; *indicate*; *display*; *express*. In dual-element characters, 示 nearly always functions as a reference to supernatural forces in general.

kanji:疑
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギ]
kunyomi:[うたが（い・う・わしい）]
raw_etymology:As per 矣# (come to a stop) + an obsolete element of unclear composition and signification. *Question* may be regarded as originating in the idea of "stop and interrogate a person," leading to the associated meanings *suspicion* and *doubt*.

___
kanji:醫
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:医
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 殹# (contain; cover) + 酉 alcohol container → medicinal brew in a container → *doctor*; *cure*. The present form combines 匸 contain/conceal and 矢 arrow, a character originally indicating arrows stretching from beyond a quiver or other container. 医 combines 匸 contain/conceal and 矢 arrow → arrows stretching from beyond a quiver or other container.
tags:[]
___
kanji:姫
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[ひめ]
raw_etymology:The element now appearing as 臣(subject; retainer) was originally 𦣝# as described in 煕 (confine in the jaw/mouth → confine). The addition of 女 woman indicated a woman confined within a palace (compare 嫁) → female palace slave. Via the intermediary sense of "courtly retainer," the character came to indicate a mistress, or court lady, and eventually a *princess*. *Honorific title for a woman of high rank* is by association.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 亥# (stretched taut) + 力 power/energy → stretch a slack object, making it taut → (criminal) *investigation* (← tighten a loose collection of facts and bring to a conclusion).

kunyomi:[おのれ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a primitive loom consisting of two sticks, between which threads are stretched or raised. In derivative characters, 己 suggests "arise." *Oneself*, *sixth in a series* and *sixth calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.

kanji:枝
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[えだ]
raw_etymology:支# branch + 木 tree/wood → *branch*; *bough*; *twig*. 枝 was devised to replace 支 after the latter came to refer to "branch" in primarily abstract senses.
tags:[]
___
kanji:解
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, ゲ]
kunyomi:[と（かす・く・ける）]
raw_etymology:角# horn + an element combining 刀 sword/knife and 牛 cow → *remove* cattle horns in butchering → *dismember*; *break*; *release*; *unravel*; *disentangle*; *untie*; *loosen*; *solve*; *melt* → *understand*; *explain* → *dispel* (← dispel doubts and obtain understanding) → *cancel*. *Comb* is by extension from "disentangle."
tags:[]

kanji:於
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オ, ヨ]
kunyomi:[お（いて・ける）]
raw_etymology:Two parallel lines suggesting an immobile pile of objects + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → flagstaffs of military standards thrust into and filling gaps in parallel objects → *on*; *at*; *in*. *With respect to* and *concerning* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:祇
kanji_stroke_count:8

onyomi:[ギ, シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:示# altar/the supernatural + 氏 family/clan → altar for worshiping a tutelary *earth god*. *Solely* and *only* are borrowed meanings. Distinguish 祇 from 祗.
tags:[]

kanji:齬

___
kanji:其
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[その, それ]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction of a square or rectangular winnow. The relevant bronzeware inscription form appends 几# desk/table. *That* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:箕
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[み]
raw_etymology:As per 其# (winnow) + 竹 bamboo → bamboo *winnow* → *winnowing fan/fork*. 箕 was devised to replace 其 after the latter's transformation of meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:麒
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ, ギ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 其# (square/rectangular) + 鹿 deer → a *fabulous creature* said to make perfect right angles in turning. The creature is supposed to have the trunk of a deer, the tail of a cow and the hooves and mane of a horse, and to emit a multicolored glow (see 麟). The compound 麒麟 refers to the male and female of the beast, with 麒 normally understood to represent the former and 麟 the latter. 麒麟 also applies to the *giraffe*, an animal which may have been the model for the imaginary beast.
tags:[]
___
kanji:矣
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form indicates an arrow hitting a squarish, lumpy target and coming to a stop. For the idea of stopping, compare 處 and 醫. 矣 was eventually employed as a *particle* indicating the completion of an action.
tags:[]
___
kanji:埃
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[アイ]
kunyomi:[ほこり]
raw_etymology:As per 矣# (come to a stop) + 土 earth → *dust* settled over stationary objects.
tags:[]
___
kanji:挨
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[アイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 矣# (come to a stop) + 手 hand/action indicator → cause to come to a stop in order/sequence → *push* (from behind) → *approach*. 挨 is rarely used except in the compound 挨拶 (greeting).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 医# (arrows stretching from beyond a quiver or other container) + 殳 action indicator → echoing sound produced by objects striking each other in a container → *echo*.

tags:[]
___
kanji:矩
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[さしがね]
raw_etymology:As per 巨# (large/great framing tool) + 矢 arrow (→ ancient measuring implement) → *carpenter's square* → *standard*. Compare also 榘 as described in 渠. For the use of 矢 to indicate a measuring implement, compare the original left-hand element of 規.
tags:[]

kanji:渠

___
kanji:冀
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[こいねが（う）]
raw_etymology:異# different + 北 north → a region in northern China (now identified with *Hebei Province*) famed for a special breed of horse, 騏, which featured a distinctive (= different) square pattern on the hide, blue-black in color. *Hope* and *wish for* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:驥
kanji_stroke_count:27
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 冀# (special breed of horse) + 馬 horse → *thoroughbred horse* → *talent*(ed person). 驥 was devised to replace 冀 after 冀 lost its connection with horses.
tags:[]
___
kanji:煕
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[ひか（る）, やわ（ら ぐ）]
raw_etymology:𦣝 derives from a depiction of a square jaw, taken broadly as a body part enabling the mouth to close upon and contain food (compare 頷) and thus associated with confinement. 巸 is 𦣝 (confine) + 巳 (fetus) → fetus confined in a womb. 煕 is as per 巸# (confine) + 火 fire → brilliant fire, confined to a particular place → *bright*; *shine*. *Spread* is via a Japanese reinterpretation of the character (fire spreading within a confined space), as is *abate* (← abating fire) → *relax* (← ease ← abating fire).
tags:[]
___
kanji:誡
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[いまし（める）]
raw_etymology:戒# admonish + 言 words → verbal admonition/warning → *admonish*; *warn*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:伎
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギ, キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 支# (skillfully manipulate) → *skill*; *talent*; *ability* → *deed*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]
___
kanji:訝
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[いぶか（しい・しむ・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 言 words → words exchanged in crossing paths → *meet*. Also, *suspicion* and *doubt* (← cautious attitude toward a stranger).

kanji:谺
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[こだま]
raw_etymology:As per 牙# (mesh; cross) + 谷 valley → crossing point of two or more gorges → *gorge*. *Echo* is an associated meaning (← sound crossing between gorges). In ancient Japan, echoes were believed to emanate from *tree spirits*.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 邪 (crossroads settlement) + 耳 ear → cross-question → (grammatical) *interrogative* (← crossroads taken in a figurative sense). 耶 is also used for transliterations.

kanji:晤

kanji:祺

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[さいわ（い）]
raw_etymology:其 here an abbreviated form# of 期 (one full agricultural cycle) + 示 altar/the supernatural → full/abundant blessings from the gods (compare 福 with this same meaning), such as manifested in a rich harvest → *fortunate*; *free of worry*. For the connection between abundance and (good) fortune, compare also 吉.

kanji:跂
kanji_stroke_count:11

onyomi:[キ, ギ]
kunyomi:[つまだ（てる）]
raw_etymology:支# branch + 足 leg/foot → *have one or more extra toes*. *Stand on tiptoes* (compare 企 and 僥) and *wish for something remote* (compare 望) are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

kanji:頤
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[あご, おとがい]
raw_etymology:As per 𦣝# as described in 煕 (jaw) + 頁 head (for emphasis/clarification) → *jaw*. Also, *raise the jaw*; *raise the jaw and thrust it in the direction of a person/object*. *Nourish* is by further extension (← raise in the manner of closing a child's jaws around food) → *raise/rear*.
tags:[]

kanji:惡
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:悪
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[アク, オ]
kunyomi:[わる（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 亞# (downward pressure) + 心 heart/emotions → hatred/resentment induced by being pressured → *evil*; *wicked*; *bad*; *hatred* → *wrong* (← bad attitude, answer etc.). There is a possibility that the graphically similar 𢛳 (one's true nature) described in 德 has influenced the meanings of 惡 in a reverse, negative sense.

kanji:抑
kanji_stroke_count:7

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨク]
kunyomi:[おさ（える）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + an element# that is 印 (press down upon a person in forcing him/her to kneel) written in reverse → push/press down upon another in forcing him to kneel → *exert pressure*; *restrain*; *hold down*; *control* → *suppress*; *repress*. The present form uses 卬.

kanji:鍔

kanji:顎
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガク]
kunyomi:[あご]
raw_etymology:As per 咢# (cross, especially, cross over, or back and forth) + 頁 head → *jaw* (enabling the crossing back and forth of the upper and lower teeth in chewing; compare 鰐). For "jaw," compare 頤 and 齶.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鰐
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガク]
kunyomi:[わに]
raw_etymology:As per 咢# (cross, especially, cross over, or back and forth) + 魚 fish (→aquatic creature) → *alligator*; *crocodile* (← creatures with jagged teeth that cross back and forth in chewing; compare 顎). The compound 鰐鮫 refers to a shark; compare 鮫, where the idea is also that of a shark's crossing teeth.
tags:[]
___
kanji:隙
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲキ]
kunyomi:[すき, ひま]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# originally combined 小 small (doubled) + 白 white (→ light) → faint light emanating small fissures. 隙 adds 阜 piled earth → *fissure/crack/crevice* in a mound or wall → *discord* (← fissure between individuals). Also, *spare time* (← open space in one's schedule).
tags:[]
___
kanji:棘
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:朿# thorn doubled → *thorns* → *severe*; *stinging*. Compare 棗.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亟
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a person, stretched to full height, standing between two lines. A bronzeware inscription form adds an element combining 口 mouth and 攴 action indicator → speak and act with the body in a state of tension from head to toe → *hasten* (← tense action) → *urgent*; *sudden* (← urgent/sudden condition causing one to hasten). A seal inscription form replaces 攴 with 又 hand/action indicator.
tags:[]
___
kanji:堊
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ア, アク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 亞# (downward pressure) + 土 earth → mud/soft earth pressed down on construction materials in plastering → *clay*; *plaster*; *coat* (v.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:扼
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク, アク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally a variant form of 抑 (push/press down upon another in forcing him to kneel) with the specific sense of gripping tightly in exerting pressure → *choke*; *compress*; *tighten*. *Yoke* is a borrowed meaning via 軛. For the idea of choking, compare 嗌.
tags:[]
___
kanji:阨
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[アイ, ヤク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 厄# (be at a cliff; be at a loss) + 阜 piled earth → *be at an impasse* at a *gorge*; *be at a loss/in distress*. Also, *narrow* (← narrow gorge; compare 隘).
tags:[]
___
kanji:軛
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク]
kunyomi:[くびき]
raw_etymology:厄 here an abbreviated form# of 扼 (grip tightly) + 車 vehicle → *yoke* gripping the throat of a beast of burden.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[か（つ）]
raw_etymology:克# overcome + 刀 sword/knife → *overcome*/*vanquish* enemies by cutting them down → *win*.

onyomi:[アイ, アク, エキ]
kunyomi:[のど]
raw_etymology:益/益# fill/full + 口 mouth → fill/stick in the *throat*, causing choking → *choke*. Compare 扼.
tags:[]
___
kanji:龠
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク]
kunyomi:[ふえ]
raw_etymology:Originally, 冊# (bamboo slats) + 口 mouth/hole (doubled, not tripled as at present) → bamboo *flute* with multiple holes, covered by the fingers in being played. The element atop the tripled 口 in the modern form is an etymologically unrelated accretion.
tags:[]
___
kanji:臆

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 意# (contained in the heart) + 肉 flesh → *heart*; *chest*; *breast* (← physical seat of the heart, regarded as the source of *thought*). *Timidity* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:谷# valley + 邑 village/settlement → valley settlement. Later, the term came to refer to a *depression* and a proper name, as well as in Chinese medicine to denote the space between bone and muscle.

___
kanji:強
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ゴウ]
kunyomi:[し（いる）, つよ（い・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is a shape indicator suggesting the horned head of a beetle + 虫 insect → beetle. A seal inscription form adds 弓# bow, functioning as an abbreviated form of 彊 (strong, tautly stretched bow), leading to the meanings *strong*, *strength*, and *force* → *compel*; *coerce*; *intensify*. Returning to the seal inscription form, this referred to a hard-shelled beetle, making 強 弓 + a variant form of the bronzeware inscription character (beetle).
tags:[]
___
kanji:競
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ケイ]
kunyomi:[きそ（う）, せ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 誩# + 从. 誩 is 言 words (doubled) → verbal disputation. 从 is a variant form of 従 (people in close formation). The combination of elements suggests verbal competition → *compete* → *auction*.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[コウ, ギョウ, アン]

raw_etymology:A depiction of straight and crossing roads extending into the distance → *go*; *movement*; *procession*; *road* → *line* (of people) → *conduct*; *do*; *perform* (← carry out an action).

kanji:映
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[うつ（す・る）, は（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 央# (stretch) + 日 sun/day → sun stretching/*shining* over a wide area (compare 影) → *reflection*; *projection* (← dark spot attending to sunlight striking an object) → *shade*; *shape*. Also, *match/go with* and *be conspicuous* (← reflect) → *be attractive* (← striking).

kanji:鄕

shinjitai:郷

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of a variant of 卿 (be positioned opposite) + 邑 village/settlement → villages/settlements that face/are opposed at a distance → *village*; *countryside* → *rural*.

kanji:響
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[ひび（き・く）]
raw_etymology:鄕 here a variant form of 卿# (be positioned at opposite sides) + 音 sound → transmission of *sound* through space from point of origin to point of reception → *resonance*; *reverberation*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:向
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[む（かう・き・く・ける・こう）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 宀 roof/building + a hole# → smoke being compressed through a ventilation hole and escaping to the outside of a structure → *face (toward)*; *head toward*; *direction*. Extended meanings include *confront*; *advance upon*; *approach*; *become/grow*; *turn to*; *point at*; *send* (a messenger); (on) *the other side*; *opposite direction* and *beyond*. Also, *position* (on a matter) and *be inclined to do* (← the approach one takes to an issue); *allocate to* (← time/objects one directs toward a matter); *destination* (← head toward); *the other party* (← person one faces); and *suitability* (← be appropriately suited to face a situation). For the idea of smoke passing through a ventilation hole, compare 囱 as described in 窓 as well as 匆, a variant form of 囱.
tags:[]
___
kanji:享
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of one of a pair of gates positioned at opposite ends of an enclosure → *entertain guests*; *enjoy* (← entertainment taking place in such a structure ) → *receive* (entertainment/a privilege etc.) (← be the recipient of entertainment).
tags:[]
___
kanji:香
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[かお（り・る）, こうば（しい）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 甘# sweet + 黍 millet → sweet *fragrance/scent* of boiled millet wafting through the air → *incense*; *perfume*; *savory* (smell).
tags:[]
___
kanji:凝
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギョウ]
kunyomi:[こ（らす・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 疑# (come to a stop) + 氷 ice → flowing water coming to a stop in hardening into ice → *rigidity*; *concentration*; *stiff*. *Strain*, *be absorbed in*, *fix attention on* and *elaborate* (v.) are extended meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:肯
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 肎 ( 冖 cover + 肉 flesh), indicating an arm hanging from a shoulder (compare 肩) and covering the side of the body. *Consent*, *agreement* and *permission* are borrowed meanings. In Old Chinese, neither 冖 nor 肉 conveys the pronunciation of this character, suggesting that a) one (or both) of the original components differed or b) one functioned as an abbreviated form of a now-obsolete character.
tags:[]
___
kanji:恆
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:恒
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 亙# (moon crossing the evening sky → fixed phenomenon) + 心 heart/emotions → constancy likened to that of the moon crossing the sky every evening → *constantly*; *always*; *fixed* → *habitual* (← always).
tags:[]
___
kanji:興
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, キョウ]
kunyomi:[おこ（す ・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 同 same + 與# (raise in unison) → work together to *raise*, *build* or *promote* → *interest*; *prosperity* (← raise interest; build up funds). *Prevalent* is an extended meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:刑
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 开# is a depiction of handcuffs stretching about a prisoner's wrists, framing them in punishment. A bronzeware inscription form curves the vertical strokes. 刑 adds 刀 sword/knife → *punish* (by confinement, severing of body parts or by other means).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[かた]
raw_etymology:As per 刑# (frame) + 土 earth → clay framed in the *mold* shaping it → *model* → *pattern*; *type*; *design*; *conventional form/idea*; *basic technique* (in martial arts).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[かた, かたち]
raw_etymology:As per 开# as described in 刑 (frame) + 彡 pattern → (frame-like and other, various) shapes and patterns → *shape*; *pattern*; *form*; *style*.

kanji:幸
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[さいわ（い）, さち, しあわ（せ）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of handcuffs for confining the movement of prisoners. *Good fortune* and *happiness* are extended meanings (← a prisoner's good fortune to escape his handcuffs).
tags:[]
___
kanji:敬
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[うやま（う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the left-hand element# is 人 person + an element combining horns and a mouth → person who cries out and goes stiff with fear upon being charged by a ram. 敬 adds 攵 action indicator → *be stiff/formal/ceremonious* (compare 改 and 僵) → *respect*. Note that the left-hand element of 敬 is etymologically distinct from the independent character 苟.
tags:[]
___
kanji:警
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 敬# (stiff; upright) + 言 words → cause others to go stiff/upright by admonishing or warning them → *warn* → *regulate*; *alarm*; *careful*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:驚
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[おどろ（かす・き・く）]
raw_etymology:As per 敬# (stiff; upright) + 馬 horse → startled horse that stiffens in attention (compare 篤) → *surprise*; *astonishment* → *fright*; *shock*; *wonder*; *marvel*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:徑
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:径
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:巠# is 巛 (a variant form of 川) river between a horizontal line at top and 工 at bottom (originally 土 earth) → river/watercourse extending between two distant points. 徑 adds 彳 movement → proceed along an extensive *path* → *diameter*; *direct*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:莖
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:茎
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[くき]
raw_etymology:As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 艸 grass/plant → long *stalk*/*stem*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:經
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:経
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[へ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 糸 thread → long, *warp threads* passed through a loom → *longitude*; *pass through* → (of time) *pass/elapse*. *Sutra*, *reason* and *manage* are from the idea of the thread of a discourse, while *experience* is via "pass through." Compare also 營.
tags:[]
___
kanji:輕
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:軽
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[かる（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 車 vehicle → long, lightweight vehicle → *light*; *lessen/lighten*; *make light of*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:慶
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 愛 (dragged down) + an abbreviated form of 鹿 deer → celebrate the dragging down/capture of a deer → *felicitation*; *congratulations*; *blessing*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:康
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:庚# (firm husk) + four marks suggesting scattered rice → firm, taut husk of a grain plant → *healthy*; *sound* (← firm and taut). 康 was devised to replace 庚 after 庚 acquired its borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:更
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[さら（に）, ふ（かす・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 丙# (spread) + 攴 action indicator → stretch a rope (compare the derivative character 綆, a rope attached to a well bucket). The meanings *replace* and *change* likely owe to the drawing of fresh well water to replace that which has been used, or dried up. (Still) *more* and *further(more)* are borrowed meanings, as are *grow late* and *stay up late*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:硬
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[かた（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 更# (stretch) + 石 stone → line of stones stretching between two points → *hard* (as a rock) → *stiff*; *stern*; *obstinate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:剛
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 刀 sword/knife → cutting implement able to slice through a *strong* or *hard* object such as rope or cable.
tags:[]
___
kanji:綱
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[つな]
raw_etymology:As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 糸 thread (for emphasis/clarification) → *rope*; *cord*; *cable* → (figurative) *lifeline*. Compare 緪 and 綆.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[はがね]
raw_etymology:As per 岡# (hard rope/cable) + 金 metal → metal bar/rod → *steel*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:杏
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, アン]
kunyomi:[あんず]
raw_etymology:口# mouth + 木 tree/wood → *apricot* (← tree fruit savored in the mouth). Compare 梅, a closely-related fruit thought to be beneficial for pregnant women on account of its voluminous production.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盈
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 乃 (soft and clingy) + 皿# dish/plate/bowl → *fill* a dish with (soft) food → *be/become full*; *satisfy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亨
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally the same character as 享 (one of a pair of gates positioned at opposite ends of an enclosure) → *smooth passage* (← unhindered passage between gates).
tags:[]
___
kanji:嬰
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:賏# is an abbreviated form of 賡 (continue without interruption) + 貝 shell → string of shells, made into a necklace. 嬰 adds 女 woman → shell necklace extending about a woman's neck → *extend about*. *Baby* and (musical) *sharp* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亙
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Depiction of the moon crossing the evening sky from end to end → *cross over*; *extend/go/run all the way across/through*; *range* (over/about). Some dictionaries list 亙 as a variant form of 亘, but they are separate characters.
tags:[]
___
kanji:畺
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:田 field (doubled) bounded and partitioned by three horizontal lines → tightly demarcated fields, about which *border* markers stretch → *boundary*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:彊
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 畺# (tight; taut) + 弓 bow → *strong*, tautly stretched bow → *strengthen*.
tags:[]

kanji:竟
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ケイ]
kunyomi:[つい（に）]
raw_etymology:As per 音# (contained) + 儿 person → person whose movement is contained on reaching a distant border → *come to an end* → *finally*; *at last*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亢
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form of 大 stand outstretched + two vertical lines# indicating an elongated neck → raise one's head, stretching the throat → *raise* (the head upright); *proud*; *arrogant*; *high*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:杭
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[くい, わた（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 亢# (stretch) + 木 tree/wood → *wooden stake* stretching straight upward. *Proceed* (over water) is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卿
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 即 (kneel immediately beside a table piled high with food) + an element# showing an additional person on the other side of the table → two figures positioned on opposite sides of a table. 卿 was originally used with exclusive reference to elder members of families who were permitted to eat in front of an altar. However, over time it came to designate the rank of an aristocrat → *noble*; *lord*; *minister*; *head of a government agency*. *You* is via the use of the term by a ruler toward a subordinate.
tags:[]
___
kanji:饗
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:鄕 here a variant form of 卿# (be positioned at opposite sides of a table) + 食 food/eating → host seated across and at a distance from banquet guests → *host* (a *banquet*). 饗 was devised to replace 卿 after 卿 acquired its extended meanings.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[いれずみ]
raw_etymology:As per 京# (expansive) + 黑 black → expansive dark *tattoo* on a criminal's face.

kanji:僵
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[たお（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 畺# (tight; taut) + 人 person → *die and go stiff*; *rigor mortis*. For stiffening of the body compare 敬, and see also 殭 (effectively a variant form of 僵).
tags:[]

kanji:絎
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[く（ける）, ぬ（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 行# (straight and crossing) + 糸 thread → *straight edge* (of the hem of a garment etc.); *sew* (in a straight line). The verb くける refers specifically to *make a blind stitch* (sew in a manner that the threads are hidden from view).
tags:[]
___
kanji:纓
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エイ, ヨウ]
kunyomi:[ひも]
raw_etymology:嬰# extend about + 糸 thread → *crown strings* (running down each side of the head, and tied beneath the jaw); *tie crown strings*. Also, a *string* worn by women as a sign of betrothal, as well as a *decoration* attached to the back of a crown.
tags:[]
___
kanji:耿
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:火 fire + 耳 ear, with the meaning *bright*. 耳 is a replacement element, with the identity of the original element being uncertain.
tags:[]
___
kanji:螯
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 蟹 crab, though 螯 came to emphasize the crab's *claw*. (In derivative characters 敖 lends the conceptual influence "spread/roam without restraint," an image inapplicable to the limited mobility of a crab claw.)
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 央# (stretch) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl → small-mouthed, wide-bellied *pot* → *abundant* (← abundant capacity) → *overflowing*.

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[さき（に）]
raw_etymology:鄕 here a variant form of 卿# (be positioned at opposite sides) + 日 sun/day → one day figuratively facing another day through intervening time → *a previous day*; *once (upon a time)*; (just) *before*.

kunyomi:[あお（ぐ）]

kanji:陘
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ, ギョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 巠# as described in 徑 (extensive) + 阜 piled earth → long *gorge/mountain pass*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]

kanji:罄

___
kanji:璜
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 黃# (extend) + 玉 jewel → light reflected from a jewel and extending a great distance (a meaning retained in the compound 璜璜). However, 璜 came also to refer to a particular type of *jeweled ornament* used as a waistband accessory, specifically, a disk-shaped precious stone ( 璧) cut in half.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:恆# fixed + 糸 thread → object fixed in place by stretching a rope taut → *stretch taut*; *large rope*. Compare 綱 and 綆.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 衡# (bars) + 艸 grass/plant → a long, straight plant. The compound 杜蘅 refers to Pollia japonica.

raw_etymology:As per 更# (stretch) + 糸 thread → *well rope* tautly stretched in drawing water. For rope, compare 綱 and 緪. 綆 was devised to replace 更 after 更 acquired its extended meanings.

kanji:甘
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[あま（い・える・やかす・んじる・んずる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 口 mouth + a line#, indicating (sweet/rich) food contained and thus concealed within the mouth → *tasty*; *mild*; *delicious* → *sweet* (← sweet food contained in the mouth) → *indulgent*; *lenient*; *spoil* (a person) (← be overly sweet) → *insufficiently serious*; *overly optimistic*; *loose*; *take advantage* → *be content* (with); *be resigned* (to); *accept* (← indulge oneself and take the easy way out).
tags:[]

kanji:嚴

raw_etymology:Abbreviated and variant form of 嵒 cliff + 敢# (covered) → rugged geologic feature such as a cliff covering the side of a hill/mountain → *severity*; *strictness* (← rugged) → *solemnity*.

kanji:炎
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[ほのお]
raw_etymology:火 fire (doubled) as an abbreviated form of 焱, 火 fire (tripled) → consuming blaze that encompasses objects in flames → *flame*. The phonetic evidence suggests that 焱 is itself a variant of a non-attested character indicating a great fire that consumes. Compare 焰.
tags:[]

___
kanji:欠
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[か（かす・く・け・ける）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a bent, open-mouthed figure (with food contained in the mouth) → *yawn* (← open mouth). 欠 now also bears the senses of 缺 (hole scooped into earthenware to create a container), accounting for the meanings *scoop out* → *lack*; *miss/be missing*; *break* (off); *chip* (off); *broken piece*; *fragment* → *flaw*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:陷
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:陥
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[おちい（る）, おとしい（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 臽# (contain in a cavity) + 阜 piled earth → earthen object that collapses and sinks into a cavity → *fall*; *sink* → *ensnare*; *entrap*; *capture*; *pitfall*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:今
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン, コン]
kunyomi:[いま]
raw_etymology:A depiction of one object contained and concealed within another. It is likely the concealing object was originally a mouth (compare 含 and 吟, as well as 甘 and 音). *Now* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:含
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[ふく（む・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 今# (contain) + 口 mouth → *contain in the mouth*; *contain*; *include*. Extended meanings include *bear (in mind)*, *have*, *hold* and *imply*, as well as *give instructions* and *understand* (← give instructions that the hearer takes in and comprehends).
tags:[]
___
kanji:吟
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 今# (contain) + 口 mouth → indistinct sound contained within the mouth (compare 音) → *groan*; *moan*; *hum*; *sing*; *recite* → *poem*. 吟 and 含 are an example of a pair of characters devised from the same elements but expressing different meanings; for another example, see 忙 and 忘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:念
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 今# (contain) + 心 heart/emotions → *thought/idea* contained deep within the heart (compare 意) → *caution* (← profound idea).
tags:[]
___
kanji:琴
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン]
kunyomi:[こと]
raw_etymology:As per 今# (contain) + 玨 (玉 jewel in abbreviated form, and doubled), here a shape indicator suggesting the outline of a particular musical instrument → musical instrument in which the sound is enclosed within a sealed base → *koto* (Japanese harp/zither).
tags:[]
___
kanji:陰
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[かげ, かげ（る）]
raw_etymology:侌# is 云 (rising vapors) + 今 (contain) → be clouded over and gloomy. 陰 adds 阜 piled earth → cloud-shadowed side of a hill → *be clouded over*; *shadow*; *dark*; *obscure* → *back/behind*; *negative*; *gloomy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:飲
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[の（む）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 酓# (contain alcohol) + 欠 (cavity) → pour (a drink/medicine) into the mouth → *drink*; *swallow*; *take* (medicine) → *smoke* (tobacco) (← consume with the mouth). Eventually, 酓 was replaced by 食 food/eating. Note a variant form 飮.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[かな, かね]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 今# (contain) + an element combining 土 earth and random marks → *gold* contained here and there within the earth → *money*; *metal*; *yellow*; *golden*.
tags:[]

kanji:音
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オン, イン]
kunyomi:[おと, ね]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 言# words + a line in the mouth element at the bottom → *indistinct utterance* contained in (not emanating as speech from) the mouth (compare 吟) → *sound*; *noise*; *tone* → *news/word of*; *ON reading* of a Han/Chinese character (← read a character by its Sino-Japanese sound; the contrast is to 訓, where the idea is to grasp the signification of a character).
tags:[]

kanji:緎
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[と（じる）]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 緘 (shut and seal with thread), referring to a *seam* that binds material shut. Also, *contain*. In 緎, the 咸 of 緘 is replaced by 或.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鹹
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 咸# (shut) + 鹵 salt/alkali → salt contained in a shut mouth (compare 鹽) → *salty* taste that causes the lips to pucker.
tags:[]
___
kanji:衿
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン]
kunyomi:[えり]
raw_etymology:As per 今# (contain) + 衣 clothing → overlapping and thus containing part of a garment → *collar*; *lapel* (compare 襟) → *neck*. Note how the same combination of elements is employed to create different meanings in 衾.
tags:[]

___
kanji:厭
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン, オン]
kunyomi:[あ（きる）, いと（う）]
raw_etymology:猒# was originally 口 mouth + an obsolete element ( 肉 flesh and 犬 dog/beast) → the disagreeable sensation of rich/fatty meat pressing upon the intestines → *be satiated*; *become tired/sick of*. 厭 adds 厂, an accretion of uncertain function. For a cognate term in Old Chinese involving rich food, compare 甘.
tags:[]
___

kanji:鷹
kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オウ, ヨウ]
kunyomi:[たか]
raw_etymology:广 + an obsolete character# of uncertain signification that combines 人 person + 隹 short, squat bird. It seems likely that the 人 + 隹 character indicated a bird trainer/handler, and that 广 building was appended to suggest a birdhouse. + 鳥 bird (for emphasis/clarification) → *hawk* (or other bird of prey).
tags:[]

kanji:頷
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

raw_etymology:As per 含# (contain in the mouth) + 頁 head → the jaw (which closes to contain food in the oral cavity) → *chin* (that enables containment in the mouth). *Nod* (the head) is by association with the up and down movement made by the jaw in chewing.

kanji:銜
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン, ガン]
kunyomi:[くつわ, ふく（む）]
raw_etymology:金# metal + 行 (straight, crossing roads) → metallic, T-shaped *horse's bit*, contained in the animal's mouth when the horse bites down upon it → *place/hold in the mouth*. Also, *keep in mind* (← thoughts contained within; compare 憶). Logically, the classifier for 銜 should be 行, but it is traditionally given as 金.

kanji:晗

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:含# contain + 日 sun/day → the sun, as yet contained in darkness but about to make its appearance → *pre-dawn*. Compare 莟, which also features the idea of an object just about to make its appearance.
tags:[]
___
kanji:崟

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 金# (contain) + 山 mountain → rugged mountain (containing protruding boulders; compare 嵒) → *steep, rugged mountain*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 音# (indistinct) + 門 gate → scant light penetrating a gate (compare 暗) → *dark*; *dim* → *secret(ly)*; *clandestine(ly)*; *hidden*.

kanji:干
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[ひ（る）, ほ（す）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a forked stick or *thick bar*, one functioning as a *shield* and employed by being *thrust* or pressed against a combatant in *defense*. *Dry*, *ebb*, *draw/drain off* and *empty* (a glass) are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[と（ぐ）]

tags:[]
___
kanji:漢
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 𦰩 shows the stretched hide of an animal tied to a frame + 火 fire → stretch an object for drying over a fire. According to this process the object shrinks, leaving a minute remainder. 漢 is as per 𦰩# (stretch) + 水 water → great, stretching river → the Milky Way (← constellation likened to a great, flowing river). The meaning *China* comes from a broad application of 漢's use in the name of the Hanshui River ( 漢水) in Hubei Province. Also, *man* (← ordinary male ← general populace ← general term for China).
tags:[]
___
kanji:勤
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン, ゴン]
kunyomi:[つと（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 𦰩# as described in 漢 (stretch over a fire) + 力 power/energy → *work diligently*; *industrious* → *employment*. Also, *be fit for/equal to* (a task).
tags:[]
___
kanji:謹
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン]
kunyomi:[つつし（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 𦰩# as described in 漢 (minute) + 言 words → pay minute attention to one's words → circumspection → *consideration*; *caution*; *restraint*; *humility* → polite term of *respect* for another.
tags:[]
___
kanji:獻
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:献
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:鬳 is composed of 虍 tiger + 鬲 tripod cooking vessel/cauldron → tripod cooking vessel with tiger and other decorations. 獻 is 鬳# + 犬 dog/beast → *offer* a sacrificial vessel filled high with meat of a dog/wild beast → *present*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:寒
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[さむ（い）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 宀# roof/building + an element combining piled bricks/stones and 廾 pair of hands → create layers of building materials in raising a shelter. Later, 氷/ 冫 ice was added at bottom to emphasize a structure offering protection from the *cold*.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[あいだ, ま]
raw_etymology:門# gate + 月 moon → bright light splitting and illuminating the *gap*/*space* between the two sides of a gate (compare 間) → *between*; *among*; *room*; *during*; *pause/interval*; (passage of) *time* (← gap).

kanji:見
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[み（える・せる・る）]
raw_etymology:儿# human figure + 目 eye → person whose sight is fixed on an object he is being shown → *see*; *look*; *observe*; *be visible/in sight*; *appear*; *viewpoint*. Also, *show*, *examine*, and *care for* (← observe) → *make a pretense of* (← for show alone). A seal inscription form rotates the eye vertically.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[あらわ（す・れる）]
raw_etymology:見# appear + 玉 jewel → gem appearing from the earth in being excavated → *appear*; *emerge* → *actual*; *real*; *existing* (← actuality/reality of that which has appeared/emerged) → *current*; *the present*. Also, *show* (← cause to appear).
tags:[]

___
kanji:遣
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[つか（う・わす）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of the right-hand element# combines 㠯 as described in 官 (wrapped objects) + a pair of hands → pass/send a wrapped object to someone else. 遣 is the right-hand element# + 辵 movement (for emphasis/clarification) → *send/dispatch* → *expend*; *spend*; *present*. Also, *manipulate* (← manipulate in sending/dispatching). Also, *consume* (← consume what is sent one).
tags:[]
___
kanji:顯
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:顕
shinjitai_stroke_count:18
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:㬎# combines 日 here an abbreviated form of 旱 dry up + 絲 thread(s) → silk threads exposed for drying in the sun. 顯 adds 頁 head → expose and make *manifest* a person's head (specifically, a severed head; compare 縣 as described in 県) → *visible*; *clear* → *noticeable*; *remarkable*. Despite appearances, 㬎 has no etymological connection with 濕 or 隰.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[やす（い）]
raw_etymology:宀# roof/building + 女 woman → woman resting/at ease indoors → *be at ease/peace* → *cheap*; *inexpensive* (← cheap enough to be purchased with ease).

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 安# (rest in/on) + 木 tree/wood → rest the elbows on a wooden desk or table. *Consider* and *plan* are borrowed meanings via 按 → *proposal*; *worry*.

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 晏 (settle) + 宀 roof/building → settle in /down to an indoors *feast* or *banquet*. Compare 讌.

kanji:憲
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 害 (cut) + 目 eye → (full/partial) cutting off of vision (compare 瞎). A seal inscription form adds 心 heart/emotions to suggest the (full/partial) cutting off of one's desires as well → *law* (← create the rule of law by restricting desires; compare 律, 埒, 法 and 笵) → *constitution*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:門# gate + 木 tree/wood → wooden bolt placed across the door of a gate, confining the persons, animals or objects contained within → *block* → *rule*; *obey*. Also, *quiet*, *tranquility* and *leisure* (← pass time quietly, tranquilly or leisurely within an enclosure).
tags:[]

kanji:言

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 辛# needle/cutting tool + 口 mouth → *speak* sharply/distinctly, the tongue likened to a needle in the mouth → *words*; *say*; *talk*; *tell*; *express*; *order*; *call*; *mean*; *speech*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:顏
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[かお]
raw_etymology:As per 彦# (handsome/well-formed) + 頁 head → *face*; *forehead*; *countenance*; *appearance* → *influence* (← face/person that carries weight). 顏 was devised to replace 彦 after 彦 acquired its associated meanings. Compare the form 顔.
tags:[]

kanji:顔
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[かお]
raw_etymology:As per 彦# (handsome/well-formed) + 頁 head → *face*; *forehead*; *countenance*; *appearance* → *influence* (← face/person that carries weight). 顔 was devised to replace 彦 after 彦 acquired its associated meanings. Compare the form 顏.
tags:[]
___
kanji:臣
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン, ジン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a variant form of 見 (person whose sight is fixed upon an object he is being shown), the person here being understood as a *subject* or *retainer* → *retain* (a person); *serve* (as a retainer). As an independent character, 臣 is regarded as consisting of seven strokes, but some sources enumerate it as six when it appears as an element in a derivative character (compare the treatment of stroke counts in 此).
tags:[]

kanji:賢
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[かしこ（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 臤# (adhere) + 貝 commodities → tightly packed collection of valuable goods → estimable (← goods worthy of esteem) → *wisdom*/*intelligence* (← wise enough to evaluate properly).
tags:[]
___
kanji:筋
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン]
kunyomi:[すじ]
raw_etymology:Originally 竹 bamboo + a depiction of connected joints (now written 肋) → the hard portion of bamboo between the joints, used in bow-making. *Muscle*, *line*, *lineage*, and *thread/plot* (of a story or line of reasoning) derive from the distinct lines of the bamboo, with *reason*, *logic* and (information) *source* by extension. Regarding the progression from "line" to "reason/logic," compare 理.
tags:[]
___
kanji:因
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[よ（って・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows bedding upon which a person lies/adheres (that is, over which the person is superimposed) → *depend*; *cause*; *be connected with* (← superimposition) → *be based on*; *be due to*; *therefore*; *consequently*.
tags:[]

onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 因# (superimpose) + 女 woman → superimposition of one family upon another in *marriage*.

kanji:恩
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 因# (superimpose) + 心 heart/emotions → feelings of *gratitude* that superimpose themselves on the heart and adhere → *favor*. Compare 懇.
tags:[]
___
kanji:隱
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:隠
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[かく（す・れる）]
raw_etymology:The element above 心 in 㥯 was originally 爪 claw/hand + an element combining a symbol in the shape of 工 + another hand → use one hand on top and the other on the bottom to cover and conceal a 工-shaped object. The addition of 心 heart/emotions suggests secrets concealed firmly in the heart. To 㥯# (conceal), 隱 adds 阜 piled earth → earthen wall behind which objects are concealed → *hide/conceal*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:穩
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:穏
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[オン]
kunyomi:[おだ（やか）]
raw_etymology:As per 㥯# as described in 隱 (conceal) + 禾 grain/rice → conceal and reserve a supply of harvested crops → *calm*; *quiet*; *peaceful* (← conceal one's volatile feelings from others) → *moderate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:印
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[しるし]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 爪 claw/hand + a variant of the abbreviated form# of 宛 (bending figures) seen in 怨 and 苑 → press down on a person in forcing him/her to kneel → *seal* (← make an impression by pressing down) → *print*; *impress*; *mark*; *sign*; *symbol*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:煙
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[けむり, けむ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 垔 shows a potter's wheel to which clay adheres in the pottery-making process. 煙 is as per 垔# (adhere) + 火 fire → *smoke* that adheres to walls and ceilings → *soot*; *fumes*; *smoky*; *dimly visible*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:斤
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of the blade of an ax adhering to and cutting an object → *ax*. *Unit of weight* (originally 256g, 600g following the T'ang Dynasty, and 500g in modern China) derives from the use of axes as counterweights (compare 質).
tags:[]

kanji:懸
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン, ケ]
kunyomi:[か（かる・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 縣# as described in 県 (hang suspended) + 心 heart/emotions → emotional state likened to hanging suspended → *hang* (suspended); *be undecided*; *be distant/apart* → *offer* (a prize) (← hold out an enticement at a tantalizing distance).

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[うら（む・めしい）]

kanji:墾

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:貇 combines 艮 (adhere) with 豸 animal that ambles along the ground → teeth of a sharp-toothed beast adhering to an object or to the piece of food being gnawed → gnaw. 墾 is as per 貇# (adhere) + 土 earth → agricultural tool adhering to the soil in *cultivation*.

kanji:厂
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *cliff* concealing objects atop it (as observed from below; compare 厃 as described in 詹) → *shape indicator*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A depiction of fine *cloth* draped about/over an object, the two ends of the cloth in neat alignment → *cloth wrapped about the head*. *Width* is a borrowed meaning.

kanji:艮

___
kanji:彦
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[ひこ]
raw_etymology:The combination of elements is unclear, but the Old Chinese pronunciation suggests that the original idea was that of a rugged, well-formed face (compare 顏/顔) adhering to the head in the manner that 厂# a cliff adheres to the side of a mountain (compare the lower element of 嚴/厳). *Handsome* is an associated meaning, with *accomplished* and *splendid* extended meanings in the sense of qualities associated with a handsome male. In 彦, the traditional form of the element atop 厂 is that seen in 顏, 諺 and 偐.
tags:[]

kanji:姦
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[かしま（しい）]
raw_etymology:奻# is 女 woman (doubled) → quarreling women. 姦 adds another 女 element to emphasize inappropriate behavior → *wicked*; *immoral*. *Adultery* is a borrowed meaning, likely influenced by 奸 (have illicit contact with a woman) → *obscene*; *debauched*. *Noisy* is via the original sense of "quarrel ."

raw_etymology:干# thick bar + a variant form of 网 net → *long-handled bird-catching net* (compare 禽). *Rare* is a borrowed meaning.

___
kanji:甲
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction of objects being pressed down, suggesting "press down on objects in containing them" → *armor*; *helmet*; *shell*. From the bronzeware inscription style onward, however, the character becomes a depiction of a hard, seed-bearing *husk*. *First in a series* and *first calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:岬
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[みさき]
raw_etymology:As per 甲# (press down on) + 山 mountain → mountain gorge (pressed down on by cliffs on both sides). Compare 峽. However, the character has been applied to land jutting into the sea and pressed upon by water on both sides , therefore *cape* or *promontory*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:押
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オウ]
kunyomi:[お（さえ・さえる・し・す）]
raw_etymology:As per 甲# (press down on) + 手 hand/action indicator → *press*/*push* down on → *thrust*; *shove*; *hold down*; *stop*; *stamp* (papers/a passport etc.); (a) *weight*; *pressure* → *seize*; *catch*; *arrest* → *control* (← restrain and control). 押 was devised to replace 甲 after the latter came to refer to a husk or shell.
tags:[]
___
kanji:壓
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:圧
shinjitai_stroke_count:5
onyomi:[アツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 厭# (press upon) + 土 earth → *pressure* exerted on the earth by a heavy object → *press*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:凹
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a concave object sunken in the middle due to pressure from above → *concave*; *indented*; *hollowed out*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:挾

kanji:狹
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:狭
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[せば（まる・める）, せま（い）]
