tags:[]
___
kanji:脅
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[おど（かす・す）, おびや（かす）]
raw_etymology:As per 劦# as described in 協 (pressure from two sides) + 肉 flesh → the two sides of the body, under pressure → *threaten* (← be threatened by attackers at both sides; compare 狹) → *frighten*; *fear*; *be scared*; *startle*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:業
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギョウ, ゴウ]
kunyomi:[わざ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a stand with notched wooden supports on both ends. Heavy bells and/or drums were suspended from a wooden bar that was placed atop of (and connected) a pair of such stands (compare 對), exerting pressure upon the notches → *work/act* (← create notches) → *skill*; *occupation*. Also, *karma* (← result of acts taken).
tags:[]
___
kanji:及
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[およ（び・ぶ・ぼす）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a person + a hand reaching toward another person (compare 服) → *reach/extend* and press a hand on the back of a fleeing person → *overtake* → *amount to*; *equal*. By further extension are *and* and *as well as* (← equally), while *come to*, *exert* (upon) and *affect* derive from the original sense of exerting pressure with one's hand.
tags:[]
___
kanji:吸
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[す（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 及# (press on) + 口 mouth → press the lips together in sucking in air → *suck* (compare 哈, 歙 and 噏) → *breathe*; *inhale*; *take in* → *absorb*; *smoke* (tobacco).
tags:[]
___
kanji:級
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 及# (press on) + 糸 thread → pieces of fabric of various quality, pressing on each other in being inspected → *rank*; *class*; *grade* (← levels of quality) → *head* (← make promotions contingent on the taking of heads on the battlefield).
tags:[]
___
kanji:急
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[いそ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 急 to have originally consisted of 及# (press on) + 心 heart/emotions → feelings of being pressed upon → *rush*; *hurry*; *hasten* → *sudden*; *emergency*; *steep*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:合
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ, カッ, ガッ]
kunyomi:[あ（う・わす・わせる）]
raw_etymology:As per 口# (cavity → open container) + an abbreviated form of 今 (contain) → press/fit together a lid on a container, containing objects inside → *fit*; *join*; *put together*; *meet*. Extended meanings include *suit*; *match*; *agree/coincide with*; *correspond to*; *be correct*; *add* (to); *combine*; *set/adjust* (a device); *adapt oneself to*; and *check* (with/against).
tags:[]
___
kanji:給
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 合# (press/fit together) + 糸 thread → fit together pieces of fabric → *supply*; *supplement*; *fill*; *give*; *salary*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:泣
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[な（かす・かせる・く）]
raw_etymology:As per 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) + 水 water → *teardrops* pressing on the cheeks → *cry*; *sob*; *weep* → *moan*; *regret*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:邑
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ, オウ]
kunyomi:[くに, むら]
raw_etymology:巴 here a variant of 丮# (kneeling figure with arms extended) + 囗 circular enclosure → subjects pressed into an enclosed space, who kneel and extend their arms in obeisance → *village*; *settlement*; *town*. Confusingly, when used as an element in a dual-element character, 邑 is written as 阝, the same simplification as employed for 阜 piled earth. The difference is that 邑 appears on the right (examples: 邦, 邸, or 郊) while 阜 appears on the left (examples: 防, 限, or 陷).
tags:[]
___
kanji:叶
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[かな（う）]
raw_etymology:口 mouth + 十# (gather) → voices gathered in harmonious supplication → *harmonize*. Also, *be realized/have one's prayer answered* (← grant a group's wish/request).
tags:[]
___
kanji:劫
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:去# withdraw + 力 power/energy → *coerce* others into withdrawing. *Long period of time* derives from the compound 劫波, a transliteration of the Sanskrit kalpa.
tags:[]

kanji:頰

kanji:盍
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, the element at top# was not 去 but rather that described in 抑 (now written as 卬, but originally 印 in reverse → hold down). The addition of 皿 dish/plate/bowl suggests the idea of pressing a *cover* down upon a container → *meet* (← meeting of cover and container). *Why* is a borrowed meaning.

kanji:加
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[くわ（える・わる）]
raw_etymology:A variant of 可 (bend/cup a hand about the mouth to amplify the voice in shouting), with *add*, *append* and *increase* being associated meanings (← add a hand atop the mouth to increase the volume of one's voice). Also, *join* (in) and *inflict* (← join in something inflicting damage/injury).

kanji:可
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a representation of a bent hook + 口 mouth → bend/cup a hand about the mouth to amplify the voice in shouting → shout/laugh/sing in a loud voice. *Possible* is an extended meaning (← make it possible to be heard at a distance), with *approve* by further extension (← approve of what has been made possible).
tags:[]
___
kanji:河

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[かわ]
raw_etymology:As per 可# (bend) + 水 water → long *river* with multiple bends. Compare 川.
tags:[]
___
kanji:歌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[うた, うた（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 哥# (sing) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure → *sing* → *song* → *poem*; *tanka*. 歌 was devised to express the original meaning of 哥 after the latter was borrowed to express "elder brother."
tags:[]
___
kanji:何
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[なに, なん]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction of a person bearing on the shoulder a load hung from a long pole. The bronzeware and seal inscription forms, though, are 人 + 可# (bend). *What* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:荷
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[に]
raw_etymology:As per 何# (bear a load) + 艸 grass/plant → *lotus* (← plant borne on water). *Bear a load*, (a) *load*, *burden* and *undertake* are meanings applied after 何 was borrowed to express "what."
tags:[]
___
kanji:奇
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 可# (bend) + 大 stand outstretched → person bending/leaning in an unusual position, on account of being lame → *strange*; *wondrous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:寄
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[よ（せる・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 奇# (lean) + 宀 roof/building → *lean on* or *draw near*/toward a building → *approach*; *bring near*; *call at/upon*; *step aside* → *depend on*; *gather* (← call at another person's dwelling for food and shelter) → *add* (up to) (← gather). Also, *entrust* (← be entrusted with the care of others) and *send* (← have objects brought to another).
tags:[]
___
kanji:崎
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[さき]
raw_etymology:As per 奇# (lean) + 山 mountain → mountainous headland → *cape*; *promontory*. Compare 埼 and 碕.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 奇# (lean) + 馬 horse → rider leaning on a horse → *horse riding*; *counter for horsemen*.

kanji:我

___
kanji:戲
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:戯
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[ギ]
kunyomi:[たわむ（れる）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 虛 (sunken) + an element combining 豆 (food stand, here a shape indicator) and 戈 spear/halberd (the combination indicating a particular type of bladed weapon) → sink a spear in a hole in the ground as a trap for game → *sport with* (← hunt for sport ← hunt). *Laugh uproariously*, *frolic*, *joke*, *play*, *tease* and *flirt* are by figurative association with "sport with" → *theater*; *drama*; *show*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:皆
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[みな, みんな]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 白. 白 replaces an obsolete element of uncertain signification, and the reason for the selection of 白 is also obscure. *All*, *everyone* and *everything* appear to be connected with the general idea of lining up many people/objects.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:幾
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[いく]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 我# (bladed weapon) + an obsolete character doubling 幺 slender thread → slice threads repeatedly, *little by little*, causing them to become *minute* and *almost equal* in size → *slight*; *(a) few*; *some* (← minute in size or quantity). Also, *almost*. *How much/many* and *which* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:繼
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:継
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[つ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines 幺 slender thread (quadrupled) + bisecting lines → sever, then link the tips of threads extending beyond a framing object. 繼 adds 糸 thread for emphasis/clarification, but 繼 came to indicate *inherit*, *succeed to* or *accede to*, in the sense of linking generations. *Resume* is an associated meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:阿

kanji:楷

raw_etymology:As per 皆# (line up) + 木 tree/wood → lacquer tree, with aligned (pinnately compound) leaves → *model*; *standard* (← orderly alignment) → *block style* for writing Han/Chinese characters (regarded as the standard form).

kanji:饑
kanji_stroke_count:21

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:幾# minute + 食 food/eating → *shortage of food* → *poor harvest* (compare 稀); *be starved*; *hunger*. Compare 饉 and 稀.
tags:[]
___

___
kanji:雟
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:隹 short, squat bird + an element# combining 山 mountain and an abbreviated form of 商 (tall platform) → bird carrying twigs or other materials in its mouth in order to build a nest in a high place. The bird is most often identified as either a *sparrow* or *swallow*. 
tags:[]
___

kanji:耆
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ, シ]
kunyomi:[お（いる）, たしな（む）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 老 (aged) + 旨# tasty → the delicious *taste* of cured/preserved food. This primary sense largely faded, with 耆 coming to refer to instead to human *aging* and/or senility. Compare 嗜, which was devised to replace 耆.
tags:[]
___
kanji:稽
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[かんが（える）, とど（める）]
raw_etymology:Originally, the right-hand element# was 耆 (preserved food). The addition of 禾 grain/rice suggested the inspection of preserved crops → *consider*; *compare* (← consider/compare in inspecting). Also, *stay*; *remain*; *retain*; *keep* (← preserved).
tags:[]

kanji:毅
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

raw_etymology:豙# combines 豕 pig/boar + 立 stand → boar raising its bristly mane in response to a threat. 毅 adds 殳 action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → stand taut/be *resolute* → *strong*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:凱
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, ガイ]
kunyomi:[かちどき, やわ（らぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 豈# (pile of food) + 几 desk/table → food piled for a feast → *enjoy* → *relax* (← take one's ease at a feast). *Shouts/songs of triumph* is a borrowed meaning. 凱 was devised to express the original sense of 豈 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings, but itself acquired other meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:懿
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[よ（い）]
raw_etymology:Originally, as per 壹 (jar crammed full) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure → partake of the fine contents of a full container → *full and fine*. 欠 morphed into 次 and 心 heart/emotions was added, causing the right-hand element to appear as the etymologically unrelated 恣. *Virtue* and *splendid deed* are via association with "full and fine."
tags:[]

onyomi:[カツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 曷# (cut off) + 衣 clothing → coarse, dark cloth cut to make clothing → *coarse cloth* → *brown*. *Dark blue* also derives from the primary meaning, the clothes of low-ranking retainers in ancient Japan having been cut from coarse blue cloth.
tags:[]
___
kanji:謁
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:謁
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[エツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 曷# (cut off) + 言 words → cut off/delimit the participants in an audience with a person of high rank → *hold an audience*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:契
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[ちぎ（る）]
raw_etymology:The top element# combines 丯 a depiction of a piece of wood or bone that has been cut through and thus separated from the remainder + 刀 sword/knife → cut and separate wood or bone into pieces in creating a pledge/vow, with each party retaining a piece. 契 adds 大 great → great *pledge*/*vow* created by the means described above → *promise*; *tally*; *match*. In derivative characters the top element of 契 is often written in the form seen for example in 絜, 齧 or挈 (and the same for 契 itself, as in 楔 and 禊).
tags:[]
___
kanji:喫
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 契# (separate) + 口 mouth → cut and separate meat and other pieces of food by biting them into pieces → *eat* → *drink*; *smoke*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:潔
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[いさぎよ（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 絜# (separate) + 水 water → cleansing torrent of water that separates out impurities → *pure* → *righteous*; *manly*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:介
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:𠆢 a variant form of 人 person + an element# indicating two sides → person intervening to reduce/eliminate distance between separate parties → *intervene*; *mediate*. *Shellfish* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:界
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:介# (reduce) + 田 field → boundaries reducing a large field into smaller sections → *boundary*; *border* → *world*/circle (of the arts etc.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:害
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 丯# as described in 契 (cut through and separate) + 口 mouth → *harm* or *damage* caused by something cut/bitten through and thus separated → *prevent*/*hinder* (← prevent/hinder by separating). In the derivative characters 瞎 and 豁, the lower vertical stroke of 害 extends down to the 口 element.
tags:[]
___
kanji:割
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カツ]
kunyomi:[さ（く）, わり, わ（る・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 害# (cut) + 刀 sword/knife → sharp implement used in cutting/separating → *separation*; *division*; *breakage* → *cut*; *split*; *divide*; *break*; *crack open*; *dilute*; *drop below* (a standard) → *rate*; *ratio*; *percentage*; *allocation*; *comparatively*. Also, *find out* (← figuratively crack open a criminal's hiding place).
tags:[]
___
kanji:轄
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 害# (cut) + 車 vehicle → linchpin (compare 舝 as described in 桀) cutting rotation of a wheel, allowing *control* of the vehicle's speed → *supervision*. For the connection between cutting and control, compare 乂.
tags:[]
___
kanji:刈
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, ガイ]
kunyomi:[か（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 乂# (vegetation cut in swaths) + 刀 sword/knife → *cut/reap* with a sickle or other bladed implement → *trim*; *prune*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藝
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:蓺# cultivate + 云 (rise) → *cultivate*/raise plants → *skill*; *art*; *accomplishment* (← cultivation in a figurative sense). 藝 was devised to emphasize the "cultivate" meaning originally borne but largely lost by 蓺, but 藝 too came to convey primarily its figurative, associated meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:芸
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 藝: *skill*; *art*; *accomplishment* .
tags:[]

kanji:傑
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:桀# (raise/rise high) + 人 person → person whose talents raise him/her above others → *excel*; *be outstanding*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:季
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:禾# grain/rice + 子 child (→ offspring) → seasonal activity (whereby grains are planted, cultivated and harvested, in conjunction with leaving the earth fallow in winter) → *season* → *three-month cycle*. For the idea of conceptual cycles, compare 期 and 週.
tags:[]
___
kanji:棄
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 𠫓 as described in 育 (newborn baby) + an element# combining a rectangular disposal bin/basket and 廾 pair of hands → abandon a newborn in a basket → *discard* → *renounce*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:器
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[うつわ]
raw_etymology:An element# quadrupling 口 mouth/hole (→ variety of containers) + 犬 dog/beast → vessels filled with hunted game, or meat (compare 獻). The idea is to reduce the empty space in a *container/receptacle* by filling it (compare 吉) → *vessel*; *implement*. Also, *ability* (← have capacity/capability).
tags:[]
___
kanji:吉
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キチ, キツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a (filled) container (compare 器) → *good luck*; *favorable* (← abundance ← abundant contents). In derivative characters such as 佶 桔 and 詰, 吉 exerts the conceptual influence "reduce/eliminate space." For the connection between abundance and good fortune, compare 祺.
tags:[]
___
kanji:結
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[むす（ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 吉# (reduce/eliminate space) + 糸 thread → use thread or a cord to *bind/tie* and thus compact an object → *join*; *make/conclude* (a contract/treaty etc.) → *end*; *wind up* (← finish binding/joining).
tags:[]

kanji:詰
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キツ]
kunyomi:[つ（まる・む・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 吉# (reduce/eliminate space) + 言 words → *question closely*, leaving no room for evasion → *cram*; *pack*; *jam*; *fill*; *stop up* → *shrink*; *shorten*; *grow narrow*; *do continuously* (← no margin).
tags:[]
___
kanji:壹
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:壱
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[イチ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 壺 lidded pot + 吉# (filled container) → full pot/jar → *one* (← unity of contents). As with 弐, 参/參, and 拾, 壱 is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 一) in documents as a precaution against forgery.
tags:[]
___
kanji:一
kanji_stroke_count:1
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イチ, イツ]
kunyomi:[ひと, ひと（つ）]
raw_etymology:Although 一 is sometimes said to represent an outstretched finger, the phonetic evidence suggests the fundamental idea is that of its cognate 壹 (unity of contents). 一 may therefore be regarded as an abstract representation of unity, or fullness → *one*.
tags:[]

kanji:乙
kanji_stroke_count:1
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オツ, イツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A representation of vapors rising (compare 气) and hitting a blocking element such as a ceiling, or the top of a container. *Second in a series* and *second calendar sign* are borrowed meanings. 乙 appears in dual-element characters such as 軋, 亂 and 札 in the form 乚.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A depiction of steam/vapors rising (compare 乙) to fill a room or container → *steam*.

tags:[]
___
kanji:桀
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Although 桀 appears to consist of 舛 crossing legs + 木 tree/wood, the phonetic evidence reveals it is actually 木 + a variant form of 舝. 舝 combines an abbreviated form of 牽 (drag/draw) + 韋 (circumambulate) → linchpin dragging on a wheel and hindering rotation (compare 轄). 桀 thus originally indicated the idea of pinning a victim to a raised, wooden construction. Later, 桀 came to refer to a *roost* as a different type of wooden construction raised high off the ground.
tags:[]
___
kanji:埶
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲイ]
kunyomi:[う（える）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 丮# kneeling figure with arms extended + an element combining 手 hand/action indicator and 坴 as described in 陸 (stretched pile of earth) → kneel with arms extended to trim/cut in cultivating → *plant* (v.). Some reference sources also assign 埶 the associated meanings conveyed by 蓺 (talent; art; accomplishment). In 埶 as in 執, 丮 came to be written as 丸.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蓺
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲイ]
kunyomi:[う（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 埶# (cultivate) + 艸 grass/plant → *cultivate plants* → *talent*; *art*; *accomplishment*. 蓺 was devised to replace 埶 after the latter came to refer primarily to the act of planting.
tags:[]
___
kanji:乂
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガイ]
kunyomi:[か（る）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of vegetation cut in swaths → *cut grass*; *mow* → *manage*; *control*; *govern*. For the connection between cutting and control, compare 轄.
tags:[]

kanji:艾
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[ガイ]

raw_etymology:As per 乂# (vegetation cut in swaths) + 艸 grass/plant → (cut) *mugwort* (compare 薛) → *moxa*. For moxa, compare 灸.
tags:[]
___
kanji:櫱
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲツ, ケツ]
kunyomi:[ひこばえ]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element of 辥 combines 屮 grass shoot + 𠂤 as described in 追 (tall pile of objects) → compressed bundles of cut grass/vegetation (compare 乂). 辥# adds 辛 needle/cutting implement → cut grass/vegetation. 櫱 further adds 木 tree/wood → *offshoot* growing from the *stump* of a cut tree.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:曷
kanji_stroke_count:9

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

raw_etymology:As per 匃# (cut off) + 曰 say/speech indicator → cut off another person's speech. Compare 害. *Who*, *what*, *when*, *why* and *how* are borrowed meanings. The derivative characters 褐 and 謁 employ a variant form of 曷.
tags:[]

kanji:葛

raw_etymology:As per 曷# (cut off) + 艸 grass/plant → vine; creeper (← vegetation that grows despite being cut off from soil; compare 葎 and 蔓) → *arrowroot*; *kudzu*.

kanji:歇

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[や（める）]

kanji:疥

kunyomi:[はたけ]
raw_etymology:As per 介# (reduce) + 疒 illness → *scabies* (illness that causes scratching, by which the top layer of skin is reduced) → *psoriasis*.

kanji:珈
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 加# (place atop) + 玉 jewel → (woman's) *hair ornament*, placed atop the head/hair. The compound 珈琲, meaning coffee, is a transliteration of the Dutch Koffie.
tags:[]

kanji:彐

raw_etymology:A depiction of the *head of an animal*, usually taken to refer to a pig or boar. 彑 is a variant form, as is one in which the middle horizontal line of 彐 is extended to the right of the vertical stroke.
tags:[]
___
kanji:齧

raw_etymology:As per 吉# (reduce/eliminate space) + 木 tree/wood → (wooden) *well bucket*, filled with water when drawn up.

kanji:考
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[かんが（え・える）]
raw_etymology:A variant of 丂# as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 耂 an abbreviated form of 老 (aged) → elderly person with a bent back (compare 久). *Think* and *consider* are borrowed meanings, via 攷. Extended meanings include *idea*; *opinion*; *suggestion*; *intention*; *discretion*; *expectations*; *imagination*; *reflect on*; *prepare* (for); *intend to*; *expect* (that); *imagine* (that); and *contrive* (to). 考 also refers to one's deceased father; the character for one's deceased mother is 妣.
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

tags:[]
___
kanji:舊
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:旧
shinjitai_stroke_count:5
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:萑 is 隹 short, squat bird + 艸 grass/plant (here acting as a shape indicator, suggesting the curvature of a pair of ears) → horned owl. 舊 adds 臼# (stooped) → owl (← bird of a stooped appearance) → *bent with rot* (compare 朽) → *old*; *former* → *old friend*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:臭
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:臭
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[くさ（い）, にお（う）]
raw_etymology:Originally 犬 here an abbreviated form# of 犾 as described in 獄 (pair of dogs) + 自 (nose) → dogs sniffing each other → (foul) *smell* → *reek*; *stench*. 臭 is a variant form dropping one stroke from the 犬 element, the original form remaining in derivative characters such as 嗅 and 糗.
tags:[]
___
kanji:求
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[もと（める）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an animal pelt, complete with head and limbs, that would be wrapped about oneself for warmth (compare 㒼 as described in 滿, 皮 and 表, as well as 韋) → *draw tight* → *want* (← draw a desired object tightly into one's possession) → *seek*; *search for*; *request*; *ask* (for); *demand*; *buy*. In derivative characters, 求 conveys the concept "wrap" (← wrap a pelt about the body).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

kanji:糾
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:丩# as described in 叫 (twisted threads) + 糸 thread (for emphasis/clarification) → *entwine* thread → *twist* → *rectify* (← prevent another from straying; compare 救) → *follow about*; *examine* (← twist); *be strict with* (← rectify). A variant form, 糺, combines 糸 thread + 乚 a variant form of 乙.
tags:[]
___
kanji:休
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[やす（まる・み・む・める）]
raw_etymology:人 person + 木 tree/wood, the latter in all likelihood a remnant of an obsolete phonetic element# that, as with other terms in Old Chinese cognate with 休, involved curvature with respect to an actual or figurative frame. The combination of elements may have suggested a person resting in the shade of a tree with curved branches, or that of a curved, wooden construction → *rest*; *stop*; *quit*. Extended meanings include *recess*; (a) *break/breather*; *holiday*; *vacation*; *day(s) off* (from work); *absence*; *sleep*; *suspend* (work); *stop* (doing); and *lay fallow*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:好
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[この（ましい ・み・む）, す（き）]
raw_etymology:子# child + 女 woman → woman clasping a child → *like*; *love* → *desirable*; *favorable*; *fondness*; *pleasing*; *fine*; *taste*; *choice*; *preference*.

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:耂 an abbreviated form# of 老 (aged person) + 子 child → child(ren) attending to an aged person → *filial piety*.

kanji:酵

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 孝# (attend to someone/something aging) + 酉 alcohol container → the aging/fermentation process → *ferment* → *yeast*.

___
kanji:憂
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[う（い）, うれ（い・える）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an element combining 頁 head and 心 heart/emotions + 夊 here an abbreviated form# of 後 (drag along) → pensive, dragging state of mind, causing deliberate movement (compare 愛) → *sadness*; *anxiety*; *worry*; *grief*; *disappointment*; *depression*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:優
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[すぐ（れる）, やさ（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 憂# (deliberate movement) → *graceful*; *flexible*; *gentle* (← move gracefully, with great deliberation) → *excel*; *superior* (← graceful motion) → *kind*; *tender*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying a nuance that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]

kanji:奧
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:奥
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[オウ, オク]
kunyomi:[おく]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 共# (act jointly) + an element combining 釆 scattered seeds (→ fine objects) and 宀 roof/building → people searching for a small object in the *deep*, winding recesses of a structure (compare 究 and 探) → *recesses* (of a valley); *depths*; *secret*; *inner part*; *in one's heart* → *obscure*; *mysterious*; *profound*. Also, *corner*, *back room* and *wife* (← woman kept in seclusion).
tags:[]
___
kanji:交
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[か（う・わす）, ま（ざる・じる・ぜる）, まじ（える・わり・わる）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a standing figure with legs twisted or crossed → *cross*; *intersect*; *exchange*; *come and go* → *mix*; *blend*; *mingle*; *keep company with*; *associate with*; *converse*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:效
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[き（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 攵 action indicator → cross two objects in comparing them → *take after*. *Effective* is a borrowed meaning via 効.
tags:[]
___
kanji:効
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[き（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 力 power/energy → crossing of energy back and forth in effective cooperation → *work well*; *effect*; *do one's best*. *Take after* is a borrowed meaning via 效.
tags:[]
___
kanji:郊
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 邑 village/settlement → *suburb* (← residential area sited close to a town, allowing for easy crossing back and forth in commuting).
tags:[]
___
kanji:校
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 木 tree/wood → wooden *cross fetters* or *shackles*. Also, *fence* (← construction of crossed boards). *School* is from the idea of a place where an exchange of teaching and learning (by comparison) is performed; the same notion is at work in 學. For shackles/fetters, compare 械, 枷, 絆 and 桎.
tags:[]
___
kanji:絞
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[しぼ（り・る）, し（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 糸 thread → twist fabric and pull *tight* → *wring*; *strangle* → *squeeze out* (water); *press*. Also, *scold*, *grill* (a person), *drill* (a person), (photographic) *stop/diaphragm*, and *tie-dyeing*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:敎
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:教
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[おし（え・える）, おそ（わる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form character combines 攴 action indicator and 爻# (obtain knowledge) → cause to obtain knowledge. The addition of 子 child suggests an instructor stimulating pupils to obtain knowledge (compare 學) → *teach*; *instruct*; *tell/show* (how to do) → *lesson*; *teachings*; *precept*; *doctrine* → *religion*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:要
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[い（る）, かなめ]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 女 woman + an element combining a pair of hands and a backbone → compress a woman's waist, creating curvaceous hips → waist; hips → *main point*; *vital* (← hips as the pivot point of the body) → *brief*; *sum up*; *in short*. Also, *demand* (← demand that which is vital to one) → *want*; *need*; *require*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:腰
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[こし]
raw_etymology:要# waist/hips + 肉 flesh → *waist*; *hips*; *small of the back*. 腰 was devised to replace 要 after the latter acquired its extended meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:高

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[たか（い）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of one of a pair of tall, curving gate towers → *tall*; *high* → *expensive* (← high price). Compare 冓.
tags:[]

kanji:稿
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:禾 grain/rice + 高# high/tall → tall stalks of millet → straw → *draft*; *manuscript* (raw version of a written work ← raw material ← millet stalks used as thatch or fuel).
tags:[]
___
kanji:豪
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 高 tall/high + 豕 pig/boar (→ wild animal) → porcupine (← small animal likened to a pig that, when threatened, arches its back and makes its protective needles stand on end) → *magnificent*; *powerful*; *wealthy*; *luxurious* (← stand tall ← stand on end).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[はし]
raw_etymology:喬# tall and limber + 木 tree/wood → arching, wooden *bridge*.

kunyomi:[た（める）]
raw_etymology:喬# tall and limber + 矢 arrow → *bend* a tall bow in firing off an arrow → *straighten*; *correct* (← bend back into shape) → *reform*.

kanji:曉
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:暁
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ギョウ]
kunyomi:[あかつき]
raw_etymology:日 sun/day + 堯# (arch/rise high) → sun rising over the horizon, which in turn lightens the sky → *dawn*; *daylight*; *daybreak* → *enlighten*.

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:One-half of a depiction of slender, curved threads (compare 絲 as described in 糸) → *slender, curved thread*; *small* (and slender). Also, *young* and *childish/childlike* (← small being ← slender/small).
tags:[]

kanji:爻
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Curving, crossing lines (divined to obtain knowledge of the future) → *cross*; *mix*. Compare 交.
tags:[]
___
kanji:臼
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[うす]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a rounded *mortar* → *mortar-shaped object* → *bone socket*. In derivative characters such as 舊/旧 and 舅, 臼 lends the conceptual influence "stooped," the habitual posture used in working a mortar/pestle set in ancient times.
tags:[]
___
kanji:韭
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ, ク]
kunyomi:[にら]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *leek*, the top of which bends back toward the ground. When used as an independent character in Japanese, the variant form 韮, adding 艸 grass/plant, is more common.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A depiction of a *tortoise* or *turtle* with a curved shell.

kunyomi:[かめ]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 龜 *tortoise*; *turtle*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:敖
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows that the 土 element was originally 出 proceed. 敖 adds 放# scatter → spread/roam without restraint → *ramble*; *play around*. *Arrogant* is a borrowed meaning, via 傲.
tags:[]
___
kanji:傲
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[おご（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 敖# (spread/roam without restraint) + 人 person → pride of one able to act unfettered → *proud*; *arrogant*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:梟
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[ふくろう]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 鳥 bird + 木 tree/wood → *owl* (the corpses of which were in ancient China hung on trees to keep sparrows and other birds away) → *expose* (a criminal's severed head); (executed criminal's) *exposed head*. Also, *ferocious* (← owl as predator). For the idea of (exposing) a severed head, compare 県 and 領.
tags:[]
___
kanji:皋
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[おか, さんたま, さわ, みずたまり]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 敫 as described in 激 (white spray that scatters when waves pound rocks), specifying a high riverbank → *waterside*. 皋 also takes the form 皐 (see 翺).
tags:[]
___
kanji:夭
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of the slender, limber figure of a running youth (compare 允) → *young*. *Die young* and *calamity* are borrowed meanings via 殀.
tags:[]
___
kanji:妖
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[あや（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 夭# (slender and limber) + 女 woman → woman twisting her body alluringly (compare 嬌) → *alluring*; *bewitching*; *weird*. *Calamity* is a borrowed meaning, via 殀.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:8

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 夭# (slender and limber) + 歹 severed bone/death → *die young/prematurely* (i.e. when one is still slender and limber) → *kill* (another in his youth).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 夭# (slender and limber) + an abbreviated form of 高 tall/high → tall, limber youth → *tall and limber* → *superior*; *arrogant*; *put on airs*.

kunyomi:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:喬# tall and limber + 艸 grass/plant → a supple and mildly toxic perennial used as a medicinal plant. The compound 蕎麥 (蕎麦) refers to buckwheat.

kanji:堯
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows 人 person + a depiction of a tall, arching pile of goods → carry goods piled high upon the back. A seal inscription form replaces the objects on top with a large pile of earth → arch (extremely) *high*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:尭
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A simplified form of 堯 arch (extremely) *high*. 尭 appears in the Shinjitai forms of the derivative characters 暁 and 焼.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 人 person → (figuratively/actually) stand on tiptoe in expectation (compare 企 and 跂) → *good fortune* (← have one's hopes/expectations met) → *expect too much*.

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:羊# sheep + 火 fire → *lamb* (← that fits into a round cooking pot for boiling whole; compare 羜).

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 丂# as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 攵 action indicator → wind and twist to the furthest reaches → *investigate* deeply (compare 究) → *consider*; *examine*; *test*.

kanji:尻

kanji:馗
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 首 neck/head → *cheekbone* (← arched bone that bumps up against the eye socket). *Road* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鳩
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[はと]
raw_etymology:As per 九# (bump up against and bend/curve) + 鳥 bird → *pigeon*; *dove* (← a plump bird) → *assemble*; *gather* (← large flock of pigeons). It is also possible to regard 九 as having a mimetic function, that of suggesting cooing.
tags:[]
___
kanji:灸
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 久# (long and curved) + 火 fire → moxa formed into a long and curved stick for use in *moxibustion*. Compare 艾.
tags:[]

kanji:疚
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[やま（しい）, や（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 久# (long and curved) + 疒 illness → *lengthy/chronic illness* (one causing the body to curve/hunch) → *guilt*; *remorse* (← protracted mental affliction). 
tags:[]

kanji:毬

onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[いが, まり]
raw_etymology:As per 求# (wrap) + 毛 hair → *ball* made of wrapped hair/fur (compare 鞠) → *ball-shaped/round object*; *burr*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:裘
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 求# (wrap a pelt around the body) + 衣 clothing → *a fur* (garment) wrapped about the body. 裘 was devised to express the original sense of 求 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:咬
kanji_stroke_count:9

kunyomi:[か（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 口 mouth → *bite*; *chew* (← teeth crossing back and forth in biting/chewing/gnawing). Compare 嚙 and 齩.
tags:[]

kanji:狡

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[こす（い）, ずる（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 犬 dog/beast → *cunning/crafty* animal (compare 獪 and 猾) able to twist and make its escape → *sly*; *deceitful*.

kanji:鮫
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[さめ]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 魚 fish → *shark* (← sea creature with jagged teeth that mesh when the jaw is closed). Compare 鰐.
tags:[]
___
kanji:浩
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 告# (bend) + 水 water → *great/abundant* amount of water that causes trees and vegetation to bend → *vast* → *wide*; *expansive* (← vast space ← vast amount of water; compare 灝).
tags:[]
___
kanji:皓
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:晧 is per 告# (bend) + 日 sun/day → *bright* sunshine, causing plants to bend/wilt (compare 浩). Later, the meaning *white* came to predominate over bright (compare 皋), leading 晧 to be supplanted by 皓, in which 日 is replaced by 白 white.
tags:[]
___
kanji:膠
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[にかわ]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 肉 flesh → *sticky* substance produced by separating the non-edible portions of a bird from the edible ones and boiling the former down (compare 餃) → *stick to*; *glue*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:嗅
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[か（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:臭# smell + 口 mouth (→ action indicator with reference to the face) → *smell* (v.). 嗅 was devised after 臭 came to be used as a noun.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舅
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[しゅうと]
raw_etymology:As per 臼# (stooped) + 男 man → stooped (= older/elderly) human male (compare 久) → *brother(s) of one's mother*; *father of one's husband*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[よもぎ]
raw_etymology:高# high/tall + 艸 grass/plant → general term for tall plants → *artemisia*; *mugwort*.

raw_etymology:高# high/tall + 攴 action indicator → raise the arm high, then *strike* down upon an object → *beat*; *pound*.

raw_etymology:高 here an abbreviated form# of 皜 pure white + 肉 flesh → white fat → *tasty food*; *fat* → *grease* → *ointment*; *paste* (n.) (← greasy substance).

kanji:毫
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 豪 (stretch at length) + 毛 (fine strands of) hair → *fine hair* stretched for use in a *writing brush*. Also, *minute amount* (← fine amount ← fine).

___
kanji:壕
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[ほり]
raw_etymology:As per 豪# (stretch at length) + 土 earth → *moat* stretching about an edifice. Compare 濠.
tags:[]
___
kanji:濠
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[ほり]
raw_etymology:As per 豪# (stretch at length) + 水 water → *moat* stretching about an edifice. *Australia* is via the phonetic construction 濠太剌利. Compare 壕.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藁
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[わら]
raw_etymology:稾# variant form of 稿 (stalks of millet) + 艸 grass/plant (for emphasis/clarification) → *straw*; *wither*. *Dead/withered tree* is a borrowed meaning via 槁.
tags:[]
___

kanji:繳
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク, キョウ]
kunyomi:[いぐるみ, まと（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 敫# as described in 激 (collide and scatter) + 糸 thread → *arrow attached to a cord*, one fired at a flock of birds that scatters when one is hit. *Hand over* is via the idea of taking (prey) in hand → *pay*; *tie up*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:耰
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 憂# (deliberate movement) + 耒 plow → using an *agricultural implement* similar to a plow, rake earth over planted seeds with a deliberate motion.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[わざわ（い）]
raw_etymology:夭 here an abbreviated form# of 殀 die prematurely + 示 altar/the supernatural → *calamity*; *disaster*.
tags:[]

kanji:窅

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ, オウ, ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:目# eye + 穴 hole → *eyes sunk deep in a person's eye sockets* → *deep*. Compare 眶.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[か（む）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 鼽 (nasal obstruction) + 手 hand/action indicator → (use the hands/fingers to) *blow the nose*.

kanji:栲
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, ゴウ]
kunyomi:[たえ]
raw_etymology:As per 考# (bend) + 木 tree/wood → tree with a bending/twisting element → *sumac* or *lacquer (tree)*. たえ refers to a type of *cloth woven from tree fibers*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A variant form of 皋 (waterside), specifying a *marsh*. *Testicle(s)* is a borrowed meaning.

onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[みずち]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 虫 insect (here in its original sense of a snake) → (one type of) *dragon* (← be supple/sinuous ← twist). Compare 虯.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[い（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 敖# (spread/roam without restraint) + 火 fire → blazing fire → *roast*; *parch*. Also, *endure* (← withstand an ordeal as scathing as a fire).

raw_etymology:As per 各# (come to a stop) + 人 person → stop a person who is in the process of making a *mistake* → *fault*; *blame*; *reprimand* → *self-reproach*.

raw_etymology:牛 cow + 口# mouth → cow bending its neck in lowing → *tell*; *inform*; *announce*; *signal* (← communicate in "speech").
tags:[]

kanji:酷
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 告# (bend) + 酉 alcohol → strong alcohol that induces stomach pains, causing one to bend over → *severe*; *intense* → *cruel*.

tags:[]
___
kanji:較
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 交# (twist/cross) + 車 vehicle → crossing bars in the passenger compartment of ancient vehicles, which passengers grasped to maintain their balance. *Compare* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:學
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:学
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ガク]
kunyomi:[まな（ぶ）]
raw_etymology:𦥯# is 爻 (obtain knowledge) + an element combining a pair of hands and 冖 a cover (→ covered building) → covered place of instruction where another is stimulated to obtain knowledge (compare 校). 學 adds 子 child → place where an instructor stimulates pupils to acquire knowledge (compare 敎) → *school* → *study*; *learn*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:覺
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:覚
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[おぼ（える）, さ（ます・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 𦥯# as described in 學 (obtain knowledge) + 見 see → be stimulated to obtain knowledge, and *realize* its acquisition → *learn*; *awaken*; *come to one's senses*; (Buddhist) *enlightenment* → *remember*; *memory*; *bear in mind*; *feel*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:約
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 糸 thread → *tie* a knot in a cord (as a sign of a pledge) → *promise*; *conspicuous mark* → *brief*; *summary* (← reduce in making compact; compare 要) → *approximately* (← summary approximating a full report in providing only the gist).
tags:[]
___
kanji:虐
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギャク]
kunyomi:[しいた（げる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is a variant of 爪 (pick/pluck) + an element# combining 虍 tiger and 人 person → person attacked/grabbed by a tiger → *brutality*; *oppression*; *persecution*. In derivative characters, 虐 is written in the form seen in 瘧 and 謔.
tags:[]
___
kanji:劇
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:豦 is 虍 tiger + 豕 pig/boar → boar likened to a tiger in ferocity. A scribal form character combines 豦# + 力 power/energy → *fierce*/swift activity → *severe*; *rapid*. *Drama* and (theatrical) *play* are borrowed meanings. 力 eventually came to be written 刀.
tags:[]
___
kanji:確
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[たし（か・かめる）]
raw_etymology:隺 combines 隹 short, squat bird + 冖 cover that obscures → bird obscured by a covering/overhanging object. 確 is as per 隺# (framing object that obscures/is obscured) + 石 stone → obscuring stone wall. *Verify*; *ascertain*, *certain*, *positive*, *reliable* and *sound* (of mind/health) are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:激
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲキ]
kunyomi:[はげ（しい）]
raw_etymology:敫# combines 白 white + 放 scatter → waves colliding with rocks, scattering white spray. 激 adds 水 water for emphasis/clarification → *turbulence*; *violence*; *intense*; *severe*; *extreme*; *fast* → *be excited*; *urge*; *encourage*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:勹 an abbreviated form# of 包 (envelop) + 米 rice → wrap the hands about a handful of rice → a *handful*.

kanji:醵
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 豦# as described in 劇 (fierce) + 酉 alcohol container → rowdy drinking party. Later, the nuance shifted to that of collecting food, drink or money in the interest of holding a feast → *contribute* (to a feast).
tags:[]

kanji:葯

raw_etymology:As per 約# (tie a knot in a cord) + 艸 grass/plant → a knotty rhizome, especially that of the iris, from which orris root is derived. *Anther* is a borrowed meaning.

kanji:駮

shinjitai:NONE

tags:[]

kanji:榷

kunyomi:[まるきばし]

kunyomi:[くつ]
raw_etymology:喬# tall and limber + an abbreviated form of 履 wear shoes → straw or hemp woven into flexible, arched *sandals*. Compare 蹻 and 屨.

raw_etymology:As per 𦥯# as described in 學 (obtain knowledge) + 告 inform → *inform*, enabling knowledge to be obtained. Also, and likely on account of the same imagery, the *name of a legendary Chinese emperor*.
tags:[]

kanji:宮

kunyomi:[みや]
raw_etymology:宀 roof/building + two squares indicating particular places within a building → winding building with many rooms → (Imperial) *palace*; *mansion* → *prince/princess*; (Shinto) *shrine*.

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[きわ（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 躬# (bend) + 穴 hole → bend in negotiating a tunnel → *be blocked/stuffed*; *be at/come to an extreme*; *end*; *dead end* (← reach the end of a tunnel). Also the borrowed meanings *investigation* and *follow through* (compare 究, 奧, and 探).

___
kanji:句
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally the same character as 局 (bending lines demarcating a frame). In 句, the sense of "demarcation" gave rise to the meanings *phrase*, *verse*, *line*, *clause* and *sentence*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拘

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 句# (bend) + 手 hand/action indicator → *confine* a prisoner in a bending posture → *detain*; *adhere*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:具
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[グ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form of 鼎 tripod kettle/cauldron + an abbreviated form of 共# (act jointly in making an offering) → act together to *equip* a vessel for offering → *equipment*; *implement*; *tool*. Also, *means* and *ability* (← have the means/ability to equip). In 颶, 具 appears in a variant form.
tags:[]
___
kanji:裕
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 谷# (cavity) + 衣 clothing → loose-fitting garments with ample space between fabric and skin → *surplus*; *ample*; *abundance*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:侯
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form replaces the top element of the oracle bone form of 矣 (target) with a person, indicating a marksman hitting a lumpy target with an arrow → *lord*; *marquis* (← persons of rank at court ← meritorious soldiers). 侯 is a later form, adding 人 person for emphasis/clarity.
tags:[]
___
kanji:候
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[そうろう]
raw_etymology:As per 侯# (lumpy object) + a person (→ human agency) → inspect a lumpy or otherwise conspicuous object → *sign*; *symptom* (← that which attracts attention to a person/object); *scout* (← person who works following signs/clues); *weather* (← signs or indicators of weather). The application to 候 of the Japanese そうろう, a *classical verb ending*, represents a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:口
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, ク]
kunyomi:[くち]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a rounded cavity, and in particular the human *mouth* → *hole*; *entrance*. 口 can also function as a shape indicator.
tags:[]
___
kanji:后
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is the reverse of the elements combined in 司 (peer through a narrow hole), and thus refers to someone kept out of sight → *empress*; *queen* (← female members of the royal/imperial family, whose quarters were secreted deep within a palace; compare 宮).
tags:[]
___
kanji:後
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, ゴ]
kunyomi:[あと, うし（ ろ）, おく（れる）, のち]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 幼 (slight power) + an element combining 夊 dragging leg/foot and 彳 movement → drag along on account of having slight power → *behind*; *late*; *after*. Other extended meanings include *back*; *rear*; *lag*; *late*; *afterward*; *since* (then); *ever since*; *the remainder*; (time) *remaining* and *successor*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[みぞ]
raw_etymology:As per 冓# (symmetry) + 水 water → symmetrical constructions that conduct water → *ditch*; *gutter*; *sewer* → *groove*.
tags:[]

kanji:構
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[かま（う・え・える）]
raw_etymology:As per 冓# (symmetry) + 木 tree/wood → assemble wood in fabricating a *structure* the front and back of which are symmetrical → *fabricate*; *build* → *prepare*; *device*; *style*; (mental) *preparation* → *mind/care about*. Other extended meanings from "prepare" or "fabricate" include *hospitality*; *interfere*; *feign*; and (assume a) *posture/attitude*.
tags:[]

kanji:苟
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク, コウ]
kunyomi:[いやしく（も）]
raw_etymology:As per 句# (bend) + 艸 grass/plant → bend grass to temporarily demarcate a small unit of land → *for the time being*. *In the event that*, *considering that*, *if*, *any* and (not) *on any account* are borrowed meanings. Distinguish 苟 from the identical-appearing element in 敬.
tags:[]

kanji:駒
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[こま]
raw_etymology:As per 句# (bend) + 馬 horse → *colt* (← bending figure of a foal on unsteady legs; compare 狗) → (general term for a) *horse*. Also via the idea of demarcating a narrow space is *bridge* (of a stringed instrument) and *shogi/chess pieces*. The latter meaning is influenced by the Chinese term 馬子.

kanji:扣

kanji:枸
kanji_stroke_count:9

onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[]

kanji:浴
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨク]
kunyomi:[あ（びせる・びる）]
raw_etymology:As per 谷# (cavity) + 水 water → submerge oneself in a water-filled cavity such as the base of a waterfall, or a bathtub → *bathing* → *pour* (water); *shower*; *immerse oneself* (in an activity). Other extended meanings from "pour" include *heap upon*; *bask* (in sunshine); *receive/be subjected to* and *under fire*.

kanji:局
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a pair of bending lines demarcating a narrow frame → bracket; compartment → *office*; *bureau*; *department* → *situation* (← circumstances dealt with by a specific authority). The present shape is via a seal inscription form of the character. Compare 句.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:犾# is a depiction of two dogs, suggesting a pair of dogs tangling in a fight. 獄 adds 言 words → *trial*; *suit*; *sue* (← be entangled in a harsh dispute; compare 訟) → *prison*.

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガク]
kunyomi:[たけ]
raw_etymology:As per 丘# (hill) + 山 mountain → rugged, rocky *mountain* → *peak*. 嶽 and 岳 are distinct characters, but 岳 is the Shinjitai (new character form) adopted in Japan during the twentieth century to replace 嶽 for official use. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:玉
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギョク]
kunyomi:[たま]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a circular, jeweled object → *precious stone*; *jewel*; *gem* → *round object* such as a *ball* or *lens* (compare 球).
tags:[]
___
kanji:屋
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オク]
kunyomi:[や]
raw_etymology:至 here a variant of 侯# (lumpy object) + 尸 shape indicator (→ cover) → lumpy covering object, such as the *roof* of a *house* or *shop* → *cover*; *business*. Also, *dealer* and *seller* (← the same semantic progression from "house/place of business" to "tradesman" as found in 家).
tags:[]
___

kanji:控
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[ひか（え・える）]
raw_etymology:As per 空# (emptiness) + 手 hand/action indicator → create space between two points, objects or people → *hold back*; *draw in* → *refrain*; *wait*; *await*; *keep from* (← hold back) → *be near at hand*. *Copy/write down*, *note*, *memo* and *a duplicate* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

___
kanji:恐
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[おそ（らく・れ・れる・ろしい）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 巩 is 工 (connecting pipe/tube) + an element combining 卩 kneeling figure with arms extended (seen also in 埶) and 手 hand/action indicator → kneel and pierce a hole in connecting two objects with a pipe/tube → secure/fasten. 恐 is 巩# + 心 heart/emotions → empty/uneasy feeling in one's heart (compare 匈), as though a hole has been pierced in it → *fear* → *threaten*; *fearsome*; *awe*; *dread* → *apprehension*; *concern* → *terrible*; *horrible*; *fierce*; *tremendous* (← aspects of a threatening or fearsome object). *Probably* and *possibly* are via the uncertainty of the state of mind that fears something desired may not in fact materialize.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 谷# (cavity) + 宀 roof/building → empty building into which voluminous goods are placed → *put in*; *contents*; *volume* → *contain*; *accept* → *appearance* (← shape of objects in a container).
tags:[]

kanji:孔
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 子 child + a mark# → mother and newborn (just passed through the vagina in being born), connected by the curving and now stretched umbilical cord → *hole* (← vagina). *Confucius* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:降
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[お（りる・ろす）, ふ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 夅 is a depiction of legs bending as they descend a hill. 降 is 夅# + 阜 piled earth (for emphasis/clarification) → *descend* a high hill → *fall*; *get off/out*; *lower*; *unload*; *transfer*. Other extended meanings from "fall" include *defeat*; *retire*; *give up*; *to rain*; *to snow*; and *abort* (a fetus).
tags:[]
___

kanji:鶲
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オウ]
kunyomi:[ひたき]
raw_etymology:As per 翁# (aged bird) + 鳥 bird (for emphasis/clarification) → an aged bird. 鶲 was devised to replace 翁 after the latter's transformation of meaning. In Japanese, 鶲 indicates a *flycatcher*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:跫
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:巩# as described in 恐 (pierce a hole) + 足 leg/foot → footsteps (that create depressions in the ground). Later, the term came to be used with specific reference to the *sound of footsteps*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[あ（げる）]
raw_etymology:As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 手 hand/action indicator → *run a pole through an object*, raise it, then *carry on the shoulders*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:杠
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 木 tree/wood → *tree/plank stretched over a river as a bridge* (connecting one bank of a river to the other; compare 矼). Also, *flagpole* (stretching into the sky).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 工# (connecting pipe/tube) + 石 stone → *stepping stones* (connecting one bank of a river to the other; compare 杠) → *hard* (← hard stones) → *earnest*.
tags:[]

kanji:蛩
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[こおろぎ]

tags:[]

kunyomi:[ぬえ]
raw_etymology:空# sky + 鳥 bird → an imaginary bird, of attributes obscure. ぬえ can refer to either *White's thrush* or to an *imaginary creature* with the head of a monkey, body of a raccoon dog, legs of a tiger and a snake for its tail; compare 鵺.

kanji:華
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ケ]
kunyomi:[はな, はな（やか・やぐ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is as per 于# (U-shaped) + an element combining 垂 hang (doubled) and 艸 grass/plant → beautiful *flower*, the center of which sinks in a U-shape → *gorgeous* (← beautiful). Also, *brilliant* (← brilliant coloring, or brilliant beauty) and *China* (← country likened to a beautiful flower).
tags:[]

___
kanji:鼓
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[つづみ]
raw_etymology:壴# is a round drum with decorations on the top, set upon 豆 food stand (→ a stand). 鼓 added 攴 action indicator in its original sense of a hand holding a stick → *hand drum*. In contemporary orthography, 攴 is replaced with 支 (originally, a hand holding a bamboo branch).
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[また]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a person's right arm contracted in surrounding or protecting an object resting on the shoulders → *above*; *beyond* → *again*; *moreover*; *or*.

kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ, ウ]
kunyomi:[あ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is as per 又# (right hand/arm) + 肉 flesh → extend the right hand/arm in shouldering a slab of meat → *have* (← hold) → *be*; *exist* (← have being ← have form ← object in a fixed point of space; compare 居, 在, and 存).

kanji:畫

shinjitai:画
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ガ, カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 晝# (demarcate in writing) + 聿 implement held upright to carve/draw characters → *demarcate*/*mark off* in writing → *draw*; *paint* → *drawing*; *picture*; *painting* → *stroke* (n.). Also, *plan* and *consider* (← written plan).

kanji:涯

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:厓 here a variant form of 圭# (neat) + 水 water → neatly carved cliff overlooking water → *shore*; *(land's) end*; *limit*; *extremity*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:掛
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, カイ]
kunyomi:[か（かり・かる・ける）]
raw_etymology:A variant of 挂 hang → *hang*. In Japanese, the verbs かかる and かける bear numerous meanings that stem directly or indirectly from the concept of "hang." The principal meanings follow. かかる： *hang*; *be covered with/by*; *be splashed*; *be locked*; *be caught*; *be tied (up)*; (of an engine) *start/catch*; *attack*; *be subject to*; *be suspected of*; *be connected/related*; *be involved in*; *call* (out); *be brought up*; *be anxious about*; *depend on*; *take/require* (time); *pay*; *carry* (insurance); (of a play/movie) *be showing/playing* and *set about*. かける： *hang*; *put* (on a stove/fire); *cover*; *sprinkle*; *pour*; *lock*; *fasten*; *grasp*; *catch/snare*; *bind* and *put/set up*. Also, *be in charge*; *weigh*, *fix*, *wear*, *multiply* and *begin to/be on the point of*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:危
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[あぶ（ない）, あや（うい・うく・ぶむ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows 厄# (withdraw in a kneeling position from a cliff) + a second crouching figure at top → kneel in a dangerous, slightly off-balanced position at a cliff → *danger*. Related meanings included *risky*; *critical* (condition); *close/narrow* (escape) → *nearly*; *almost*; *barely* (← close escape), as well as *fear* (for); *be anxious*; *uncertain*; *unreliable*; *dubious* and *doubt* (← fear/be anxious or doubtful about escaping a dangerous situation).
tags:[]
___
kanji:尤
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[もっと（も）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 又# hand + a vertical, slightly bent line, suggesting a skin eruption → wounded, contracted hand → *differ*; *conspicuous* (← conspicuously different shape of a wounded hand). Also, *criticize* (← be critical of what is perceived as figuratively bent) and *outstanding* (← conspicuous). *Natural(ly)*, *stand to reason*, and *especially/particularly* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:瓜
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[うり]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *melon* (conceptualized as a solitary object pendent on a vine) → *gourd*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:壺
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[つぼ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a lidded *vase* or *pot* → *jug*; *jar*. Also, *key point* and *vital point* (← ancient game in which the objective was to toss arrows into a jar).
tags:[]
___
kanji:圭
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of clay/earth piled high in a neat cone shape. An ancient Chinese custom was to declare sovereignty over a particular territory by hanging a proclamation over such a pile. *Imperial present of a jade object in recognition of a lord's sovereignty* is an extended meaning from this custom. The jade object itself had a square base and was pointed at top.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卦
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケ, カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (jade object) + 卜 divination → jade object used in *divination* → *omen*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:奎
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ, キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 大 stand outstretched → *crotch* (shaped liked the base of a cone; compare 夸 and 胯) → *star* (believed to preside over literary activities, and belonging to a group of sixteen stars in Andromeda that resemble a human crotch).
tags:[]
___
kanji:娃
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[アイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (neat) + 女 woman → woman of neat, attractive appearance (compare 佳) → *beautiful woman* → *beautiful*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:桂
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[かつら]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 木 tree/wood → general term for various species of trees that grow or are cultivated in the shape of a cone → (general term for) *aromatic trees*; *katsura tree*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:珪
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 玉 jewel → jeweled *tablet/scepter*, the crown of which formed a cone shape. *Silicon* is a meaning expressed by the compound 珪素.
tags:[]

onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[あぜ, うね]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (neat) + 田 field → a neat *ridge* that partitions fields.
tags:[]

kanji:閨
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[ねや]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 門 gate → small, cone-shaped *entrance* → (woman's) *bedchamber* (led on to by such an entrance; compare 閤) → (elegant/refined) *woman*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鮭
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, ケイ]
kunyomi:[さけ, ふぐ]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (neat) + 魚 fish → *salmon* (← fish of a neat, attractive appearance; compare 佳 and 娃). 鮭 has also been used to refer to *blowfish/puffer* (fish).
tags:[]
___
kanji:于
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an object that stretches before bending into a U-shape. *Here*, *from*, *interrogative particle*, *go*, and *exclamation of lament* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

kanji:夸
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ, カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Variant# of 于 (U-shape) + 大 stand outstretched → stride/stretch over an object, the crotch forming a U-shape (compare 奎) → *extravagant* (← exaggerated pose). *Boast* is a borrowed meaning via 誇.
tags:[]
___

kanji:袴
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[はかま]
raw_etymology:As per 夸# (U-shaped crotch) + 衣 clothing → trousers (← garment covering the crotch) → *hakama* (long, pleated skirt worn by males over their kimono).
tags:[]
___
kanji:跨
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ, カ]
kunyomi:[またが（る）, また（ ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 夸# (U-shaped crotch) + 足 leg/foot → *straddle* or *stride over* an object, the crotch forming a U-shape → *astride*; *bestride*; *span*; *step over*. 跨 was devised to replace 夸 after 夸 lost its connection with "straddle."
tags:[]
___
kanji:瞿
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:目 eye (doubled)# is a character indicating "make a circular sweep with the eyes." 瞿 adds 隹 short, squat bird → bird looking about nervously (compare 雇 and 鶪) → *look about*; *stare at in surprise*; *be surprised and fearful*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:惧
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[グ, ク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:懼 is as per 瞿# (look nervously about) + 心 heart/emotions → nervous emotion in the forms of *fear*, *awe* or *apprehensiveness*. 惧 is a variant form of 懼.
tags:[]
___
kanji:佑
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウ, ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 右#: *protect* → *help*; *assist*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one. Compare 侑.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 右# (protect) + 示 altar/the supernatural → protection/*help* extended by the gods.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[ウ, ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 有# (extend) + 人 person (→ human agency) → extend *help/assistance* to another (compare 佑). Also, *urge another to eat* (← assist by feeding).
tags:[]
___
kanji:宥

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

tags:[]

___
kanji:柩
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[ひつぎ]
raw_etymology:匛# combines 匚 enclosure/frame + 久 (long and curved) → corpse in a *coffin*, the body curled rather than laid straight out. 柩 adds 木 tree/wood to denote a wooden coffin (in distinction to a stone sarcophagus or coffin made of other material).
tags:[]
___
kanji:皀
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 白# (scatter) + 匕 double-pronged eating implement (→ pitchfork-like implement) → scatter animal feed. Later, 皀 came to refer to the foodstuffs itself and, in Japan, to the *fragrance* given off by *grain*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廏
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キュウ]
kunyomi:[うまや]
raw_etymology:𣪘# is 皀 (feed animals) + 殳 action indicator → feed animals. 𣪘 was devised to replace 皀 after the latter's transformation of meanings. 廏 adds 广 building → *barn/stable* (in which farm animals are sheltered and fed).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[いぼ]
raw_etymology:As per 尤# (skin eruption) + 疒 illness (for emphasis/clarification) → *wart*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:槻
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[つき]
raw_etymology:規# (compass-like implement) + 木 tree/wood → variety of *zelkova* tree. One important application of this wood in ancient China was for making precisely measured bows. That said, the original reason for adding 木 tree/wood and creating 槻 may have been to replace 規 and indicate the implement in question.
tags:[]
___
kanji:窺
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[うかが（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 規# (observe) + 穴 hole → observe through a hole → *peep through/into*; *spy (on)*; *watch for*.
tags:[]

kanji:罫
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ, カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 罣 hinder, with 卦# replacing 圭. *Ruled line(s)* is a borrowed meaning, influenced by the reticulated pattern of a net.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:筥
kanji_stroke_count:13

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[はこ]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 宮 (winding) + 竹 bamboo → *round basket* (made of bamboo or other material that has been wound about); *stackable boxes*. Also, by shape association, a *bundle of rice plants*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:壼
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[つぼ]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 壹 (jar crammed full) + 亞# (downward pressure) → narrow-mouthed, wide-bodied *pot/container* (compare 罌) filled with heavy contents. *Inner garden of a palace* is a borrowed meaning, as are the minor meanings of *vital point* and *point on which one's places one's hopes/expectations*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:沍
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴ, コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 互# (fit together) + 水 water → close off a sluice (compare 閘) → *drying up/closing off of a source of water* → *close* (an open object). *Freeze* is a borrowed meaning via 冱.
tags:[]
___
kanji:瞽
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:鼓# drum + 目 eye → (blind) *musician* → *blind person*; *musical troupe*. Also, *illiterate* and *stupid* (← non-understanding ← blind). In ancient China, blind persons were commonly employed as court musicians.
tags:[]

kanji:絓
kanji_stroke_count:12

onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[しけ]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (neat) + 糸 thread → neat pile of *thread*. Also, on account of the use of threads in nets, an overlap with the meanings of 罣: *be caught* (in/on) → *hinder*; *disturb*; *obstruct*.
tags:[]

kanji:佹

onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 殳# (throw) + 羊 sheep → one *ram* flinging itself against another in butting horns → *black ram*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:褂
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 袿 gown, with 卦# replacing 圭 → *gown*; *overcoat*. Also, a type of *ceremonial clothing* during the Manchu Dynasty.
tags:[]
___
kanji:袿
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[うちかけ, うちぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 圭# (cone-shaped) + 衣 clothing → *ceremonial gown* (cone-shaped garment worn by women). Also, the *back hem of a garment*. うちぎ refers to both an outer garment (for women) and an undergarment (for men) worn in Japan. Compare and contrast 褂.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[えぐ（る）]
raw_etymology:咼# (variant of 冎 bone) + 刀 sword/knife. Effectively, 剮 is a variant of 叧 as described in 拐 (sever/separate a limb from its joint) → *cut*.
tags:[]

kanji:郭
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 享 (enclosure) + 邑 village/settlement → *enclosure* about a village/settlement → *quarters*; *red-light district*. The phonetic evidence suggests that the 享 element in 郭 has replaced a graphically similar element indicating a circular enclosure; compare 或.
tags:[]

kanji:玃
kanji_stroke_count:23

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 矍# (enclose in the hands) + 犬 dog/beast → large, predatory *ape* (← take prey captive in the hands). Compare the phonetically close 禺 and 猴 as well as the more common character 猿, all of which refer to simians.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鶪
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element# combines 目 eye + 犬 dog/beast, suggesting a captive animal casting nervous glances all about (compare 瞿, in which the nervous creature is a bird). 鶪 adds 鳥 bird → a captive *shrike* (compare 鴃).
tags:[]
___
kanji:擁
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:雝 combines 邕 moated village + 隹 short, squat bird → birds contained in a marsh adjacent to a moated village. 擁 combines 手 hand/action indicator + 雍#, originally a variant of 雝 → contain a bird, whether in a cage or by wrapping the hands around it → *hold*; *embrace*; *protect*.
tags:[]

tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:往
kanji_stroke_count:8

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 王# (extend) + a stylized rendering of an oracle bone character combining a leg in motion + 彳 movement → make an extensive journey → *go*; *gone* → *past*. There is no etymological connection between 往 and 主.
tags:[]
