kanji:雄
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[お, おす]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 厷 combines 又 hand and a bending line representing an elbow → extend the arm toward an object. 雄 is 厷# (extend) + 隹 short, squat bird → male bird extending its wings to display authority → *male*; *strong*; *brave*; *manly*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:榮
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:栄
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[さか（える）, は（える）]
raw_etymology:𤇾# is 火 fire (doubled) + 冖 cover (→ fire ring) → campfire burning within a fire ring. To 𤇾 (curve about), 榮 adds 木 tree/wood → blossoming flowers that curve about a tree → *blossom*; *thrive*; *flourish*; *be attractive*; *be conspicuous*; *be brilliant* → *prosper*; *boom*; *shine*; *glory*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:螢
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:蛍
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[ほたる]
raw_etymology:As per 𤇾# as described in 榮 (curve about) + 虫 insect → insect (such as a glow-worm) that produces a ring of light → *firefly*. Compare the idea of illumination in 營.
tags:[]
___
kanji:營
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:営
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[いとな（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 𤇾# as described in 榮 (curve about) + an abbreviated form of 官 (wrapped about/enclosed) → circular military encampment (compare 軍), illuminated by torchlight (compare the idea of illumination in 螢) → *camp*; *barracks* → *conduct* (business); *perform*; *build* (← set up camp).
tags:[]
___
kanji:櫻
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:桜
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[オウ]
kunyomi:[さくら]
raw_etymology:嬰# extend about + 木 tree/wood → flowering blossoms extending about a tree (compare 榮) → variety of plum tree → *cherry tree*; *red*; *pink*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:傾
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[かたむ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 頃#: incline one's head → *tilt*; *incline*; *lean*; *list* (to one side); *slant*; *sink*; *decline*; *concentrate* (on) (← incline one's head toward a desk) → *squander*; *ruin* (← decline). Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冂
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ケイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction of a marker hung on a fence. The meanings *border* and *distant* suggest that the marker indicated a distant borderline, or border post. The relevant bronzeware inscription form adds an element indicating a particular place, creating the variant form 冋.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冏
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キョウ, ケイ, ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A representation of a ventilation hole# (compare 向) + 八 split right and left → *bright* light streaming through a pair of ventilation holes made on opposite sides of a roof → *clear*.
tags:[]

kanji:滉

kanji:元
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン, ガン]
kunyomi:[もと]
raw_etymology:As per 兀# (head) + a horizontal line → *head* → *origin*; *cause*; *raw material*; *capital*; *prime element* (← head as source and beginning; compare 頭) → *former* (← prior ← original). 元 was devised to replace 兀 after the latter lost its original connection with the head.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:頑
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 元# (rounded/oval head) + 頁 head → rounded/oval head → *stubborn* (← make no progress in convincing another ← circular discussion going round and round in a person's head; compare 願) → *stout*. 頑 was devised to convey the original sense of 元, but it too acquired extended meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冠
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[かんむり]
raw_etymology:As per 元# (rounded/oval head) + an element combining 冖 cover and 寸 hand/action indicator → object placed on and adhering to the head → *crown*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:官
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 㠯 is a depiction of objects that have been accumulated and wrapped. 官 adds 宀 roof/building → a number of people wrapped about/enclosed in an (official) building → *government*; *official* → *human organ* (← object controlling a variety of functions, in the manner of an official). Compare 營.
tags:[]
___
kanji:棺
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[ひつぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 官# (wrap about/enclose) + 木 tree/wood → wooden *coffin* in which a corpse is enclosed.
tags:[]
___
kanji:管
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[くだ]
raw_etymology:As per 官# (wrap about/enclose) + 竹 bamboo → (bamboo) *pipe*; *tube*; *flute*. There is no longer any specific connection with bamboo. * Control* is a borrowed meaning via the acquired, associated meaning of 官, here possibly with respect to the control exercised in playing a wind instrument; compare 筦.
tags:[]
___
kanji:館
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[やかた]
raw_etymology:As per 官# (official building) + 食 food/eating → official building for taking meals → (large) *building*; *inn*; *shop*. Also, *fort*, *mansion* and *place where cultural activities are held*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:券
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 𠔉# shows the palm of an open hand (symbolizing a handprint as a guarantee) + 廾 pair of hands (suggesting the parties involved in a transaction) → wooden slat on which handprints were made as a guarantee. As proof of a transaction, this slat was cut in two, each piece wrapped/rolled up with an encircling cord, and one piece given to each of the two parties involved. 券 adds 刀 sword/knife (for emphasis/clarification) → cut slats serving as proof of a transaction into two pieces → *draft*; *certificate*; *ticket*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卷
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:巻
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[カン, ケン]
kunyomi:[まき, ま（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 𠔉# as described in 券 (wrap/roll up) + a bending figure → *curl*; *roll*; *roll up*; *reel*; *coil*; *wind* (up/around) → *volume* (of a set of *books*, originally, rolled *scrolls*).
tags:[]
___
kanji:圈
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:圏
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:卷# curl + 囗 circular enclosure → pen or cage that curls about captive animals → *range*; *orbit*; *sphere* (of influence).
tags:[]
___
kanji:原
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[はら]
raw_etymology:厂 cliff + an abbreviated form# of 泉 spring → round spring at the base of a cliff → *origin*. *Field* and *plain* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:源
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[みなもと]
raw_etymology:原# origin + 水 water → *origin* of a *source* of water → *trace*; *fountain*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:願
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[ねが（い・う）]
raw_etymology:As per 原# (round) + 頁 head → round head. Eventually, 願 came to be associated with the idea of a notion that circulates persistently in the brain (compare 惱 and 慮), leading to the extended meanings *wish*; *desire*; *hope* → *request*; *petition*; *application*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:員
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 囗# circular enclosure + a tripod kettle → (the *circumference* of a) *round*, tripod kettle → *number* (← counter for round objects ← round objects) → *member* (← number of people; compare the expression "per capita," along with the character 頁).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:員# round (→ perfectly round → harmonious) + 音 sound → *rhyme*; *meter*; *tone* (← rounded/harmonized sound).

kanji:垣

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[かき]
raw_etymology:As per 亘# (circle about) + 土 earth → earthen *wall* that circles about an enclosure → *fence*; *hedge*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:環
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:睘# was originally 袁 (wrap about/enclose) + 目 eye → all-encompassing observation (compare 觀). In derivative characters, the "all-encompassing" aspect of 睘 takes the aspect "circularity." 環 adds 玉 jewel → jeweled *ring*/bracelet → *circle*; *surround*. *Return* is a borrowed meaning via 還. For "ring," compare 鐶; for "bracelet," compare 釧.
tags:[]
___
kanji:還
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 睘# as described in 環 (circular) + 辵 movement → *circulate* (compare 運) and *return* → *circle*; *look back*. For the meaning "look back," compare 眷.
tags:[]
___
kanji:園
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[その]
raw_etymology:囗 circular enclosure + a variant of 袁# (wrap about/enclose) → fields and gardens enclosed by a fence → *garden* → *villa*; *country house*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遠
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[エン, オン]
kunyomi:[とお（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 袁# (wrap about/enclose) + 辵 movement → move a great *distance* within enclosed territory (compare 運, 還, and 逭) → *distant*; *far*.
tags:[]

kanji:猿

kunyomi:[さる]
raw_etymology:犬 dog/beast + 袁#. The original form of the character, however, was 犬 + 爰 (twist about) → the twisting figure of an ape or *monkey*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 爰# (twist an object about a stick) + 手 hand/action indicator → *assist*/*help* the creation of a tool or the completion of a task by twisting an object (whether or not around a stick).
tags:[]
___
kanji:緩

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[ゆる（い・む・める・やか）]
raw_etymology:As per 爰# (twist about) + 糸 thread → twist knotted threads in loosening them → *loose*; *slack*; *relieve*; *relax* → *gentle* (curve etc.); *slow*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:丸
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[まる, まる（い・める）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 人 person bending beneath a curved line# suggesting a cliff (compare 宛) → *round*; *circular*; *spherical* (← posture of the figure) → *roll up*; *make a ball of*; *wad up*. Also, *entire* (← complete ← round). *Suffix in the names of ships* is by confusion with the classical Japanese term まろ (maro), meaning "lineage."
tags:[]

raw_etymology:宛# bend + 肉 flesh → (flexible) *wrist* → *arm* → *talent*; *ability* (← accomplishments ← things accomplished with the hands/arms). For wrist and arm, compare 捥.
tags:[]
___
kanji:絹
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[きぬ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 肙# combines 肉 flesh + a round shape → reel (= unwind) the thread from the cocoon of a silkworm. 絹 adds 糸 thread → *silk* threads. Compare 繭.
tags:[]

kanji:繭

onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[まゆ]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 巾# cloth + an element combining 糸 thread and 虫 insect → *silkworm cocoon*, from which silk is produced. Compare 絹.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[か（える・わる）]
raw_etymology:As per 奐# (draw out of/away from) + 手 hand/action indicator → *change*, *replace*, *exchange* or *substitute* one object for another after drawing the old one out of its position.
tags:[]

kanji:寬
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:寛
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the lower element# is a depiction of a mountain goat with widely spaced horns. 寬 adds 宀 roof/building → *spacious* building in which one can relax → *magnanimous*; *generous* (← broad-minded).
tags:[]
___
kanji:幻
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[まぼろし]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is a reverse image of the seal inscription form of 予 (stretch), suggesting the faintly visible tip of a thread stretching/protruding beyond a surface. The present style combines 幺 slender thread with an element signifying a slight wavering. The common reference is to a faintly wavering, slender thread → *illusion*; *vision*; *specter*; *phantom* → *confusion*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:玄
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows *slender* threads twisted together and thus linked → *darkness* (← so slender as to be barely perceptible, a situation likened to darkness) → *obscure*; *mysteriousness*; *black*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:勸
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:勧
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[すす（める）]
raw_etymology:雚# is 艸 grass/plant + an element combining 口 mouth (doubled) and 隹 squat bird → flock of birds above a marsh, in circular uniformity. 勸 adds 力 power/energy → offer a uniform recommendation/suggestion etc. → *recommend* *suggest*; *advise*; *encourage*; *offer*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 木 tree/wood → circular pieces of wood counterbalancing each other → *power* counterbalancing that of another → *right*; *authority*.

___
kanji:款
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element is a variant of 柰, which is 木 tree/wood + 示 altar/the supernatural → press a knife to carve characters into offerings made of soft wood from a Chinese apple tree. 款 is as per 欠# (cavity) + the left-hand element to suggest a block on which characters were carved → carve characters into a block by scooping out wood (creating cavities) → engrave; engraved characters. *Amity*, *clause* and *sincerity* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:川
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[かわ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a curving *river* boring its way through the earth in linking distant points. Compare 河. In characters such as 巡 and 邕, 川 appears in the form 巛.
tags:[]
___
kanji:訓
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 川# (bore through) + 言 words → (a) *teaching* (← words that allow one to bore through a difficult problem) → *interpret*; *KUN reading* of a Han/Chinese character (← grasp the signification of a character ← comprehend in learning; the contrast is to 音, where the idea is to read a character for its sound).
tags:[]
___
kanji:貫
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[つらぬ（く）]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction of two rounded seashells, pierced and adhering closely in being strung together → *pierce*; *penetrate*; *go through* (compare 擐). *Consistent* and *carry out* are extended meanings. The present form combines 貝 shell/commodities + 毌#, a depiction of a cowrie shell (distinguish from 毋).
tags:[]
___
kanji:慣
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[な（らす・れる）]
raw_etymology:貫# penetrate; go through + 心 heart/emotions → condition created by going through an action/activity to the point of thorough penetration → *become/make accustomed to* → *train*; *exercise*; *custom* → *become skillful*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:患
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[わずら（い・う）]
raw_etymology:串# pierce + 心 heart/emotions → *worry*; *suffer* (← heart that is figuratively pierced) → (be) *ill*; *trouble*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:關
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:関
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[かか（わる）, せき]
raw_etymology:The lower element# is as per 丱 (two boards pierced by a connecting rod) + 幺 slender thread (doubled) → connect two objects by piercing each and inserting thread or cord through holes in them (compare 串 and 穿). 關 adds 門 gate → *shut* a gate by connecting its two doors with a *bolt* or *bar* → *connect*; *barrier*; *checkpoint*. Also, *be involved* (← have a connection with).
tags:[]
___
kanji:軍
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[グン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 車 vehicle + an obsolete element indicating "wrap" → circular military encampment (compare 營) formed by chariots → *army* → *soldier*; *battle*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:運
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウン]
kunyomi:[はこ（ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 軍# (circularity) + 辵 movement → *move about in a circle* (compare 還) → *transport*; *carry*; *convey* → (make) *progress*; *manage/carry out* (an undertaking). *Fate* comes from the idea of the circulation of good and evil in the course of one's life; compare 業.
tags:[]
___
kanji:君
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[きみ]
raw_etymology:As per 尹# (ruler who brings heaven and earth into harmony) + 口 mouth → ruler whose commands create a harmonious group. The meaning *you* originally was with respect to social superiors, but in modern Japanese is used toward social equals or subordinates.
tags:[]
___
kanji:郡

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[グン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 君# (group) + 邑 village/settlement → administrative group → *district*; *county* → *division of an administrative unit*.
tags:[]

kanji:群

raw_etymology:日 here an abbreviated form# of 旬 (cycle/circle) + 比 line up → a figurative or actual circle (of people) → *companions*; *group* → *insect* (← swarm of insects).

raw_etymology:As per 昆# (circular group) + 水 water → assemble and *mix/stir* in a round container a variety of soluble objects → *blend*.

kanji:旬
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン, シュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 匀 (arrange in a circle) + 日 sun/day → one *cycle of ten days* (according to a traditional calendar). *The season when foods taste their best* is by extension from the minor meaning of "pervade" (← time when fish, fruits and vegetables are to be found all over/at their peak).
tags:[]
___
kanji:温
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オン]
kunyomi:[あたた（か・かい・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:𥁕# is a depiction of a curved lid fitting its container in holding in the contents. 温 adds 水 water → hold in moisture and keep an object *warm/hot*. 温transforms the top element of 𥁕 into 日, but 𥁕 is the style found in derivative characters such as 慍, 褞, 縕, 醞 etc.
tags:[]
___
kanji:勳
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:勲
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:熏 here an abbreviated form# of 薰 fragrance + 力 power/energy → the (figuratively) fragrant result of effort → *merit*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:薰
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:薫
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[かお（り・る）]
raw_etymology:熏# smoke + 艸 grass/plant → plant the *smoke* of which carries a fragrant *scent* → *fragrance*; *perfume*; *aromatic*. Also, *smolder*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:雲
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウン]
kunyomi:[くも]
raw_etymology:As per 云# (adhering vapors) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → *cloud* (vapor-filled, steam-like object).

kanji:魂
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コン]
kunyomi:[たましい]
raw_etymology:鬼 ghost; demon + 云# (adhering vapors) → *soul*; *spirit* (vaporous object of indeterminate form).
tags:[]
___
kanji:縣
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 県# (be suspended) + 系 connection → be connected in hanging suspended → *hang suspended in-between* → *prefecture* (← political unit suspended between the central and local governments).
tags:[]
___
kanji:県
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an upside-down, severed head (compare 首), which it was a custom to *suspend in midair* from a high place (to serve as a warning to potential criminals). In Japan, 県 was also adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 縣, according to which 県 also conveys the meanings *hang suspended in-between* and *prefecture*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:丨
kanji_stroke_count:1
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A line, originally curved, that penetrates from top to bottom → *vertical penetration* such as of water emerging from a spring (compare 原/源) or of skewered objects (compare 串).
tags:[]
___
kanji:尹
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:丨# line that penetrates from top to bottom + 又 hand/action indicator → ruler who brings heaven (top) and earth (bottom) into harmony (compare 氳) → *oversee*; *govern*; *overseer*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:串
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン, セン]
kunyomi:[くし]
raw_etymology:丨# line that penetrates from top to bottom + what were originally two circular objects → *pierce* round objects (compare 丱 and 穿), which adhere closely in being strung together → *skewer*; *spit* (n.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:丱
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of two boards pierced by an elliptical connecting rod (compare 串 and 穿). Later, 丱 came to refer to a *children's hairstyle* in which two tufts or braids were run through and held in place by a hairpin.
tags:[]
___
kanji:宦
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 宀 roof/building + 臣# subject; retainer → palace servant → *government official*; *serve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:穿
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[うが（つ）, は（く）]
raw_etymology:穴# hole + 牙 fangs/mesh → using fangs, pierce a hole → *make a hole*; *dig*; *drill* → *pass through*; *pass an object through*; *penetration*; *investigate thoroughly*. Also, *wear/put on* (footwear) (← foot that penetrates the hole of footwear). For the idea of piercing, compare 串 and 丱.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冤
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 宛 (bend beneath a cover), the substitution of 兔 (variant form of 兎 rabbit) for the two bending figures in 宛 suggesting a rabbit crouching under the cover in which it is trapped → *be framed/falsely accused*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:宛
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[あて, ずつ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows two figures bending beneath a cover (compare 丸) → *bend* (= make the body round) in concealment → *wind*. *As if*, *just like*, *addressed (to)* and *allotment* are borrowed meanings. In derivative characters, 宛 exerts either the conceptual influence "bend" (婉 惋 捥 etc.) or "circular" ( 埦 椀 碗 etc.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:婉
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:宛# bend + 女 woman → the *graceful* figure of a bending (= supple) woman → *gentle*; *beautiful*. For the coupling of "supple" and "beauty," compare 鵷.
tags:[]
___
kanji:捥
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワン]
kunyomi:[もぎ（る）, も（ぐ）, も（げる）]
raw_etymology:宛# bend + 手 hand → (flexible) wrist → *arm* → *wrench from/off* → *snatch from* → *tear/break off*. For wrist and arm, compare 腕.
tags:[]
___
kanji:椀
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 宛# (circular) + 木 tree/wood → round *wooden bowl* (in which food is served) → *wooden cup*. Compare 埦, 碗 and 鋺.
tags:[]
___
kanji:碗
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 宛# (circular) + 石 stone (→ stoneware; chinaware) → round *bowl* → *teacup*. Compare 埦, 椀 and 鋺.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 宛# (circular) + 豆 bean → round peas (in a flexible pod) → *pea*.

kunyomi:[もが（く）]
raw_etymology:宛# bend + 足 leg/foot → *bend/stoop* → *writhe*; *squirm*; *struggle* (← contort ← bend).
tags:[]
___
kanji:苑
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン, オン]
kunyomi:[その]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 宛 (bend) + 艸 grass/plant → winding enclosure for flowers, trees or animals → *pasture*; *farm*; *park*; *garden*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:怨
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン, オン]
kunyomi:[うら（み・む）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 宛 bend + 心 heart/emotions → bent, warped emotions → *enmity*; *hatred*; *grudge*. Compare 慍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鴛
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン, オン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 宛 bend + 鳥 bird → *male mandarin duck*. In contrast to the female of the species, 鴦, the male has feathers on the flank that bend/curl up.
tags:[]
___
kanji:灌
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[そそ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 水 water → *pour* liquid, causing it to circulate → *irrigate*; *flow into*. For the idea of a great flow, compare 渙.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[かま]
raw_etymology:As per 雚# as described in 勸 (circular uniformity) + 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase → wide-mouthed, bulging earthenware jug/vase → *vessel*; *can* → *boiler*.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 柬# (place over a fire) + 火 fire → *smoke* rising from an object being burned → *smoke* (v.); *darken*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:燻
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[クン]
kunyomi:[いぶ（す・る）, くすぶ（る）, くす（べる）]
raw_etymology:熏# smoke + 火 fire (for emphasis/clarification) → smoking fire → (to) *smoke*; *smolder*; *fumigation*; *oxidation*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:淵
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[ふち]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form of the right-hand element# is a depiction of a deep, round basin filled with water, such as found at the base of a waterfall. 淵 adds 水 water (for emphasis/clarification) → *deep pool*; *deep waters* → *profound* (← profundity ← deep pool). Also, *depths*, *abyss* and *pond*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:允
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows a human figure running in chasing or being chased (compare 夭). *Consent*; *permit*, *sincere* and *peaceful* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:4

onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a variant# of 尹 (harmonious circle) + 二 (align) → objects arranged in a neat circle → *equal*; *uniform* → (place in) *balance*; *even*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:匀# uniform + 金 metal → piece of metal of uniform weight → *unit of weight* (approximately 7.7 kilograms).
tags:[]

kanji:奐
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 廾 pair of hands + an element# indicating a woman with spread thighs → draw a fetus out of/away from the womb. *Bright*, *exchange* and *replace* are borrowed meanings via 換.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 奐# (draw out of/away from) + 火 fire → *bright*/*brilliant* flame(s) drawn away from a fire's fuel source → *shining*.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (stretch) + 弓 bow → stretched, curved bow → *stretched bow* → *pull/draw back on*; *curve*. In 湾, 彎 appears in the simplified form 弯.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爰
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A horizontal line + an element# that is 爪 claw/hand + an element combining an object and 又 hand/action indicator → twist an object about a stick → *lead to* (← twist and come to an end) → *then*; *thus* (← primary and secondary effects of an action).
tags:[]

kanji:暈
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[かさ, ぼか（す）]

kanji:梱

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[こり]
raw_etymology:As per 困#: a *bale* of wood encircled by a cord → *pack*; *package*. 木 tree/wood was added to devise a replacement character for 困 after 困 acquired its figurative meanings.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:縕
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウン, オン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 𥁕# as described in 温 (hold in/down) + 糸 thread → *tangled hemp* or raveled silk used to bind/hold down an object → *confusion*. Compare 紜 for these two meanings. Also, *old cotton* (← old, worn/frayed fabric ← tangled hemp).
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:縕# tangled hemp + 艸 grass/plant → tangled pile of harvested vegetation → *pile up*; *store* (up). Compare 薀. 
tags:[]

kunyomi:[ひつじさる]
raw_etymology:As per 申# (bolt of lightning) + 土 earth → marker, likened to a bolt of lightning, thrust into the *earth* as a *divination sign*. *Southwest* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:玩
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[もてあそ（ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 元# (round) + 玉 jewel → toy/*play with* a round gem (compare 弄) → *enjoy*; *take pleasure in* (compare 翫). Also, *trifle with* and *make sport of*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:翫
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガン]
kunyomi:[もてあそ（ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 元# (round) + 習 learn (specifically, learn by repetition) → smooth out the rough edges of an action by repeated practice → *enjoy*; *take pleasure in* (← enjoy obtaining perfection). Compare 玩.
tags:[]

kanji:絃
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲン]
kunyomi:[いと, つる]
raw_etymology:As per 玄# (link) + 糸 thread → *string* (of a musical instrument, strung between and thus linking two points). In contemporary Japanese usage, 絃 has been displaced by 弦.
tags:[]
___
kanji:喧
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[かまびす（しい）, やかま（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 宣# (proclaim) + 口 mouth → proclaim noisily, as a *boisterous* crowd (compare 諠 and 讙) → *noisy*. It is possible that here 宣 is intended to function mimetically, conveying the sound of clamor.
tags:[]

kanji:滾

kunyomi:[たぎ（る）]

kanji:鋺

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[かなまり]

tags:[]
___
kanji:轅
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[ながえ]
raw_etymology:As per 袁# (wrap about/enclose) + 車 vehicle → pair of *shafts* protruding from the front of an ox/horse-drawn vehicle (compare 轘). The shafts were connected by a crossbar, about which the animals' reins were wrapped to enable pulling.
tags:[]

kanji:轘

kanji:烜
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン, キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 亘# (circle about) + 火 fire → circle of objects being dried (in the heat given off) by the *bright* sun → *dry*. Compare 晅.
tags:[]
___
kanji:睍
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン, ゲン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:見# fix sight upon + 目 eye → goggle eyes → *stare* with eyes wide open. Also, take *a quick glance* all about (compare 眴).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 旬# (cycle/circle) + 目 eye → take *a quick glance* all about (compare 睍) → *be dazzled*; *give someone a meaningful look*.
tags:[]

kanji:稛
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コン, キン]
kunyomi:[つか（ねる）]
raw_etymology:As per 囷#: *bundle* grain → *bind*. 禾 was added to devise a replacement character for 囷 after 囷 came to be used to indicate a granary.
tags:[]
___
kanji:髠
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兀# (shave a person's head) + 髟 hair → *shave the head* → *shave a head in punishment*. 髠 was devised to replace 兀 after 兀 lost its connection with shaving the head. 
tags:[]

kanji:果
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[は（たして・たす・て・てる）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a tree with round *fruit* hanging from a long branch → *result* (← fruit of effort); *fill*; *fulfill*; (← fully ripe) → *carry out*; *accomplish* (← fulfill) → *limit*; *end*; *come to an end*; *die* (← final result) → *as expected* (← end up as expected); *actually* (← turn out actually to be); *be at a loss* (← come to an end of resources).
tags:[]
___
kanji:菓
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:果# fruit + 艸 grass/plant → *fruit* → *confection*. 菓 was devised to replace 果 when the latter came to refer primarily to results and related abstract meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:課
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:果# result + 言 words → *investigate* in order to obtain results → *subject*; *lesson*; *assignment* → *department* (← department assigned to investigate; compare 科).
tags:[]
___
kanji:委
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[ゆだ（ねる）]
raw_etymology:As per 禾# (hang low) + 女 woman → tired (and/or stooped) woman likened to low-hanging grain → *let go of*; *leave behind* (← let hang) → *entrust* (← leave matters to others ← hang listlessly); *devote oneself to* (← allow oneself to become completely devoted to ← let go of).
tags:[]
___
kanji:和
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワ]
kunyomi:[やわ（らぐ・らげる）]
raw_etymology:禾 here an abbreviated form# of 龢 (harmony; calm; peace) + 口 mouth → *harmony*; *calm*; *peace* (produced by words/song) → *soften*; *moderate*; *lessen*; *tone down*; *ease* → *die down*. *Japan* is a borrowed meaning (see 倭 for explanation).
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]

___
kanji:化
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ケ]
kunyomi:[ば（かす・ける）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a fallen person aligned with a seated person. A seal inscription form has a standing person aligned with another person, the latter assuming a curious pose. The meanings *transformation*, *change*, *assume a disguise*, *bewitch* and *deceive* suggest that the two figures depicted in 化 are one and the same individual, who has undergone a transformation in posture or appearance.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ケ]
kunyomi:[はな]
raw_etymology:化# transformation + 艸 grass/plant → *flower/blossom* (← part of a plant that undergoes a slow transformation).
tags:[]
___
kanji:貨
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:化# transformation + 貝 commodities → *money* transformed into *goods* and vice-versa → *load* (← load of goods).
tags:[]
___
kanji:爲
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:為
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[ため, な（す）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 爫/爪 hand/claw + 象 elephant → brandish a curved stick in training elephants, transforming their behavior. *Do* is an associated meaning (← use the hands and accomplish an objective) → *make*; *arrange*. Also, *become* and *change into* (compare 化), as well as *on behalf of* and *because of* (← do/perform for the benefit of another). The pronunciation of 爲 suggests that 象 has replaced another element, one likely indicating a different animal.
tags:[]
___
kanji:僞
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:偽
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ギ]
kunyomi:[いつわ（り・る）, にせ]
raw_etymology:As per 爲# (transform) + 人 person: → transform one's persona → *deceit*; *sham*; a *lie/fabrication*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]

kanji:鬼
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[おに]
raw_etymology:Originally, an abbreviated form# of 旡 engorgement + the obsolete "head" element described in 思 (specifically, a skull with openings at top; compare also in this context 遷 soul departing from the body) → mysterious, large and lumpy being → *ghost/spirit*; *devil*; *demon*; *ogre*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:塊
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[かたまり]
raw_etymology:As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 土 earth → large *lump/clod* of earth (compare 圣 as described in 怪, as well as 顆) → *cluster*; *group*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遺
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:貴# valuable goods + 辵 movement → movement of valuable goods in being bequeathed → *bequeath*; *leave behind* → *leave*. *Send* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:回
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, エ]
kunyomi:[まわ（し・す・り・る）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of one object rotating within another → *rotate*; *revolve*; *spin*; *turn/go around* → *pass around*; *spread* (of a fire); (of medicine/alcohol) *take effect*; *number of times*; *encircle*; *curve*; *return*; *detour*; *cycle*. Extended meanings include *refer to* (a specialist) and *transfer* (← pass around), as well as *sumo wrestler's belt* (← encircling object). 回 may be regarded as a variant of the cognate 冎/咼 (bone circulating in its joint).
tags:[]
___
kanji:怪
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ, ケ]
kunyomi:[あや（しい・しげ・しむ）]
raw_etymology:圣# is 又 hand/action indicator + 土 earth → knead a lump of earth/clay (compare 塊 and 顆). 怪 adds 心 heart/emotions → *odd* feelings aroused by the figure of a lumpy, mysterious object (compare 鬼) → *mystery*; *wonder*; *doubt*; *suspicion*; *strange*; *dubious*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:胃
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 肉 flesh + an obsolete element# combining 囗 circular enclosure and 米 rice → *stomach* containing meat/food.
tags:[]
___
kanji:歸
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:帰
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[かえ（す・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 帚 hand holding a broom + 𠂤# as described in 追 (tall pile of objects) → sweep in circular fashion, gathering a pile. *Return* is an extended meaning (← sweep in a circle, returning to one's starting point) → *leave* (← leave to return home). A seal inscription form adds 止 stop to suggest completion of action.
tags:[]
___
kanji:懷
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:懐
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[なつ（かしい・かしむ・ける）, ふところ]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form of 褱# shows a trail of round tears falling from an eye + 衣 clothing → trail of tears absorbed in one's garment → fall and be absorbed. 懷 adds 心 heart/emotions → warm feelings harbored in the heart/breast → *fondness*; *yearning/longing*; *breast/bosom/heart*; *be dear to one*; *miss* (someone); *win over*. Also, *breast pocket* and *purse*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:壞
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:壊
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[カイ, エ]
kunyomi:[こわ（す・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 褱# as described in 懷 (fall and be absorbed) + 土 earth → collapsing pile of earth, absorbed by the ground (compare 崩, 隨 and 圮) → *collapse*; *destruction* → *pull/tear down*; *breakage*; *damage*; *injury*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:威

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:戌 here a variant of 戈# halberd + 女 woman → exercise *authority* over a woman → *dignity*; *majesty*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:囗
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ, コク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a circular *enclosure* such as a city wall → *specific/particular place*. Although the present style of the character squares the edges, ancient forms are rounded, and the association with circularity is evidenced by cognate characters with the element such as 韋, 圍 and 囮.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[ほこ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long *halberd* with a curved handle and sharp blade → *spear*; *lance*. Also, *battle*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A depiction of two overlapping tiles, forming a round shape → *tile* → *unglazed earthenware*. *Gram* is a borrowed meaning.

kanji:隈
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワイ]
kunyomi:[くま]
raw_etymology:As per 畏# (lumpy) + 阜 piled earth → *recess* in a lumpy hill or mountain represented by a bay/cove → *corner*. Also, *shade* (← gradations of light created by indentations/corners).
tags:[]

kanji:煨

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 畏# (lumpy) + 火 fire → lumps of charcoal (compare 熅) in a *charcoal fire* over which food is simmered → *simmer*; *stew*.
tags:[]

kanji:冎
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 骨 (scoop out a limb from its joint) → *hollow/scoop out*. 咼 is a variant form of 冎.
tags:[]

kanji:彙
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 果# (round) + 彑 variant form of 彐 head of an animal → *hedgehog/porcupine* (animal that curls into a ball for protection; compare 蝟). Also, *gather*, *assemble* and *(same) kind* (← great number and similarity of porcupine needles).
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[おびただ（しい）]
raw_etymology:果# fruit + 多 much/many → *large number/quantity* of fruit → *tremendous*.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 果# (round) + 足 leg/foot → (the round) *anklebone* → *ankle*.

___
kanji:顆
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[つぶ]
raw_etymology:果# fruit + 頁 head → (fruit-shaped or head-shaped) *clod* (compare 塊 as well as 圣 as described in 怪); *small round object* → *counter for small round objects*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:倭
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワ, イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 委# (hang low) + 人 person → short person/*dwarf* (viewed as hanging low; compare 矮). *Yamato* (ancient Japan) derives from the Chinese use of 倭 to refer to Japan or the Japanese. Afterwards, the Japanese replaced 倭 with 和, a homonym (in Japanese, though not in Chinese) with more positive associations. Other pejorative names for countries and their residents that involve shortness include 魏 and 夷.
tags:[]
___
kanji:萎
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[しお（れる）, しな（びる）, し, ぼ（む）, な（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 委# (hang low) + 艸 grass/plant → drooping/fading plant → *droop*; *fade* → *decline*; *weaken*; *be exhausted*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 委# (hang low) + 矢 here an abbreviated form of 短 short → hang *low*; be *short* → *dwarf*. Compare 倭.
tags:[]

kanji:魁
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[さきがけ]
raw_etymology:As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 斗 ladle → large ladle. *Leader*, *founder* and *conspicuous* are either borrowed meanings (via 傀) or extended senses via "large" → *take the lead*. Logically, the classifier for 魁 should be 斗, but it is traditionally given as 鬼.
tags:[]

___
kanji:毀
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Here, 臼 mortar is an abbreviated form# of a character below which is added 米 rice → grind rice in a mortar. 毀 adds a character combining 土 earth and 殳 action indicator → knead earth/clay (compare 圣 as described in 怪). The combination of elements suggests the idea of destroying by causing to collapse (compare 壊) → *destroy* → *slander* (← words that destroy).
tags:[]
___
kanji:恢
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, an abbreviated form# of 宜 (pile) + 灰 ash → *great* pile of ash → *vast*. Also, *empty* (← emptiness created by a conflagration resulting in a great pile of ash). The present form substitutes 心 heart/emotions for the abbreviated form of 宜.
tags:[]
___

___
kanji:槐
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[えんじゅ]
raw_etymology:As per 鬼# (large and lumpy) + 木 tree/wood → *Chinese scholar tree*; *Japanese pagoda tree* (← Styphnolobium japonicum: tree of a rounded shape, with pea-like clusters of flowers). Also, a Zhou Dynasty *rank-indicator*, said to originate in the custom of officials of this rank being seated facing three of these same trees.
tags:[]

kanji:匯
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[めぐ（る）]
raw_etymology:淮# is as per 隹 (exert downward pressure) + 水 water → heavy buildup of water → name of a particular river. 匯 adds 匸 (contain) → converging waters that collect in a containing basin → *confluence*; *swirling water*.

___
kanji:衞
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:衛
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[エイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows four feet circulating about a particular spot. A seal inscription form reduces the number of feet to two, adds four marks around the perimeter, and appends 帀# circulate → *protect/defend* a site by patrolling the perimeter. The present form combines 行 go with 韋# (go around).
tags:[]
___
kanji:活
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 舌# (chisel-like implement in motion) + 水 water → break a container with a chisel-like implement, creating an active flow of the liquid contents → *activity* → *life*.
tags:[]
___

tags:[]

kanji:越
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エツ]
kunyomi:[こ（える・す）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form of 歳 (walk about a field in harvesting) + 走 run → *exceed* the speed of another person → *surpass*; *go over/beyond* → *cross* (over) (← surpass); *go*; *come*; *move* (house). Also, *pass* and *pass time*. Compare 超.
tags:[]
___
kanji:歳
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ, セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 戉# (scoop out) + a modified form of 歩 walk → walk about a field, harvesting rice by scooping it from the ears of the plant with a sickle-like implement → *year*; *age* (← harvest as the end of a long agricultural cycle; compare 年).
tags:[]
___
kanji:月
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゲツ, ガツ]
kunyomi:[つき]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a crescent *moon*, observed as a scooped-out portion of the full moon → *month*. *Monday* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:外
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ガイ, ゲ]
kunyomi:[そと, はず（す・れ・れる）, ほか]
raw_etymology:夕 here a variant form# of 月 (crescent) moon + 卜 divination → cast horoscopes on the basis of the invisible *outside* portion of the moon (compare 朏) → *other* → *some/any other place*; *somebody else*; *others*; *besides*. The sense of "the part other than the portion scooped out" leads to extended meanings such as *take off*; *be/come off*; *remove*; *undo*; *take leave*; *evade*; *edge* and *outskirts* → *miss* (the mark); *be wrong*; *failure* → *violate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:屆
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:届
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[とど（く・け・ける）]
raw_etymology:凷 is 土 an abbreviated form of 圭 (clay/earth piled high in a neat cone shape ) + 凵 hole → lump of earth (compare 圣 as described in 怪) that fills a hole. 届 is 凷# + 尸 body → person arriving at the top of a hill → *arrive*; *reach* → *send*; *pass along* *deliver*. Also, *report to*, *notification*, *registration*, *attend (to)*, and *attain*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拐
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:叧# combines an abbreviated form of 冎 (joint of a bone) + 刀 sword/knife → sever/separate a limb from its joint. 拐 adds 手 hand/action indicator to reinforce the idea of physical separation, eventually acquiring the specific sense of separating a person from his/her kin → *kidnap*. Also,*deceive* (← use deception in kidnapping).
tags:[]
___
kanji:骨
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コツ]
kunyomi:[ほね]
raw_etymology:肉 flesh + a remnant element indicating the joint of a bone → *bone* circulating in the cavity of its joint → *frame*; *ribs* (of an umbrella); *outline*. Also, *spirit* (← bones as the essence of an existence).
tags:[]
___
kanji:滑
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カツ, コツ]
kunyomi:[すべ（る）, なめ（らか）]
raw_etymology:As per 骨# (circulate) + 水 water. However, as the character bears the primary meanings*slip*, *slide*, *glide* and *skate*, it is likely that 水 was originally 氷 ice, with the term originally signifying "glide/skate in a circle." Associated and extended meanings include *ski* and *smooth*, along with *fail* and *be demoted* (← slip up and pay the consequences).
tags:[]
___
kanji:惠
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:恵
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[めぐ（み・む）]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 褱 as described in 懷 (fall and be absorbed), indicating a *benefaction* from above, whether actually (rain for crops) or figuratively (a *blessing*) → *bless*; *have mercy on*; *benevolence*; *kindness*; *warmth* → *bestow*; *favor*. *Calm* is an extended meaning, while *smart* is a borrowed meaning. For "benefaction," compare 恤.
tags:[]
___
kanji:穗
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:穂
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[ほ]
raw_etymology:惠# benefaction + 禾 grain/rice → heavy *ears/heads* of grain (a benefaction of the heavens). *Crest* (of a wave) and *point* (of a spear/writing brush) are via association with the tips of the ears of grain plants.
tags:[]
___
kanji:貴
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[たっと（い・ぶ）, とうと（い・ぶ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 貝# commodities + a representation of a pair of hands wrapped about and compressing a large, round bundle → compress *valuable* goods in a bundle → *precious*; *value*; *cherish* → *respect*; *honor*; *noble*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 一# (fullness) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl → deep bowl filled with sacrificial *blood*, which was then swirled.

kanji:尉
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 寸 hand/action indicator + 屈# (bend over) → brand a bending figure with an *iron* to mark or to punish. *Officer* is an extended meaning (← military officer who suppresses rebels). Eventually, the 出 element in 屈 was replaced by 示.
tags:[]
___
kanji:慰
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[なぐさ（み・む・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 尉# (bending figure that is branded) + 心 heart/emotions → *comfort*/*console* a person who has been branded (= a person who is suffering) → *cheer up* → *relief*; *hobby*; *amusement*; *diversion*; *pastime*; *make sport of*. For the idea of comforting a suffering person, compare 恤.

___
kanji:鬱
kanji_stroke_count:29
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The upper element is an obsolete character combining 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase + an abbreviated form of 棥 (twist vegetation). The lower element is another obsolete character, this one composed of 冖 cover over yet another obsolete character combining 鬯 aromatic herbs and 彡 pattern. Given the meanings conveyed by 鬱 and those of cognate terms, it may be supposed that the original idea was to create a rich brew by grinding aromatic herbs and, after mixing with alcohol, sealing the brew in a container → *dense/luxuriant* growth; *pervasiveness* (← rich brew) → *flourishing*. Also, *mood*, *gloom*, *melancholy* and *depression* (← dense atmosphere ← rich brew). A variant form, 欝, is equally opaque.
tags:[]
___
kanji:詘
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[クツ, チュツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:言 words + 出 here an abbreviated form# of 屈 bend → stutter/*stammer*, the sound likened to bent words (compare 吃 and 訥). *Bend*, *obey*, *yield* and *shrink from* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:橘
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キツ]
kunyomi:[たちばな]
raw_etymology:As per 矞# (circular) + 木 tree/wood → tree bearing round *citrus fruit*. たちばな (Citrus tachibana) is not the mandarin orange, but an inedible variety of citrus fruit native to Japan.
tags:[]
___
kanji:斡
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 乾 (rise high) + 斗 ladle → the Big Dipper, high in the sky, and circulating about Polaris → *circulate*. Also, *administer* (← be the focal point around which affairs center).
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[は（く）, ほうき]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 又# hand wrapped around the bamboo handle of a *broom* (compare 帚) → *brush*; *sweep*. *Comet* is via assigning 彗 the signification of the compound 彗星.

kanji:夬
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 尹 (harmonious circle), specifying the act of creating a physical circle by scooping out a hole → *part*; *separate* (← separate contents in scooping a portion). 夬 later came to indicate an *archery glove*, as well as a コ-shaped *device attached to a bow*.

kanji:魏
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ギ]
kunyomi:[たか（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 委# (hang low) + 鬼 ghost; demon → a name for a particular country in ancient China, regarded as populated by short and unsightly inhabitants. The meaning *high* likely stems from association with the mountainous areas of the country. Other pejorative names for countries and their residents that involve shortness include 倭 and 夷. 
tags:[]

___
kanji:厥
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ, クツ]
kunyomi:[そ（の・れ）]
raw_etymology:The lower element# ( 屰 reverse + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure) originally indicated a person vomiting, with ingested food reversing itself up the digestive tract. 厥 adds 厂 cliff/shape indicator (→ stiff body) → seizure accompanied by vomiting . *That* is a borrowed meaning. Note that in Chinese, the lower element acquired the associated meaning "hiccup," while 厥 was borrowed for use as a personal pronoun.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蕨
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[わらび]
raw_etymology:As per 厥# (seizure) + 艸 grass/plant → *bracken*; *fernbrake* (← plant that induces convulsions when its toxic portions are eaten).
tags:[]
___
kanji:孒
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a child (compare 子) with its left arm cut off (compare 孑). The compound 子孒 originally indicated "short" or "lacking," but the same compound (with a different reading) also refers to mosquito larvae.
tags:[]

kanji:薈
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ワイ, カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 會# (reduce/eliminate space) + 艸 grass/plant → *luxuriant vegetation* → *abundant* (gathering).

kanji:鴃

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[もず]
raw_etymology:As per 夬# (scoop out) + 鳥 bird → *shrike* (← bird with a scoop-shaped bill). Compare 鶪. Some sources present 鴂, which repositions the elements in 鴃, as a variant form of 鴃. Other sources, however, present 鴂 as an independent character referring to a variety of cuckoo.

Extended meanings include (in) *secret*, *behind the scenes*, *the sole* and *the bottom half of an inning*. A variant form, 裡, repositions the 衣 element.

kanji:櫓
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロ]
kunyomi:[やぐら]
raw_etymology:As per 魯# (long and drawn out) + 木 tree/wood → a *scull* (single oar of a boat, drawn up out of the water and moved from one side to the other to propel the vessel) → *oar*. Compare 艪. *Watchtower* and *turret* are via reinterpretation of the character as a high (= vertically long) wooden construction.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:落
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラク]
kunyomi:[お（ち・ちる・とし・とす）]
raw_etymology:As per 洛# (connect) + 艸 grass/plant → chain of dewdrops falling from a plant → *drop*; *fall* → *omit*; *settle down*. Other extended meanings from "drop" or "fall" include *collapse*; *come off/out*; *die down*; *decline*; *fail* (a test etc.); *be inferior*; *remove*; *trap*; and *trick*. *Mistake* is via "omit," while *punch line* (of a joke) is by extension from "trick."
tags:[]
___
kanji:略

tags:[]

kanji:絡

___
kanji:曆
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:暦
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[レキ]
kunyomi:[こよみ]
raw_etymology:厤# is 厂 cliff/shape indicator (here suggesting a roof) + 秝 (禾 grain/rice doubled → sheaves of grain) → count neat lines of sheaves in a storehouse (compare 稟) → manage. 曆 adds 日 sun/day → neat lineup or arrangement of days that enables easy counting → *calendar* → *destiny*; *fate*; *lifespan*; *era*; *period*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:歷
kanji_stroke_count:16

onyomi:[レキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 厤# as described in 曆 (neat lines) + 止 (leg/foot) → walk with a neat gait → *passage*; *continuation*; *one's career*.
tags:[]

kanji:力

kunyomi:[ちから]

kanji:洛
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:水 water + 各# (come to a stop) → tributary that connects with a river and comes to a stop. 洛水 is the name of a *tributary of the Yellow River* → *Kyoto/the capital* (← association with the one-time Chinese capital of 洛陽).
tags:[]

kanji:掠
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リャク, リョウ]
kunyomi:[かす（める・る・れる）]
raw_etymology:京 here an abbreviated form# of 涼 (flow) + 手 hand/action indicator → fluid motion → *graze* against; * brush by/past/over*; *snatch* → *steal* → *plunder*. Also, *blurry* as well as *husky* (voice) (← indistinct sensations ← graze).
tags:[]
___
kanji:瀝
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レキ]
kunyomi:[したた（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 歷# (neat lines) + 水 water → *trickle* of liquid → *drip*; a *drop*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:櫪
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レキ]
kunyomi:[くぬぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 歷# (neat lines) + 木 tree/wood → stable/manger constructed of neatly aligned pieces of wood. Also, via the idea of neatly aligned pieces of wood, a *trough* for feeding livestock. (Certain variety of) *oak* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:靂
kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 歷# (neat lines) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → neat string of thunderbolts → *thunder*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:仂
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 力# (ripples) + 人 person → supernumerary (likened to ripples of a main force) → (numerical) *remainder*. In Japan, 仂 sometimes serves as an abbreviated form of 働 *work*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:朸
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロク, リキ, リョク]
kunyomi:[おおご, おうご]
raw_etymology:As per 力# (ripples) + 木 tree/wood → *grain* (of wood) (← ripple pattern). In Japan, 朸 has also been reinterpreted to mean a *carrying pole*.
tags:[]

kanji:轣

raw_etymology:As per 歷# (neat lines) + 車 vehicle → neat *gravel road* laid out for vehicular traffic. Also, the *crunching sound* produced by wheels of a vehicle in rolling over gravel.
tags:[]
___
kanji:雒
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 各# (come to a stop) + 隹 short, squat bird → *horned owl* (← bird that remains perfectly still before pouncing). *Black horse with a white mane* may be regarded as either a borrowed meaning (compare and contrast 駱) or a derivative one (← horse patterned like a particular horned owl).
tags:[]
___
kanji:良
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[よ（い）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a grain/kernel being washed in the flow of a pure stream → *good* (← pure) → *superior*; *truly*; *considerably*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:郎
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 良# (flowing stream) + 邑 village/settlement → village/settlement adjacent to a pure, flowing stream. Via "pure," 郎 came to indicate a "clean/pure young man," next became a term by which wives addressed their husbands, and finally developed into a euphemism for a male → *man*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 郎# (flow) + 广 building → flowing (= extensive) passageway of a building → *hallway*; *corridor*; *gallery*.

raw_etymology:As per 良# (flowing stream) + 水 water → a *wave* (likened to a stream of water flowing atop an even layer of water).

kanji:量
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[はか（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 重# weight + grain → *measure* grain in weighing it → *weigh* → *quantity*; *amount*; *estimate*; *consider*. It is possible that the phonetic element is the obsolete grain element; compare 良 and 秝.
tags:[]

kanji:兩

shinjitai_stroke_count:6
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a measuring device with long arms aligned on *both* sides → *form a pair* → *unit of weight*; (Edo period) *unit of money*. *Counter for cars/tanks* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:令
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ, リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 今 (contain in the mouth) + 卩 kneeling figure → kneeling figure listening carefully to a long sequence of commands issuing from the mouth of a ruler → *command*; *order*; *rule*; *leader*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冷
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ]
kunyomi:[さ（ます・める）, つめ（たい）, ひ（える ・や・やかす・やす）, ひや（やか）]
raw_etymology:As per 令# (long sequence) + 氷 ice → long stretch of ice → *cold*; *chilly*; *cool*. Other extended meanings include *refrigerate*, *cold-hearted* (compare 惏), *surly*, *calm* and *quiet*. *Tease* and *window shopping* are via the sense of taking a cool attitude toward a person/purchasing.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 令# (long sequence) + 金 metal → *bell* that gives off a long sequence of peals. Compare 鐘.

kanji:零
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 令# (long sequence) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → prolonged rain/drizzle → *drops of water* (compare 露, 落 and 靈) → *tiny*; *little* → *zero*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 令# (long sequence) + 頁 head → string of heads severed at the *neck* (compare 県 and 梟) → *rule*; *possess* (← display severed heads to demonstrate rule) → *domain*.

___
kanji:陵
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:夌 combines an abbreviated form of 坴 as described in 陸 (stretch) + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward → stretch the legs in relaxation. 陵 is 夌# (stretch) + 阜 piled earth → long stretch of earth → *(imperial) tomb/mausoleum* (← hill-shaped tombs).
tags:[]
___
kanji:諒
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:京 here an abbreviated form# of 涼 (flow) + 言 words → flow of (clear) words → *truth*; *clarity*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亮
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 諒 clear (words) + 儿: *clear*. Here, 儿 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying a meaning that dropped from the original one. *Help* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:梁
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[はり, やな]
raw_etymology:刅 is 刀 sword + marks on both sides → double-edged sword. The upper element# of 梁 adds 水 water → planks set side by side over water as a *bridge* → *beam*; *girder*; *rafter*. Also, *fish trap*. 梁 adds 木 tree/wood for emphasis/clarification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:霝
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ, リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:雨 rain/natural phenomena + 囗 (here a shape indicator suggesting linked beads of water; compare 露, 落 and 零) tripled → linked *raindrops* → *drops of liquid*; *falling in drops*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 霝# (linked) + 木 tree/wood → *latticework* → *lattice window*.

kanji:琅

raw_etymology:兩# (aligned) pair + 車 vehicle → two-wheeled *vehicle* → *counter for vehicles*. The number of wheels on the vehicle is no longer limited to two.
tags:[]
___
kanji:魎
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:兩# (aligned) pair + 鬼 (large, lumpy being) → *monster* that moves on a pair of legs, like a human. The compound 魑魅魍魎 is a general term for evil spirits resident in forests, mountains and rivers.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 令# (long sequence) + 人 person → lengthy and *clever* performance given by a musician and/or *actor* → *smart*.

kanji:凌
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]

raw_etymology:As per 夌# as described in 陵 (stretch) + 氷 ice → thick wall of ice stretching skywards → *surpass* → *overcome*. Also, *icehouse* → *keep out/at bay*. *Insult*, *break a rule* and *commit a crime* are borrowed meanings.

kanji:菱
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[ひし]
raw_etymology:As per 夌# as described in 陵 (stretch) + 艸 grass/plant → *water caltrop* (the fruit of which has long, well-defined lines). (Water caltrop also goes by the name of water chestnut, but it is the corms of a different plant, Eleocharis dulcis, that feature in Chinese cuisine.) *Diamond-shaped* is via the compound 菱形.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 棱 (*angle*; *edge*; *corner*), with 禾 replacing 木.

kanji:螂
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 郎# (flow → extensive) + 虫 insect → long or long-legged insect → *praying mantis*. This meaning is normally conveyed not independently but in the compound 蟷螂 (praying mantis). A variant form, 蜋, replaces 郎 with 良.
tags:[]

kanji:聆

raw_etymology:As per 令# (listen carefully) + 耳 ear → *listen carefully* → *hear*. Also, *wise*. 聆 was devised to replace 令 after 令 came to refer to orders themselves rather than their reception.

kanji:閬
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[むな（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 良# (flowing stream) + 門 gate → *tall, broad gate* adjacent to a moat → *broad*. Eventually, the character also acquired the meaning of a *dry moat* → *empty*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:裲
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[うちかけ]
raw_etymology:兩# (aligned) pair + 衣 clothing → a waistcoat or *sleeveless vest* (paired with the garment worn underneath). Also, an *Edo-Period garment* consisting of a trailing skirt, worn over a kimono.
tags:[]
___
kanji:椋
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[むく]
raw_etymology:京 here an abbreviated form# of 涼 (flow) + 木 tree/wood → tree with a figurative flow of flowers → Ehretia ovalifolia. むく, however, refers to Aphananthe aspera, a member of the elm family.
tags:[]
___
kanji:粱
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[あわ]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 梁 (run side by side) + 米 rice → *millet*, the heads of which are strung in long rows.
tags:[]
___
kanji:林
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[はやし]
raw_etymology:A depiction of two trees, suggesting a large number of trees growing alongside each other and encompassing villages (compare 村), sacred ground (compare 禁) and other spaces → *forest*; *woods*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:婪
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 林# (encompass) + 女 woman → be encompassed with craving for a woman → *covetous*; *ravenous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:淋
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[さび（しい）]
raw_etymology:林# forest + 水 water → rain dripping in a forest → *drip* → *desolation* (← desolate feeling created by the sound of dripping water) → *lonely*. Compare 漓.
tags:[]

kanji:琳
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 林# (encompass) + 玉 jewel → jeweled necklace strung about the neck → *jewel*; *tinkling of a string of jewels* (compare 玲 and 瓏).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 林# (encompass) + 酉 alcohol container → object soaked/encompassed in alcohol → *bleach* (← bleach by soaking).
tags:[]
___
kanji:霖
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:林# forest + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → *long spell of rain* (originally, with specific reference to rain in a forest).
tags:[]
___
kanji:稟
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン, ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The top element# is a granary (compare 亶). 稟 adds 禾 grain/rice → *granary* in which rows of harvested crops are stored (compare 厤 as described in 曆) → *conferral*; *grant*; *salary* (← grain conferred as payment; compare 料). Also, *receive a request for (and offer one's opinion)* (to a superior) (← have a request conferred on one by one's superior, considered an honor). A variant form, 禀, replaces 禾 with 示 altar/the supernatural.
tags:[]
___
kanji:凜
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 稟# (rows) + 氷 ice → row of icicles formed in *freezing* weather, causing shivering/trembling (compare 凓) → *severe* (← severe weather conditions). Also, *manly* (← severe personality ← severe weather). A variant form, 凛, replaces 禾 with 示 altar/the supernatural.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廩
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:稟# granary + 广 building → *granary*. 廩 was devised to replace 稟 after the latter acquired extended meanings in addition to "granary."
tags:[]
___
kanji:痳
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:林 here an abbreviated form# of 淋 drip + 疒 illness → disease that causes fluids to drip from the body → *gonorrhea*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[おそ（れる）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 凜 (shiver/tremble) + 心 heart/emotions → shiver/tremble in *fear* or *awe*. Also, *be anxious for another*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:惏
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン, リン]
kunyomi:[むさぼ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 林# (encompass) + 心 heart/emotions → heart encompassed with *insatiable greed*. Also, *cold-hearted* (← greedy and indifferent to others; compare 冷).
tags:[]
___
kanji:練
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[ね（る・れる）]
raw_etymology:Originally 柬# (separate) + 糸 thread → separate silk threads, then process them into a finished product → *train* → *knead*; *gloss*; *polish*; *discipline*; *mature*; *season*. The present form replaces 柬 with 東.
tags:[]
___
kanji:錬
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 柬# (separate) + 金 metal → *refine* metal, separating out impure elements (compare 煉) → *temper*; *forge*; *train*. The present form replaces 柬 with 東.
tags:[]
___
kanji:欄
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 闌# (link) + 木 tree/wood → pieces of wood linked to form a *railing*, *pen* or *partition* → (newspaper) *column*. 欄 was devised to replace 闌 after 闌 acquired secondary meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:連
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[つら（なる・ねる）, つ（れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:車 here an abbreviated form# of 陣 (military vehicles in tight rows) + 辵 movement → rows of military vehicles on the move → *be/put in a row*; *be lined up*; *range*; *arrange*; *link* → *be involved*; *be accompanied/taken*; *companion*; *regiment* → *attend* (← be one of many attendees).
tags:[]
___
kanji:隣
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[となり]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 粦 combines 炎 flame with 舛 crossing legs → ignis fatuus ("will-o'-the-wisp," a flame or fire that appears in a long and clear chain). Later, 炎 came to be written 米. To 粦# (repeated series), 鄰 adds 邑 village/settlement → lines of dwellings standing in close proximity → *neighboring*; *next to*; *adjoining*. However, 鄰 has been supplanted by 隣, which replaces 邑 with 阜 piled earth.
tags:[]
___
kanji:聯
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 關 connect + 耳 ear → chain of linked ears, severed from the heads of enemy warriors (compare 馘) → *connect*; *join*; *align*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[やぶさ（か）]
raw_etymology:As per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) + 口 mouth → finely woven excuses (for being *stingy*/*miserly*) → *grudging*; *sparing of*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[ね（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 柬# (separate) + 火 fire → *refine* (metal), separating out impure elements (compare 錬). Also, *knead into shape*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:闌
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[たけなわ, た（ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 柬# (separate) + 門 gate → pieces of wood linked to create a fence, partition or *railing* that separates/blocks off visitors from a gate → *block*; *screen*. Also, *rise high*, *be advanced/well along*, *at the height of* and *in the thick of* (← gate within a partitioning element). For railing and partition, compare 欄.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 闌# (link) + 水 water → linked ripples, or crests of *high waves*. Compare 漣.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爛
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[ただ（れる）]
raw_etymology:闌# link + 火 fire → *bright* chain of flames (compare the Old Chinese cognate 粦 and its replacement character 燐). The character was however reinterpreted as flames attendant to boiling (compare 燗) or cooking → *spoil*; *rot* (← overcook food to the point of spoiling it) → *running sore*; *inflammation*.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 闌# (link) + 衣 clothing → pieces of cloth linked to form a *one-piece garment*. Compare 褸.
tags:[]

kanji:蘭
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 艸 + 闌, with the etymology running: As per 闌# (link) + 艸 grass/plant → *orchid* (with a linked series of vertical or horizontal shoots). *Holland/Dutch* is via the phonetic construction 阿蘭陀. The JIS form replaces 闌 with 門 + 東. 
tags:[]

kanji:鱗
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[うろこ]
raw_etymology:As per 粦# as described in 隣 (repeated series) + 魚 fish → fish *scales* → *scaly*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:麟
kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 粦# as described in 隣 (repeated series) + 鹿 deer → a fabulous creature reputed to emit a repeated, multi-colored glow. The creature is supposed to have the trunk of a deer, the tail of a cow and the hooves and mane of a horse, and to make perfect right angles in turning (compare 麒). The compound 麒麟 refers to the male and female of the beast, with 麒 normally understood to represent the former and 麟 the latter. 麒麟 also applies to the *giraffe*, an animal which may have been the model for the imaginary beast.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藺
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[い]
raw_etymology:The lower element# combines an abbreviated form of 闌 (link) + 隹 short, squat bird → birds linked in formation atop a gate. 藺 adds 艸 grass/plant → *rush* (← type of vegetation linked in being woven into mats).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per the lower element# described in 藺 (link in formation) + 足 leg/foot → *trample* an object into (a string of) small pieces.

kanji:立

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[た（つ・てる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a standing figure who exerts continuous downward pressure on the ground → *stand* → *arise*; *raise*; *erect*.

kanji:躐

raw_etymology:As per 巤# as described in 獵 (bind) + 足 leg/foot → bind the legs with protective material in crossing a river or other obstacle → *cross over*; *step across* → *exceed* . Also, *step on the foot of a person walking ahead of one*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:苙
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ, キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) + 艸 grass/plant → *pen* (for pigs or other domesticated animals) erected from heavy, woven plant matter. Also, by way of interpreting the character as 艸 + 立 stand, the herb Angelica dahurica, which stands as high as three meters.
tags:[]
