___
kanji:禮
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:礼
shinjitai_stroke_count:5
onyomi:[レイ, ライ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element is 豆 food stand + grain piled atop in an orderly arrangement. 禮 adds 示 altar/the supernatural → well-ordered, lengthy ritual → *propriety* → *salutation*. Distinguish the right-hand element in this character from the independent character 豊, which is a Shinjitai (new character form) of 豐.
tags:[]
___
kanji:履
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[は（く）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 夂# leg/foot pointed downward + an obsolete character that appears to have suggested "make plodding progress, by various means." Eventually, the focus shifted to shoes worn in plodding along → *wear shoes* → *wear*; *put on*. The present form is 尸 + 復 (double back) → *tread*.
tags:[]

kanji:犂
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ, リュウ, レイ]
kunyomi:[すき]
raw_etymology:犁 is as per 利# (plow) + 牛 cow → cattle-drawn *plow*. However, in contemporary Japanese usage, 犁has been supplanted by the form 犂.
tags:[]
___
kanji:黎
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ, レイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 犂 plow + an abbreviated form of 黍 millet → plow *dark* soil over millet seeds → *swarthy*. Also, *numerous* (← numerous seeds).
tags:[]
___
kanji:莉
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ, レイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:利# sharp + 艸 grass plant → plant with a sharp flavor when processed. The compound 茉莉花 refers to jasmine.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鱧
kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ]
kunyomi:[はも]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# of 禮 (well-ordered) + 魚 fish → fish understood to refer to a snakehead, or a variety of eel. The precise connection with "well-ordered" is now obscure. In Japanese, はも refers to the *conger (or pike) eel*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蘿
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラ]
kunyomi:[つた]
raw_etymology:羅# net + 艸 grass/plant → *vine*; *creeper* (← plant that creates a net-like cover).
tags:[]
___
kanji:蠡
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ, ライ, ラ]
kunyomi:[にな, ひさご]
raw_etymology:彖 pig/boar (→ voracious creature) + 虫 insect (doubled) → (destruction of a tree by a) *wood-boring insect*; *wood-borer*. Also, a *split gourd used as a container* for liquids or as a drinking implement (← bore out the contents in creating a container). *Variety of aquatic snail* (compare 蜷) is a borrowed meaning. Neither 彖 nor the doubled 虫 element bear upon the Old Chinese pronunciation of this character, indicating that the phonosemantic element was originally something else.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[あまざけ]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# of 禮 (ritual) + 酉 alcohol container → sweet wine, offered ritually → *sweet rice wine*.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:裂
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レツ]
kunyomi:[さ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 列# (sever) + 衣 clothing → cut/rip material → *rip*; *tear*; *split*; *rend*; *break apart*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:隷
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:隸 is the left-hand element# as described in 款 (carve characters) + 隶 seize. (Distinguish 隶 from the identical-appearing lower element of 康; also, compare 逮.) 隸 thus means to seize captives and tattoo them → *slave*; *servant* → *follower*. For the connection between tattoos and slaves, compare 妾. Although 隸 is the form consistent with the term's etymology, 隷 has become standard in Japanese usage.
tags:[]
___
kanji:戻
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レイ]
kunyomi:[もど（す・る）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 犬 dog/beast + not 戸 but rather 立# (exert continuous downward pressure) → fend off repeated, frenetic attacks from a dog or beast → *go/come back*; *return*. Associated meanings include *be contrary*, (barely) *reach* and *restore*. Also, *violate* and *vomit* (← contrary), as well as *be settled*. As with 器, 犬 is now replaced by 大.
tags:[]
___
kanji:勵
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:励
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[レイ]
kunyomi:[はげ（ます・み・む）]
raw_etymology:厲# (vigorous exertion) + 力 power/energy → *urge* others to *exert* themselves/*work hard* → *apply oneself to*; *be diligent* → *encourage*; *cheer up*; *raise the voice*; *incentive*; *stimulation*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:賴
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:頼
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[ライ]
kunyomi:[たの（む・もしい）, たよ（り・る）]
raw_etymology:束 here an abbreviated form# of 剌 (sharp) + an element combining 貝 commodities and a variant of 人 person → person who suffers a sharp reduction in circumstances, and pleads for material relief → *ask*; *request* → *entrust*; *depend/rely on*; *count on*. Also, *call in/on* (a specialist), *dependable* and *reliable*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[せ]
raw_etymology:As per 賴# (sharp reduction) + 水 water → swift current accompanying a sharp reduction in the size of a river, stream or other conduit → *rapids*; *shallows*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kanji:籟
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ライ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 賴# (sharp reduction) + 竹 bamboo → bamboo sharply reduced in size in being carved into a pipe/flute. In Japan, however, 籟 has been reinterpreted to suggest the *sound of the wind* (such as heard through a bamboo grove).
tags:[]

kanji:僚

kunyomi:[]

___
kanji:流
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ, ル]
kunyomi:[なが（し・す・れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:㐬# is as per 𠫓 as described in 育 (newborn baby) + 川 river (→ flowing water) → flow of amniotic fluid accompanying a fetus passing through the birth canal. The further addition of 水 water is to expand the scope of the term to that of a heavy *flow* of water → *float*; *pour* → *trendy*; *school* (of thought, art etc.); *style*; *rank*; *grade*. Other extended meanings include *wash off/away*; *circulate*; *wander*; *passage* (of time); *descent*; *distribute*; *divert*; *stroll*; *cruise*; and (a) *sink*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:硫
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 㐬# as described in 流 (flow) + 石 stone → *sulfur* (← mineral composed of the discharge of volcanic flow).
tags:[]
___
kanji:留
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ, ル]
kunyomi:[と（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 卯# (bend) + 田 field → field laborer coming to a stop in stooping with exhaustion (compare 勞) → *stop*; (temporarily) *stay/settle*; *hold down*; *detain*; *fix in place* → *keep* (in mind). 留 employs the same variant of 卯 as in 貿.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[やなぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 卯# (bend) + 木 tree/wood → *willow* branches bending in a strong breeze.

tags:[]

kanji:寥

onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 宀 roof/building → *empty* building, one separated from a main structure → *vacant*; *deserted*; *lonely*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蓼
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[たで]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 艸 grass/plant → species of *smartweed* the leaves of which are spaced quite far apart. Compare 蘢.
tags:[]
___
kanji:劉
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ, ル]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:𨥫# combines 金 metal + a variant of 卯 (bend). The original signification of this character is obscure, but likely similar to that of 戮 (kill). 劉 adds 刀 sword/knife → force a victim to bend/hang the neck then decapitate with a bladed implement → *kill*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:撈
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ, リョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勞# (stoop) + 手 hand/action indicator → stoop in dredging, or in dragging a seine → *dredge*; *drag*; *fish up*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:琉
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ル, リュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 㐬# as described in 流 (flow) + 玉 jewel → *jewel* with a slippery surface over which the fingers flow. The compound 琉璃 is an abbreviation of 吠吠瑠璃, a transliteration of the Sanskrit vaidurya (lapis lazuli).
tags:[]
___
kanji:溜
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ]
kunyomi:[た（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 留# (round) + 水 water → liquid that collects to form a round, slippery puddle (compare 潦) → *collect*; *build up*. Also, *drip* and (rain)*drops* (← drops of rain that collect; compare 霤).
tags:[]
___
kanji:榴
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 留# (round) + 木 tree/wood → roundish *pomegranate* fruit.
tags:[]
___
kanji:瘤
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ, ル]
kunyomi:[こぶ]
raw_etymology:As per 留# (round) + 疒 illness → a roundish *bump*, *swelling* or *tumor*. Also, a *nuisance*, particularly with reference to a child. Compare 疣.
tags:[]
___
kanji:聊
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ]
kunyomi:[いささ（か）]
raw_etymology:As per 卯# (bend) + 耳 ear → figuratively bend/incline the ear in listening → *slightly*; *somewhat*; *a little* (← be able to hear only slightly).
tags:[]
___
kanji:摎
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ, キュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 手 hand/action indicator → *tighten* objects that had been separate into a single unit (compare 勠 and 繆) → *tie into a bundle* → *strangle*. Also, *be entangled*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:醪
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[にごりざけ, もろみ]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 酉 alcohol container → liquor with dregs at the bottom resting separate from the alcohol → *unrefined, cloudy liquor*.
tags:[]

kanji:鐐
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リョウ, ロウ]
kunyomi:[あしかせ]
raw_etymology:As per 尞# as described in 僚 (circular continuum) + 金 metal → round *iron fetters*. *Silver* is via a reinterpretation of the constituent elements of this character (metal with a long-lasting luster).

kanji:癆
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勞# (stoop) + 疒 illness → stoop with *exhaustion*. Though "tuberculosis" is sometimes noted as a meaning of this character, the sense actually pertains to the compound 癆痎.
tags:[]
___

tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 隆# (wind upward) + 疒 illness → *tumor* rising on the surface of the skin (compare 瘤). Also, *fatigue* and *retention of urine* (← symptoms of a tumor-accompanied disease).
tags:[]

kanji:陸
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:坴 was originally 六 (mound that stretches at length) doubled → a stretch of land. 陸 is 坴# + 阜 piled earth → *land* winding far, wide and high → *plateau*; *winding*; *jump up*.
tags:[]

kanji:漏
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[も（らす・る・れる）]
raw_etymology:屚# is 尸 (here a shape indicator suggesting a roof) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → raindrops leaking through a roof. 漏 adds 水 water for emphasis/clarification → *leak* → *spill*; *escape*; *shine through* → *divulge*; *confide*; *reveal* → *give vent to*; *reject*; *omit*.
tags:[]

kanji:陋
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[いや（しい）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is as per 丙 (spread) + an L-shaped frame → spread over a low, narrow space. 陋 adds 阜 piled earth → low, narrow space between (earthen) walls → *low*; *narrow*; *cramped* → *narrow-minded* → *mean*. Compare 窶.
tags:[]

kanji:瓏

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 龍# (winding) + 玉 jewel → the *clean/clear tinkling sound made by a long chain of jewels* (compare 玲 and 琳). 瓏 has also been understood as a *jewel cut into the form of a dragon*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:籠
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロウ]
kunyomi:[かご, こ（める）, こも（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 龍# (winding) + 竹 bamboo → *basket* woven of curved bamboo strips → *contain*; *include*; *encompass*. Also, *unite*, *shut oneself up* and *cage*. For cage, compare 槞. A variant form, 篭, employs the 竜 form of 龍.
tags:[]

___
kanji:亂
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:乱
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[みだ（す・れる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows the left-hand element to have been two hands untangling a ball of threads by by pulling the threads up and down (compare 䜌 as described in 戀). Meanwhile, 乚 is a variant of 乙 (rise and hit a block). The combination of elements suggests a ball of tangled threads → *confusion*; *disorder* → *disturb*; *disarrange*; *rebel*; *riot*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卵
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[たまご]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a swarm of fish eggs → *egg*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:戀
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:恋
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[こい, こい（しい）, こ（う）]
raw_etymology:䜌# is 絲 thread(s) + 言 (make verbal distinctions → distinct) → make tangled threads distinct by stretching and untangling them. 戀 adds 心 heart/emotions → attempt to untangle confused feelings (of longing, anxiety, or love) by figuratively stretching them straight (compare 攣 and 亂) → *long for*; *be anxious for*; *love*. The top element of the present form of the character represents a tremendous simplification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:倫
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:侖# neat assemblage/alignment + 人 person → people in orderly arrangement → *principle(s)*; *ethics*; (moral) *code*; *companion*.
tags:[]

kanji:侖

kanji:攣
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (stretch) + 手 hand/action indicator → stretch → *twitch*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:欒
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:䜌# as described in 戀 (tangled) + 木 tree/wood → tree (sometimes specified as a chinaberry aka bead tree, sometimes as Koelreuteria paniculata ) bearing a profusion of blossoms in clusters or panicles. *Wooden portion of a cornice helping support the weight of a roof* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鸞
kanji_stroke_count:30
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:䜌# as described in 戀 + 鳥 bird → *imaginary bird* believed to accompany the phoenix ( 凰/鳳). 䜌normally conveys either the sense "stretch" (compare 彎 戀 攣 etc.) or "tangled" (compare 孿 蠻 變etc.); its function in 鸞 is uncertain.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (stretch) + 山 mountain → *mountain range*; *peak* (← stretch of mountain peaks).

kanji:離
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[はな（す・れる）]
raw_etymology:离 odd beast + 隹# short, squat bird → bird and beast tangling then separating after a protracted fight → *separation* → *part* (from); *come apart*; *release*; *set at intervals*; *leave*; *drift away*; *quit*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:累
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ルイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 畾# as described in 壘 (pile) + 糸 thread → a tall spiral of threads → *link*; *successive*; *involvement* (in trouble).
tags:[]
___
kanji:壘
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:塁
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ルイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:畾# is 田 field (tripled). This element is a variant of one that added another 夕 element at the bottom left of 多 (tall, neat pile of meat). 壘 is 畾 (pile) + 土 earth → earth piled into a long/tall and winding *rampart* → (baseball) *base*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[かみなり]
raw_etymology:Once 畾# as described in 壘 (pile) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → successive (= figuratively piled) claps of *thunder* → *lightning*.

kunyomi:[]

tags:[]

kanji:醨
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:离 here an abbreviated form# of 離 (tangle; adhere) + 酉 alcohol container → *wine lees*/dregs adhering to the bottom of an alcohol container. In Japan, the character has also been understood to refer to *diluted wine*, as well as to the *clear liquid that separates at the top of soup*.
tags:[]

kanji:鸝

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 驪 neatly aligned + 鳥 bird → birds flying in alignment. The compound 黄鸝 (黃鸝) refers to a Chinese oriole.
tags:[]
___
kanji:縲
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ルイ, ラ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 累# (winding/spiral) + 糸 thread → string/cord spiraled about an object in binding → *tie/bind*. The compound 縲絏 (絏: variant form of 紲) refers to a long rope for binding criminals, and, by extension, to a jail/prison.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:律
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:聿# implement held upright to carve/draw characters + 彳 movement (→ action indicator) → create written standards for regulating human conduct → *law*; *rule*; *regulate*. Compare 埒, 法, 笵 and 憲.
tags:[]

___
kanji:率
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソツ, リツ]
kunyomi:[ひき（いる）]
raw_etymology:The present form is 十 (gather) + an element# combining a slender thread and protruding objects → curved threads brought into alignment, creating a compact unit → *proportion*; *ratio* (the リツ term). The meanings *command* and *lead* are from the once-separate ソツ term, which suggested the idea of gathering in a neat line and tightening into an orderly unit.
tags:[]
___
kanji:類
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ルイ]
kunyomi:[たぐい]
raw_etymology:犬 dog/beast (→ animals in general) + an element# combining 米 rice (→ plants in general) and 頁 (people) → sort a variety of things according to type, creating smaller piles → *variety*; *kind* → *broadly*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:葎
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リツ]
kunyomi:[むぐら]
raw_etymology:律# regulate + 艸 grass/plant → a plant the regulation of which requires constant attention → (general term for) twisting *vines*, *creepers* and *trailing plants*. Compare 藟.
tags:[]
___
kanji:埒
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラチ, ラツ, レツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:寽 is 爪 claw/hand + 寸 here an abbreviated form of 奪 snatch → pick/pluck then enclose an object in the fingertips or hand. 埒 is as per 寽# (enclose) + 土 earth → earthen *enclosure* or embankment. Also, *framework* and *restriction* (← delimit human behavior ← enclosure; compare 律, 法, 笵 and 憲).
tags:[]
___
kanji:捋
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラチ, ラツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 寽# as described in 埒 (snatch) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → *pluck*; *wrench*; *pick*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:荒
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[あら（い・す・っぽい）, あ（れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:The lower element# is 亡 (obscure) + 川 river → watery wasteland (← obscure part of a river). 荒 adds 艸 grass/plant → *wasteland* → *wild*; *rough*; *lay waste to*; *devastate*; *go to ruin*; *vast*; *violence*; *riot*; *storm* → *chapping* (← roughness).
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 力 power/energy → strive to obtain something concealed, or not at hand → *appeal* (for/to); *invite*; *recruit*; *raise* (money) → *grow intense*.

kanji:慕
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[した（う・わしい）]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 心 heart/emotions → yearn for something concealed, or not at hand → *yearning* → *admiration*; *adoration* → *dear to one*; *love*. Also, *follow* (← follow the object of one's adoration).
tags:[]
___
kanji:暮
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[く（らし・らす・れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 日 sun/day → concealment of the sun at *sunset*/*nightfall* → *become dark* → *end* → *spend time* (← passage of time ← grow dark) → *earn a living*; *livelihood* (← manner in which one passes time ← passage of time). 暮 was devised to replace 莫 after 莫 lost its connection with nightfall. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:模
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モ, ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 木 tree/wood → wooden *mold* concealed by clay covering it → *copy*; *imitation*; *shape*; *model*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:麻
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ]
kunyomi:[あさ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 广 building + 𣏟# two stalks of hemp, the fiber of which is concealed within the plant → rub and scrape *hemp* indoors → *linen*; *flax*. The 𣏟 form replaced by 林 in 麻, 摩, 磨 and 魔 is retained in other derivative characters such as 痲, 糜, 靡 and 麼.
tags:[]
___
kanji:摩
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 手 hand/action indicator → *rub* (off); *scrape* → *stroke*; *polish*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:磨
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ]
kunyomi:[みが（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 石 stone → stone used in rubbing or scraping → *rub*; *scrape* → *polish*; *wear down*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:魔
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 鬼 ghost; demon → *demon* that figuratively rubs a person's senses into numbness. There is a strong likelihood that 魔 was devised to transliterate the first syllable of the Sanskrit Mara, referring to one of the gods in the Indian pantheon.
tags:[]
___
kanji:無
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ム, ブ]
kunyomi:[な（い・くす・くなる・し）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a dancing figure with long sleeves that conceal the arms. To an abbreviated form of this character was eventually appended 火 fire → person/object concealed by dense smoke. *Not*, *none* and *un-* are extended meanings (lack presence/existence ← concealed; compare 亡) → *disregard*; *lose*; *be gone*; *be missing*; *run out of*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舞
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ]
kunyomi:[まい, ま（う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is as per that described in 無 (perform a dance)# + 舛 crossing legs → figure performing a *dance of entreaty* before the gods → *dance*; *flit*; *glide*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:武
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ, ム]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 止# (stand straight) + 戈 spear/halberd → armed warrior(s) attending on a superior → *martial*; *military* → *ferocious*.

raw_etymology:武# military + 貝 commodities → *levy* imposed to *endow* *troops* with supplies → *taxation*; *payment*; *tribute* → *ode*/*poem* (← poem offered in tribute).

kanji:莫
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マク, バク, ボ]
kunyomi:[なか（れ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows four sprouting plants + 日 sun/day → the setting sun, as seen from ground level, concealed by vegetation → *late*; *end*; *not be*; *must not*; *defy*; *disobey*; *refuse*; *decline*; *empty*; *vast*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:摸
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バク, ボ, モ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 手 hand/action indicator → run the hand gently over a dimly visible object gently to determine its nature (compare 撫 and 捫) → *stroke*; *search for* → *caress*. Also, *imitate* and *copy* (← imitate brushstrokes and create a copy of a text ← stroke). 
tags:[]
___
kanji:蟇
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バ, マ]
kunyomi:[ひき, ひきがえる]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 虫 insect/creature → well-camouflaged variety of *toad*. 蟆 is a variant form.
tags:[]
___
kanji:謨

onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 言 words → *plan*/*plot*/*scheme* (in secret; compare 謀) → *deliberate* (a matter).
tags:[]
___
kanji:痲
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ, バ]
kunyomi:[しび（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 𣏟# as described in 麻 (hemp) + 疒 illness → medical condition characterized by *numbness* (← stupefactive properties of hemp) → *paralysis*. *Measles* properly pertains to the compound 痲疹.
tags:[]
___
kanji:糜
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub/scrape) + 米 rice → *rice porridge* (consisting of fine pieces of rice). Also, *crush* and *crumble* (← grind grain in making porridge).
tags:[]
___
kanji:縻
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[きずな]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 糸 thread → shredded fibers twisted into a *halter* for cattle → *rope*; *tie up*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:靡
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ビ, ミ]
kunyomi:[なび（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 非 (spread in alignment to right and left) → *scatter* objects to right and left in the process of rubbing/scraping → *wave/flutter* (← move back and forth between right and left). Also, *yield to* (← waver).
tags:[]
___
kanji:麼
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マ, バ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 麻# (rub and scrape) + 幺 slender thread → *fine* (← rub/scrape fine) → *dim*; *slight*. *Interrogative particle* is a borrowed meaning. Logically, the classifier for 麼 should be 幺, but it is traditionally given as 麻.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廡
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ]
kunyomi:[ひさし]
raw_etymology:As per 無# (concealed) + 广 building → concealed hallway/passageway within a building or compound → (concealed) *passageway under eaves* → *eaves*. *Luxuriant vegetation* is a borrowed meaning via 蕪.
tags:[]
___
kanji:醢
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[ひしお]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines 右 (protect) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl → food preserved in a food container. 醢 adds 酉 alcohol → meat or other food preserved by means of alcohol → *salted meat*; *preserve (that which has been slain) in salt*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:嫵
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ, ム]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 無# (concealed) + 女 woman → *charm*; *enchant* (← the alluring, concealed figure of a woman; compare 妄).
tags:[]
___
kanji:膴
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ, ム]
kunyomi:[ほじし]
raw_etymology:As per 無# (concealed) + 肉 flesh → *thin strips of dried meat* (easily concealed when carried as a provision). Later, the character also acquired the meaning of a *thick chunk of (dried) meat*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:舞# dance + 人 person (for emphasis/clarification) → *dance*.

kanji:黑

onyomi:[コク]
kunyomi:[くろ, くろ（い）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 火 fire + an element# combining a chimney along with specks representing soot → *black*/*dark* (soot).
tags:[]

kanji:默
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:黙
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[モク]
kunyomi:[だま（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 黑# (dark) + 犬 dog/beast → silent dog, *silence* being the aural/oral counterpart of darkness → *hold one's tongue*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冖
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A *cover* that conceals an object. Based on the ancient pronunciation of 冖, it in all likelihood derives from the top element of 冥.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 宀 roof/building → *quiet*, concealed dwelling → *lonely*. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:獏
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 犬 dog/beast → (dimly visible and) imaginary beast believed to eat copper, iron and nightmares. *Tapir* is a borrowed meaning. A variant form, 貘, replaces 犬 with 豸 animal that ambles along the ground.
tags:[]
___
kanji:驀
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 莫# (concealed) + 馬 horse → dashing horse with sight-concealing blinders covering its eyes → *dash* → *sudden*; *abrupt*. Also, *mount/ride a horse*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:亡
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[な（い・くなる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 人 person + a long vertical line# behind which the person is (partially) concealed (compare 毋). The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows 人 person hidden by an L-shaped object → be partially obscured and dimly visible, or fully obscured and non-existent → *perish*; *fall*; *die*; *dead*; *flee*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:忙

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[いそが（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 亡# (obscure) + 心 heart/emotions → obscure state of mind, on account of busyness or being pressed/hurried → *busy*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 亡# (obscure) + 目 eye → obscure vision → *blind*.

___
kanji:望
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[のぞ（み・む）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 臣 (staring subject/retainer) + 人 person ← gaze at the moon. In the bronzeware inscription style, which adds 月 moon, the 臣 + 人 components have morphed into a single element. A seal inscription form adds 亡# (obscure) → *wish*; *hope*; *desire* (← hopes/desires with only obscure chances of realization).
tags:[]
___
kanji:明
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ, ミョウ, ミン]
kunyomi:[あ（かす・く・くる・ける）, あか（らむ・るい・るむ）, あき（らか）, あけ]
raw_etymology:Originally, 月 moon + 向# (ventilation hole) → *bright* moonlight streaming through an *open* window, and manifesting the hidden → *brightness*; *light*. Extended meanings from the idea of the light of dawn (signaling the end of one day and the start of the next) include *spend/pass* (the night); *be visible*; *the next/following* (day/week/year); *begin*; *end*; and *dawn*. *Disclose* and *confide* are extended senses of "open" (open up to), as are *clarity*; *evident* and *obvious*. *Be conversant with* is via the idea of illumination, here with respect to a particular subject matter. The reading ミン refers to the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644).
tags:[]
___
kanji:皿
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベイ]
kunyomi:[さら]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a large *dish*, *plate* or *bowl* covered by a lid that conceals the food beneath it.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盟
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 明# (manifest the hidden) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl → drink blood from a bowl in making a *vow/oath*, causing the gods to manifest themselves → *alliance* (← allied forces keeping the vow they have made).
tags:[]
___
kanji:猛
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 孟# (energetic → frenetic) + 犬 dog/beast → frenetic activity of a dog/beast (compare 狂 and 戻) → *fierce*; *strong*; *fly into a rage*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:民
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミン]
kunyomi:[たみ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an eye blinded in being pierced by a needle → blinding of a slave → *people* (← subservient masses who go blindly about their lives) → *nation*. Note that in contrast to 目, the bronzeware inscription form of 民 lacks a pupil. For the blinding of slaves, compare 艮, 敃, 僕 and 童.
tags:[]
___
kanji:名
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ, ミョウ]
kunyomi:[な]
raw_etymology:夕 here a variant form of the 月 element in 明 (manifest the hidden) and serving as an abbreviated form# of the entire character + 口 mouth → state one's *name* upon being challenged (by a guard), revealing oneself → *repute*; *famous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:銘
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 名# (reveal oneself) + 金 metal → *engrave* an *inscription* in a metallic vessel, revealing the names of the artist or the person commissioning the work, the reasons for commemoration etc. → *inscribe*; *signature*; *motto* → *memorize* (← memorize something inscribed/written).
tags:[]
___
kanji:命
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ, ミョウ]
kunyomi:[いのち]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 名 (reveal oneself) + 令 (receive a long sequence of commands) → receive a revelatory *command*/*order* from an unseen god → *calling/mission*; *fate* → *life*. Also, *name* (← name in ordering) → *word*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鳴
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ]
kunyomi:[な（く・らす・る）]
raw_etymology:口 mouth here an abbreviated form# of 名 (reveal oneself) + 鳥 bird → bird that, by its cries, reveals itself → *cry/sound* (produced by an animal) → *sound/ring out*; *play* (an instrument); *resound*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:网
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モウ, ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *net* in which fish or other objects sought are obscured → *network*. Compare 罔. When used as an element in a dual-element character, 网 most often takes the form 罒. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:冥
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミョウ, メイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:In its present form, 冖# cover + an element combining 日 sun/day + 六 (originally, 入 enter) → cover blocking the entry of sunlight → *darkness* → *the depths*; *the other world* (← unseen dimension). Also, *stupidity* (← dark ignorance). However, 冥 itself is likely the source of the 冖 element/character, suggesting that a different combination of elements conveyed the idea of darkness in the earliest form of 冥.
tags:[]
___
kanji:孟
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モウ, マン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 皿# (cover an object) + 子 child → child energetically throwing off a cover (whether actual or figurative) and making a *beginning*. Also, *eldest sibling* (← energetic growth) → *big/great*. *Mencius/Mengzi* is via an abbreviation of 孟子.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芒
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[すすき, のぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 亡# (obscure) + 艸 grass/plant → *beard*/*awn*, the (obscure), sharp tip of a plant → (beam of) *light*. The character has been applied to Miscanthus sinensis, with most Japanese-English dictionaries rendering すすき as *Japanese pampas grass*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:茫
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, モウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:汒# is as per 亡 (obscure) + 水 water → vast spread of water, extending into obscurity → inundation. 茫 adds 艸 grass/plant → *vast*, grassy plain → *boundless* → *vague* (← only vaguely discernible on account of vastness).
tags:[]
___
kanji:罔
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is a net + 亡# (obscure) → objects obscured in a *net* → *cover*; *obscure* (v.); *non-existence*. Compare 网.
tags:[]
___
kanji:虻
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[あぶ]
raw_etymology:As per 亡# (obscure) + 虫 insect → *botfly* (the larvae of which pupate in their hosts, and are thus obscure) → *horsefly*; *gadfly*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 明# (manifest the hidden) + 艸 grass/plant → *bud*/*sprout* manifested in breaking through the surface of the earth → *sprouting*; *beginning*. Note a variant form styled 萠.

kanji:慢
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 曼# (cover/be covered) + 心 heart/emotions → *sloth* (← heart figuratively covered by dullness) → *slow*; *idle*; *lazy*. *Conceitedness* and *boastfulness* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:面
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[おも, おもて, つら]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 首 neck/head + a line# adhering to and nearly surrounding it, suggesting a *mask* adhering closely to and partially obscuring the *face* → *surface*; *aspect* → *turn (a face) to*; *look away*; *side*; *direction* → *counter* (for flat objects).
tags:[]
___
kanji:綿
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[わた]
raw_etymology:緜 is 帛# white cloth + 系 connection → connected fibers of *cotton* in a piece of cloth. However, 緜 has been supplanted by 綿, which substitutes 糸 for 系 and transposes the elements.
tags:[]
___
kanji:免
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[まぬか（れる）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 奐 (draw a fetus out of/away from the womb) + 儿 person (→ human agency) → assist the escape of a fetus from its mother by drawing it out of/away from the birth canal → *escape/be rescued from* → *avoid*; *evade*; *elude* → *exempt* (← escape from an obligation).
tags:[]
___
kanji:勉
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 免# (draw out of/away from) + 力 power/energy → *make great efforts* in drawing out of or away from (compare 敏 and 僶) → *encourage*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:敏
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 毎# (succession) + 攵 action indicator → work briskly, producing a figurative succession of achievements (compare 勉 and 僶) → *alert* → *agile*; *quick* (← brisk ← energetic activity).
tags:[]
___
kanji:眠
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミン]
kunyomi:[ねむ（い・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 民# (blind) + 目 eye → eyes blind in *sleep* → *sleepy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:宀
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン, メン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of the covering element of a particular character, the shared final -N suggesting that the most likely candidates are 寒, 宴, 安, 賓 and 寅. In these and other dual-element characters 宀 suggests a roof, one concealing the contents of a building → *roof*; *building*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:黽
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ベン, ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *frog* (← creature often directly concealed by the water or vegetation to which it closely adheres; compare 鮟). 黽 is also used to refer to other kinds of amphibious creatures, especially turtles.
tags:[]
___
kanji:棉
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:帛 here an abbreviated form# of 綿 cotton + 木 tree/wood → *cotton* plant.
tags:[]
___
kanji:緬
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 面# (adhere) + 糸 thread → clingy threads → *thread*. *Far* and *distant* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:麵
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 面# (adhere) + 麥 barley/grain → sticky dough, or sticky noodles adhering to each other → *noodle* → (wheat) *flour*. A variant form, 麺, replaces 麥 with 麦.
tags:[]
___
kanji:眄
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン, メン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:丏# is a variant of 正 straight, the curving line suggesting the idea of obscurity (← curved object that eludes direct observation) → bend; oblique. 眄 adds 目 eye → view obliquely → *look sidelong at*; *look the other way*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:閔
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ミン]
kunyomi:[あわ（れむ）, うれ（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 門 (conceal behind a gate) and as per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) → use fine, delicate words in sympathizing with one concealed at home in mourning → *mourn*; *sympathize*; *pity*. Compare 憫 and 愍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:憫
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ミン]
kunyomi:[あわ（れむ）, うれ（える）]
raw_etymology:閔# mourn; sympathize; pity + 心 heart/emotions (for emphasis/clarification) → *mourn*; *sympathize*; *pity*. Compare 愍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:敃
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 民# (blind) + 攵 action indicator → blind a slave, removing his or her eyeballs → *remove by force* → *forceful*. For the blinding of slaves, compare also 艮, 僕 and 童.
tags:[]
___
kanji:愍
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ミン]
kunyomi:[あわ（れむ）, うれ（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 敃# (remove) + 心 heart/emotions → remove another person's anxieties → *compassion*; *sympathy*; *worry*. Compare 閔 and 憫.
tags:[]
___
kanji:俛
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ, ベン, メン]
kunyomi:[つと（める）, ふ（せる）]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 勉 (make great efforts), consisting of 免# + 人 person (→ human agency): *strive*; *exhort*. *Hang the head* and *look down* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:旻

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ミン]
kunyomi:[あきぞら]
raw_etymology:As per 文# (fine, detailed pattern) + 日 sun/day → patterned cloud formation in the *autumn sky* → *the sky*; *the heavens*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メン, ベン]
kunyomi:[おぼ（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 面# (adhere) + 水 water → adhere to/be immersed in liquid → *be immersed in*; *be absorbed in* (an undertaking).
tags:[]

kanji:緡

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン, ミン]
kunyomi:[いと, さし]
raw_etymology:As per 昬# as described in 昏 (darkness) + 糸 thread → *fishing line* (← line that disappears into the depths). Also, a *string run through holed coins*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 黽# (adhere closely) + 人 person → person hewing to his work → *work hard*. Compare 勉 and 敏.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン, メン]
kunyomi:[む（かう）]
raw_etymology:面# face; look away + 人 person (for emphasis/clarification) → *face* (v.); *look away*. Also, *go against* (← face in an adversarial manner).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 民# (blind) + 玉 jewel → a *stone* of a blinding/dazzling (red) hue.

kanji:米
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マイ, ベイ]
kunyomi:[こめ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of fruits of grain (rice), concealed in husks/hulls → *crop grain* → *rice*. *America* is via the phonetic construction 亜米利加 (亞米利加).
tags:[]
___
kanji:迷
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ]
kunyomi:[まよ（う・わす）]
raw_etymology:As per 米# (concealed) + 辵 movement → stray off course on account of obscure visibility → *go astray*; *be lost* → *confound*; *be perplexed/at a loss*; *doubt*; *uncertainty*; *illusion*; *delusion*; *tempt*; *captivate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:弥
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[や]
raw_etymology:The older form of this character is 彌, which is as per 爾# (adhere) + 弓 bow → bowstring adhering to and filling the *nock* of an arrow → *end* (← nock located at the end of an arrow) → *stop*; *desist*; *quit* (← come to an end ← end). 弥 replaces 爾 with 尓.
tags:[]
___
kanji:弭
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ, ミ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally a variant of 弥/彌 end; stop; desist. However, in Japanese usage 弭 conveys the meanings *distance*, *long time*, *spread*, and *prevail* along with *increasingly* and *more and more*; compare 瀰.
tags:[]
___
kanji:謎
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メイ]
kunyomi:[なぞ]
raw_etymology:迷# be lost + 言 words → be lost/confounded by a *riddle* or *puzzle* → *enigma*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:滅
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メツ]
kunyomi:[ほろ（びる・ぼす）]
raw_etymology:烕 is 戌 (exterminate) + 火 fire → exterminate a fire. 滅 is 烕# + 水 water → exterminate/*destroy* by water → *annihilate*; *ruin*; *collapse*; *perish*; *die out*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:袂
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベイ]
kunyomi:[たもと]
raw_etymology:As per 夬# (scoop out) + 衣 clothing → *sleeve* → *by*; *near* (← sleeves attached to the main portion of a garment).
tags:[]
___
kanji:蔑
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベツ]
kunyomi:[さげす（む）, ないがし（ ろ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a person plus an element# combining an eye afflicted with inward-growing eyelashes (trichiases) and 戊 (cover) → person with obscured vision, the eyes being covered with inward-growing eyelashes → *scorn*; *disdain*; *contempt* (← refusal to recognize ← inability to see). Also, *slight* (adj.) (← so few/little as to be barely recognizable).
tags:[]
___
kanji:衊
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベツ]
kunyomi:[けが（す）, はなぢ]
raw_etymology:As per 蔑# (obscure) + 血 blood → *smear* in blood (and thus obscure from sight) → (blood from a) *bloody nose*. Also, *put to shame* (← bloody another).
tags:[]
___
kanji:冒
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[おか（す）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 冐 is 目 eye + 冃# covered parallel lines → wrap a long blindfold around the head, covering the eyes. *Risk*, *brave* and *dare* are associated meanings (← blind attack, interpreted in a positive sense) → *have a bad effect on*; *damage* (← results of such an attack). In contemporary Japanese usage, 冐 has been supplanted by 冒.
tags:[]
___
kanji:帽
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 冒# (wrap about the head) + 巾 cloth → wrap-about *headgear*.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モ]
kunyomi:[しげ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 戊# (cover) + 艸 grass/plant → thick vegetation covering a wide area → *thick growth* → *thrive*.
tags:[]

kanji:矛

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ム]
kunyomi:[ほこ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a halberd or *pike*, the base of the curved spearhead of which is covered and concealed in the shaft (compare 戊) → *arms*.
tags:[]

kanji:務
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ム]
kunyomi:[つと（まる・め・める）]
raw_etymology:敄# is 矛 pike/halberd + 攵 (strike) → great exertion in battle. 務 adds 力 power/energy (for emphasis/clarification) → *work*; *serve*; *carry out one's duties*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[きり]
raw_etymology:As per 務# (exertion) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → vigorous, fine *spray* from a geyser → *fog*; *mist*.

onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Variant of 卯# (bend) + 貝 commodities → bend another person to one's demands in trading → *trade*; *business*.

kunyomi:[け]

___
kanji:耗
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モウ, コウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Once written 秏, which is 禾 grain/rice + 毛# (fine objects) → fine particles of grain, decreased in size by polishing → *decrease*; *decline*; *wear down*. 禾 was later replaced by 耒 plow.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ビョウ, ミョウ]
kunyomi:[なえ]
raw_etymology:艸# grass/plant + 田 field → sprouts/seedlings (obscured) in a field → *seedling*; *shoot*; *young plant* → *family*; *blood relations*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 苗# (obscure) + 手 hand/action indicator → *trace*/*sketch*/*draw* a rough (= an obscure) outline of a scene → *paint*; *depict*; *describe*.

onyomi:[ビョウ]
kunyomi:[すがめ, すが（める）]

tags:[]
___
kanji:皃
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, バク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 冐# (cover the eyes) + 儿 person → dimly observed human figure. However, 冐 came to written as 白 white (→ pale) and 皃 itself was subsumed in the character 貌, from which it derives the meanings *appearance*; *external aspects*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:貌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, バク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 皃# (obscure figure) + 豸 animal that ambles along the ground → obscure figure (of an animal) → *appearance*; *external aspects*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廟
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:朝# dynasty + 广 building → imperial court. Later, 廟 was applied to a *temple* or *shrine* (← place for venerating ancestors ← place for paying respects to the emperor) → *mausoleum*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:戊
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ, ボウ]
kunyomi:[つちのえ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *battle-ax* with a curved handle in which the base of the blade is covered and concealed (compare 矛). *Fifth in a series* and *fifth calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卯
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[う]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of a door or window with a bar aimed at preventing forced entry. A second oracle bone form omits the horizontal line to indicate that force has been exerted on the bar in bending and removing it → door or window the protective bar of which has been bent. The second form described came to be written 卯, and 卯 now conveys the sense of the first one as well. *Rabbit* (as the *fourth sign of the Chinese zodiac*), *east*, and *5-7 A.M.* are borrowed meanings. The modern ON pronunciations of most derivatives of 卯are the result of initial M- transforming to L- via the intermediary cluster ML-.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鶩
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 敄# as described in 務 (exertion) + 鳥 bird → *duck* (← bird regarded as needing to exert itself greatly to fly).
tags:[]
___
kanji:耄
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モウ, ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:毛# (fine strands of) hair + 老 (aged person) → the remaining strands of an elderly person's hair → *old person*; *grow senile*.
tags:[]

kanji:茅
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, ミョウ]
kunyomi:[かや]
raw_etymology:矛# pike/halberd (→ shape indicator) + 艸 grass/plant → (pike-shaped) *miscanthus* (compare 茆 and 萱) → *rushes*; *grass*. Also, *thatched roof* (← thatch with miscanthus reeds or rushes) → *house*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:楙
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, モ]
kunyomi:[ぼけ]
raw_etymology:矛# pike/halberd (→ shape indicator) + 林 forest → *luxuriant growth of trees*. ぼけ refers to *Japanese quince*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:旄
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, モウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:毛# hair/fur + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → *pennant/banner with a long-haired yak tail attached* (compare 氂 and 氅) → *yak tail*; *yak*. *Old* is a borrowed meaning via 耄.
tags:[]
___
kanji:髦
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, モウ]
kunyomi:[たれがみ]
raw_etymology:毛# (fine strands of) hair + 髟 hair → *bangs*; *long hair* (of a young child); *long mane* (of a horse). Also, via the sense of the long mane of a fine horse, *excellent* and *outstanding*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:杪
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビョウ]
kunyomi:[こずえ]
raw_etymology:As per 少# (small/slight) + 木 tree/wood → *treetop*; *tip of a branch*. Compare 末 and 未.
tags:[]
___
kanji:繆
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビュウ, ボク, リョウ]
kunyomi:[あやま（り・る）, まと（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 糸 thread → wind rope/cord around objects that had been separate in binding into a single unit (compare 勠 and 摎) → *wind around/bind*; *coil about*; *be constricted*. *Error* and *mistake* are borrowed meanings via 謬.
tags:[]
___
kanji:茆
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[かや]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 茅 *miscanthus*, with 卯# replacing 矛. Also, a variety of *waterplant*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藐
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バク, ビョウ, ミョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 貌# (obscure) + 艸 grass/plant → plant life that stretches off into obscurity → *stretch off (thinly/barely) into the distance*; *tiny and dimly visible*. Also, *disdain* and *make light of* (← barely merit recognition; compare 邈).
tags:[]
___
kanji:淼
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:水 water (tripled) to create a variant form of 渺: *wide expanse* of water; *boundless*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:騖
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ, ム]
kunyomi:[は（せる）]
raw_etymology:As per 敄# as described in 務 (exertion) + 馬 horse → *horse galloping in a circle* → *rush about*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:眊
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, モウ]
kunyomi:[くら（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 毛# (fine objects) + 目 eye → object too fine to be seen clearly → *dim-sighted* → *eye lacking sparkle*. Also, (mentally dull/senile) *elderly person* (← overall physical decline ← decline in vision). Compare 瞀.
tags:[]
___
kanji:媢
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[ねた（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 冐/冒# (wrap about the head) + 女 woman → (blind) *jealousy* → *envy* (← figurative types of blindness).
tags:[]
___
kanji:賵

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, フウ]
kunyomi:[おく（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 冐/冒# (wrap about) + 貝 commodities → *wrapped present* (sent on the occasion of a death).
tags:[]
___
kanji:瞀
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[くら（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 敄# as described in 務 (exertion) + 目 eye → strain the eyes, attempting to see an object clearly → *dim-sighted* → *dim-witted*. Compare 眊.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蝥
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kanji:穆
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines 彡 pattern + an abbreviated form of the right-hand element of 隙 (faint light spreading through small fissures) → faint pattern. 穆 adds 禾 grain/rice → *quiet*/*calm* of a grain field with crops planted at regular intervals → *gentle*; *reverent*; *respectful* (← behavior of a quiet/calm individual).

kanji:蒙
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[こうむ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 冡# (cover/conceal) + 艸 grass/plant → covering vegetation → *ignorance*; *stupidity* (← dim intelligence ← dim perception on account of covering vegetation). *Receive*, *suffer* and *be subject to* are borrowed meanings, while *Mongolia* is via the phonetic construction 蒙古.

___
kanji:萬
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, マン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 萬 is a depiction of a scorpion, the curved tail of which contains virulent venom. *Innumerable* and *ten thousand* are borrowed meanings. Along with the introduction of Buddhism into China came the symbol 卍 (Sanskrit svastika, a good luck symbol). The Han gave 卍 the same pronunciation as 萬, and eventually 卍 came to be used as a simplified form of 萬.
tags:[]
___
kanji:万
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, マン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of the symbol 卍 (Sanskrit svastika, a good luck symbol), which was used in place of 萬. For meanings, see 萬.
tags:[]
___
kanji:滿
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:満
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[マン]
kunyomi:[み（たす・ちる）]
raw_etymology:㒼# combines the head of an animal and its pelt, suggesting "cover completely" (← cover the body completely with an animal skin that has its head still attached; compare 美). 滿 adds 水 water → inundate (← cover completely with water; compare 漫) → *(be) full*; *fill* → *fulfill*; *all over*.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 免# (give birth) + 女 woman → *give birth*. 娩 was devised to express the original sense of 免 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:挽
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン]
kunyomi:[ひ（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 免# (draw out of/away from) + 手 hand/action indicator → *draw* (out/away) → *pull* (back) → *saw*; *turn* (on a lathe); *grind*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:輓
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 免# (draw out of/away from) + 車 vehicle → *draw/pull* a vehicle (originally, out of ruts, or a ditch; now in the sense of "draw along").
tags:[]
___
kanji:刎
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フン, ブン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勿# (obscure) + 刀 sword/knife → *die by the sword* (becoming obscure in death) → *die* (by having one's jugular cut); *behead* (← cut off the entire head ← slit the throat).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 門# (concealed) + 手 hand/action indicator → *grope for* a concealed object → *stroke* (← motion resembling that made when groping). Compare 摸and 撫.
tags:[]

kanji:縵
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マン, バン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 曼# (long and winding object that covers/is covered) + 糸 thread → *unpatterned silk* (used as a dropcloth). *Loose* is a borrowed meaning via 慢.
tags:[]
___
kanji:謾
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マン, バン]
kunyomi:[あざむ（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 曼# (cover; be covered) + 言 words → *deceive*; *swindle* (← hoodwink; compare 瞞). *Look down on*, *condescend* and *neglect* are borrowed meanings via 嫚.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鬘
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マン, バン]
kunyomi:[かずら, かつら]
raw_etymology:As per 曼# (long and winding object that covers/is covered) + 髟 hair → *luxuriant growth of hair*. Also, an *accessory* made from a vine and/or interwoven flowers. *Wig* and *hairpiece* are extended meanings in Japanese.
tags:[]
___
kanji:悗
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, ボン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:免 here an abbreviated form# of 晩 night + 心 heart/emotions → heart shrouded in darkness, in the form of being at a loss or in a daze (compare 惛) → *be at a loss*; *be in a daze*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[くら（い）]
raw_etymology:As per 昏# (darkness) + 心 heart/emotions → heart shrouded in darkness, in the form of *confusion* or dull-mindedness (compare 悗) → *dull-minded*; *stupid*.

raw_etymology:As per 㒼# as described in 滿 (cover/fill completely) + 足 leg/foot → cover an object in passing over it → *coil about*; *lie/crawl flat on one's stomach*. Also, *stagger*.

kanji:尾
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[お]
raw_etymology:尸# buttocks + 毛 hair → long, wavy hair of an animal's *tail* → *tail end* (of a long, thin object); *copulate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:美
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[うつく（しい）]
raw_etymology:The present form combines 大 person standing outstretched and 羊 sheep (originally, goat), but neither of these elements can supply the Old Chinese pronunciation of the character. The phonetically close term conveyed by 㒼 (described in 満) suggests that 美, like 㒼, involved the notion "cover the body completely with an animal skin that has its head still attached." The exact provenance of the meanings *beautiful* and *good* is uncertain, as is the identity of the element replaced by 大.
tags:[]
___
kanji:微
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# combines a representation of thread stretching above and hanging below a line + 攴/攵 action indicator → manipulate slight threads. 微 adds 彳 movement (for emphasis/clarification) → *slight*; *fine*; *minute*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:魅
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 未# (obscure) + 鬼 (large, lumpy being) → be enchanted (compare 妄) by an obscure entity → *enchantment*; *fascination*; *charm*. The compound 魑魅魍魎 is a general term for evil spirits resident in forests, mountains and rivers.
tags:[]
___

kanji:徽
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 微 slight/fine + 糸 thread → *mark*, *insignia* or *emblem* woven from fine thread → *badge*; *string*. Also, *good (and beautiful)*. Some sources give the form with a horizontal stroke between the 山 and 糸 elements as the preferred form of this character.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 微 slight/fine + 黑 black → fine, black *mold*/*mildew* → *be(come) moldy/musty*. Also, *fungi* (← another form of growth).

___
kanji:末
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マツ, バツ]
kunyomi:[すえ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a tree with a diminutive, curved, and minutely visible branch obscured on top → *treetop*; *small*; *trifling*; *end*; *youngest child* (← extremity of a tree) → *period of decadence* (← decadent values marking the end of an age); (in) *the future* (← extremity of time). Originally the same character as 未.
tags:[]
___
kanji:抹

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 末# (minute) + 手 hand/action indicator → *grind* an object to the point that it becomes minute → *rub*; *crush*; *erase*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:未
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a tree with a diminutive, curved, and minutely visible branch obscured on top → *not yet*; *not be* (← not yet fully visible). *Sheep* (as the eighth sign of the Chinese zodiac) and *1 P.M. to 3 P.M.* are borrowed meanings. Originally the same character as 末.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 未# (minute) + 口 mouth → minutely scrutinize the *taste/flavor* of food → *zest*; *relish*; *appreciate*.

kunyomi:[いもうと]
raw_etymology:As per 未# (minute) + 女 woman → *younger sister* (← female family member who is comparatively smaller).
tags:[]
___
kanji:没
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows that the right-hand element# (traditionally written as per the right-hand element of 歿) was originally swirling water + a hand → body dimly visible in the water in which it is submerged (compare 沈). 水 water was appended for emphasis/clarification → *sink* → *die*.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブツ, モツ]
kunyomi:[もの]
raw_etymology:As per 勿# (obscure) + 牛 cow → obscure (= unremarkable) cow → *thing(s)*; *object(s)* (← things/objects of unremarkable characteristics ).
tags:[]
___
kanji:勿
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[モチ, ブツ]
kunyomi:[なか（れ）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of curved pieces of cloth dimly visible in the liquid in which they are being soaked → *negation* (← negativity likened to darkness ) → *prohibition*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:忽
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コツ]
kunyomi:[たちま（ち）, ゆるが（せ）]
raw_etymology:As per 勿# (obscure) + 心 heart/emotions → absent-minded (← obscure consciousness) → *neglect*; *disregard* (← neglect/disregard out of absent-mindedness) → *in a moment/an instant*; *suddenly* (← happen before one is cognizant of the fact ← absent-minded).
tags:[]
___
kanji:惚
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コツ]
kunyomi:[とぼ（ける）, ほう（ける）, ぼ（ける）, ほ（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 忽# absent-minded + 心 heart/emotions → *absent-minded* → *be/become senile*; *vague*. Also, *fall in love* and *be/become enraptured*. 惚 was devised to convey the sense of "absent-minded" after 忽 underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:笏
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コツ, シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勿# (obscure) + 竹 bamboo → *thin tablet*, obscure on account of its thinness. Such tablets were once made of bamboo, but later often made of ivory or other precious materials. The tablet originally signified authority, but later came to indicate a slat used by attendees of imperial audiences to take notes. The reading シャク is a borrowed meaning, as are the meanings *mace* and *scepter*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:沫
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 末# (minute) + 水 water → minute *foam*, *froth* or *suds* → *spray*; *splash*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 末# (minute) + 艸 grass/plant → *plant with numerous, minute flowers*. The compound 茉莉花 refers to a jasmine.

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 萬# (virulent → vigorous) + 辵 movement → pass over vigorously (such as in working a bladed implement over a whetstone; compare 礪) → *pass by* → *pass out of sight*; *exceed*. Also, *excel* (← exceed others).
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 蔑# (obscure) + 革 leather → *leather undergarment* (obscure on account of being hidden by clothes; compare 襪). *Socks* is a borrowed meaning, via 襪.

___
kanji:駑
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ド]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 奴# (strenuous activity) + 馬 horse → tired (old) horse, worn down by strenuous exertion → *slow horse* → *dull*; *weak*; *dull-witted*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拿
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 合 (press/fit together) + 手 hand/action indicator → *grab* a slave → *catch* → *arrest*. Originally, the character was written 拏, with 奴 in place of 合, suggesting the use of the hand in strenuous activity. Some dictionaries continue to give 拏 as standard, with 拿 noted as a variant form.
tags:[]
___
kanji:迺
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダイ, ナイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:辵# movement + 西 (nest-like object) → soften food by placing in a basket/colander and running water over it. *Namely*, *that is to say* and *possessive particle* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:而
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ, ニ]
kunyomi:[しか（して・も・るに）, しこう（して）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a soft and droopy beard. Compare 冉. *Then*, *you*, *and*, *moreover*, and *but* are all borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 而# (soft and droopy) + 魚 fish → soft *roe/fish eggs*.

kanji:乃
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダイ, ナイ]
kunyomi:[すなわ（ち）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a supple ear clinging to the side of the head (compare 耳) or a fetus clinging in the womb (compare 身). *You*, *after all*, *that is (to say)* and *of* are all borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[ゆ（だる・でる）]
raw_etymology:As per 如# (supple) + 艸 grass/plant → plant matter softened (by boiling or other means) → *boil*; *soften*; *soft*; *seethe*.

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 如# (supple) + 心 heart/emotions → supple/pliant attitude of tolerance or forgiveness → *tolerate*; *forgive*; *excuse* (← follow a suggestion to demonstrate magnanimity) → *thoughtfulness*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:餌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ]
kunyomi:[え, えさ]
raw_etymology:As per 耳# (supple) + 食 food/eating → soft dumpling → *bait*; *lure*; *feed* → *tempt*; *entice*; *decoy* (← lure). Note that for the 食 element, some publications prefer the style that appears in 饑, 飩 and other characters, which adds another stroke to the count.
tags:[]
___
kanji:汝

onyomi:[ジョ]
kunyomi:[なんじ]
raw_etymology:As per 女# (supple) + 水 water → softly/gently curving watercourse (originally, the name of a river in China). *You* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:孥
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ド, ヌ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:奴# female servant + 子 child → child of a (or, one's own) concubine → *wife and children* (as opposed to the master of the house, the husband) → *punish the wife and children along with the convicted criminal*. *Slave* and *servant* are atavistic meanings.
tags:[]

___
kanji:若
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャク, ニャク]
kunyomi:[も（しくは）, わか（い）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of a supple young women combing her hair. A seal inscription form transforms the hair element into 艸 grass/plant and adds 口 (an object) below, probably under the influence of the seal inscription form of 右 → *youth* (← suppleness of youth) → *immature*. The minor meanings of *either/or*, *some ... while others ...*, and *if* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___

kanji:桑
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[くわ]
raw_etymology:叒 derives from a depiction of a three-branched tree covered with large, supple leaves. 桑 is 叒# + 木 tree/wood → *mulberry* (← tree with supple leaves on which silkworms feed).
tags:[]
___
kanji:能
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ノウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a bear, a supple and powerful creature → *ability*; *skill*; *able* (← power/ability to accomplish something ← powerful) → *endure* (← power/ability to hold out) → *Noh* (← skill).
tags:[]
___
kanji:寧
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:寍# is 宀 roof/building + an element combining 心 heart/emotions and 皿 dish/plate/bowl → settle into a relaxed position while partaking of food indoors. 寧 alters 皿 into 罒 and adds 丂 as described in 号 (extend then bend) → settle oneself in a relaxed posture, with a plate of food alongside → *quiet*; *peaceful*. *Rather* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 仁# (interact) + 女 woman → *flatter* a woman to make her interests coincide with one's own.
tags:[]

kanji:襄
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows a number of mixed items + 衣 clothing (here suggesting a supple/soft cloth sack) → *cooperate* in inserting seized goods in sacks → *work*; *assist* → *aid*; *help*. *Raise* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

___
kanji:囊
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ノウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 襄# (sack) + a variant of the element that came to be written 東 (sack bound on two ends and pierced by a shaft) → *sack*; *bag*; *pouch* → *container*. 囊 was devised to replace 襄 after 襄 lost its connection with "sack."
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 寧# (settle) + 水 water → *mud* in which objects settle → *muddy*; *mire*. Compare 泥 and 淖.

kanji:入
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニュウ]
kunyomi:[い（る・れる）, はい（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts a soft, yielding sack into which goods are placed (compare 襄) → *enter*; *put/allow in*; *let in*; *take in*; *hold/accommodate*; *contain*; *carry/stock* (goods); *go/come in*. *Need/require* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:内
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナイ, ダイ]
kunyomi:[うち]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a roof + 入# (place inside) → place objects *inside/within* a storehouse → *home*; *put in*; *among*; *between*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:納
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ノウ, ナッ, ナ]
kunyomi:[おさ（まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 内# (place inside) + 糸 thread → patch/mend vestments by inserting needle and thread through the holes (compare the replacement character 衲). *Pay*; *supply*; *deliver*; *furnish*; *store*; *put away* are via reinterpretation of the constituent elements of the characters as fabric paid as tribute or a tax, and which is stored away. Also, *accept* (← accept that which is paid/supplied) → *settled*; *finished*; *content*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:南
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナン]
kunyomi:[みなみ]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is a depiction of a hut or small storehouse. However, a seal inscription form is 屮 grass shoot + an element# combining 冂 boundary/enclosure and an inverted 入 pierced by two horizontal lines, suggesting sprouts placed inside a hothouse for cultivation → *south* (← direction associated with warmth, which hothouses were positioned to face).
tags:[]
___
kanji:任
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニン]
kunyomi:[まか（す・せる）]
raw_etymology:As per 壬# (encompass) + 人 person (→ human agency) → encompass/bear *responsibility* → *duty* → *undertake* (← undertake a duty/responsibility) → *entrust*; *leave* (up to another) (← entrust/leave up to another a duty or responsibility) → *leave to chance*; *endure* (← endure a duty).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 任# (encompass responsibility) + 貝 commodities → goods/money paid to someone employed, who bears responsibility → *employ*; *hire* → *rent* (to/from); *wages*; *charge*.

kanji:冉
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼン, ネン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a supple object, a soft, droopy beard (compare 而) → *tender*; *weak*. Also, *advance* (← advance slowly and steadily, like a growing beard). 冄 is a variant form of 冉. Distinguish from 再.
tags:[]
