___
kanji:拈
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネン, デン]
kunyomi:[つま（む）, ひね（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 占# (fixed in place) + 手 hand/action indicator → fix an object in place by picking it up or grasping it → *pick up/grasp* (with the fingertips). *Twist* and *twirl* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:衲
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ノウ, ドウ]
kunyomi:[ころも]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 納 (patch/mend) + 衣 clothing → *patch/mend* apparel → *priest's vestments* (← one who wears patched garments ← patched garments) → (humble term of self-reference used by a) *priest*. 衲 was devised to convey the original sense of 納 after 納 acquired different meanings via reinterpretation.
tags:[]
___
kanji:紝
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン, ニン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 壬# (spool of thread) + 糸 thread → *spool of thread inserted in the shuttle of a loom* → *weave*. 紝 was devised to replace 壬.
tags:[]
___
kanji:飪
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン, ニン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 壬# (encompass) + 食 food/eating → a filling encompassed by a lump of *boiled food* → *cook*/*boil* a long time.
tags:[]
___
kanji:然
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼン, ネン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 難 (grill over a fire), with the distinction that in 難 it is 隹 a bird being grilled while in 然 it is 犬 a dog/beast → *burn*. *Thus*, *that's right*, *but*, *however*, and *as it is* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:燃
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネン]
kunyomi:[も（える・す・やす）]
raw_etymology:然# burn + 火 fire (for emphasis/clarification) → *burn*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:難
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナン]
kunyomi:[かた（い）, がた（い）, むずか（しい）]
raw_etymology:As per 𦰩# as described in 漢 (stretch over a fire) + 隹 short, squat bird → bird stretched over a fire in being grilled → *difficult*; *disaster* (← tribulation as intense as being grilled over a fire) → *defect*; *flaw*; *misfortune*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:刃
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン, ニン]
kunyomi:[は]
raw_etymology:刀 sword/knife + a diagonal mark# emphasizing the flexible *blade* → *edge*. In 扨 and 靱, 刃 takes the form 刄, while in 牣, 訒 and 軔 it takes yet another form. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:忍
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニン]
kunyomi:[しの（ばせる・び・ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 刃# (flexible) + 心 heart/emotions → *bear*; *endure* (← heart that flexibly bears/endures burdens). *Stealth* and *concealment* are borrowed meanings → *secret*; *hide*; *incognito*; *sneak into/about*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:認
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニン]
kunyomi:[みと（める）]
raw_etymology:忍# endure + 言 words → *acknowledge* that something endures examination → *recognize*; *determine*; *knowledge* → *accept*; *approve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:人
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン, ニン]
kunyomi:[ひと]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a standing *person* reaching toward another, suggesting people in mutable interaction → *human* (being). Compare 仁. In dual-element characters, 人 nearly always appears on the left in the form 亻. In many such characters ( 價 儗 仰 儆 偃 儀 etc.), 人 suggests human agency, but there are others in which 人 has no semantic function at all. In these cases ( 伎 優 供 佑 傾 佹 etc.), 人 is used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]
___
kanji:仁
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン, ニ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 人# (people in mutable interaction) + 二 two → two individuals in mutable interaction → *humanity*; *benevolence*; *virtue*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[とし]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 禾 grain/rice + 千# (advance through luxuriant vegetation) → advance through crops in harvesting → *year*; *age* (← harvest as the end of a long agricultural cycle; compare 歳).

___
kanji:尼
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニ]
kunyomi:[あま]
raw_etymology:尸 body + an abbreviated form# of 比 line up → close contact among members of a group of similar people (compare 二). *Nun* is a borrowed meaning, to transliterate the Sanskrit bhiksuni (nun) (比丘尼). Note that あま is thought to be a Japanese transliteration of the Pali term for "mother."
tags:[]

tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[ふた（つ）]
raw_etymology:Parallel lines indicating *two* and suggesting an alignment of supple objects, along with the abstract sense of ongoing affinity.
tags:[]
___
kanji:貳
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:弐
shinjitai_stroke_count:6
onyomi:[ニ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 弍: 弋 stake + 二# two → *two* stakes aligned side by side. As with 壱, 参/參, and 拾, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 二) in documents as a precaution against forgery.
tags:[]
___
kanji:璽
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:爾# seal + 玉 jewel → *imperial seal*. 璽 was devised to replace 爾 after 爾 acquired its borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:那
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element# is a variant of 冄 as described in 冉 (supple). 那 adds 邑 (village/settlement), but the original form of the character had a different element than 邑. The identity of this original form and the original meaning of the character are now obscure, although the meaning was likely to have been connected with the concept "supple" as this concept is active in derivative characters such as 娜, 挪 and 梛. *How*, *which*, *what*, and *that* are all borrowed meanings. 那 is used in transliterations of terms such as 刹那 (Sanskrit: ksana), an instant.
tags:[]
___
kanji:雫
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナ, ダ]
kunyomi:[しずく]
raw_etymology:雨 here an abbreviated form# of 霽 (clear or clearing sky) + 下 down → scattered *raindrops* falling from a clear(ing) sky → (a) *drop*; *dripping*; *trickle*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爾
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニ, ジ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a large seal (for pressing images that adhere in soft clay or, later, on documents). *That*, *so*, *you*, *just*, *near* and *like* are borrowed meanings. In dual-element characters, 爾 sometimes appears in the reduced form 尓.
tags:[]
___
kanji:禰
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 爾# (adhere) + 示 altar/the supernatural → memorial tablet dedicated to one's father, and adhering to an altar → *ancestral shrine*.

kanji:梛
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナ, ダ]
kunyomi:[なぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 那# (supple) + 木 tree/wood → tree with long, supple branches. The compound 枸梛 refers to a tree resembling a willow. なぎ (Podocarpus nagi), however, is a species of evergreen.
tags:[]

kanji:熱
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[あつ（い）]

___
kanji:日
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニチ, ジツ]
kunyomi:[か, ひ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of the *sun* → *day* (← appearance of the sun ushering in a new day). As with 熱, the heat of the sun was understood in terms of softening objects and/or reducing them in size.
tags:[]
___
kanji:奈
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダイ, ナ, ナイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 柰 as described in 款 (carve characters), here suggesting that the production of the characters involves not carving but rather pressing an implement downward into soft clay (compare the derivative character 捺). *How* and *what* are borrowed meanings. 奈 is also used in transliterations, such as 奈落 (Sanskrit or Pali: naraka), referring to hell/purgatory or the underworld in general.
tags:[]
___
kanji:褻
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 埶# (cut) + 衣 clothing → cut cloth for use as underwear → *be familiar* (← be on as close terms with something/someone as with one's own underwear); *dirty* (← soiled underwear) → *treat with disrespect*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:昵
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 尼# (close contact) + 日 (sun → sunlight) → sunlight contacting (objects on) the earth → *intimacy* (compare 怩); *approach*. Compare also 暱.
tags:[]

kanji:捏
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネチ, ネツ, デツ]
kunyomi:[こ（ねる）, つく（ねる）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is 土 earth + 日 (sunlight that softens objects it strikes) → hard earth softening in the sun. 捏 adds 手 hand/action indicator → *knead clay into an object* → *fabricate*.

kanji:衵
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジツ]
kunyomi:[あこめ]
raw_etymology:As per 日# (sunlight that softens) + 衣 clothing → (soft) *underwear* (particularly, for females) → *everyday clothing*. あこめ refers to one of two separate types of ancient Japanese garment, one worn by males, the other by females; compare 袙.
tags:[]
___
kanji:暱
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 匿# (objects in a container) + 日sun/day → sunlight contacting objects set out for drying → *intimacy* (← be in close contact). Compare 昵.
tags:[]
___
kanji:惱
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:悩
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ノウ]
kunyomi:[なや（ます・み・む）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 𡿺# shows hair curling over a scalp, with the form 𡿺 transforming the element into a cranium with three bending lines suggesting wrinkles in the soft brains. 惱 adds 心 heart/emotions → persistent thoughts (compare 願 and 慮) of a disturbing nature running about the brain → *distress*; *trouble*; *affliction*; *worry* → *harass*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:腦
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:脳
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ノウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 𡿺# as described in 惱 (brain) + 肉 flesh (for emphasis/clarification) → brains → *brain* → *head*; *main*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:尿
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:尸 an abbreviated form# of 尻 buttocks + 水 water → *urine* issuing from between the buttocks. For urine, compare 溲.
tags:[]
___
kanji:柔
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュウ, ニュウ]
kunyomi:[やわ（らか・らかい）]
raw_etymology:矛# pike/halberd + 木 tree/wood → *soft*/*pliant* wood made into curved weapon handles → *judo* (← pliancy).

kanji:禸

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an animal, seen from the rear. The meaning *trample* suggests the original notion was that of a beast softening earth in trampling it; compare the Old Chinese homonym 蹂 (also "trample").

raw_etymology:As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 女 woman → lithesome woman (← tall and supple) → *graceful*; *tease*.

___
kanji:撓
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ニョウ, トウ, ドウ, コウ]
kunyomi:[いた（める）, しな（う）, しわ（る）, たわ（む ・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 堯# (arch/rise high) + 手 hand/action indicator → *bend* a tall object (into a particular form) → *disarrange*; *disturb* (← bend an object out of its original shape). For disturb, compare 鐃.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]

kanji:橈

kanji:弱
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャク]
kunyomi:[よわ（い・まる・める・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 弜# (doubling of 弓 flexible, curved bow) with two sets of the element 彡 pattern → supple, decorated (or ornamental) bows → *weak*; *feeble*; *weaken* (← soft ← supple). Also, *inferior* and *young*. In derivative characters such as 搦, 嫋, 溺, 蒻 and 鶸, the two strokes at bottom left parallel each other.
tags:[]

kanji:鶸
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャク]
kunyomi:[とうまる, ひわ]
raw_etymology:As per 弱# (supple) + 鳥 bird. The bird originally signified is obscure, as is the specific connection with suppleness, but the character has been applied both to a large variety of *domestic fowl* ( とうまる) and to the *siskin* ( ひわ). *Light yellow-green* is via the compound 鶸色, derived from the color of a siskin's breast feathers.
tags:[]

kanji:冗

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows two curving lines serving as an abstract representation of the idea of movement through open space + 冖 cover → move through the open area of a covered space → *superfluity* (← space other than that necessary in which to move ). There is no etymological connection with 几.

___
kanji:軟
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナン]
kunyomi:[やわ（らか・らかい）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 車 vehicle + 耎# (soft) → large, wheeled plow used to turn up soft soil (lying beneath the hard upper layer) → *soft*. For the idea of softness vis–à–vis the turning of soil, compare 農. 軟 replaces 耎 with 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure (bend → pliable), and this became the standard form of the character.
tags:[]
___
kanji:暖
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダン]
kunyomi:[あたた（か・かい・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:Two once-separate characters combine 耎# (soft) + 火 fire or 日 sun/day, respectively → warm up and soften (by fire or by sunlight; compare the right-hand element of 捏) → *warm/heat up*. The present form, which has assumed this meaning from the others mentioned, combines 日 sun/day + 爰.
tags:[]
___
kanji:耎
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 而# (soft and droopy) + 大 stand outstretched → *soft* and droopy, human figure → *weak*.

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 需# (soft) + 虫 insect → soft, moist wriggling worm → *squirm*; *crawl*; *move*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:閏
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[うるう]
raw_etymology:As per 門# (concealed) + 王 ruler → ruler remaining concealed within the gates of a palace. It was the custom of Chinese rulers to confine themselves during intercalary periods (i.e., periods when the days exceeded those provided for in the official calendar) → *intercalation*; *intercalary month*; *leap*; *leap year* → *usurp* (← throne obtained in an irregular manner).
tags:[]
___
kanji:嫩
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドン, ノン]
kunyomi:[わか（い）]
raw_etymology:敕 a variant form of 勅, here a variant of 耎# (soft) + 女 woman → *young* (← young and therefore soft/supple woman). Compare 嬬.
tags:[]
___
kanji:煖
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダン, ナン]
kunyomi:[あたた（か）, あたた（まる ・める）]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 暖, replacing 日 sun with 火 fire → (be/get) *warm*; *warm up* (an object).
tags:[]
___
kanji:糯
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ, ナ]
kunyomi:[もち]
raw_etymology:As per 需# (soft) + 米 rice → softened, *glutinous rice*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蕊
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズイ]
kunyomi:[しべ]
raw_etymology:惢# is 心 heart/emotions (tripled) → the deep heart/core of an object. 蕊 adds 艸 grass/plant → core of an unopened *bud*, where pistil and stamen adhere. "Pistil" and "stamen" are distinguished by prefixing 雌 for the former and 雄 for the latter. Like certain other characters composed of triple elements such as 毳 and 淼, 惢 may be regarded as having been devised to replace an obsolete compound character that had been created according to the standard formation principle (one phonosemantic element + one semantic element).
tags:[]
___
kanji:緌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズイ]
kunyomi:[おいかけ]
raw_etymology:As per 委# (hang low) + 糸 thread → hanging *crown strings* tied about the jaw. A *decoration* attached above the ear to a crown is a borrowed meaning in Japanese.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蕤
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:甤# combines 豕 pig/boar (→ animal with a drooping belly) + 生 birth; life → drooping life forms. 蕤 adds 艸 grass/plant → *drooping flowers/leaves* → *decoration* hung from a crown, or from a pennant/banner.
tags:[]
___
kanji:訥
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トツ, ドツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 詘 *stammer*. Also, *slow* (of speech) → *dull*. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from K- to N-; compare 吶, 蚋, 汭, 芮 and 枘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:吶
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トツ, ドツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 咄 scold. *Stammer* and *stutter* are borrowed meanings, via 訥. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from T- to N-; compare 訥, 蚋, 汭, 芮 and 枘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蚋
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼイ, ネイ]
kunyomi:[ぶよ]
raw_etymology:A variant form of a character combining 虫 insect and 出, indicating an insect/creature with a protrusion employed in biting/stinging/eating. For 蚋, the specific reference is to a mosquito or *gnat*. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from T- to N-; compare 訥, 吶, 汭, 芮 and 枘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:餒
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダイ]
kunyomi:[う（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 妥# (hang) + 食 food/eating → wilted foodstuffs → *sag*. Also, *be hungry* and *starve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:汭
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 泏 (出 protrude + 水 water) → *bend in a river*; *confluence* → *inlet*. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from T- to N-; compare 訥, 吶, 蚋, 芮 and 枘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芮
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 茁 flourishing vegetation, emphasizing vegetation flourishing at *water's edge*. 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from S- to N-; compare 訥, 吶, 蚋, 汭 and 枘.
tags:[]
___
kanji:枘
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼイ]
kunyomi:[ほぞ]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 柮 (出 protrude + 木 tree/wood) → *tenon* (← projection on the end of a piece of wood, inserted into a mortise). 内 replaces 出 to indicate a shift in the initial consonant from T- to N-; compare 訥, 吶, 蚋, 汭 and 芮.
tags:[]
___
kanji:普
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 並# (long lines) + 日 sun/day → long rays of sunlight (compare 晡 and 昉) spreading *widely* → *generally*; *pervade*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:譜
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 普# (long lines) + 言 words → long lines of words or notations spreading over the surface on which they are recorded → *notation*; *record*; *(musical) score*; *genealogy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:覇
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:霸 is 雨 rain/natural phenomena + an element combining 革# (stretch tautly) and 月 moon → strain (figuratively "stretch") the eyes to observe the whitish moon spreading over the daytime sky. *Domination* and *dominion* are borrowed meanings. 霸 has been supplanted by the form 覇.
tags:[]
___
kanji:捕
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[つか（まえる・まる）, と（らえる・らわれる・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 甫# (spread) + 手 hand/action indicator → spread the hands/arms and *grasp* an object (compare 把) → *catch*; *grab*; *take hold*; *arrest*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:浦
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[うら]
raw_etymology:As per 甫# (spread) + 水 water → *shore* of a *bay*, *beach* or *inlet* (← spreading waterside).
tags:[]
___
kanji:補
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[おぎな（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 甫# (spread) + 衣 clothing → spread a piece of material over a rip/hole to supplement and mend a garment (compare 裨) → *aid*; *mend*; *compensate*; *make up for*; *supply*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舗
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:舎 here was originally 金 metal, which when added to 甫# (spread) yielded the meaning of a metal bracket fitted precisely (= spreading flat) into a gate. (The present-day character 鋪, however, means "lay out; spread; pave.") For 舗, the idea eventually became that of goods *spread flat* for display/sale (compare 販) in a simple structure → *sales* → *store*; *shop*. Note a variant form, 舖.
tags:[]
___
kanji:敷
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[し（く）]
raw_etymology:旉# combines 甫 (spread) + 方 (spread) → spread at length over a flat surface. 敷 adds 攵 action indicator → *spread/lay* at length over a flat surface → *cover*; *pave*. Also, *set up* and *effectuate* (← cover existing gaps).
tags:[]
___
kanji:簿
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 溥# (spread) + 竹 bamboo → strips of bamboo spread in record-keeping → *account book*; *register*.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[ちち]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts a hand spread over the handle of an ax (compare 兵). *Father* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[ぬの]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 父# (spread) + 巾 cloth → *cloth* *spread* over an object.
tags:[]

kanji:歩
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ, フ, ブ]
kunyomi:[あゆ（む）, ある（く）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 止# (stand straight) + another leg/foot → stand straight by in attending upon a superior, then *walk* off (to carry out orders; compare 寺) → *step*; *pace* → *interest rate* (← move forward).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 虜 (emaciated) + 肉 flesh → (emaciated) *skin*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:派
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:𠂢# is a depiction of branching rivulets. 派 adds 水 water → distributaries of a main watercourse → *faction*; *group*; *school* (← branches of a main organization).
tags:[]
___
kanji:避

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[さ（ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 辟# (spread) + 辵 movement → spread in evasive movement → *evade*; *avoid*; *avert* → *shun*; *remain aloof*; *shirk*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卑
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[いや（しい・しむ・しめる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows a variant form of 左 (left hand) spread over the handle of an implement used to flatten or lower a surface, such as a spatula or a trowel → *low*; *lowly*; *base* (← bottom) → *vulgar*; *greedy*; *mean* → *humble*; *despise* (← make oneself/another lower).
tags:[]
___
kanji:碑
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 卑# (spread low) + 石 stone → low-lying stone (marker) → *monument*; *memorial stone*; *tombstone*. Compare 礴.
tags:[]
___
kanji:巴
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[ともえ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a person spread flat on the ground (compare 匍) → *spread open*; *cling/stick to* (← cling/stick to the earth; compare 爬). The borrowed meaning *swirling design* is based on the resemblance between 巴 and the swirling patterns on an archer's elbow protectors ( ともえ) → *whirlpool*; *vortex*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芭
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 巴# (spread) + 艸 grass/plant → plant with large, spreading leaves. The compound 芭蕉 refers to Musa basjoo (*banana/plantain* plant).
tags:[]
___
kanji:杷
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 巴# (spread) + 木 tree/wood → tree spread through with voluminous fruit. The compound 枇杷 refers to the loquat. *Rake* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 巴# (spread) + 爪 claw/hand → *crawl*/*creep*/*climb* over a surface. Also, via reinterpretation of the elements of this character, *scratch*.
tags:[]

onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 甫# (spread) + 勹 wrap → lie on one's stomach (as though wrapping the earth with one's belly) → *crawl*. Compare 巴.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 甫# (spread) + 口 mouth → mouth spread over a breast in suckling → (of food or a breast) *take into/hold in the mouth*.

___
kanji:痺
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[しびれ, しび（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 卑# (low) + 疒 illness → disease that stunts growth. However, 痺 became confused with 痹, which is as per 畀 (pass an object from hand to hand until it reaches the ultimate recipient → stretch) + 疒 illness → *numbness* that stretches over the body → *paralysis*.
tags:[]

kanji:斧
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[おの]
raw_etymology:As per 父# (hand spread over an ax handle) + 斤 ax → *ax*; *hatchet* → *chop*. 斧 was devised to replace 父 after 父 came to mean "father."

kanji:丕
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[おお（きい）]
raw_etymology:As per 不# (bulge) + a horizontal line → *great*; *large* (← bulging). 丕 was devised to recreate the original sense of 不 after 不 acquired its borrowed meanings, and the horizontal line functions simply to create a separate character.
tags:[]

kanji:簠

___
kanji:俾
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ヘイ]
kunyomi:[したが（う）, し（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 卑# (low) + 人 person → a (lowly) servant (compare 婢). *Cause* (to happen) (← give orders to a servant) and *submit/obey* (← servant bending in acquiescence, then following orders) are extended senses. *Stare* is a meaning appertaining to the compound 俾倪.
tags:[]
___

kanji:白

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[しら, しら（む）, し, ろ, しろ（い）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an acorn, a large number of which would be scattered over the ground. The meaning *white* is by association with the color of acorn meat. For "large number," compare 百.

___
kanji:辟
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ヘキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element at left combines 尸 body + 囗 circular enclosure → place for punishing criminals by severing body parts and spreading them about → *punish*. 辟 adds 辛 needle/cutting tool for emphasis/clarification. *Law* is by association (← legally sanctioned penalty) → *rule (over)*; *ruler/lord*. *Avoid* and *open (up)* are borrowed meanings. The idea of severing body parts in punishment is a common theme among the Han/Chinese characters: Compare 刑 顯 馘 県 領 聯 罰 斬 取 and 殊 among others. The phonetic evidence suggests that 尸 is a replacement for 巴 (person spread flat on the ground).
tags:[]
___
kanji:僻
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘキ]
kunyomi:[ひが（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 辟# (punish) + 人 person → *remote* place for punishing criminals → *rural*; *inaccessible*; *secluded*; *out of the ordinary*. *Biased* is a borrowed meaning via 癖. Here, 亻/人 has no semantic function, serving simply to create a separate character conveying meanings that dropped from 辟.
tags:[]
___

kanji:坊
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 方# (spread) + 土 earth → earth spread to create an embankment (compare 壩). Originally the same as 防, but 坊 eventually was applied to the idea of streets divided into squares → *town* → *residences* (of princes, priests, artisans etc.) → *priest* → *young boy* (← acolyte).

kanji:匚

onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a large *enclosure* → *shape indicator*. Conceptually, the character suggests the idea of spreading within a large enclosure. Distinguish 匚 from 匸.
tags:[]

Also, *spread* (*all over*) and *element positioned on the right side of a Han/Chinese character*.

kanji:馮

kunyomi:[つ（く）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 凴 lean on + 心 heart/emotions → *lean/depend on* (emotionally). *Proof* is another meaning carried over from 凴. Also, the borrowed meaning *haunt/possess*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:娉
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ, ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:甹# is 丂 as described in 号 (extend then bend) + 由. Here, 由 replaces an obsolete element of uncertain signification, leaving the original sense of 甹 unclear. (In Chinese, the present-day meanings are "make one's feelings known" and "chivalrous knight." In Japanese, 甹 is not used independently.) However, the Old Chinese pronunciation suggests that 甹 was connected with the broad concept "spread extensively" (compare 方 丙 平 etc.) and more specifically with the idea of visiting or calling upon someone (compare 訪). 娉 adds 女 woman → pay a visit to obtain and bring home a bride → *take a bride*. Also, *call* and *invite*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:聘
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 甹# as described in 娉 (pay a visit) + 耳 ear → pay a *visit* to learn of another person's intentions → *invite* → *employ* (← invite to take up a post). *Take a bride* is a borrowed meaning, via 娉.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[かすり]
raw_etymology:并# align + 糸 thread → align tacking/basting stitches in sewing. *Splash-patterned* (cloth/kimono) is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]

kanji:版
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 反# (thin sheet) + 片 (long piece of wood split down the middle) → *wooden slat*. Virtually the same as 板, except that 版 came to refer to woodblocks used in the printing process → (printing) *block*; *printing* → *edition*.
tags:[]

kanji:板
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[いた]
raw_etymology:As per 反# (thin sheet) + 木 tree/wood → wooden sheet/*board*. Compare 版.
tags:[]
___
kanji:弁
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 廾 pair of hands with a type of headgear → cap or crown spread over the head (compare 冠). 弁 now serves as a simplified form of distinct characters with the element 辡# , which is 辛 needle/cutting tool doubled → split, the divided objects spreading but remaining in close proximity. *Discriminate* and *deal with* are via 辨. *Speech*, *fluency* and *dialect* are via 辯. *Petal* and *valve* are via 瓣, and *braid* is via 辮.
tags:[]
___
kanji:邊
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:辺
shinjitai_stroke_count:5
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[あた（り）, べ]
raw_etymology:The lower part of 臱 is 方 (spread) + 穴 hole → separate holes that are in close proximity. The addition of 自 (nose) specifies the apertures of a nose, the latter an object forming a border between the two sides of a face. 邊 is as per 臱# (border) + 辵 movement → move to a *border*/*boundary* → *vicinity*; *end*; *edge* → *side* (of a polygon).
tags:[]
___
kanji:偏
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[かたよ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 人 person (→ human agency) → *lean*; *incline* → *partiality*; *bias*. *Element at the left of a Han/Chinese character* is a borrowed meaning, via 扁.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遍
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 辵 movement → journey far, but remain in contact → *widespread*. Also, *general* (compare 凡).
tags:[]
___
kanji:編
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[あ（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 糸 thread → weave a binding so that records spread but remain connected → *compile*; *edit*; *combine*. Also, *knit*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:便
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン, ビン]
kunyomi:[たよ（り）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element was originally an element of uncertain composition, but the Old Chinese pronunciation of 便 suggests that this element conveyed the concept "spread" (compare 丙, a constituent element of 更). 便 adds 人 person (→ human agency) → cause to spread → *pass smoothly* → *excrement* (← offal that passes smoothly out of the body) → *easy*/*at ease* (← pass smoothly/easily) → *convenient*; *expedient* (← make something easy). Also, *letter*, *message* and *news* (of/from) (← pass word from one place to another).
tags:[]
___
kanji:變
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:変
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[か（える・わる）]
raw_etymology:As per 䜌# as described in 戀 (tangled) + 攵 (strike) → strike in an attempt to untangle a volatile situation, that leads to *change* (compare 改) → *unusual*; *unusual/wondrous event*; *political event*; *internal disturbance*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:賓
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The two elements at the top of the relevant bronzeware inscription form represent a character# combining 宀 roof/building + 豕 pig/boar → throng of pigs inside a pigpen. 賓 adds 貝 commodities → throng of gift-bearing guests, in close contact → (honored) *visitor*; *guest*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:濱
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:浜
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[はま]
raw_etymology:As per 賓# (contact) + 水 water → *shore/beach* (where land and water contact). 浜 originally represented another term, being as per 兵 (spread over) + 水 water → creek. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:頻
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:歩# walk + 頁 people → people marching in close formation, with no interval between them → *occur repeatedly* (← various persons marching over a given spot).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン, ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of scattered seeds adhering to soil in a field → *scatter* → *separate*; *divide*.
tags:[]

kanji:斑

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[ふ, ぶち, まだら]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 班 (split into a group) + 文 (pattern) → *spotted/dappled/speckled* or *mottled* patterns forming a group. Compare 駮 and 駁.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:林# forest + 彡 pattern → harmonious spread of trees in a forest → *harmony between appearance and content* (compare 斌) → *splendid*.

onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:文# literature + 武 martial → harmonious combination of literary and martial talents → *harmony between appearance and content* (compare 彬) → *beautiful*.

kanji:牝
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[め, めす]
raw_etymology:As per 匕# (double-pronged and aligned) + 牛 cow → the genitals of a cow (dual ovarian-tubed organ of a double-pronged appearance) → *female* genitals.
tags:[]
___
kanji:辨
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 刀 sword/knife → split an object cleanly in two, the spread pieces remaining proximate → *distinguish*; *discern*; *discriminate* (← cut cleanly in two; compare 辯 and 裁) → *deal with* (a complicated job by making distinctions).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

tags:[]

___
kanji:扁
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 反# (thin sheet of wood) + 冊 (bamboo slats) → thin, flat *nameplate* (compare 榜) spread upon a gate → (votive) *tablet*; *flat*; *thin* → *left-hand element of a Han/Chinese character* (← element by which a character may be identified ← nameplate).
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 竹 bamboo → bound set of inscribed, bamboo strips → *book*; *chapter*; *section*; *article*; *counter* for poems or articles.
tags:[]

kanji:蝙

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 虫 insect (→ creature) → *bat* (← creature that unfolds its forelimbs like wings and takes flight). Compare 翩.
tags:[]

kanji:騙
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[かた（る）, だま（す）]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 馬 horse → swing a leg over a horse in mounting it. *Deceive*, *fool*, and *cheat* are borrowed meanings, via 諞.
tags:[]

kanji:顰

kanji:胖
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[ゆた（か）]
raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 肉 flesh → *sliced meat from a sacrificial offering* → *wide-open*. *Fat* is a colloquial meaning unconnected to the etymology of this character.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蘋
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 頻# (no interval) + 艸 grass/plant → *floating weed* or semi-aquatic fern, resting directly on the surface of water → *duckweed*. Compare 萍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:豳
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:豩 combines 豕 pig/boar + an abbreviated form of the top element of 賓 (pigs spread tightly throughout a pigpen) → swarm/throng of pigs. To 豩# (swarm), 豳 adds 山 mountain → *mountainous region* (originally, one swarming with boars/wild pigs). The character also was applied to a particular *Zhou Dynasty kingdom*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 辡# as described in 弁 (split) + 力 power/energy → split/*partition* a work force into units and *perform* a task → *manage*.
tags:[]

kanji:徧

kunyomi:[あまね（し）]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 心 heart/emotions → idea that spreads through the heart/mind but remains within → *narrow-minded*. Compare 褊.

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 扁# (spread, but remain in contact) + 足 leg/foot → *totter*; *stumble* (← feet dragging on the ground). Compare 踣.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卞
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン, ベン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 弁 (cap; crown): *cloth crown*. *Restless* and *unsettled* are borrowed meanings; compare the phonetically close 翻 (flutter) and 奮 (bird flapping its wings → vigorous exertion).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:卞# restless/unsettled + 手 hand/action indicator → *clap* (← restless motion) → *applaud*; *clap a hand on*.

kanji:拚
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ベン, ヘン, フン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 弁# (spread) + 手 hand → spread (the hands/wings) → *spread wings*; *spread* (in driving off/out). The compound 拚命 means to go all out, heedless of risk.
tags:[]
___
kanji:乏
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[とぼ（しい）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is the reverse image of 正 correct, suggesting a widespread lack of something that is correct, or required → *scarcity*; *meager*; *limited*; *lacking*; *exhausted*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:皮
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[かわ]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines a drooping pelt with the head still attached + 又 hand/action indicator → spread open (open up) a pelt, then align it over one's body (compare 求, 㒼 as described in 滿 and 表, as well as 韋) → *skin*; *hide*; *leather* → (tree) *bark*; *rind*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:彼
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[かれ]
raw_etymology:As per 皮# (align) + 彳 movement → align others at a distance from oneself → *over there*; *that*; *that person* (← person/object at a point opposite; compare 樣 and 方); *he*; *boyfriend*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:披
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 皮# (open up) + 手 hand/action indicator → *open up*. 披 was devised to replace 皮.
tags:[]
___
kanji:疲
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[つか（らす・れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 皮# (align) + 疒 illness → align the legs and *bend* over on account of *fatigue* (compare 留) → *get/be tired*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:被
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[こうむ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 皮# (align) + 衣 clothing → align clothing (or bedclothes/bedding) over the body → *cover*; *be covered* → *reach*; *suffer*; *incur* (← be figuratively covered by unpleasant matters) → *passive auxiliary verb* (← be acted upon ← suffer).
tags:[]
___
kanji:罷
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The lower element was originally 卑 (flatten or lower). The addition of 罒 net indicated the spreading/lowering of a net over prey, ending a hunt. *Leave* (off), *stop* and *end* are associated meanings. In the present form, 卑 is replaced by 能 (bear).
tags:[]
___
kanji:比
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[くら（べる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows two persons, one immediately behind the other, suggesting "line up people" → *line up*; *objects of a similar kind* → *compare* (← compare two objects by lining them up); *rate*. For the idea of lining up, see also 竝 and 方.
tags:[]
___
kanji:批
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:比# compare + 手 hand/action indicator → *critique*; *criticize* (← critique/criticize by comparing).
tags:[]
___
kanji:陛
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:坒# is 比 line up + 土 earth → neatly aligned earthen steps. 陛 adds 阜 piled earth → *steps* (of an imperial throne) → *imperial*. 陛 was devised to replace 坒 (a character not used independently in Japanese).
tags:[]
___
kanji:秘
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[ひ（める）]
raw_etymology:祕 is as per 必# (split) + 示 altar/the supernatural → *mysterious*/*secret* ritual involving actual/figurative and permanent splitting. 秘, which substitutes 禾 grain/rice for 示, is a variant form that has supplanted 祕. The use of 禾 may owe to connections with harvest rituals.
tags:[]
___
kanji:閉
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ]
kunyomi:[し（まる・める）, と（ざす・じる）]
raw_etymology:A variant of 閟 shut, replacing 必 with 才 (cut off): *shut*; *close* → *conclude* (an event). *Bolt* and *bar* are borrowed meanings, via the original sense of 閟 (lumber barring a gate).
tags:[]
___
kanji:匕
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a spoon-like eating implement with double, aligned prongs → *spoon* → *dagger*. Note that many publications offer as the standard form of 匕 the way it appears, for example, in 牝, eliminating the leftward protrusion of the horizontal stroke.
tags:[]
___
kanji:畀
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Depiction of an object bound by a cord + a variant of 廾 pair of hands → pass an object from hand to hand, to the end of the line → *give*; *bestow*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:庇
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[かば（う）, ひさし]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 广 building → *eaves* lining a roof → *cover*; *protect*. Compare 軒.
tags:[]
___
kanji:枇
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ビ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 木 tree/wood → (clustered fruit of a) *loquat*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:毘
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ビ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 田 (not field but rather fontanels, as described in 思) → fusing of fontanels in an infant's skull → *connect*; *(ad)join*. Also, *help/assist* (← join another and lend assistance ← adjoin), as well as the *navel* (← spot marking the one-time connecting point between mother and infant). Logically, the classifier for 毘 should be 田, but it is traditionally given as 比. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:篦
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ]
kunyomi:[へら]
raw_etymology:Variant form of 毘# connect + 竹 bamboo → bamboo comb (with fine teeth connected to the shaft). *Arrow shaft* and *spatula* are borrowed meanings. Note a variant form, 箆.
tags:[]
___
kanji:瀰
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ, ミ, デイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 彌# as described in 弥 (fill) + 水 water → fill to the point of overflowing → *overflow* → *spread at length*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:妣
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[なきはは]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 女 woman → *one's deceased mother*. The idea is that one's deceased mother forms a pair with one's deceased father (a sense once attached to the character 考).
tags:[]
___
kanji:砒
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, ヘイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:比# + 石. The original signification is obscure. 砒 is used in the compound 砒素 *arsenic*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:秕
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[しいな]
raw_etymology:比# line up + 禾 grain/rice → *devoid of grain* (← husks neatly aligned but devoid from the outset of grain) → *bad*. 秕 and 粃 are effectively variant forms of each other.
tags:[]

___
kanji:寶
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:宝
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[たから]
raw_etymology:This character was written with a combination of many different elements before 寶 was settled upon as the standard form. Among these combinations, most of the forms featured both 宀 roof/building and 貝 commodities. The phonetic similarity to 富 suggests that the original idea of the character that came to be written 寶 was that of 富, namely, a building stocked with abundant possessions → *treasure* → *currency* → *cherish*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:保
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ]
kunyomi:[たも（つ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 子# child + 人 person → child protected by being wrapped in a cloth (compare the replacement character 褓) and carried on the back of an adult → *protect*; *protection* → *preserve*; *maintain*; *retain*; *keep*. For the idea of enveloping a child in protection, c ompare 孚.
tags:[]
___
kanji:褒
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[ほ（める）]
raw_etymology:As per 保# (cover) + 衣 clothing → large/loose-fitting robe or other clothes that cover the body → large. *Praise*, *commend* and *reward* are borrowed meanings. Compare and contrast 褓, which too is composed of 保 + 衣 (the latter in the form 衤).
tags:[]
___
kanji:浮
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]

tags:[]

kanji:報

shinjitai:NONE

tags:[]

kanji:票
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]

tags:[]

kanji:暴
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, バク]
kunyomi:[あば（く・れる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 日 sun/day + an element combining the curled hide of an animal with the bones still attached + 廾 pair of hands → spread an animal hide and *expose* it on the ground for drying in the sun → *reveal*. The meanings *violent*, *rough* and *sudden(ly)* are either via association (← strip a hide) or are borrowings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:表
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒョウ]
kunyomi:[あらわ（す・れる）, おもて]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 衣 clothing with 毛# hair/fur → spread a fur or an animal skin over one's body (compare 求, 㒼 as described in 滿 and 皮, as well as 韋) → *surface*; *face*; *chart*; *express*; *expression*; *outside*; *appearance*; *show*; *mark*; *monument*; *sign*; *outdoors* (← outwardness). Also, *the top half of an inning*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:俵
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒョウ]
kunyomi:[たわら]
raw_etymology:As per 表# (spread) + 人 person (→ human agency) → spread/distribute the contents of a *sack* → *counter for straw sacks* (← たわら, originally a container of woven straw in which to keep rice or charcoal, i.e., goods stored for subsequent distribution).
tags:[]
___
kanji:勹
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 包 envelop → *wrap*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:阜
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[おか]
raw_etymology:A representation of bulging earth + 十 (gather) → bulging *mound*/*hill* → *piled earth*. Confusingly, when used as an element in dual-element characters, 阜 is written as 阝, the same simplification as employed for 邑 village/settlement. The difference is that 阜 appears on the left (examples: 防, 限, or 陷) while 邑 appears on the right (examples: 邦, 邸, or 郊).
tags:[]
___
kanji:髟
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 長 long + 彡 pattern (here suggesting hair) → *long hair*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:抛
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[なげう（つ）, ほう（る）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines a variant form of 尤 (contracted hand) + 力 power/energy → contract the hand about an object preliminary to hurling it. 抛 adds 手 hand/action indicator → *throw/hurl* → *throw away*; *discard*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:呆
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ, ボウ]
kunyomi:[あき（れる）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 保 (protect a child). *Absent-minded*, *be dumbfounded*, *dull(-minded*) and *stupid* are via the non-comprehending expression of an infant.
tags:[]
___
kanji:咅
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 否 (spread word of refusal), adding a stroke at top that later came to be reinterpreted as indicating spittle → spread spittle → *spit*. トウ is a reading attached to this latter sense.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:包# envelop + 广 building → *kitchen* (located deep within a building compound).

kanji:疱
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:包# envelop + 疒 illness → ailment in which a protrusion is enveloped by skin → (water) *blister*. Compare 皰.

kanji:腹
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フク]
kunyomi:[はら]
raw_etymology:复 is an abbreviated form of 畐 as described in 副 (alcohol container with a bulging middle) + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward (→ action indicator) → send back/return something received (in kind) → double back. 腹 is as per 复# (double back) + 肉 flesh → *stomach* of an obese person (i.e. with an extra layer of fat doubled atop the abdominal muscles) → *abdomen*; *belly*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:復
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 复# as described in 腹 (double back) + 彳 movement → double back along the same course → *return* → *repeat*; *once more*. Also, *report* (← repeat that which has happened by reporting it).
tags:[]
___
kanji:覆
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フク]
kunyomi:[おお（う）, くつがえ（す・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 復# (double back) + 襾 cover → boat that is blown back in a breeze and overturns, becoming covered in water → *capsize*; *turn over*; *overturn*; *turn back*. Associated and extended meanings include *overthrow*, *overrule* and *disprove*, as well as *cover* and *spread over*.
tags:[]

kanji:菩

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:艸 grass/plant + 咅# (spread) → a plant with a widely spreading fragrance (compare 芳 and 苾). 菩 eventually came to be used for transliterations of Sanskrit-language Buddhist terms such as 菩薩 for bodhisattva (roughly, one who helps sentient beings attain Buddhahood).
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:鰒
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フク]
kunyomi:[あわび, ふぐ]
raw_etymology:As per 复# as described in 腹 (double back) + 魚 fish → *abalone* (← sea creature the shell of which has spirals that double back upon themselves ). In Japan, the proximity between the sounds フク and ふぐ has caused the character to be applied to the fish known as *puffer* or *blowfish*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:畝
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホ, ボウ]
kunyomi:[うね, せ]
raw_etymology:田 field + an element# combining 攵 (strike) and an obsolete character of uncertain identity. The original intent seems to have been "strike (with a hoe or plow) in creating ridges or furrows" → *ridge*; *furrow* → *unit of measurement*. Also, *rib* (in ribbed cloth). 畝 replaces 攵 with 久.
tags:[]
___
kanji:攵
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボク, ハク, ホク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 卜# (crack) + 又 hand/action indicator → *strike* with a stick, causing to crack. In dual-element characters, 攵 suggests either striking ( 敗 敵 勅 改 攻 務 etc.) or action in a general sense ( 政 收 故 救 效 敷 etc.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:卜
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホク, ボク]
kunyomi:[うらな（い）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of cracks spreading over shells/bones burnt in a divination rite → *divination*; *fortune-telling*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:仆
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ, ホク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:卜 here a variant form of 菐# as described in 僕 (servant falling prostrate) + 人 person (→ human agency) → *fall*; *lie prostrate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:訃

onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]

___
kanji:剝
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハク]
kunyomi:[は（がす・がれる・ぐ・げる）, む（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 彔# (pare/strip) + 刀 sword/knife → *pare*; *strip (off)*; *peel*; *come/peel off*; *shell* (a nut). 剝 was devised to replace 彔 after the latter came to be associated specifically with carving.祿 (13)　ロクAs per 彔# (scatter right and left) + 示 altar/the supernatural → blessings scattered on humans by the gods → *happiness*; *prosperity* → *salary*. 禄 is a variant form that is sometimes encountered.
tags:[]
___
kanji:碌
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ロク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 彔# (scatter right and left) + 石 stone → *the sound of stones tumbling over each other* as they scatter. Japanese has many borrowed meanings attached to the terms ろくな and ろくに; in modern orthography 碌 is not used in these cases.
tags:[]
___

kanji:付
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[つ（き・く・け・ける）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 尌 as described in 樹 (set/stand in place) + 人 person (→ human agency) → set/stand in place or spread over by attaching → *attach*; *be attached*. Extended meanings include *apply*, *per*, *hand something to*, *entrust*, *deposit*, *set*, *bill* and *credit*. 
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 付# (set in place) + 广 building → *storehouse* with goods placed throughout → *governmental office*; *capital*; *administrative division*.

kanji:腐
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[くさ（らす・る・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 府# (storehouse) + 肉 flesh → stored meat that has spoiled → *spoil*; *rot*; *decompose*; *decay*; *go bad*; *corrode*; *corrupt*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:附
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 付# (set in place) + 阜 piled earth → compacted earth set firmly in place. This meaning eventually dropped, and 附 now expresses the same meanings as 付: *attach*; *be attached*; *apply*; *per*; *hand something to*; *entrust*; *deposit*; *set*; *bill* and *credit*. In modern Japanese usage, 附 is often replaced by 付.
tags:[]
___
kanji:符
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 付# (set in place) + 竹 bamboo → bamboo tablet/tally split in two to make a pledge, the pieces of which, when set in place, *fit together exactly* → *tally*; *marker* → *paper charm*; *code*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:赴
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[おもむ（く）]
raw_etymology:卜 + 走. However, 卜 here likely functions as it does in 仆 and 訃, namely, as an abbreviated form# of 菐 as described in 僕 (servant). 赴 adds 走 run → servant rushing to *attend* to his master → *rush up toward*; *go/proceed to* (hurriedly); *approach*.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:僕
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 菐# depicts a rough slave/servant spreading his arms in falling prostrate. Distinguish 菐 from 業 (stand with notched wooden supports on both ends) and note that the present-day meaning of 菐 (thicket) is borrowed from the graphically similar 丵. A needle (suggesting the blinding of slaves: compare 艮, 民, and 童) hangs over the slave's head, and a tail is appended to lay unqualified stress on the near-animal nature of a slave's lowly status. adds 人 person for emphasis/clarification → *servant* (person of low birth and rough manners) → humble reference to self → *I* (← casual masculine reference to self).
tags:[]
___
kanji:撲
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 菐# as described in 僕 (rough) + 手 hand/action indicator → *strike* roughly.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 菐# as described in 僕 (rough) + 巾 cloth → rough cloth of a *turban* → *kerchief*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:樸
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 菐# as described in 僕 (rough) + 木 tree/wood → rough, *unprocessed lumber* → *simple*; *natural*; *plain*.

kanji:奉
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ, ブ]
kunyomi:[たてまつ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + an element# combining 廾 pair of hands and 丰 (cone-shaped, fruit-bearing ears of grain) → spread/extend the arms in presenting an offering → *present*; *offer* → *serve*; *honor*; *revere*; *obey*. Also, *receive* (← receive by spreading/extending the arms).
tags:[]
___
kanji:俸
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 奉# (spread/extend in presenting or receiving): → receive a *salary*. In 俸, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying a nuance ("receive") that largely disappeared from 奉.
tags:[]

kanji:豐
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:豊
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[ゆた（か）]
raw_etymology:豆 food stand + an element# combining 山 mountain and 丰 cone-shaped, fruit-bearing ears of grain (doubled) → abundant grain piled high in a cone shape on a food stand → *abundance*; *rich*. Distinguish this element from the right-hand element of 禮, which is etymologically unrelated.
tags:[]
___
kanji:邦
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is as per 丰# (cone-shaped, fruit-bearing ears of grain) + 田 field. A bronzeware inscription form replaces 田 with 邑 village/settlement → platform built upon a cone-shaped mound of earth that proclaims (to the gods) the ownership of a particular area of land (compare 封) → *country* → *Japan*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:否
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[いな, いな（や）, いや]
raw_etymology:As per 不# (refusal; negation) + 口 mouth → oral *refusal/negation/denial* → *no*; *bad*; *otherwise*; *whether or not* → *as soon as*; *no sooner than* (← practically no time between the occurrence of two events). I n derivative characters such as 痞 and 嚭, 否 conveys the concept "bulge," a carryover influence of 不.
tags:[]
___

kanji:陪
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 咅# (spread) + 阜 piled earth → spread earth over the roots of a plant in cultivation. 陪 originally conveyed the same meanings as 培 (cultivate; raise; grow), but acquired the borrowed meanings *accompany*; *attend* (upon); *serve*; *deputy*; *vice-*; and *sub-*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:部
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 咅# (spread) + 邑 village/settlement → spread over *part* of a settlement → *section*; *group*. Also, (via "a part"), *counter* (for books/papers) and *radical/classifier* for a Han/Chinese character.
tags:[]
___
kanji:賠
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 咅# (spread) + 貝 commodities → spread money or payment in kind to provide full *compensation* for the original value of a (lost/destroyed) object → *indemnity*. For the correlation of the concept "spread" with the meaning "compensate," compare 補.
tags:[]
___
kanji:背
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ]
kunyomi:[せ, せい, そむ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 北# (back) + 肉 flesh (to emphasize the physical aspect) → one's curved *back* → *height*. Also, *contrariness*; *go back on* (one's word); *go against*; *disobey*; *go/turn away* and *avert* (← turn one's back on), as well as *carry on one's back*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:負
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[お（う）, ま（かす・ける）]
raw_etymology:The crouching figure described in 危 + 貝# commodities → stoop to *carry goods on one's back* → *carry*; *bear* (a load) → *be burdened*; *be shouldered with* (responsibility); *owe*; *sustain* (an injury); *turn one's back to/upon*; *go against* → *lose*; *be defeated*; *succumb* (to); *flee* (← be defeated in battle, then turn to flee; compare 北).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]

kanji:備
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ビ]
kunyomi:[そな（える・わる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form of the right-hand element# is a depiction of arrows spread through a quiver; compare 箙. 備 adds 人 person (→ human agency) → *equip/ready* a soldier → *prepare*; *provide*; *possess*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:佩
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ]
kunyomi:[は（く）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines 巾 cloth + an abbreviated form of 風 (flutter) → fluttering cloth. 佩 adds 人 person (→ human agency) → *put on*/*wear* a cloth (particularly, about the waist as a belt or accessory) → *fix (to)*; *accessories*. *Be impressed* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:甫

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ, ホ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a seedling curving upward in spreading from a field or seedbed → *broad/wide*; *great*. Also, *beginning* (← beginning of a plant's life cycle) → *for the first time*. (*Suffix for male names*) is a borrowed meaning.

kanji:服
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 𠬝 features the same elements as 及, a hand + a person → spread a hand over another person's back. A bronzeware inscription form adds 舟 boat → spread boards in fashioning a boat. A seal inscription form replaces 舟 with 肉 flesh → *clothes* that spread over/*cling* to the body → *submit*; *obey* (← be closely attached to; compare 伏) → *accede* → *take (medicine) regularly* (← submit to/obey a doctor's prescription) → *counter* (for a dose of medicine/a smoke). Also, *be engaged in* and *be accustomed to*. In the derivative characters 菔 and 鵩, 服 appears in slightly different forms.
tags:[]

kanji:曝

shinjitai:NONE

kanji:分

kanji:本

kunyomi:[もと]
raw_etymology:木 tree/wood + a horizontal line# (compare that in 旦) indicating the *base*/*root* of the trunk → *origin*; *originally*; *true*; *one's own*; *capital*; *counter* (for cylindrical objects) → *book* (← counter for scrolls ← counter for cylindrical objects).
tags:[]
___
kanji:奔
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The present style is based on a bronzeware inscription form combining 夭 (a running figure) + 歮, a variant of 歰 meaning "be stopped." However, neither 夭 nor 歮 can be the phonosemantic element in 奔, and the meaning of 奔 (*run*) does not square with the sense "be stopped." Other bronzeware forms show 夭 plus an obsolete element of unknown signification. As 奔 conveys the concept "spread" in derivative characters such as 賁 and 鼖, the obsolete element may be posited to have been connected with the idea of legs spread in running.
tags:[]
___
kanji:奮
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[ふる（う）]
raw_etymology:奞# combines 大 stand outstretched (→ outstretched) + 隹 short, squat bird → bird spreading and flapping its wings. 奮 adds 田 field → bird in a field flapping its wings in preparing to take flight (compare 翻) → *vigorous exertion*; *spirited effort* → *muster courage*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:半
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[なか（ば）]
raw_etymology:牛 cow + 八# split right and left → split a cow in butchering it, the separate parts remaining in close proximity → *half* → *part(ly)*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:伴
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, ハン]
kunyomi:[ともな（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 人 person → person who, with an *accomplice*/*associate*, splits off from a group → *accompany*; *bring with*; *involve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:判
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン, バン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 刀 sword/knife → judgment likened to a decisive cutting in two (compare 斷, 裁, 決 and 折) → *judge* → *seal* (of judgment); *size* (← seal of a particular size).
tags:[]
___
kanji:畔
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 田 field → *ridge*/path splitting fields → (water's) *edge*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:反
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン, タン]
kunyomi:[そ（らす・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 又 hand/action indicator + a thin sheet of wood → curve a thin piece of wood back upon itself → *bend back*; *return*; *warp*; *reverse*; *flutter*; *on the contrary*; *anti-* → *rebel*; *disobey*. *Counter for cloth or paddies/fields* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:坂
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[さか]
raw_etymology:反# bend back + 土 earth → series of slopes → *slope*; *hill*; *incline*; *mountain path*. Compare 阪.
tags:[]
___
kanji:返
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘン]
kunyomi:[かえ（す・る）]
raw_etymology:反# return + 辵 movement → *return* to one's point of origin → *turn over*; *reverse*; *fall upside down*. Compare 僨.
tags:[]
___
kanji:販
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 反# (thin sheet) + 貝 commodities → goods laid out on display (compare 舗) on a board → *sales*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:飯
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[めし]
raw_etymology:反# bend back + 食 food/eating → fold cooked rice back upon itself with a spatula → (cooked) *rice*; *food*; *meal* → *feed* (a person); *eat* (rice).
tags:[]
___
kanji:班
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:玨 (玉 jewel in abbreviated form, and doubled) + what was originally 八# split right and left → split a round gem in two → *group*; *squadron* (← large group of people split into smaller units, which however remain coordinated).
tags:[]
___
kanji:番
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:釆# scattered seeds + a representation of a basket (now written 田) → reach into a basket and scoop up seeds to spread/sow them → *number*; *order* (← count the number of times the hand is inserted into a basket) → *keep watch* (← keep watch over in turn). 釆 replaces an obsolete character that likewise indicated seeds or grain.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藩
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 潘# (spread) + 艸 grass/plant → rough-woven fence created by spreading branches → *feudal lord* (← protection offered by a lord ← protection offered by a fence) → *fief* → *han* (feudal clan or domain in the Edo period).
tags:[]
___
kanji:翻
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホン]
kunyomi:[ひるがえ（す・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 番# (spread) + 羽 feather/wing → birds spreading and flapping their wings in preparation to take flight → *flutter*; *wave* → *dodge*; *leap up*. Also, *change* (one's mind) and *turn over*. Note a variant form, 飜, which replaces 羽 with 飛 fly.
tags:[]
___
kanji:般
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element at left was originally not 舟 but a rounded tray. 殳 action indicator was added to suggest "*carry*/transport a tray on which objects are *spread out*" (compare 販, in which goods are spread on a board for sale) → *circle*; *(in) general*; *all* (← spread of objects from a starting point).
tags:[]
___
kanji:搬
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:般# carry/transport + 手 hand/action indicator → *carry*; *transport*. 搬 was devised to replace 般 after 般 acquired its extended meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盤
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:般# tray + 皿 dish/plate/bowl (for emphasis/clarification) → *tray* → *basin*; (game)*board*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:煩
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボン, ハン]
kunyomi:[わずら（う・わす）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 見# (fix upon) + 火 fire → figurative fire fixed upon the head → *trouble*; *worry*; *suffer from an illness* → *annoy* (another). Also, *hesitate* (← be troubled over a decision).
tags:[]
___
kanji:繁
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 敏# (succession) + 糸 thread → succession/profusion of decorative tufts of threads → *proliferate* → *plenitude*; *busy/bustling*; *many times*.
tags:[]

onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[た（く）]
raw_etymology:林# forest + 火 fire → forest fire → *burn* → *boil*; *cook*.

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:A variant form of 番 (basket used in sowing) → *straw basket*.

raw_etymology:本# base + 竹 bamboo → the *rough*/*coarse* base of a bamboo tree.

raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 手 hand/action indicator → *break* an object into pieces → *mix*; *stir* (← break ingredients into smaller pieces and stir in a pot).

kanji:絆
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, ハン]
kunyomi:[きずな]
raw_etymology:As per 半# (split) + 糸 thread → split the limbs away from each other and shackle/bind → *bond(s)*; *tie*; *ties*. For fetters, compare 械, 校, 枷 and 桎.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 番# (spread) + 水 water → grain spread throughout water in which it is washed → *water in which rice has been washed* → *whirlpool*.

raw_etymology:As per 番# (spread) + 艸 grass/plant → grass/plants spread over a field → *grow thick*; *thrive*. *Foreign* and *barbarian* are borrowed meanings (compare 胡).
tags:[]

kanji:蟠
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バン, ハン]
kunyomi:[わだかま（り・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 番# (spread) + 虫 insect (here in its original sense of a snake) → coiled snake, set to strike → *coil*, *curl up/around* → *loiter*; *hang about* → *discontent*; *antagonism* (← disagreeable sensations that linger in the heart).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 分# (split) + 心 heart/emotions → lose one's composure in becoming *angry* (← anger conceived of as a split between one's habitual and temporary mental states ; compare 扮). Compare also 憤.
tags:[]
___
kanji:枌
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[そぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 分# (split) + 木 tree/wood → lumber divided (by cutting or bending back; compare 反) into thin boards → *shingle*(s). Originally, however, the term may have referred to a tree the seeds of which scatter widely: compare 番.
tags:[]
___
kanji:氛

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 雰 mist/fog + 气 rising vapors (→ air/atmosphere) → mist/fog as one manifestation of *air*, *atmosphere* or *weather*.
tags:[]

kanji:礬

raw_etymology:As per 番# (spread) + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → *flag*, *pennant* or *streamer* (spreading in a breeze). Compare 幡.
tags:[]

kanji:鷭

kanji:濆

onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 賁# (swell) + 水 water → *spouting/gushing water*. Also, *shoreline* (← waves crashing on a shoreline) and *confusion* (← mental turbulence).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[ひし（めく）]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 奔 run, with the 牛 cow elements suggesting *jostle*; *throng*; *stampede* (originally, with respect to cattle).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:半# split + 氷 ice → ice that splits in melting → *melt*. Compare 泮.

kanji:泮
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:半# split + 水 water → water produced by splitting/melting ice → *melt*. Compare 冸. The compound 泮宮 refers to an ancient Chinese school.
tags:[]

___
kanji:賁
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ, フン, ホン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 奔 (spread) + 貝 bivalve shell → *beautiful pattern* spread over a shell → *spotted/dappled/speckled/mottled* (pattern) (for the latter sense, compare 斑) → *beautifully ornamented*. Also, via the image of a bulging/swelling shell, *large*. *Run swiftly* and *valor* in battle are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:份
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒン, フン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:分# portion + 人 person (→ human agency) → *portion* out. *Harmony between the inner and outer person* is via reinterpretation, in the sense of contentment with one's allotted portion in life.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 分# (split) + 土 earth → *dust* splitting away from the earth → *gather* (← unit of separate particles ← cloud of dust).

kanji:蕡
