kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 賁# (swell) + 艸 grass/plant → *swollen fruit/bud* → *profusion of fruit/berries* on a plant. 蕡 can also refer specifically to *hemp seeds*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鼖
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 奔 (spread) + 鼓 drum → large (spreading) *drum*. For "drum," compare 彭.
tags:[]
___
kanji:魬
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン, バン]
kunyomi:[はまち]
raw_etymology:As per 反# (thin sheet) + 魚 fish → *flatfish* (such as sole/flounder). はまち however refers to a *young yellowtail*; compare 鰍 for young yellowtail ( いなだ).
tags:[]
___
kanji:僨
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フン]
kunyomi:[たお（れる）, やぶ（る）]
raw_etymology:賁# run + 人 person → lose one's balance while running → *fall*; *collapse*; *overturn*. Compare 返.
tags:[]
___
kanji:棥
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 林# (encompass) + 爻 crossed objects → twist vegetation in creating an encompassing *pen/fence* or *enclosure*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:法
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ, ホッ, ハッ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 水 water + an element# combining 去 (withdraw) and 廌 imaginary beast with a single horn → cause a creature to withdraw to an island → *law* (← enjoy freedom of action within the framework of the law ← enjoy freedom of movement within the confines of an island; compare 憲 律 笵and 埒) → *fixed way of doing*; *rule*; *Buddhist truth*; *follow*; *model*. The 廌 element eventually dropped.
tags:[]
___
kanji:琺
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ホウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 法# (cover) + 玉 jewel → cover/coat a precious object with *enamel*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:非
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of curved wings that spread in alignment to right and left → *not*; *non-*; *in-*; *un-* (← brush off a request in objecting/refusing → *object*; *refuse*) → *fault*; *mistake*; *wrong*; *incorrect* (← negativity). Compare 不, as well as 拂.
tags:[]
___
kanji:俳
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 人 person → two persons performing, one on the right and the other on the left → *performer*; *actor* → *haiku*; *comic poems* (haikai).
tags:[]
___
kanji:排
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → spread in alignment to right and left → line up; arrange; row. Also, *reject*, *exclude* and *eject* (← push off to both sides in rejecting).
tags:[]
___
kanji:悲
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[かな（しい・しみ・しむ）]
raw_etymology:As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 心 heart/emotions → heart split by *sadness* or lamentation → *lament*; *grieve* → *mercy* (← strive to eliminate the sadness of common people). Compare and contrast 悱.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[とびら]
raw_etymology:As per 非# (spread in alignment to right and left) + 戸 door → doors swinging open in alignment → *door* → *title page* (of a book).

kanji:配
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ]
kunyomi:[くば（る）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 妃 spouse + 酉 alcohol container (→ feast) → wedding at which two persons are joined/aligned in marriage, becoming spouses → *align*; *combine* → *distribute*; *allot*; *assign* (← align in distributing, allocating etc.). Also, *wife* (← wife aligned with her husband; compare 妻).
tags:[]

kanji:肥
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヒ]
kunyomi:[こえ, こ（える・やし・やす）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is a variant of 卩 kneeling figure, here an abbreviated form# of 配 align + 肉 flesh → aligned layers of fat → (grow) *fat*; *gain weight* → *enrich*; *cultivate*; *fertilize*; *manure*; *night soil*. The contemporary form is 肉 + 巴.

tags:[]

kanji:佛
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:仏
shinjitai_stroke_count:4
onyomi:[ブツ, フツ]
kunyomi:[ほとけ]
raw_etymology:As per 弗# (split) + 人 person → person who splits away and disappears. *Buddha* is a borrowed meaning, 佛 being used to transliterate the Sanskrit buddha → *Buddhist image*; *the deceased*; *merciful*. *France* is via the phonetic construction 佛欄西.

kanji:貝
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハイ, バイ]
kunyomi:[かい]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a bivalve (one split open to reveal its contents) → *shellfish*; (sea) *shell* → *treasure*. When used in dual-element characters, 貝 most often denotes "commodities" (shells having anciently been used as currency), but this is not an independent meaning in Japanese.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:發
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:発
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[ハツ, ホツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element# combining 癶 (split to right and left) + 殳 action indicator means "split to right and left." 發 adds 弓 bow → arrow splitting from a curved bow in being launched → *release* → *start*; *appear/issue suddenly*; *open/emerge all at once*; *spread/extend outward*; *expose* (by digging up); *send* → *counter for bullets/gunshots*.
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:12

raw_etymology:As per 發# (split away in being released) + 广 building → building materials released as a structure splits apart (compare 壞 and 崩) → *abandon*; *abolish*; *decline*; *go out of use/fashion*; *die out*.
tags:[]

kanji:八
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハチ]
kunyomi:[や]
raw_etymology:Two curved lines bending away from each other, suggesting the idea of splitting away to right and left → *divide/part from* right and left. *Eight* is either a borrowed meaning or may be regarded as having been considered the single-digit number divisible by two the greatest number of times.
tags:[]

kanji:肺
kanji_stroke_count:9

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element#, which in contemporary fonts can be identical in form with 市, combines 八 split right and left + a bud → buds split right and left. 肺 adds 肉 flesh → *lung* (← internal organ found on both sides of the chest).
tags:[]

kanji:撥
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハツ, バチ, ハチ]
kunyomi:[はね（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 發# (split away in being released) + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → push/set objects aside → *push aside*; *set aside* *release* → *allocate* → *spring* (outward/upwards; compare 孛); *separate* (← become separated as a result of being released) → *eliminate*; *reject* (← separate those chosen from those not). Also, *plectrum*.

kanji:醱
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 發# (split away in being released) + 酉 alcohol container → release alcohol for a second *fermentation* or *brewing*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:孛
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボツ, ハイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 八# split right and left + an element combining 屮 grass shoot and 子 child/offspring → young living things bursting upward and outward → *spring up* (compare 撥). The compound 孛星 refers to a comet.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:孛# spring up + 力 power/energy → *sudden* action, in the form of springing up or bursting forth.
tags:[]

kanji:茇

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハツ, バツ, ハイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 犮# (split away) + 艸 grass/plant → split grass or vegetation off to both sides (compare 蔽) → *split grass off to both sides*. Also, via a separate application of the combination of the constituent elements, *grass root(s)* (← roots that split the earth in thrusting upward).
tags:[]
___
kanji:紼
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 弗# (split) + 糸 thread → one of multiple ropes splitting away from a central point , particularly a *thick rope used to lead oxen* → *rope used to pull a hearse*. *Braided, ornamented cord identifying one's rank* is a borrowed meaning via 紱.
tags:[]

kanji:初
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショ]
kunyomi:[うい, そ（める）, はじ（め・めて）, はつ]
raw_etymology:As per 刀 (cutting implement) + 衣 clothing → *begin* making a garment by cutting cloth (compare 裁) → *beginning* → *first*; *first time*; *naïve*. The pronunciation of the character has been influenced by 裁 (also meaning "cut cloth").
tags:[]

kanji:疎
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ]
kunyomi:[うと（い・ましい・む・んじる）]
raw_etymology:𤴔# a variant of 疋 (point in opposite directions) + 束 bundle → pair of piled objects, set at a distance from each other → *distant* → *shun*; *neglect* (← keep at a distance). Also, *ignorant* and *unfamiliar* (with) (← distant from one's knowledge or experience) as well as *disagreeable* (← unpleasant thing, kept at a distance). *Pass through* and *sparseness* are borrowed meanings via 疏.
tags:[]

Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.

___
kanji:子
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[こ]
raw_etymology:子 is the single remaining form of two distinct oracle bone depictions of a small child . One shows a small child, while the second shows a child with rapidly growing hair → *child*; *son*; *boy*; *person*; *suffix appended to small objects*. Conceptually, a child was understood as one of a figurative pile of offspring. *Rat* (as the first sign of the Chinese zodiac), *north*, and *11 P.M. to 1 A.M.* are borrowed meanings. The Old Chinese readings of the two glyphs featured different vowels.
tags:[]
___
kanji:絲
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:糸
shinjitai_stroke_count:6
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[いと]
raw_etymology:A depiction of piled threads → *thread* → *yarn*; (musical instrument) *string*; *line*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:思
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[おも（い・う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows that the top element was originally not 田 field but a depiction of a profusion of fine bones in fontanels, open spaces in an infant's skull over which the skull bones eventually fuse; compare 兒. 思 adds 心 heart/emotions → finely detailed thoughts → *think*; *consider*; *believe* → *be sunk in thought*. Compare 慮.
tags:[]
___
kanji:才
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of rocks piled to cut off/dam a river → *stop/cut off* → *a little*; *for the first time*. *Genius* and *ability* are borrowed meanings, as is (number of) *years old*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:才# cut off + 木 tree/wood → cut off a resource in felling a tree → *wood*; *(raw) material* → *ability* (← raw material of an individual's nature).

kanji:在
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ザイ]
kunyomi:[あ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 才# cut off + 土 earth → pile earth to cut off the flow of a river. *Be*, *exist*, *location*, *stay*, *be alive*, and *in* are extended meanings (← be fixed firmly in one place; compare 居, 有, and 存) → *country(side)* (← permanence of rural abodes).
tags:[]
___
kanji:栽
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 𢦏# combines 才 cut off + 戈 spear/halberd → cut; sever. 栽 adds 木 tree/wood → trim a tree in cultivating it → *cultivation*; *planting*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:裁
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[さば（く）, た（つ）]
raw_etymology:𢦏# as described in 栽 (cut; sever) + 衣 clothing → *cut cloth* in making clothes (compare 初) → *decide*; *judge* (← cut through to a decision ← cut). For these latter meanings, compare 決, 判, 折, and 斷.
tags:[]

kanji:磁

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 茲# (luxuriant growth) + 石 stone (→ mineral) → minerals rushing toward each other in a magnetic field → *magnetism* → *porcelain* (← use of such minerals in ceramic glaze). For porcelain, compare 瓷.
tags:[]

kanji:字
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ]
kunyomi:[あざ]
raw_etymology:子# child/offspring + 宀 roof/building → place in which to *raise* and increase the number of children* → *character* (← make one character after another by combining different elements) → *letter* → *small administrative unit* of a town/village (← small unit ← letter/character as one unit of a whole).
tags:[]

kanji:再
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[ふたた（び）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 冓 (symmetrical construction; symmetry) + an additional line (at the top) indicating "another of the same" → *(once) again*; *twice*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:史
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 又 hand/action indicator + an upright tube for holding slender, inscribed bamboo slats → an official raising a slender tube containing bamboo slats inscribed with records → *chronicle*; *annals*; *history* (← contents of matters recorded). Also, *record keeper*. Originally the same character as 事, but 史 and 事 came to bear divergent meanings (compare the same process in 句 and 局).
tags:[]
___
kanji:使
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[つか（い・う）]
raw_etymology:吏# official (n.) + 人 person → *messenger*/*envoy* dispatched on an *errand* or *mission* → *servant*; *work for* (another) → *use* (← make use of a functionary) → *make/force to do*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:事
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ]
kunyomi:[こと]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 又 hand/action indicator + an upright tube for holding slender, inscribed bamboo slats → an official raising a slender tube containing bamboo slats inscribed with records → *matter*; *affair*; *thing* (← matters recorded) → *job*; *work*; *serve*; *attend to* (← carry out official duties). Originally the same character as 史, but 事 and 史 came to bear divergent meanings (compare the same process in 句 and 局).
tags:[]
___
kanji:斯
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[か（く）]
raw_etymology:斤 ax + 其# (winnow) → *split* apart a winnow. *This*, *such* and *namely* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:徙
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:辵# movement (with the elements repositioned) + 止 (leg/foot → action indicator) → *move* to a different location → *relocate*; *reposition*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:猜
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:青# blue/green (→ bluish black; compare 鯖) + 犬 dog/beast → black dog, faintly visible → *doubt* (← faint veracity ← faintly visible) → *suspect* (v.) (← doubt a person's veracity). Also, *envy* and *jealousy* (← dark products of a suspicious mind).
tags:[]
___

kanji:甾
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element at top originally had a horizontal line drawn through it, as visible in the derivative character 湽. This element combined 才 (cut off) + the horizontal line for emphasis/clarification. The original form of 甾 added 田 field → cut weeds in a field and pile them, preparing for plowing. *Calamity* is a borrowed meaning, via 菑, with *evil* by extension.
tags:[]
___
kanji:菑
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ, サイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 甾# (cut weeds in a field) + 艸 grass/plant → field barren of both weeds and crops → *wasteland* → *disaster*; *calamity* (compare 災). 菑 was devised to replace 甾 after 甾 came to refer to "evil."
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 甾 (cut) + 水 water → cut pieces of fabric and dye them (*black*; compare 緇) → *dye black*.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:26
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[ふ（む）, わらぐつ]
raw_etymology:As per 麗# (neatly aligned) + 足 leg/foot → footwear aligned with the feet in being slipped over the toes (not covering the foot entirely) → *sandal*. The feet were then dragged over a surface in performing a dance; compare 屣.
tags:[]
___
kanji:釃
kanji_stroke_count:26
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ, リ]
kunyomi:[した（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 麗# (neatly aligned) + 酉 alcohol → neatly aligned trickles of alcohol trailing from a strainer (compare 湑) → *strain* or *pour* alcohol.
tags:[]
___
kanji:牸

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ, ジ]
kunyomi:[めうし, めす]
raw_etymology:As per 字# (produce numerous offspring) + 牛 cow → *female cow* (← producer of numerous offspring) → *female*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:屣
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[くつ]
raw_etymology:徙# relocate + 尸 shape indicator (here suggesting a shod foot/leg) → *footwear* that one drags across the floor or ground, as opposed to lifting with the foot with each step taken (compare 躧).
tags:[]
___
kanji:簁

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[とおし]
raw_etymology:徙# relocate + 竹 bamboo → relocate water by means of a (bamboo) *sieve* (compare 篩) → *sift* → *screen in selecting* (← sift out candidates).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 乍# (create a pile) + 阜 piled earth → earthen *steps* → *staircase* (particularly, one set to the east side of a structure for non-public use, and by extension to the imperial throne).

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 且# (pile) + 金 metal → *plow*; *hoe* (← piles of earth created in plowing/hoeing; compare 鎡 and 耤) → *eradicate* (← uproot in plowing/hoeing).
tags:[]

kanji:厝
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ, サク, ジャク, セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 昔# (pile) + 厂 cliff/shape indicator → pile of shavings created in engraving → *place atop* (← place a knife atop an object being engraved); *polish* (← polish by placing one object atop another) → *whetstone*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:癙
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ, ショ, ペスト]
kunyomi:[ぺすと（ペスト）]
raw_etymology:鼠# rat/mouse + 疒 illness → *phobia*; *morbid fear* (← rat-inspired dread). In Japan, and on account of its constituent elements, the character has also been specifically applied to plague/Black Death, a rat-borne disease.
tags:[]
___
kanji:顋
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[あぎと, あご, えら]
raw_etymology:As per 思# (fine) + 頁 head → *jaw*; *lower jaw* (← finely chisled, lower part of the face). *Gills* is a borrowed meaning via 鰓.
tags:[]
___
kanji:疋
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショ, ソ, ヒツ]
kunyomi:[ひき]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 足 leg/foot written in reverse, suggesting a pair of legs pointing in opposite directions → *leg*. *Counter* (for animals or bolts of cloth) and *unit of measurement* (for lengths of cloth) are borrowed meanings via 匹, which also supplies the ヒツ reading.
tags:[]
___
kanji:作
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サ, サク]
kunyomi:[つく（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 乍# (create a pile): → *work*, in the form of making a pile by chopping/cutting → *make*; *craft*; *change into*; *crop*. Compare 似. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]
___
kanji:昨
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 乍# (create a pile) + 日 sun/day → figurative pile of days (compare 昔 and 時) → *past*; *day/year before*. 昔 and 昨 likely were variants of each other that eventually diverged in usage.
tags:[]
___
kanji:析
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 木 tree/wood + an element# (possibly a variant of 乍, but now written as 斤 ax) indicating cutting or chopping → split/*divide* wood by chopping it → *analyze* (← figurative division of elements in analyzing).
tags:[]
___
kanji:索
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines the stalk of a hemp plant + fibers torn from the stalk → separate the slender fibers of a hemp plant and pile them up. 索 adds 糸# thread → the separate fibers of a *rope* or *cord* → *search (for)* (← separate in searching).
tags:[]
___
kanji:昔
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ, シャク]
kunyomi:[むかし]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 日 sun/day + a representation of one object layered on another → passage of days/time (likened to a figurative piling up; compare 昨 and 時) → *antiquity*; (previous) *night*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[か（り・りる）]
raw_etymology:As per 昔# (pile) + 人 person → person with piles of goods → *borrow*; *rent* (← receive money, goods etc. from such a person) → *debt*; *loan*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:惜
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[お（しい・しむ）]
raw_etymology:As per 昔# (pile) + 心 heart/emotions → negative feelings piled in the heart, in the form of *regret*, *disappointment*, lamentation etc. → *lament*; *reluctant* → (reluctant to) *spare/grudge*. Also, *cherish*, *hold/regard dear*, and *precious* (← be loathe to part with), as well as *pitiful* (← lament) and *wasteful* (← sparing/grudging).
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:As per 昔# (pile) + 金 metal → pile up layers of gold/silver in inlaying → *mix*; *intertwine* → *disorder*; *mistake* (← irregular layering).

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 耤# (pile) + 竹 bamboo → pile inscribed bamboo tablets for preservation → *register*; *document*; *book*; *write down*.

onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[かた]
raw_etymology:Variant# of 舃 (double/pile up) + 水 water → *tidelands*; *tidal flats* (where water laps upon itself) → *lagoon*.

kanji:席
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 庶 (pile) + 巾 cloth → pile seating mats on the ground/floor (for a feast) → *mat* → *rank*; *post*; *position*; *seat* (← determining the placement of one's seating mat). Also, *spread* (a mat) and *cushion*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:跡
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[あと]
raw_etymology:As per 亦# (slender line) + 足 leg/foot → trail of footprints (compare 迹) → *footprint*; *traces*; *tracks* → *mark*; *sign*; *site*. For "footprints," also compare 蹟, 踪 and 蹤.
tags:[]
___
kanji:責

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[せ（める）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 朿# (stab) + 貝 commodities → the torment of *debts* piled one atop another → *torture*; *condemn*; *censure*; *urge*; *drive up*; *demand*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 責# (pile) + 禾 grain/rice → pile crops → *pile/heap up*; *load*; *accumulate* → *area*; *bulk*; *store*; *save*; *savings* → *intention*; *expectation*; *estimation* (← accumulation of ideas).

kanji:績
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 責# (pile) + 糸 thread → *spin* or *intertwine* piled threads → *achievement* (← results of spinning). For the conceptual link between achievements and a pile, compare 勣.
tags:[]
___
kanji:策
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:朿# thorn + 竹 bamboo → sharp-pronged whip/stick for taming a horse. *Policy*, *plan*, (bamboo) *slat*, *record* and *document* are all borrowed meanings (for bamboo writing slats, compare 冊).
tags:[]
___
kanji:冊
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a profusion of slender, inscribed bamboo slats of irregular length, bound with a cord → *book*; *counter* (for books/magazines etc.) (← bamboo and wood as writing mediums). Note a variant form 册.
tags:[]
___
kanji:色
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショク, シキ]
kunyomi:[いろ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 巴# (spread) atop a second figure → two persons copulating → *sex*; *lover*; *mistress* → *looks*; *appearance* (← motive factors stimulating the sex drive) → *color* (← complexion ← appearance).
tags:[]
___
kanji:息
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[いき]
raw_etymology:As per 自# (nose) + 心 heart/emotions → breathe through the nostrils in rhythm with the beating of the heart → *breath* → *live* → *give birth*; *increase*. Also, *stop*; *rest* (← stops and starts of steady breathing); *interest* (← increase); *son* (← give birth).
tags:[]
___
kanji:則
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 鼎 tripod kettle/cauldron + a knife beside it for cutting food or other objects (compare 析). *Rule* and *law* are abstract, extended meanings (← abide by/*follow* norms closely ← be beside/in line with something) → *at once*; *if so*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:側
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[かわ, がわ]
raw_etymology:As per 則# (beside): → *side* → *move (toward)*; *lean*; *one of two facing sides* → *raise* (← raise the head so as to face another person directly). Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]

kanji:測

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[はか（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 則# (beside) + 水 water → place oneself beside a body of water to *measure* its depth → *predict*; *estimate*.

kanji:即
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 卩# (kneeling figure) immediately beside (or, depending on vantage point, opposite) a table piled high with food → *immediate* → *accession* (← draw into immediate proximity). *Namely* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:賊
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゾク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element is a variant# of 戎 (seize goods). 賊 adds 貝 commodities (for emphasis/clarification) → seize goods → *plunder*; *bandit*; *thief*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:塞
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク, サイ]
kunyomi:[せ（く）, ふさ（がる・ぐ）]
raw_etymology:土# pile of earth + the upper element of 寒 (pile construction elements in raising a shelter) → plug/fill holes in raising an earthen *fortress/fort* → *plug/dam up*; *stop (up)* → *fill*; *be filled*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:脊
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 肉 flesh with a representation# of a jagged *backbone* (compare 呂) → *back*; (a person's) *height*. Also, *ridge* (elevated in the middle, and depressed on the sides).
tags:[]
___
kanji:嗇
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 麥 barley/grain plus an element# depicting a granary → piles of barley/grain in a granary → *stingy*; *sparing*; *grudging* (← be reluctant to part with stored goods). Compare 貪.
tags:[]
___
kanji:仄
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[ほの（か・めかす・めく）]
raw_etymology:厂 here an abbreviated form# of 厝 (engrave) + 人 person (→ human agency) → angle a knife in engraving → *incline toward*; *lean*; *oblique*. Also, *faint* (adj.) (← obliquely visible ← oblique angle ← lean). *Shabby* and *base* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:亦
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク, エキ]
kunyomi:[また]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 大 stand outstretched + two marks indicating the two sides of the body → slender line of people standing outstretched → *also*; *again* (← one person after another); *armpit* (← sides of the body). Compare 胳 and 脇.
tags:[]
___
kanji:奕
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エキ, ヤク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 亦# (slender line) + 大 stand outstretched → slender line of people→ *stretch on*. 奕 was devised to replace 亦.
tags:[]
___
kanji:迹
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ, シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 亦# (slender line) + 辵 movement → trail of footprints (compare 跡) → *footprint*; *traces*; *tracks* → *mark*; *sign*; *site*. For "footprints," also compare 蹟, 踪 and 蹤.
tags:[]
___
kanji:耤
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク, セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 昔# (pile) + 耒 plow → create piles of earth in *plowing*. Compare 鎡 and 鉏.
tags:[]
___
kanji:藉
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャ, セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 耤# (pile) + 艸 grass/plant → pile mats of woven grass (compare 簀) → *mat*. Later, the term was applied to folding mats, *spread* out for the same purpose of creating a sitting surface. *Lend* is an extended meaning (← spread funds) → *borrow* (← receive spread funds). Also, *trample* (← trample grass to make an even sitting surface ← create a sitting surface). *Make excuses* and *pretext* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舃
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク, セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:鵲 combines 鳥 bird + 昔# for the sound alone to simulate cawing (compare 雅 and 烏) → a Korean magpie. 舃 is a variant form of 鵲 that eventually came to indicate a type of wide-mouthed and *double-soled shoe*, with the "pile" aspect of 昔 lending an atavistic influence (← one sole piled atop another). *Great/huge* and *dry beach/tidelands* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:朔
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:屰# reverse + 月 moon → moon reversing its course in completing its cycle → (astronomical) *conjunction* (← return, creating a conjunction of beginning and end points). Also, *first day of the (lunar) month*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:炸
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 乍# (create a pile) + 火 fire → *deep fry* numerous ingredients → *explode* (← crackle of hot oil used in deep frying).
tags:[]
___
kanji:窄
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[すぼ（む・める）, つぼ（む・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 乍# (pile) + 穴 hole → create a *narrow* opening in a pile → *make narrow*.
tags:[]

kanji:簀

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[す]
raw_etymology:As per 責# (pile) + 竹 bamboo → layered bamboo *mat* (compare 藉) → *screen*; *blind*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蹟
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ, シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 責# (pile) + 足 leg/foot → tread upon *footprints* in following one who has gone ahead, creating a figurative pile → *follow (a precedent/rule)*; *trace one's steps*. Also, *site* and *remains* (← vestiges; compare 跡 and 迹, as well as 踪 and 蹤).
tags:[]
___
kanji:柵
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[しがらみ]
raw_etymology:As per 冊# (bamboo slats) + 木 tree/wood → enclosing *fence* made of wooden/bamboo slats → *palisade*; *weir* → *obstacles*; *bondage*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:熄
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 息# (breathe) + 火 fire → breathe/blow upon a fire to *extinguish* it → *cease*; *perish*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廁
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ, ソク]
kunyomi:[かわや]
raw_etymology:As per 則# (beside) + 广 building → *toilet* beside a residence → *mingle* (← toilet used in common).
tags:[]

kanji:晰
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:析# divide + 日 sun/day → divide by making *clear* distinctions → *obvious*. It is also possible that 晰 was devised as a variant form of 皙 white, with clarity likened to bright sunlight.
tags:[]

___
kanji:畟
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The top element# combines 田 here an abbreviated form of 甾 (cut weeds in a field) + 儿 person (→ human agency) → prepare a field for plowing. 畟 adds 夂 leg/foot pointed downward (→ drag) → create piles of soil in dragging a *plow*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:稷
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショク]
kunyomi:[きび]
raw_etymology:As per 畟# (pile) + 禾 grain/rice → piles of grain → *millet*. 稷 also has been used as a reference to a grain deity; note a variant form 禝 with 示 altar/the supernatural replacing 禾.
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[あい]
raw_etymology:目 here an abbreviated form# of 省 (observe) + 木 tree/wood → eyes focused on an object (establishing a *mutual* relation between observer and observed) → *together*; *watch*; *assist*; *assistant*; *shape*; *appearance* → (grammatical) *voice*; *emphatic verbal prefix*. Also, *minister* (← one who assists a ruler).

kanji:將

shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 丬/爿# (long and slender) + an element combining 肉 flesh and 寸 hand/action indicator → long, slender finger extended to prod others forward → *lead*; *command* (← point/lead the way with a finger or with a long, thin object: compare 指) → *hold an object in the hand*; *deal with*; *carry out*; *take*; *by means of* → *be about to* (← hold an object in the hand and set it in place in preparation for the next action).
tags:[]

kanji:床
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[とこ, ゆか]
raw_etymology:广 here a variant of 爿# long, wooden sleeping pallet + 木 tree/wood → *bed* ( compare 牀) → *floor*; *stool* (← things on which it is possible to sleep) → *ground*; *stratum* (← "bed" in figurative senses); *alcove* (← shelf board shaped like a bed/sleeping pallet) → *barber* (← stool on which a customer sits while having his hair cut). *Tasteful* and *elegant* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:青
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[あお, あお（い）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 生# (fresh grass shoots) + 井/丼 (pure well water) → grass that is fresh, clean and pure → *green*; *blue* → *youth*; *immaturity*. In dual-element characters, 青 may also appear in the form 靑.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ, セイ]
kunyomi:[なさ（け）]
raw_etymology:As per 青# (clean/pure) + 心 heart/emotions → pure emotion, in the form of *compassion*, *sympathy*, *pity* or *charity* → *truth*; *circumstances* (← true feelings expressing a situation exactly as it is).
tags:[]
___
kanji:清
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ショウ, シン]
kunyomi:[きよ（い・まる・める・らか）]
raw_etymology:As per 青# (clean/pure) + 水 water → *pure* water → *clear*; *clean*; *purify*. *Cool* is a borrowed meaning. The reading シン refers to the Manchu Dynasty (1644-1911). Note the variant form 淸.
tags:[]

kanji:請

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kanji:生
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, セイ]
kunyomi:[い（かす・きる・ける）, う（まれる・む）, お（う）, き, なま, は（える・やす）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 艸 grass/plant + 土 earth → fresh, slender grass shoots → *birth*; *life* → *new*; *fresh*; *sprout*; *raw*; *alive*; *by nature*; *youth*; *unripe*; *pure*; *bear fruit*; *spare a life*; *bring back to life*; *make use of*; *make a living*; *be/remain valid*; *arrange flowers/plants*; *grow*; *undiluted*.

kanji:牲
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:生# birth; life + 牛 cow → sacrificial cow offered for the renewal of life → *sacrifice*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:星
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[ほし]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 晶# (brightness) + 生 (fresh) → fresh, bright, invigorating starlight → *star*. 星 is a scribal form simplification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:省
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[かえり（みる）, はぶ（く）]
raw_etymology:目 eye + 少 here a variant of 生# (slender grass shoots) → narrow the eyes in observing (compare 睜) → *inspect minutely* → *ponder*; *inquire*; *confirm*. *Reduce* and *omit* are borrowed meanings → *governmental office*; *unit of an administrative district* (← local authority of reduced/lesser power ← centralized power of the ruler).
tags:[]
___
kanji:增
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:増
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[ゾウ]
kunyomi:[ふ（える・やす）, ま（さる・し・す）]
raw_etymology:As per 曾# (pile) + 土 earth → pile earth → *pile up*; *add (to)*; *increase*; *gain*; *multiply* → *breed*; *extra*; *increasingly*; *more and more*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:層
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:層
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 尸 shape indicator suggesting the upper part of a building (a roof or a drop curtain/banner) → *house with multiple layers of roofing* → *layer* → *pile up*; *stratum*; *class*; *counter* (for stories of buildings).
tags:[]
___
kanji:憎
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:憎
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[ゾウ]
kunyomi:[にく（い・がる・しみ・む・らしい）]
raw_etymology:Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 心 heart/emotions → emotions that pile upon each other, in the form of hatred, detestation etc. → *hate*; *detest*; *loathe* → *animosity*; *be jealous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:贈

shinjitai:贈
shinjitai_stroke_count:18
onyomi:[ゾウ]
kunyomi:[おく（る）]
raw_etymology:Originally as per 曾# (pile) + 貝 commodities → a pile of gifts/offerings → *give/present*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爿
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long and slender, wooden sleeping pallet → *long, wooden sleeping pallet* (compare 片) → *piece of wood*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爽
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[さわ（やか）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 大 stand outstretched + an X on both sides of the chest# → clear the heart and body of impurities → *clear*; *refreshing* (compare 清 and 淨). Later, each of the X marks was replaced by 井 well, with the present form in turn replacing the 井 elements with 爻.
tags:[]
___
kanji:庄
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A simplified, variant form of 莊 storage barn → *farmhouse* → *manor* → *village*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:曾
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ, ソウ, ゾウ]
kunyomi:[かつ（て）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a cooking pot with a steaming basket atop, from which slender wisps of steam arise and figuratively pile upon each other → *once*; *before*; *at one time*; *formerly* (← prior ← prior wisp of steam).
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 艸 grass/plant → piled, freshly cut grass → *green*; *blue* (← deep color of freshly cut grass) → *pale* (← stored, faded grass).
tags:[]
___
kanji:槍
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[やり]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 木 tree/wood → wooden weapon with multiple (= a pile of) heads (compare 矠) → *spear*; *javelin*; *lance*. Compare also 鎗.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[かさ, くさ]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 疒 illness → *swelling*, *tumor*, *boil* or *scab* piled on the skin. Compare 疽 and 疵.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[やり]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 金 metal → metallic weapon with multiple (= a pile of) heads (compare 矠) → *spear*; *javelin*; *lance*. Compare also 槍, as well as the made-in-Japan character 鑓.
tags:[]

kanji:漿
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 將# (long and slender) + 水 water → liquid poured in a long, slender trail (compare 醬) → (thick) *liquid substance* → *general term for drinks*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:丼
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 井 well, the mark in the middle indicating water → *sound* made by an object striking the (water at the) bottom of a well. In Japan, 丼 came to be reinterpreted as a serving vessel filled with rice (どんぶり = a bowl of rice topped with vegetables, seafood and/or meat).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:井# well + 穴 hole → *pit* in which to *trap* animals.
tags:[]

kanji:靖

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:青 here an abbreviated form# of 靜 calm/peaceful + 立 stand → stand still/at ease → *tranquil*; *at ease*; *peaceful*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蜻
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 靑/青# (clean/pure) + 虫 insect. The compound 蜻蛚 refers to a cricket (insect that produces a clean, strong calling sound), while 蜻蛉 is a dragonfly (with transparent wings).
tags:[]
___
kanji:錆
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[さび, さび（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 靑/青# (clean/pure) + 金 metal → clean(-colored) ore. *Rust*, *tarnish* and *become rusty/tarnished* are via a Japanese reinterpretation of this character (← metal turned bluish-black with time; compare 猜 and 鯖).
tags:[]
___
kanji:鯖
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[さば]
raw_etymology:靑/青# blue/green (→ bluish black; compare 猜 and 錆) + 魚 fish → variety of *mackerel* the back of which is bluish-black.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ, セイ]
kunyomi:[とろ]
raw_etymology:靜# calm; peaceful + 水 water → calm *pool* (in a river) → *pure*; *clean* (← still, limpid water).
tags:[]
___
kanji:蔬
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:疏# pass through + 艸 grass/plant → plant with loosely bunched shoots, allowing the passage of air and water. The compound 蔬菜 refers to vegetables or greens in general.
tags:[]
___
kanji:牀
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:爿# long, wooden sleeping pallet + 木 tree/wood → (long and thin) wooden *bed* → wooden *stand*, *chair* or *couch*. Also, *wood floor*. Compare 床. Logically, the classifier for 牀 should be 木, but it is traditionally given as 爿.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 嗇# (granary) + 爿 long, wooden sleeping pallet (→ long, wooden object) → long wooden *fence* extending around a granary → *hedge*; *wall*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 牆 (extend) + 艸 grass/plant → long-stemmed plant. The compound 薔薇 indicates a rose.
tags:[]

kanji:檣
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[ほばしら]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 牆 (extend) + 木 tree/wood → *mast*. The connection with boats is more evident in the variant form 艢, which substitutes 舟 boat for 木.
tags:[]

kanji:猩

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 星# (bright) + 犬 dog/beast → imaginary animal with a bald, shiny pate and human-like face, for which (a particular species of) *orangutan* may or may not have been the original inspiration.
tags:[]

kanji:甥
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, セイ]
kunyomi:[おい]
raw_etymology:生# birth; life + 男 man/male → male child (born to a sister), i.e. *nephew*. Also, *son-in-law* (adopted into a family). In Japanese, 甥 indicates the male child of a brother as well.
tags:[]

kanji:甑
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[こしき]
raw_etymology:As per 曾# (steaming pot) + 瓦 tile/earthenware → earthenware *rice steaming pot*. 甑 was devised to replace 曾 after 曾 acquired its extended meanings.

kanji:搶

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 手 hand/action indicator → pile plundered goods → *plunder*. Compare 贓. *Thrust/poke* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:滄
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:倉 here an abbreviated form# of 蒼 green/blue + 水 water → pure (blue) water (compare 清 and 淨) → *blue*; (dark) *green*. Also, *ocean* (← blue water) and *cold* (← pure, cold water).
tags:[]
___
kanji:蹌
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 倉# (pile) + 足 leg/foot → *move* (rapidly), piling up the number of steps taken. *Stagger* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廂
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[ひさし]
raw_etymology:相# mutual + 广 building → (rooms in a) *wing*, aligned with those opposite → *side room*. In Japan, the character also refers to an (overhang attached to) *eaves*. It also indicates a *passageway*, generally under the eaves (or extension of the eaves) of the main roof, that partially or completely encloses the main part of a building.
tags:[]
___
kanji:孀
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[やもめ]
raw_etymology:As per 霜# (facing pillars) + 女 woman → *widow* (likened to one in a pair of pillars left standing).
tags:[]
___
kanji:倩
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン, セイ]
kunyomi:[つらつら]
raw_etymology:As per 靑/青# (clean/pure) + 人 person → *male of fine character* → *son-in-law*. Also, *beautifully formed mouth* (displayed when smiling/laughing). *Attentive(ly)* and *careful(ly)* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:旌

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[あら（わす）, はた]
raw_etymology:生# (fresh) + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → *pennant* composed of a string of vivid (= freshly colored) feathers → *make clear/evident* (someone's meritorious deeds) → *express*.

kanji:圊

kanji:湘
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:相# mutual + 水 water → name of a river in present-day *Hunan Province*. Legend had it that the river was protected by a pair of goddesses.
tags:[]

kanji:醬
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 將# (long and slender) + 酉 alcohol container → fermented, viscous liquid that forms a long, slender trail when poured → (viscous) *sauce*; *sticky/gooey food*. The compound 醬油 indicates soy sauce. 醤 is a variant form.
tags:[]
___
kanji:曽
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ, ゾ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 曾 (*once*; *before*; *at one time*; *formerly*).
tags:[]
___
kanji:漸
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 斬# (cut) + 水 water → partially cut the flow of water (compare 澀/渋 and 減) penetrating a crevice (compare 浸) → *gradual* (← partial/gradual cut) → *gradually*.
tags:[]

kanji:三
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[み, み（つ・っつ）]
raw_etymology:Three slender lines = *three*. In Chinese, "three" often suggests a group, or many; compare this sense in the cognate terms 參 and 森.
tags:[]
___
kanji:杉
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン, セン]
kunyomi:[すぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 彡# (hair-like pattern) + 木 tree/wood → tree with needle-like leaves → *cryptomeria*; *Japanese cedar*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:參
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:参
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[まい（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 彡# (hair fully layered over the head) + a depiction of a young woman with three slender hairpins thrust deep into and commingling with her hair (compare 潛 and 妻) → *three* → *join*; *mix*; *meet* (← groups of three people commingling in coming, going or visiting ← three pins commingled in the hair) → *come*; *go*; *visit*; *obey*. As with 壱, 弐, and 拾, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 三) in documents as a precaution against forgery.
tags:[]
___
kanji:慘
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:惨
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[サン, ザン]
kunyomi:[みじ（め）]
raw_etymology:As per 參# (commingle) + 心 heart/emotions → mixed, painful emotions → *pain*; *misery*; *piteous*; *wretched*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:森
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[もり]
raw_etymology:林# forest + 木 tree/wood →　dense growth of slender trees encompassing a settlement, sacred place etc. → *forest*; *woods*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:侵
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[おか（す）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is a variant of the right-hand element as described in 探 (penetrate). 侵 adds 人 person (→ human agency) → penetrate enemy territory in invading → *invade*; *violate*; *infringe* (on). Also, *seep in* (compare 浸).
tags:[]
___
kanji:浸
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[ひた（す・る）]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# of 侵 (penetrate) + 水 water → water that penetrates thoroughly → *immersion*; *soak*; *flood*; *steep*; *moisten*; *wet*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:寢
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:寝
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[ね（かす・る）]
raw_etymology:The addition of 宀 roof/building to 侵 (deep) indicated a room crammed deep into the corner of a house. 寢 combines an abbreviated form# of this element + 爿 long, wooden sleeping pallet → *lie down*/*sleep* in a *back/inner room* → *lay down*; *go to bed*. Also, *leave* (unused).
tags:[]
___
kanji:心
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[こころ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a slender object encompassed in the *heart* of another object → *mind*; *breast*; *center*; *core*; *thought*; *consideration*; *meaning*; *taste*; *spirit*; *sincerity*; *emotion*; *feelings*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:潛
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:潜
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[ひそ（まる・む・める）, もぐ（る）]
raw_etymology:朁# is 兓 deep penetration + 曰 say/speech indicator → utterance that penetrates deeply. 潛 adds 水 water → penetrate deep into water in diving/submerging → *dive/submerge* → *lurk*; *hide* (← lie in wait in deep concealment) → *conceal*; *secret*; *latent*. Also, *hush*, *lower one's voice*, and *get/crawl into* (becoming hidden). Note that there is no etymological relation between the Shinjitai 潜 and the character 替.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蚕
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[かいこ]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 忝 attach + 虫 insect/creature → earthworm(s) attached to the ground by setae (bristles). However, 蚕 has been used as an abbreviated form of 蠶 since the Tang Dynasty.蠶 is as per 朁 as described in 潛 (deep penetration) + 虫 insect/creature (doubled) → *silkworm* (deeply ensconced in a cocoon).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of fine strands of hair, deeply rooted in the scalp they cover → *pattern* (← the pattern of hair on a scalp).
tags:[]

kanji:韱
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element minus 韭 combines 从, a variant form of 從 (people in close formation) + 戈 spear/halberd → use the tip of a long, slender weapon in prodding a line of captives to keep moving. To this element# (long and slender), 韱 adds 韭 leek → tall and slender/fine *leek* or *wild scallion* (compare 葱).

kanji:錢

onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[ぜに]
raw_etymology:As per 戔# (fine/slight) + 金 metal → small/fine pieces of metal → coinage → *money*; *change*; (type of) *unit of money*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:線
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:綫 is per 戔# (fine/slight) + 糸 thread → fine *thread*. 線 is a variant form with the same core meaning as 綫 but with the associated nuance of "slender line" → *line* → *clue*; *lead*. In 線, 戔 is replaced by 泉.
tags:[]
___
kanji:産
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[うぶ, う（まれる・む）]
raw_etymology:生# birth; life + an abbreviated form of 彦 (handsome/well-formed) → well-formed offspring/product → *produce*; *production*; *childbirth*; *local product/material*. Also, *one's birthplace*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:散
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[ち（らかす・らかる・らす・らばる・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 散 to be a variant of a character that is 𣏟 as described in 麻 (hemp) + an element combining 肉 flesh and 攴 action indicator → shred and *scatter* vegetable matter or flesh → *resolve*; *remove*; *pointless*. For the idea of shredding or stripping away, and for the graphical evolution of 散 as well, compare the remnant element above 食 in 餐.
tags:[]
___
kanji:傘
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[かさ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a slender *umbrella* with adhering raindrops → *parasol*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:前
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼン]
kunyomi:[まえ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the element# minus 刀 combines an abbreviated form of 船 boat + 止 (leg/foot) → progression of boats or of people on foot. The addition of 刀 sword/knife suggests the idea of cutting/shearing in small increments → *forward progress* in small increments (compare 先 and 踐) → *before*; *in front* (← immediately behind/in front of one). In derivative characters, 前 is often written in the form seen for example in 揃 and 湔.
tags:[]
___
kanji:薦
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[すす（め・める）]
raw_etymology:廌 here a variant of 塵# (advancing herd of deer) + 艸 grass/plant → herd of deer grazing as it advances → advance to present an offering → *urge*; *recommend* (← urge another to advance).
tags:[]
___
kanji:辛
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[から（い）, かろ（うじて）, つら（い）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a needle or a *sharp* knife/cutting tool, one adhering to or in close proximity to the object it is about to cut → *bitter*; *spicy*; *harsh*; *pungent* → *mustard*; *tough*; *painful*; *barely*. *Eighth in a series* and *eighth calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:新
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[あたら（しい）, あら（た）, にい]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element# is an abbreviated form of one combining 辛 needle/cutting tool and 木 tree/wood → thornbush (the sharp, needle-like thorns in close proximity). 新 adds 斤 ax → create firewood by chopping a thornbush/tree with a sharp ax. *New* is an extended meaning (← freshly hewn tree/wood) → *recently/lately*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:薪
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[たきぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 新# (firewood) + 艸 grass/plant → *firewood*. 薪 was devised to replace 新 after 新 acquired the meaning "new."
tags:[]
___
kanji:親
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[おや, した（しい・しむ）]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element# as described in 新 (sharp, and in close proximity) + 見 see; watch → observe others sharply → *parent*; *relative*; *intimate* (← be in a close relationship and receive direct stimulus); *group leader*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盡

shinjitai:尽

onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[つ（かす・きる・くす）]
raw_etymology:皿 dish/plate/bowl + an element# representing liquid dripping from a brush → ink dripping from a brush into a bowl → *use up*; *exhaust*; *run out of* (← use up the last of one's ink) → *give one's utmost*; *devote oneself to*; *be an extreme of*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:贊
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:賛
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:兟# is 先 (advance in small increments) doubled → group advancing in small increments. 贊 adds 貝 commodities → collect/accumulate presents from supporters in small increments → *support* → *praise* (← verbal support) → *panegyric*; *eulogy*; *inscription*; *dedication*. There is no etymological connection between the Shinjitai 賛 and 替.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遷
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# is combines 1) two pairs of hands about a skull with openings at top (the fontanels described in the entries for 兒 and 思) and 2) a kneeling figure + 廾 (pair of hands) → soul departing the body (through the head) as a result of magical or ascetic practices. 遷 adds 辵 movement → depart and *transfer*/*shift* one's location → *change*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:山
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サン]
kunyomi:[やま]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *mountain* with sharp ridges in close proximity → *mound*; *heap*. *Temple* and *mine* are on account of such facilities often being situated in mountains.
tags:[]
___
kanji:仙
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An earlier form of 仙 is 僊, which is the right-hand element# as described in 遷 (soul departing from the body) + 人 person → *wizard* or *hermit* attaining transformation via separation of soul and body. In 仙, this element is replaced by the cognate 山.
tags:[]
___
kanji:千
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[ち]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 人person with a line drawn at the shin to indicate a person progressing in small increments through luxuriant vegetation (compare 年 and 延) → *one thousand* (← number reached by counting on and on). It is unclear whether it is 人 or the line element acting as the phonosemantic element.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:卂 depicts slender birds flying in tight formation (compare 進). 迅 is 卂# + 辵 movement → *swift* movement.

tags:[]
___
kanji:晋
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form depicts two arrows plus a target, suggesting the firing (and thereby the insertion) of slender arrows into a target → *proceed*; *advance* (← forward motion). Distinguish 晋 from 普. Also, note a variant form 晉, which preserves the visual connection with 至 (arrow) more closely than does 晋, and which appears in derivative characters such as 搢 and 戩.
tags:[]

kanji:剪
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[はさ（む）]
raw_etymology:As per 前# (cut/shear in small increments) + 刀 sword/knife → shears used to *cut* closely → *clip*; *shear*; *trim*. 剪, like 揃, was devised to replace 前 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:揃
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[そろ（い・う・える）]
raw_etymology:As per 前# (cut/shear in small increments) + 手 hand/action indicator → *shear*, then *arrange* objects neatly, in close adherence → a *set/unit*; *all*; *line up*; *make objects uniform*; suffix suggesting *every one of*. 揃, like 剪, was devised to replace 前 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:阡

tags:[]
___
kanji:孱
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン, サン]
kunyomi:[よわ（い）]
raw_etymology:孖 is 子 child (doubled) → twins. 孨 combines 孖 and 子 → many small (and weak) children. In 孱, which adds 尸 (body), 孨 acts as a variant form of 孫 (small child) → *small* of body → *weak*; *frail* → *weaken*.
tags:[]

kanji:濺
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[そそ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 賤# (slight amount) + 水 water → *sprinkle/splash on* or *spray* (a slight amount of water) → *pour*.

kanji:莘
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[みらのねぐさ]
raw_etymology:辛# bitter + 艸 grass/plant → plant with a sharp flavor (in Chinese, often specified as wild ginger) . *Long (and thin)* and *numerous* are associated meanings based on characteristics of the plant in question, such as long racemes and numerous plant hairs on the stem or elsewhere.

kanji:集
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[あつ（まる・める）, つど（う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 隹 short, squat bird (tripled) above 木 tree/wood → birds assembled in a tree, pressed tightly together (compare 喿 as described in 操) → *assemble*; *gather*; *collect* → *stay*; *remain*; *reach* (a situation); *achieve*; *poem collection*. The present form uses a single 隹.
tags:[]
___
kanji:雜
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:雑
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[ザツ, ゾウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:集# assemble (with 木 repositioned) + what was originally 衣 clothing → assemble various rags into garments → *miscellaneous*; *mix(ture)*. With regard to the 衣 element, note a variant form 襍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:澀
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:渋
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ジュウ]
kunyomi:[しぶ, しぶ（い・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of 歰 shows that the doubled element on top was originally inverted feet, so that the character featured two feet pointing downward + two feet pointing upward → tangling of legs → be stopped. 澀 adds 水 water → liquid that does not flow, but seeps (compare 漸) → *proceed haltingly* → *astringency* (← tongue rendered numb by the deep penetration of astringent juices; compare 浸) → *sober*. Also, *be unwilling/reluctant*, *austere*, *quiet* and *stingy*. 歮 is a variant form of 歰, and 澁 a variant form of 澀. In contemporary Japanese orthography, 澀/澁 is written 渋.
tags:[]
___
kanji:妾
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[めかけ]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 辛 needle/cutting tool + 女 woman → female slave (tattooed with a needle) employed as a *concubine* → *mistress*; *lady-in-waiting*. For the connection between tattoos and slaves, compare 隷. In derivative characters, 妾 conveys the idea of being in close proximity, as in when having sex with a concubine.
tags:[]
___
kanji:帀
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 之 (forward motion) written in reverse. 帀 therefore suggests feet pressing on the ground in stamping or in marching back and forth (compare 踏) → *circulate* (← return to one's starting point).
tags:[]
___
kanji:臿
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:臼 mortar + a slender chisel (not 干 forked stick or thick bar) → slender, chisel-like stick pressed/inserted into a mortar in separating grain from husk → *insert*; *break into*; *separate grain from husk*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[はや（す）]
raw_etymology:雜# miscellaneous + 口 mouth → miscellaneous voices → *jeer*; *banter*. Also, *accompany* and *musical accompaniment* (← loud accompanying voices).
tags:[]
___
kanji:葺
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[ふ（く）]
raw_etymology:咠# is 口 mouth + 耳 ear, here an abbreviated form of 囁 (press together) → (figuratively or actually) press one's mouth to another person's ear in whispering. To 咠 (press) 葺 adds 艸 grass/plant → *thatch* a roof with grasses, reeds etc. by pressing them together (compare 蒹)→ *repair*; *cover*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[かじ]
raw_etymology:As per 咠# as described in 葺 (press) + 木 tree/wood → set of *oars/paddles* (pressed in the hands when rowing) → *row* (a boat).
tags:[]
___
kanji:輯
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 咠# as described in 葺 (press) + 車 vehicle → press gathered objects into a transport vehicle → *gather* → *arrange*; *put into order* (← harmonious arrangement; compare 燮). *Soften*, *calm* and *gentle* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:倢
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:疌# was originally 屮 grass shoot + an element# combining 叉 (stab at) and 足 (compress) → nimbly pluck grass shoots by compressing the fingertips. 倢 adds 人 person (→ human agency) → nimbly pluck grass shoots → *nimble*; *quickly*; *astute*.

kanji:燮
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[やわ（らげる）]
raw_etymology:The top element is a variant of 䜌 as described in 戀 (tangled), replacing the dual 糸 thread elements with 火 fire, suggesting an attempt to control a blaze, conceived of as a tangled situation involving fire. 燮 adds 又 hand/action indicator → temper a fire → *adjust*; *control*; *harmonize*. For the idea of harmonious adjustment/arrangement, compare 輯.
tags:[]

kanji:佐
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 左# (assist): → *assist*. Here, 人 has no semantic function, being used simply to create a derivative character conveying meanings that dropped from the original one.
tags:[]
___
kanji:差
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サ]
kunyomi:[さ（し・す）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines 左# (aligned at an angle) + a rice plant → rice plants in irregular alignment → *inconsistent*; *difference* (← irregular) → *dispatch* (← send forth ← protrude) → *thrust*; *offer* (← dispatch). The verb さす bears many extended senses from the idea of "thrust," including *extend*; *stretch*; *insert*; *raise* (the hands); *put up*; *carry*; *hold*; and *wear*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:砂
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サ, シャ]
kunyomi:[すな]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 沙 sand + 石 stone → small stones, in the form of gravel/*sand* or *fine* stone particles.
tags:[]
___
kanji:次
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジ, シ]
kunyomi:[つ（いで）, つぎ, つぎ（に）, つ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 二# (align) + 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure → bend/kneel in aligning small objects → *order*; *sequence* (← place things in precise order) → *next*; *follow*; *after that*; *counter* (for times/matters). In dual-element characters 次 is sometimes written in the form seen for example in 恣.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[すがた]
raw_etymology:As per 次# (align) + 女 woman → woman preoccupied with aligning/arranging her wardrobe → *appearance*; *figure*; *form*; *shape*.

kanji:諮

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[はか（る）]
raw_etymology:咨# inquire + 言 words (for emphasis/clarification) → *consult*; *confer*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:齊
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:斉
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 齊 shows three slender, diamond-shaped objects arranged/aligned neatly. A bronzeware inscription form adds 二# (align), while a seal inscription form transforms 二 into a board (or a piece of cloth; in either case acting to represent things in general; compare 牛 in 物, and 半) → *equality*; *arrange*; *neater*; *all together* (← match up/align).
tags:[]
___
kanji:劑
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:剤
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ザイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 齊# (align) + 刀 sword/knife → align cut pieces of bark and plant roots for medicinal use → *medicine*; *drug*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:濟
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:済
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[サイ, セイ]
kunyomi:[す（ます・む）]
raw_etymology:As per 齊# (align) + 水 water → goods in alignment on opposite sides of a river → *ferry* (across); *cross* (a river); *pass safely* → *relieve*; *aid*; *help* (← ferry material aid) → *manage* (to do/with); *finish*; *be over/at an end* → *economic management*; *settle an account*; *pay* → *settle* (a matter). Also, *do without* (← manage to do without) and *adjust*.
tags:[]

kanji:齋
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:斎
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 齊# (align) + 示 altar/the supernatural → align body and spirit through fasting and other purification methods → *purification* → *room* (for abstinence, training or study).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 此# (irregular) + 糸 thread → fabric dyed *purple/violet*, an irregular color (a mix of red and blue).

kanji:雌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[め, めす]
raw_etymology:As per 此# (line up irregularly) + 隹 short, squat bird → feathers irregularly spread over the rear end of a *female* bird.
tags:[]
___
kanji:姉
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[あね]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# shows it to be a depiction of three ears of a plant in irregular alignment. The addition of 女 woman indicated the eldest among female siblings of various heights → *elder sister* → *respectful, friendly term for a woman older than oneself*. There is no etymological connection between this element and the independent character 市.
tags:[]
___
kanji:妻
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ]
kunyomi:[つま]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 又 hand/action indicator + a woman wearing a comb-like hairpin with aligned teeth (compare 參) → woman performing housework (compare 婦) → *wife* (conceived of as a person figuratively aligned with her spouse; compare 妃).
tags:[]
___
kanji:師
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 帀# (march) + an abbreviated form of 追 pursue an enemy army → lead (marching) soldiers → *army*. *Teacher* is a borrowed meaning (compare 帥) → *study under*; *boss*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:婿
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[むこ]
raw_etymology:As per 胥# (separate) + 女 woman → male separated from his own family in marrying into another → *son-in-law*; *bridegroom*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:西
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ, セイ]
kunyomi:[にし]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a nest in which chicks are neatly aligned. *West* is either a borrowed or an extended meaning; in the latter case the idea might be that of the reddish sun aligned with the horizon at sunset. (For "reddish," compare 茜.) By further extension is *the Pure Land*, Buddhism having entered China from lands west.
tags:[]
___
kanji:死

raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 比 line up (people) + 歹 severed bone/death → a line of corpses → *death* → *die*; *execute*.
tags:[]

kanji:私
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[わたくし, わたし]
raw_etymology:厶# possession + 禾 grain/rice → divide harvested crops and take possession of one's own share → *self*; *private*; *first person pronoun* → *selfishness*; *family*; *private ownership*; *secret*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:肆
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 隶# seize + 镸/長 long → align objects that have been seized/obtained → *line up horizontally*; *shop/store*; *extend in length*. *Relax*, *do as one pleases*, *four* (used in documents as a precaution against forgery) and *therefore* are borrowed meanings. In the present form, 隶 is replaced by 聿.
tags:[]
___
kanji:叉
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サ, シャ]
kunyomi:[また]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 爪 (pick/pluck) + an object → stab at an object with a forked implement to *catch* or *sandwich* it → *fork* (in the road); (Edo-era) *Y-shaped weapon for apprehending criminals*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:犀
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サイ, セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 尸# body + 辛 needle/cutting tool → slow, lumbering, horned animal → dual-horned species of *rhinoceros* (← horns in alignment). Later, the character came to be written as 牛 cow + 尾 tail.
tags:[]

___
kanji:此
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[こ（の・れ）]
raw_etymology:止 (leg/foot) + an abbreviated form# of 比 (line up) → legs/feet lined up irregularly. *This/these* (*here*) and (in) *this way* are borrowed meanings. As an independent character, 此 is regarded to consist of six strokes, but five when used as an element in a dual-element character (compare the treatment of stroke counts in 臣). 
tags:[]
___
