shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨク]
kunyomi:[つばさ]
raw_etymology:As per 異# (raise) + 羽 feather/wing → pair of wings, raised high → *wing*.

___
kanji:翌
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Variant form of 昱 (bright sunlight), the adoption of 羽 suggesting bright sunlight accompanying the rising sun at daybreak or dawn via the "wings standing high" → rise aspect of 翊 → (the) *next* (day); (the) *following* (day); *tomorrow*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:彳
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テキ]
kunyomi:[]

kanji:橐
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element minus 束 originally combined 石 (substantial) + 囗 circular enclosure → substantial goods contained in an enclosure. The addition of 束 bundle to an abbreviated form# of this element suggests the substantial contents of a *sack*, open at both ends, placed horizontally in a wooden frame. The character also conveys a minor meaning of *bellows*.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 翊 (rise) + 日 sun/day → *bright light* given off by the rising sun. *The next/following day* is a borrowed meaning via 翌.

kanji:傷
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[いた（む・める）, きず]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# combines 昜 rise + 𠂉 a variant of 人 person → raise the hand and strike another person → *injure* → *injury*; *wound* → *damage*; *harm*; *spoil*; *bruise*; *scratch* → *flaw*; *fault*. 人 was later appended for emphasis/clarification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:唐
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[から]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 史 (raise) + 口 mouth → actually or figuratively raise the mouth in boasting, or in exaggerating. *Tang* (China) and *China* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:糖
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 唐# (rise) + 米 rice (here suggesting sugar cane, a plant similar in shape to a rice stalk) → boil sugar cane (similar in shape to a rice stalk), causing steam to rise → *sugar*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:尚
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is as per 向# (be compressed through a window or hole) + 八 split right and left → rising air that disperses through windows or ventilation holes set off to right and left → *respect* (← look up to ← rise); *besides* (above and beyond). In derivative characters, 尚 may appear in the form seen for example in 倘, 徜 and 敞.
tags:[]
___

kanji:當
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:当
shinjitai_stroke_count:6
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[あ（たり・たる・て・てる）]
raw_etymology:As per 尚# (disperse) + 田 field → disburse (= disperse) an amount of money fitting the value of a field → *fit." "Fit (together)" has produced a slew of extended meanings, including *be on the mark*, *face*, *hit*, *aim*, *purpose*, *expectation*, *guess*, *object*, *put/place against*, *pawn* and *deserve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:賞
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 尚# (disperse) + 貝 commodities → disburse (= disperse) a *reward* → *prize* → *praise*; *appreciation*.
tags:[]

kanji:償
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[つぐな（い・う）]
raw_etymology:賞# bestow; reward + 人 person (→ human agency) → bestow compensation → *compensate*; *indemnify* (a person) → *reparation*; *atonement*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:上
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ]
kunyomi:[あ（がり・がる・げる）, うえ, うわ, かみ, の, ぼ（せる・り・る）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of one line above another, suggesting the idea of rising *above* (contrast 下) → *up*; *upper*; *top* → *rise*; *raise*; *offer*. Other extended meanings include *ascent*; *readiness*; *completion*; *just after*; *go up*; *climb*; *enter*; *end*; *increase*; *improve*; *on*; *beyond*; *first* (half); *emperor*; *raise/bring up* (a matter); *record*; *upward* (bound); *go to the capital*; and *reach*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:章
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is 辛 needle/cutting tool + an element# combining a crossing mark and a circle (= a particular pattern) → *mark*/tattoo a slave using a sharp instrument (compare 艮 and 妾) → *sentence*; *chapter*; (musical) *movement*; *counter* (for sentences, poems, regulations etc.) (← marking elements) → *rule*; *clear* (← clear rules for marking). The mark/tattoo was conceived of as rising from the skin, and "rise" is the concept most often conveyed by 章 in derivative characters. A seal inscription form alters the components to 音 and 十, these eventually morphing into 立 + 早.
tags:[]
___
kanji:彰
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 章# (mark/tattoo) + 彡 pattern → *clear/manifest* pattern (originally, of a mark or tattoo) .
tags:[]

kanji:商
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[あきな（い・う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is as per 章# (rise) + a tall platform (compare 堂) → tall platform (rising particularly high) → *trade*; *commerce*; *business*; *merchant* (← people of China's high plateaus noted for their mercantile skills, who referred to themselves as 商) → *deal in*; *compare* (← compare goods in conducting trade/business).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 昌# (chant; recite) + 口 mouth → *chant*; *recite* → *advocate*; *advance* (a theory). 唱 was devised to replace 昌 after the latter came to refer to brightness.

The many extended meanings include *tension*, *tautness*, *stiffness*, *will(power)*, *strain* (the nerves), *keep watch*, *exert influence*, *take/make a stand*, *put up/hang* (curtains/wallpaper etc.) and *lay* (flooring).

kanji:証
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 正# (straight) + 言 words → straighten another out in admonishing (compare 訂). In Japan, 証 was adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 證, according to which 証 conveys the meanings *(make a) report to a superior* → *testify*; *evidence*; *proof*.

kanji:整
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[ととの（う・える）]
raw_etymology:敕, a variant form of 勅, combines 束 bundle + 攵 action indicator → pull tightly on a bundle in straightening it → imperial decree. Compare 勅. 整 adds 正# (straight) → straighten by tying firmly → *put in order*; *arrange*; *regulate*; *make proper*; *ready*; *prepare* → *well-proportioned*; *raise money* (← prepare funds).
tags:[]
___
kanji:定
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[さだ（か・まる・め・める）]
raw_etymology:Variant# of 正 (straight) + 宀 roof/building → stand straight upright (fixed in place) in a building → *fix in place*; *settle*; *settle down*; *set* (a date); *determine*; *decide* (← fixity) → *rule*; *regulation*; *law*; *fate*; *destiny* (← fixed rules/destiny). Also, *sure* and *certain* (← correctness/certainty of a decision taken, or of a rule).
tags:[]
___
kanji:錠
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:定# fix (straight) in place + 金 metal. Originally, a metal spindle fixed in place. Later understood as *solder* (liquefied metal that fixes other objects in place) → *ingot*; (medicinal) *tablet* (← objects of prescribed or fixed shape). *Lock* is the result of reinterpreting the character as 定 fix in place + 金 metal → metallic device that fixes something in place.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廷
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form of the right-hand element is a variant of 千 (advance through luxuriant vegetation). The left-hand element# was originally a long line indicating extension → *garden* with luxuriant, extensive vegetation → (imperial/law) *court*; (governmental) *office*.
tags:[]

kanji:聲
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:声
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[こえ]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 殸# combines a suspended piece of slate used as a percussion instrument with a hand holding a stick used to beat the slate and produce sound that carries over a great distance. A seal inscription form adds 耳 ear → (musical) *sound* that carries over a distance and enters the ear → *voice* → *rumor*; *reputation*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:丁
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ, テイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows the head of a nail driven straight into an object → raise a hammer and strike straight down on a nail. A seal inscription form depicts a nail at a right angle to a surface → T shape → *counter* (for city blocks, or blocks of tofu; or for the two sides of a page of text) (← shape of character) → *unit of length* (about 109 meters). *Fourth in a series* and *fourth calendar sign* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:成
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[な（す・る）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 丁# (nail) + a pounding tool → pound nails (straight) into an object → *make* (← object/structure containing nails); *do* (← pound nails as one form of doing work) → *become*; *complete*; *achieve*; *established*; *existing*. In the present form, the pounding tool resembles 戊 battle-ax.
tags:[]

Also, *popular*, *to a great degree* and *good measure of*.

kanji:乘
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:乗
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[ジョウ]
kunyomi:[の（せる・っかる・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a person atop a tree → help a person climb a tree (compare 丞) → *mount*; *ride* (← clamber atop) → *help someone get on* (a conveyance); *get into/take* (a bus/train etc.); → *give someone a lift*; *convey*. Also, *multiply* (← place atop), *take part* (← get on a vehicle with others) and *deceive* (compare English "take someone for a ride").

kanji:登

kanji:徴
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:王# ruler + an abbreviated form of 徽 insignia → ruler who summons a subject for the purpose of conferring an honor → *summon*; *demand*. Also, *sign* and *symbol* (← symbol appearing on an insignia).
tags:[]
___
kanji:懲
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[こ（らしめる・らす・りる）]
raw_etymology:徴# summon + 心 heart/emotions → summon a subject for *reprimand*/chastisement→ *chastise*; *punish*; *teach someone a lesson* → *learn a lesson*; *learn from (bitter) experience*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:稱
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:称
shinjitai_stroke_count:10
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:爯# combines an abbreviated form of 再 (symmetry) + 爪 (pick/pluck) → pick up/raise an object in weighing it on a balance (compare 耑). 稱 adds 禾 grain/rice → raise crops in order to weigh them. *Name* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鬯
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:匕 serving implement + an offering container filled with aromatic herbs# → offer *aromatic herbs* → (sacrificial) *aromatic liquor*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ]
kunyomi:[かなえ]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a tall *tripod kettle* or cauldron with two hoop-like (or ear-shaped) handles. Compare 鬲.
tags:[]
___
kanji:秤
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[はかり]
raw_etymology:禾 grain/rice + 平# (spread level/flat) → spread crops flat/level in weighing them → *weigh*; *steelyard*; (weighing) *scale*. Also, *measure* and *gauge*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鄭
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 奠# (extend downward) + 邑 village/settlement → settlement extending down slopes (also the name of an ancient province in present-day Henan). *Formal* and *courteous* are borrowed meanings (via the acquired "offering/pay respects" senses of 奠).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:石# stone + 宀 roof/building → *cave* used as a stone quarry. *Selfish* and *willful* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:昌
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, an abbreviated form# of 昜 (bright) + 曰 say/speech indicator → chant/recite in a *bright*/*clear* voice → *prosper* (← bright conditions). A seal inscription form simplifies the character to 曰 + 日 sun/day.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 昌# (chant; recite) + 女 woman → woman entertaining by singing (compare 倡) → *prostitute*.

___
kanji:丞
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A simplification of a seal inscription character composed of 廾# pair of hands + an element combining 山 mountain and a squatting figure → *help* raise a person (compare 乘 and 登) out of danger etc. → *assist*; *adjutant*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:烝
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 丞# (raise/rise) + 火 fire → rising flames (compare 煬) → *rise*; *steam* → *many*; *numerous* (← wisps of steam rising without limit). Also, *make an offering* (of harvested crops) (← offer up ← rise/raise).
tags:[]
___
kanji:昜
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 日 sun/day + a T-shaped form suggesting "rise straight" → sun rising high → *rise* → *open (out)* (← raise in opening out). A bronzeware inscription form adds 彡 pattern to emphasize the sun's bright rays. Distinguish 昜 from 易.
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:昜# rise + 木 tree/wood → poplar or *willow*, the flexible branches of which rise when caught in gusts.

kanji:鐺

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ, ソウ]
kunyomi:[こじり]

For "tip of a sheath" and "point of a scabbard," compare 鏢.

kanji:蕩
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[とろ（かす・ける）]
raw_etymology:As per 湯# (vapor rising from boiling water) + 艸 grass/plant → pond vegetation wavering like vapors → *waver*; *cause a person to waver/give in*. Also, *spread* (← spread in a wavering manner) and *licentiousness* (← irresolute/loose behavior ← waver). *Wash/sweep away* is a borrowed meaning, via 盪. In that connection, note that 蕩 has a variant form 蘯.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盪
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 湯# (vapor rising from boiling water) + 皿 dish/plate/bowl → *wash/sweep away* with boiling water. *Waver* and *cause a person to waver/give in* are borrowed meanings, via 蕩.
tags:[]

kanji:宸
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 辰# (twitch) + 宀 roof/building → *imperial palace* (or, a particular building located deep within palace confines, in either case, which causes those entering to twitch/tremble with awe or dread) → *language used with respect to the emperor*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拯
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジョウ, ショウ]
kunyomi:[すく（う）]
raw_etymology:丞# help + 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → *help*/*save* by raising a person out of danger → *aid*. 拯 was devised to emphasize/clarify the original sense of 丞 after 承 (composed of the same elements: 丞 + 手) came to be understood as raising a person to a post/rank rather than lifting him to safety.
tags:[]
___
kanji:昶
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]

kanji:縢
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[かが（る）, かな, から（ げる）, むかばき]
raw_etymology:As per 朕# (rise) + 糸 thread → *bind* sheaves and stand them upright → *sheave*; *cord*; *rope*. むかばき is a *protective covering* such as gaiters, worn when hunting or horse riding, while かな refers to *one woof thread binding four warp threads*.

kanji:占
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 貞 divination + 囗 circular enclosure (specific place) → use divination/*fortunetelling* to pick out, *fix upon* or *select* a site → *occupy* (← occupy a site that has been chosen) → (of a specific group, market or so on) *make up/account for*; *hold/command* (a share) (← be in possession ← occupy). Also, *state* and *tell* (← state the results of divination).

kanji:担
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[かつ（ぐ）, にな（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 旦# (long and flat) + 手 hand/action indicator → knock/beat down with a long and flat implement (compare 單). However, 担 was adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 擔, according to which 担 bears the meanings *shoulder a load*; *load*; *bear* and *undertake*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 詹# (bear a burden) + 肉 flesh → gallstones burdening a *gallbladder* → *courage* (← courage welling from deep within; compare English "guts") → *pluck*; *nerve*. Compare 肝 and 腹.
tags:[]

kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[い, きも]
raw_etymology:As per 旦# (long and flat) + 肉 flesh → a long, flat piece of fat or grease → lip gloss (← lip gloss made from fat/grease). However, 胆 was adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 膽, according to which 胆 bears the meanings *gallbladder*; *courage*; *pluck* and *nerve*.
tags:[]

kanji:添
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

raw_etymology:As per 忝# (attach) + 水 water → use a sticky fluid to *attach* one object to another → *append*; *add*; *accompany* (← add a layer). Also, *comply with*, *satisfy* and *marry* (← complete ← add to).
tags:[]
___
kanji:探
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[さが（す）, さぐ（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 穴 hole + an element combining 又 hand/action indicator and 火, here an abbreviated form of 炎 (consuming blaze) → poke at a fire in penetrating the deep recesses of the hole where it burns. A later form added 手 hand/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → search for an object by penetrating a deep recess and groping/fumbling for it → *fumble/feel about for*; *search/look for*; *probe* → *explore*. The right-hand element# of the present form replaces the hand and fire elements with 木.
tags:[]
___
kanji:深
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[ふか（い・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# as described in 探 (deep) + 水 water → *deep* waters → *profound*; *intense*. The original reference may have been to a pool/lake located deep within the earth.
tags:[]

___
kanji:沈
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チン]
kunyomi:[しず（む・める）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of 冘 shows that it originally combined 川 river and 牛 cow → drive cattle across a river, their bodies sinking in being largely submerged. A bronzeware inscription form alters the character by showing a person weighed down by a heavy bar across the shoulders → slump; sink. 沈 is 冘# + 水 water → sinking person/object (compare 没) → *sink*; *immerse*; *submerge* → *go down*; *set*; *be mired in*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:甚
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[はなは（だ・だしい）]
raw_etymology:As per 匹 (side by side) + 甘# (sweet/rich food contained in the mouth) → consume extreme amounts of sweet/rich food → *intensity*; *great degree* → *very*; *extreme*; *enormous*; *exceedingly*; *excessively*; *serious*; *outrageous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:尋
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[たず（ねる）]
raw_etymology:Originally 寸 hand/action indicator + an element# combining another hand with abbreviated forms of 左 left and 右 right → settle one's hands right and left. The original sense appears to have been that of a position of obeisance taken when visiting a superior in seeking to have a request granted → *visit*; *seek* → *search for*; *ask*; *inquire*. Additionally, the phonetic evidence suggests the hands would have been concealed in assuming the position of obeisance. 
tags:[]
___

kanji:鮎
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ネン, デン]
kunyomi:[あゆ]
raw_etymology:占 here an abbreviated form# of 粘 sticky + 魚 fish → fish with sticky flesh → freshwater catfish. In Japan, however, 鮎 is normally applied to *ayu* * (sweetfish)*, with catfish being the made-in-Japan character 鯰.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[まくら]
raw_etymology:As per 冘# as described in 沈 (sink) + 木 tree/wood → wooden *headrest* or *pillow* onto which the head sinks.

___
kanji:淫
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[みだ（ら）]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is 爪 claw/hand + 壬, here an abbreviated form of 妊 pregnancy → have (immoral) intercourse with a pregnant woman. 淫 adds 水 water (→ sexual fluids) → indulge heavily in immoral sex (compare 甚 and 耽) → be encompassed in *immorality* → *indecency*; *licentiousness*; *obscene*; *steep oneself in vice*. Note a variant form 婬 which replaces 水 with 女 woman.
tags:[]
___

___
kanji:詹
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン, タン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:厃# combines 厂 cliff (immediately beneath which objects adhere) + a crouching person → person crouched atop a cliff, hidden from the sight of those below. Later, crouching became associated with the idea of slumping in shouldering a burden. The original form of 詹 adds 言 words → bear/endure the burden of another person's *annoyingly verbose* speech → *harp on*. 詹 acquired the element 八, a graphic accretion unrelated to the character's etymology.
tags:[]
___

kanji:眞
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:真

onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[ま]
raw_etymology:匕 double-pronged eating implement + an abbreviated form# of 鼎 tripod kettle/cauldron → fill a vessel by ladling things into it → *truth*; *essence* (← fully real; compare 實) → *reality*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[つつし（み・む）]
raw_etymology:As per 眞# (fullness) + 心 heart/emotions → full attentiveness/*care* → *discretion*; *prudence*; *modesty*; *self-control*; *restraint* → *refrain/abstain* (from).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is 彡 pattern + 𠆢 a variant of 人 person → hair fully layered over a person's head. 珍 adds 玉 jewel → fully perfect (= flawless) jewel → *unusual*; *rare*.

___
kanji:申
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[もう（す）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a bolt of lightning stretching from sky to earth. A seal inscription form, however, is a pair of hands + a straight line representing a rope → pair of hands tugging on/stretching a rope. *Say* is a borrowed meaning, as are *monkey* (as the *ninth sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *3 P.M. to 5 P.M.*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:伸
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[の（ばす・びやか・びる・べる）]
raw_etymology:As per 申# (stretch) + 人 person (→ human agency) → *stretch*; *extend*; *lengthen* → *grow long/tall*; *let grow*; *develop*; *increase*; *straighten* (out); *spread*. Also, *free and easy* and *comfortable* (← relax ← stretch), *go up* (← increase), *be flattened* (← spread smooth) → *be exhausted* (← lie flat in exhaustion).
tags:[]
___
kanji:神
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン, ジン]
kunyomi:[かみ, かん, こう]
raw_etymology:As per 申# (bolt of lightning) + 示 altar/the supernatural → supernatural force associated with lightning/thunder → *mysterious power*; *God*; *god* → *mind*; *supreme* → *ancestor*; *soul of the dead*. In the dual-element characters 榊 and 鰰, 神 appears in variant form.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 申# (stretch) + 糸 thread → band stretched about the waist, that holds the body erect → *gentleman* (← person of upright stature).

kanji:電
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 申# (bolt of lightning) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → long bolt of *lightning* → *electricity*. Like 伸, 電 was devised to replace 申 after the latter underwent its transformation of meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:引
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[ひ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:弓 bow + 丨# line that penetrates from top to bottom → *draw/pull* straight back on a bowstring → *draw out*. Extended meanings include *lead*; *subtract*; *deduct*; *connect* (a power/gas line etc.) → *recede*; *subside*. Also, *attract* (attention/sympathy) and *cite* (an authority) (← draw attention), *look up* (a word) (← draw out a single term from among many); *be finished* and *close* (← ebb away ← recede), as well as *catch* (a cold) (← have one's strength sapped ← draw out).
tags:[]
___
kanji:朕
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 舟 boat (→ rounded object) + an element# combining 廾 pair of hands and a mark → hands stretched about a rounded object to raise it high → *royal we* (← elevate oneself in speaking). In derivative characters, 朕 may appear in the form seen for example in 滕.
tags:[]

___
kanji:陳
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally 攴 action indicator + an element# doubling 柬 sack → line up sacks/sandbags in tight rows → *state*; *explain* (← line up words ← line up sacks/sandbags) → *old* (← line up objects and leave them behind to rot). The present form replaces the doubled 柬 element with 東 (another character originally indicating a sack) and for 攴 substitutes 阜 piled earth.
tags:[]
___
kanji:陣
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 陳 (line up in tight rows) + 車 vehicle → line up military vehicles in tight rows → *camp*; (military) *position*. Compare 軍.
tags:[]
___
kanji:天
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン]
kunyomi:[あま, あめ]
raw_etymology:大 stand outstretched + a line above the head indicating the horizon (compare 旦) → top of the head (of a person standing outstretched and uniting heaven and earth) → *the sky/heavens* → *the natural world*; *the supreme god*; *destiny*; *emperor*; *heaven*. Compare 王. As it is in 旦, the line was the phonosemantic element in 天.
tags:[]

kanji:振
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン]
kunyomi:[ふ（られる・り・る・るう・れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 辰# (twitch) + 手 hand/action indicator → twitch/tremble → *shake*; *wave*; *swing*; *sway*; *wag* → *reject*; *jilt*; *stand (someone) up*; *use* (violence); *wield* (power); *display* (one's abilities); *flourish*; *invigorate*; *lean*. Also, *appearance*, *manner of doing* and *pretense* (← impression made by an actor in shaking the hands in gesturing), *give up* and *abandon* (← give up/abandon an undertaking in the face of rejection), *oscillate* and *sprinkle on* (← swing), *tend toward* (← lean), *do well* (← flourish), and *choreography* (← dancer's manner of doing).

kanji:辰

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シン, ジン]
kunyomi:[たつ]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines a person + a hoe (comprised of a handle attached to a bivalve's shell), twitched to turn soil → twitch a hoe in turning soil. *Dragon* (as the *fifth sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *7 A.M. to 9 A.M.* are borrowed meanings.

___
kanji:塵
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジン]
kunyomi:[ちり]
raw_etymology:鹿 (long herd of) deer + 土 earth → *dust* kicked up by an advancing herd of deer → *dirt* → *trash*; *waste*. As the Old Chinese pronunciation of 塵 matches that of 廛 (long strip), the two characters are graphically similar, and both involve long strings of objects, 塵 may be regarded as a variant and reinterpreted form of 廛.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element in the middle combines 幺 slender thread + 肉 flesh → *posterity* (physical and figurative thread of lineage). 胤 adds 儿 person for emphasis/clarification → *lineage*; *descendant* → *inherit*.

kanji:衍

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 行# (straight, crossing roads) + 水 water → water crossing over/transgressing the banks of a straight waterway and spreading over surrounding land (compare 沺) → *overflow*; *spill (over)*; *spread*. Also, *thrive*, *grow thick* and *be rampant* (← spread), as well as *be left over* (← amount left over after spilling).
tags:[]

kanji:奠
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン, デン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows 奠 to be a combination of 酋 (alcohol container) + an abbreviated form# of 典 (a stand/table) → extend an alcohol container and set it down on a stand → *pay one's respects*; *make an offering*; *an offering*. Also, *settle* and *decide* (← settle upon ← set in place).
tags:[]

kanji:灘

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[なだ]
raw_etymology:As per 難# (stretch over) + 水 water → shoal; sandbar; bank (← thin slice of land stretching over water). In Japanese, *open sea*, which is via reinterpretation of the character (compare 沖, also reinterpreted in Japan to mean "open sea").
tags:[]
___
kanji:寅
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イン]
kunyomi:[とら]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character combines 矢# arrow + a pair of hands → straighten an arrow. A seal inscription form adds 宀 roof/building, creating 寅, the original sense of which was to straighten/stretch and stand to one's full height, inside a building. *Tiger* (as the *third sign of the Chinese zodiac*) and *3 A.M. to 5 A.M.* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

___
kanji:蟬
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[せみ]
raw_etymology:As per 單# (fanning motion) + 虫 insect → fanning/beating motion of *cicada* wings. Compare 螗. Note a variant form 蝉.驒 (22)　タ；ダ；タン；ダンAs per 單# (fanning motion) + 馬 horse → weakened horse whose unsteady steps are likened to a fanning motion (compare 癉). The specific reference to a *dappled (gray or brown) horse* is on account of such horses being regarded as unworthy of domestication, and in consequence being left to make do with whatever nourishment they could find in the wild. Note a variant form 騨.
tags:[]
___
kanji:闡

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 單# (fanning motion) + 門 gate → fanning motion involved in flinging *open* the doors of a gate → *clarify*; *explicate* (← make evident ← open).
tags:[]

kanji:旦
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:日 sun/day + a line# representing the horizon (compare 天) → the sun rising upon the long, flat line of the horizon → *sunrise*; *dawn*. As it was in 天, the line was the phonosemantic element in 旦.

kanji:塡

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kanji:顚

shinjitai:NONE

kanji:疹

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# as described in 珍 (fullness) + 疒 illness → illness causing a *rash* that fully covers the body. "Measles" properly pertains to the compound 痲疹.

kanji:矧

raw_etymology:引# draw/pull + 矢 arrow → hand drawing back an arrow → much/still more (← ever-increasing tension). In Japan however the character was applied to the verb はぐ (*feather an arrow*).

kanji:羨
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン, エン, ゼン]
kunyomi:[うらや（ましい・む）]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form of 膳 (meals; provisions) + the top element as described in 盜 (drool with desire) → (figuratively/actually) drool with desire for food (compare 涎) → *covet*; *yearn for* → *envy*. *Be left over* and *remainder* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廛
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:广 building + an element# combining 田 field and 坴 stretch → long strip of buildings/shops in close proximity → *shop*(s); (expansive) *residence*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:纏
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン, デン]
kunyomi:[まつ（る・わる）, まと（い・う・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 廛# (long strip) + 糸 thread → long strip of fabric/clothing wrapped about the body → *wrap/wind about*; *wear*. Also, *tie/bind* (← tie/bind in wrapping).

___
kanji:葉
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[は]
raw_etymology:枼# is a depiction of three leaves growing from the top of a tree, suggesting slight objects (thin, flat leaves) piled on each other. 葉 adds 艸 grass/plant (for emphasis/clarification) → *leaf* → *thin object*. *Era* and *age* are extended meanings (← piling up of generations ← fallen leaves piled upon each other; compare 祖 and 昔).
tags:[]
___
kanji:拾
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ, ジュウ]
kunyomi:[ひろ（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 合# (press/fit together) + 手 hand/action indicator → *pick up*/*gather* scattered pieces and select that those fit together → *find* → *select*. Also, *catch* (a taxi) (← pick up) and *escape hardship* (← be picked/plucked out of hardship ← pick up). As with 壱, 弐, and 参/參, this character is used as a substitute for the usual number (in this case, 十) in documents as a precaution against forgery.
tags:[]
___

tags:[]

kanji:執
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シツ, シュウ]
kunyomi:[と（る）]
raw_etymology:Originally, an abbreviated form# of 睪 (align) + 丮 (kneeling figure with arms extended) → extend the arms to bind a captive → *seize* (compare 奪); *grasp*; *take* → *do*; *execute/carry out* (← carry out a sentence) → *handle*; *treat*; *take pains*. In 執 as in 埶, 丮 came to written as 丸.
tags:[]
___
kanji:渉
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:歩 here an abbreviated form# of 陟 climb + 水 water → *cross (over)* water in climbing → *be involved with/in* (← be concerned with affairs on both sides of a river).
tags:[]
___
kanji:習
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[なら（う）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 羽 feather/wing + 旦# (long and flat) → bird exerting pressure in flapping its long, flat wings. *Learn* is an extended meaning (← learn by repetition ← repeated action in flapping the wings) → *accustomed*; *custom*; *take lessons*. 旦 was later replaced by 白. In derivative characters, 習 most often appears in the form seen for example in 慴, 摺 or 褶.
tags:[]
___
kanji:疊
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:畳
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ジョウ]
kunyomi:[たたみ, たた（む）]
raw_etymology:畾 is a variant of an element adding another 夕 to the bottom left of 多 (tall, neat pile of meat). 疊 adds 宜 (originally, also piled meat). 疊 therefore expresses the tautological idea of pile up + pile → *pile/fold* an object to a number of layers → *fold up*; *tatami* → *put an end to* (← fold and put away after using).
tags:[]
___
kanji:攝
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:摂
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[セツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 聶# (press together) + 手 hand → *take* a number of objects and press them together (compare 搭). *Act in place of another* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:踏
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[ふ（まえる・む）]
raw_etymology:沓# pile + 足 leg/foot → footsteps piled upon each other → *stamp/tread*; *step/stand on*; *set foot on*; *stand firm* → *be based on* → *experience*; *go through* (← based on what one has experienced or gone through).
tags:[]
___
kanji:襲
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[おそ（う）]
raw_etymology:龖 is 龍 dragon (doubled) → dragons pressed closely together in flight. 襲 combines 龍 (an abbreviated form# of 龖) + 衣 clothing → wear layers of clothing (← double/pile up garments) → *inherit*; *succeed to* (← add goods, offices etc. to those already in one's possession). Also, *attack*; *sweep over* and *seize* (← attack like dragons in flight).
tags:[]
___
kanji:濕
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:湿
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[シツ]
kunyomi:[しめ（す・り・る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 水 water + an element# representing bundles of thread pressed together → soften bundles of thread by submerging them in water → *wet*; *moisten*; *damp* → *rain*. There is no etymological connection with the 㬎element described in 顯.
tags:[]
___
kanji:沓
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[くつ]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 枼 as described in 葉 (pile) → *pile*; *stack*. *Shoe* is a borrowed meaning via 鞜.
tags:[]
___
kanji:荅
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 合# (press/fit together) + 艸 grass/plant → beans pressed tightly between the sides of a shell/pod → *adzuki beans*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:喋
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[しゃべ（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 枼# as described in 葉 (thin/flat/slight) + 口 mouth → *chatter* (of slight substance) → *babble*; *talk*. Compare 諜, 讋, and the original sense of 沓.
tags:[]

kanji:牒

shinjitai:NONE

kanji:諜

raw_etymology:As per 枼# as described in 葉 (thin/flat/slight) + 言 words → chatter of slight substance (compare 喋) → *spying* (← chat a person up to gain information).

kanji:蟄
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 執# (captive) + 虫 insect/creature → *hibernation of insects* (temporarily captive in the earth) → *confine oneself*.

kanji:帖
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 占# (fixed in place) + 巾 cloth → image transferred to and fixed on cloth as a rubbing → *document*; *paper*; *bill*; *notice* (compare 牒). Also, *counter* for Japanese paper, tatami, folding screens and other objects. For rubbings, compare 摺 and 搨.
tags:[]

kanji:池

kunyomi:[いけ]

kanji:旨
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[むね]

kanji:低
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ]
kunyomi:[ひく（い・まる・める）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows heaped earth with a line underneath, indicating the bottom of a pile. Later, however, this element was replaced by 氐# (low). 低 adds 人 person → person hanging the head *low* → *lower*; *short*.

kanji:弟
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ, ダイ, デ]
kunyomi:[おとうと]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a cord or vine aligned with a stake, the lower part of which is represented by a slanting line → crops aligned by size → *younger brother*; *disciple* (← occupant of a lower vertical stage in a hierarchy). For a conceptually related term indicating a "younger sister," compare 娣.

kanji:隶
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ, ダイ, イ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 又 hand/action indicator + 尾# tail → *seize* an animal by the tail. Distinguish this character from the identical-appearing lower element of 康.
tags:[]
___
kanji:夷
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[えぞ, えびす]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts 人 person (→ small person) proximate to 大# stand outstretched (→ large person), the latter actually and figuratively looking downward upon the former → a tribe in east China the stature of which was smaller than that of the Han Chinese. *Barbarian* and *subjugate* are associated meanings, while *Ainu* and *Ebisu* (one of the seven gods of good fortune) are borrowed meanings. Other pejorative names for countries and their residents that involve shortness include 魏 and 倭.
tags:[]
___
kanji:它
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long *snake* (compare 也) → stretch; be elongated. *Other* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:佗
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:它 other + 人 person → *another* person → *other*; *separate*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:沱
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ, タ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 水 water → long flow (of a river, stream or other waterway). In Japan, the character is used with respect to a *flow of tears*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:陀
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ, タ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 阜 piled earth → long/steep bank or slope. 陀 appears primarily in transliterations of Sanskrit terms such as buddha (Buddha: 仏陀 or 佛陀) and Amitabhah (Amida: 阿弥陀).
tags:[]
___
kanji:柁
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ, タ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 木 tree/wood → a long tie beam. In Japan, however, the character came to be reinterpreted as a variant of 舵 (*rudder* or *helm*).
tags:[]
___
kanji:舵
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ]
kunyomi:[かじ]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 舟 boat → long *rudder* → *helm* (← a boat's steering mechanism in general). Compare 柁.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鉈
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャ, タ]
kunyomi:[なた]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 金 metal → long metallic weapon such as a pike → *hatchet*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:駝
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 它# (stretch) + 馬 horse → *camel* (← animal with an elongated neck; compare 鴕). "Camel" is normally expressed, however, by the compound 駱駝. Compare again 鴕, as well as the compound 駝鳥, both of which refer to an ostrich.
tags:[]
___
kanji:馳
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チ]
kunyomi:[は（せる）]
raw_etymology:As per 也# (stretch) + 馬 horse → horse running at blurring speed (compare 闖) → *run*; *gallop*; *drive (something) forward briskly*.
tags:[]

kanji:氐
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 氏# (dig) + a line beneath → dig to/press the *low* point or *foundation* of an object → *base*. Also, name of an *ancient tribe*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:柢
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:氐# foundation + 木 tree/wood → *root* → *basis*. Compare 本.
tags:[]
___
kanji:砥
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ, テイ]
kunyomi:[と]
raw_etymology:氐# foundation + 石 stone → *whetstone* (← foundation upon which a bladed implement is sharpened) → *sharpen* → *polish*. Compare 礪.
tags:[]

kanji:薙
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チ, テイ]
kunyomi:[か（る）, な（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 雉 (pheasant with long tail feathers rising tall) + 艸 grass/plant. The meanings *mow*/*cut down* (tall grass) appear to owe to an obsolete variant form of the character substituting 弟 for the 矢 portion of 雉, with the 弟 element here functioning as an abbreviated form of 剃*shave*.
tags:[]

kanji:姨
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イ]
kunyomi:[おば]
raw_etymology:As per 夷# (downward) + 女 woman → *mother's/wife's sister*; *younger sister of one's wife*; *aunt*; *concubine*. The common denominator in the meanings is the idea of a female social inferior (from the perspective of a male in close relation). With respect to females low in a hierarchy, compare 娣.

kanji:世
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, セ]
kunyomi:[よ]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows the top half of 枼 as described in 葉 (thin, flat leaves piled upon each other), suggesting successive generations figuratively piled one atop the other → *one generation* → *era* → *successive*; *for generations*; *life*; *the world* (← successive generations that make up life/the world; compare 葉 as well as 祖).
tags:[]
___
kanji:折
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セツ]
kunyomi:[おり, お（り・る・れる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a tree cut in two + 斤 ax → chop/cut lumber → *break*; *snap*; *interrupt*; *die*; *lose* → *bend*; *fold*. Also, *turn* and *suitable time/moment* (← reach a turning point ← interrupt) → *opportunity*. Other extended meanings include *yield to* (← bend in defeat ← bend), *judge* and *decide on* (← decisive decision ← decisive cut; compare 判, 斷, 裁 and 決), *at the time of* (← time ← suitable time), and *folded object* or *small wooden box* (← end or point created by a fold ← fold).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 折# (cut) + 口 mouth → wise/cutting words → *wisdom*.

kanji:制
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:To a variant of 木 tree/wood, the left-hand element# adds 丿 (split) → split off part of a branch. 制 adds 刀 sword/knife → cut to *control* the growth of a tree → *arrange into shape* → *regulation*; *system*; *establish*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[セイ]
kunyomi:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:設
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セツ]
kunyomi:[もう（ける）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows a chisel + an element combining a hand and a bar → chisel an object into shape → *make*; *create* → *establish*; *provide*; *equipment*; *facilities*. By the time of the seal inscription forms, the chisel has become 言 words, with the hand/bar element developing into 殳.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 埶# (cut) + 力 power/energy → cut (something tall/long) energetically → *force*; *power*; *energy*.

kanji:大
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダイ, タイ]
kunyomi:[おお, おお（きい）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a person standing greatly outstretched, reducing the distance between oneself and others → *big*; *large*; *great*; *full*; *spacious* → *extremely*; *too*; *excellent*; *general*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:太
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ, タ]
kunyomi:[ふと（い・る）]
raw_etymology:A variant of 大# great that acquired the meanings *be/become thick*, *extremely*, *too* and *fat*, as well as *calm*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:達
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タツ, タチ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 辵 movement + an element combining 大 great and 羊 sheep → procession of a great flock of sheep → *proceed smoothly*; *arrive at*; *reach* → *achieve*; *be in use*; *notice*; *deliver*; *skillful*. Suffix meaning a *plural number of humans* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:泰
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 大# great + an element combining 水 water and 廾 pair of hands (→ action indicator) → great outpouring of liquid (compare 太) → *calm*; *peace* (← relaxed feeling ← plenitude). *Thai(land)* is via transliteration ( 泰, or 泰國).
tags:[]
___
kanji:舌
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼツ]
kunyomi:[した]
raw_etymology:As per the slender chisel element described in 臿 + 口 mouth → the slender, chisel-like *tongue* enclosed in the mouth, which facilitates *speaking*.
tags:[]

kanji:至
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シ]
kunyomi:[いた（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts 矢# arrow arriving at a target, its *stopping point* → *arrive*; *reach*; *lead to*; *proceed*; *come*; *extend to* → *come to do*; *bring about*; *result in*. In derivative characters such as 疾, 耋, 銍 and 絰, 至 suggests specifically the stopping point of a life.
tags:[]
___
kanji:室
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シツ]
kunyomi:[むろ]
raw_etymology:至# stopping point + 宀 roof/building → *room*/chamber representing a stopping point (i.e. leading on to no other rooms) in a *house* → *deep cavern* (compare 窒); *cellar* → *greenhouse*. Also, *dynastic family* (compare 家).
tags:[]
___
kanji:致
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チ]
kunyomi:[いた（す）]
raw_etymology:Originally 至# arrive + 夂 leg/foot pointed downward (here an action indicator) → *cause* to arrive, actually or figuratively (= occur) → *bring about*; *do*; *exert oneself*. The present form replaces 夂 with 攵 action indicator.
tags:[]
___
kanji:窒
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:至# stopping point + 穴 hole → stopping point in a cavern, where further progress is impossible (compare 室) → *block*; *obstruct*. *Nitrogen* is via the compound 窒素.
tags:[]
___
kanji:實
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:実
shinjitai_stroke_count:8
onyomi:[ジツ]
kunyomi:[み, みの（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows that the element at the bottom# was originally not 貫 but a combination of 貝 commodities and 周 (an enclosure). The addition of 宀 roof/building yields the meaning "house full of treasures" → *be filled (with)* → *seed*; *berry*; *fruit*; *nut*; *content*; *substance*; *ingredients* (← fill) → *bear fruit*. Also, *actuality* and *sincerity* (← fully true content; compare 眞).
tags:[]
___
kanji:質
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シツ, シチ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:斦 is 斤 ax doubled, emphasizing splitting. 質 adds 貝, here an abbreviated form# of 實 (house full of treasures) → split one's belongings → *pawn* → *hostage*; *mortgage* → *quality/content*; *nature*; *verify*; *ask* → *simple* (← simple reality).
tags:[]
___
kanji:失
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シツ]
kunyomi:[うしな（う）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 手 hand/action indicator + a line slanting downward → (by means of beating/flogging etc.) cause a person to *slip*/lose his footing (compare 跌) → *lose* → *miss* (an opportunity) → *mistake*.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:失# lose + 辵 movement/action indicator → rotate in a new item in place of a lost one → *rotation*; *alternation*.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:禾 grain/rice + 失, here an abbreviated form# of 迭 rotation → rotate crops → *sequence*; *order*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:逸
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兔#/兎 rabbit (fast-moving) + 辵 movement → *be fast* and elusive → *stray*; *deviate* → *be missing*. The present form deletes one stroke from 兔. There is no etymological connection with 免.
tags:[]
___
kanji:屮
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of cut grass, indicating a *grass shoot* (compare 艸). Graphically, this character is properly written as it appears on the right-hand side of 艸, but 屮 is the JIS form. Also, the grass shoot character should be distinguished from a separate character written 屮 and with the reading サ; this is a variant form of 左.
tags:[]
___
kanji:獺

kunyomi:[うそ, おそ, かわうそ]
raw_etymology:賴 here an abbreviated form# of 瀨/瀬 shallows + 犬 dog/beast → *otter* (← animal that inhabits shallows).
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:衣 clothing + an abbreviated form# of 矞 (circular) → the rounded *hem* or *train* of a garment → *border* (← end of a garment). Also, *descendants* and *posterity* (understood as figuratively following in the train of ancestors).
tags:[]

raw_etymology:世# successive + 水 water → successive flow on account of leakage → *leak*; *flow*. Compare 洩.

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kanji:跌
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:失# slip + 足 leg/foot → slip and *lose one's footing*; *stumble* (and fall) → *err*. 跌 was devised to replace 失 after 失 came to indicate "slip" and "lose" in broader senses.
tags:[]

___
kanji:筮
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:筮 is 巫 sorcery + 竹 bamboo. However, the character originally included another element#, 廾 pair of hands, written at the bottom. Here, 廾 acted as an abbreviated form of the now-disappeared element described in 泰 that combined 廾 with 水 water, indicating an outpouring of liquid → bamboo *divining rod* used to locate water → *divination*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:朝
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[あさ]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows plants + an element combining 日 sun/day and a variant form of 水 water → the rising sun, as seen between plants. A seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form of 乾 (the sun rising high in the sky) + 舟, here an abbreviated form# of 朕 (rise) → rising of the *morning* sun. *Dynasty* is an extended meaning, connected with the practice of issuing imperial commands at the beginning of the day.
tags:[]
___

kanji:透
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[す（かし・かす・く・ける）]
raw_etymology:秀# surpass + 辵 movement → *penetrate*/*pass through* in surpassing → *create a gap/space* → *opening* (← gap) → *look through* (← look through a gap) → *transparency* (← be able to look/see through). Also, *thin* (out), *empty out* and *be free/unoccupied*, as well as *watermark* (← mark made visible by transparency).
tags:[]
___

___
kanji:搖
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:揺
shinjitai_stroke_count:12
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[ゆ（さぶる・すぶる・する・らぐ・らす・らめく・るがす・るぐ・れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:䍃# is 肉 flesh + 缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase → wavering motion of hands kneading meat in a vessel. 搖 adds 手 hand/action indicator → *waver*; *tremble*; *shake*; *swing*; *sway*; *flicker*; *rock* → *jolt*; *shock*; *tremor*; *vibration*; *undermine*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:謠
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:謡
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 䍃# as described in 搖 (waver) + 言 words → *sing* in a wavering/quavering voice → *folksong*; *Noh song*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遊
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[あそ（ばす・ばせる・び・ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 斿# (float) + 辵 movement → *roam*/*wander* as if floating about → *move about freely* → *recreation*; *play*; *nomadism*; *be at ease*. Extended meanings include *game*; *pastime*; *diversion*; *amusement*; *pleasure*; *enjoyment*; *have fun*; *take a vacation*; *be idle*; *be out of use* and *leave free/idle*. Also, *deign to* (← undertake at one's pleasure).
tags:[]
___

kanji:島

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[しま]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 鳥 (curve upward) + 山 mountain → mountain-like projection rising from the sea → *island*. 嶋 is a variant form often used in surnames.
tags:[]

kanji:少
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[すく（ない）, すこ（し）]
raw_etymology:As per 小# (small shavings) + 丿(split) → small/slight, curled shavings split from a piece of wood → *few*; *little* (← insufficiency in volume or number) → *some* (← a small quantity).
tags:[]

kanji:弔

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[とむら（う）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a suspended vine (compare 叔) → suspend; hang. *Mourning*, *hold a memorial service* and *condolence* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:壽
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:寿
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[ジュ]
kunyomi:[ことぶき]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an abbreviated form# of 老 (aged person) + ridges surrounding a paddy or field → aged person following a long, curved ridge about a paddy/field → *longevity*; *long span* (← length of an aged person's lifespan) → *congratulations* (← celebration of long life).
tags:[]
___
kanji:鑄
kanji_stroke_count:22
shinjitai:鋳
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[い（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 壽# (long and curved) + 金 metal → pour molten lead into a long and curved die or *cast* (compare 鉛) in smelting → *mint*; *coin*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:守
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュ, ス]
kunyomi:[まも（る）, も（り）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 又# hand/action indicator + a covering element → enclose/surround to *defend* or *protect* → *guard*; *watch* → *govern*; *observe* (a tradition); *maintain* (a position); *keep* (one's word); *stick to*. Also, *protector*, *keeper* and *babysitter*. Later, 又 was replaced by 寸, also a hand/action indicator.
tags:[]

kanji:狩

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[か（り・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 守# (enclose/surround) + 犬 dog/beast → *hunt* by surrounding animals (or, by driving them into an enclosure and surrounding to prevent their escape) → *gather*; *pick* → *view nature* (← enjoy the outdoors).
tags:[]

kanji:討

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[う（つ）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 寸 hand/action indicator + a bladed instrument# (now styled 言; compare 誅) → carry out an armed *attack* → *subjugate*; *avenge oneself*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:受
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュ]
kunyomi:[う（かる・け・ける）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 舟# (curved) boat (here a shape indicator suggesting a large, curved object) + an element combining 爪 claw/hand and 又 hand/action indicator → *receive/accept* a large, curved object → *receptacle*; *catch* (a ball); *popularity* (← receive general acceptance) → *reputation*; *be a success*. Also, *sustain* (damage) (← be on the receiving end of a damaging act) and *support(ing)* (← accept a supporting role), as well as *undergo* and *take an exam* (←be on the receiving end of a trying experience/exam) → *pass an exam*.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:As per 受# (receive/accept) + 手 hand/action indicator → *confer* an object on another (= cause another to receive) → *give*; *grant*; *endow*; *award* → *teach*; *instruct*; *initiate*; *blessing*.

kanji:晝
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:昼
shinjitai_stroke_count:9
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[ひる]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 書 (written work) + 日 sun/day surrounded by straight lines on all four sides → ( written) demarcation of sunshine from darkness → *noon*; *afternoon*; *daytime*. 晝 eliminates the two vertical strokes toward the bottom of the character.
tags:[]
___
kanji:獸
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:獣
shinjitai_stroke_count:16
onyomi:[ジュウ]
kunyomi:[けだもの, けもの]
raw_etymology:嘼# combines an abbreviated form of 單 (weapon) and 囗 circular enclosure → use weapons to surround and drive a *beast/wild animal* into a snare or enclosure (compare 狩 and 逐) → *brute*. 獸 adds 犬 dog/beast for emphasis/clarification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:周
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[まわ（り）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows grain crops in a field, growing thickly. A bronzeware inscription form adds 囗 circular enclosure → enclosure encircling a field of grain → *circulate*; → *surroundings* (← surroundings of an enclosure); *circumference*. In derivative characters, 周 may also appear in the form seen for example in 稠, 綢 or 雕.
tags:[]
___

kanji:調
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[しら（べる）, ととの（う・える）]
raw_etymology:周# circulate + 言 words → circulate/go about in examining/inspecting (compare 訪) → *examine*; *inspect*; *investigate*; *search*; *look into* → *study*; *look up* (a word). Also, *arrange* (← spread in orderly fashion ← spread widely), *settle* (← examine and settle a matter), *tone* (← smooth; harmonious ← spread smoothly ← spread widely), *condition* (← overall condition ← overall ← spread widely). *Prepare*, *supply* and *purchase* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:曜
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 翟# (rise high) + 日 sun/day → brilliant light radiating from the rising sun. *Day of the week* is via the assignment of bright celestial bodies to the names of the days of the week ( 日 sun 月 moon 火星 Mars 水星 Mercury 木星 Jupiter 金星 Venus 土星 Saturn).
tags:[]

kanji:盜

shinjitai:盗
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[ぬす（む）]
raw_etymology:The top element# is 欠 bent, open-mouthed figure + 水 water → drool with desire for tasty food. 盜 adds 皿 dish/plate/bowl (for emphasis/clarification) → drool with desire for tasty food and take a portion → *steal* → *rob*.

kanji:兆

kanji:跳

tags:[]

kanji:刀
kanji_stroke_count:2
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[かたな]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *sword* with a curved blade. When used as an element in dual-element characters, 刀 more often refers to a knife or cutting implement than to a sword.
tags:[]
___
kanji:召
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[め（す）]
raw_etymology:As per 刀# (curve) + 口 mouth → curve the arm and beckon, supplementing oral summoning → *summon* → *term of respect*. From the idea of a person of superior rank beckoning to an inferior for service, the verb めす is used as a polite expression for the following senses: *eat*, *drink*, *put on*, *wear*, and *take* (a bath/a conveyance). めす is also used in the same way for *buy* or *catch* (a cold). *Invite* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:招
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[まね（く）]
raw_etymology:召# summon + 手 hand/action indicator → summon/*beckon* (with the hand/arm) → *invite*; *engage* (professionally). Also, *bring about* and *incur* (← set in motion by beckoning).
tags:[]

kanji:肇
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, a character that, like 畫, was composed of 晝 (demarcate in writing) + 聿 implement held upright to carve/draw characters → demarcate/mark off in writing. *Commence*, *begin*, *start* and *open* are borrowed meanings (compare 啓, the top element of which is the same as in 肇) → *originate*; *for the first time*.

___
kanji:斿
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Here, 子 is an abbreviated form# of a character that combines 子 and 水 water, indicating a child or small object floating on water. 斿 adds the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → small flag/banner fluttering in a breeze (compare 纛). *Roam*, *ramble* and *swim* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:游
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[およ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 斿# (float) + 水 water → *float*; *drift*; *swim*. *Roam* and *wander* are borrowed meanings via 遊 → *enjoy* (← enjoy a rambling life). 游 was devised to replace 斿 after 斿 acquired its borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蝣
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 斿# (float) + 虫 insect → insect that floats in the air. The compound 蜉蝣 refers to a mayfly.
tags:[]
___
kanji:攸
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form shows a long and thin stream of water being poured from on high in a slender arc over a bather's back → *far*; *distant* (← high). Also, *feel at ease* (← soothing sensation of having water poured on one's back). *Place* is a borrowed meaning. For the idea of pouring in an arc, compare 酒.
tags:[]

___
kanji:柚
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユ, ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 由# (pass/run through) + 木 tree/wood → fruit juice run through a filtering device. In China, 柚 refers to the pomelo, and in Japan to Citrus junos (*citron*).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[そで]
raw_etymology:As per 由# (pass/run through) + 衣 clothing → *sleeve* (← the part of a garment through which the arms run; compare 褎) → *insert in one's sleeve*.
tags:[]

kanji:酋
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:酉# alcohol container + 八 split right and left → alcohol container with vapors rising and splitting away. (Tribal) *leader* is a borrowed meaning. 酋 appears in slightly distinct variant forms in the derivative characters 輶 and 猶.
tags:[]

onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Effectively a variant form of 獸 (drive a beast/wild animal into a snare or enclosure) with the meanings *plan*, *scheme* or *measure* (← consider how to drive prey into a trap).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:壽# (long and curved) + 水 water → large, swelling waves → *swell*; (high) *wave*. Compare 波 and 浪. 涛 is a variant form sometimes encountered.
tags:[]

kanji:檮
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:壽# (long and curved) + 木 tree/wood → long, curving piece of wood → *block of wood* → *blockhead*; *foolish*; *ignorant*. *Stump* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:疇
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 壽# (ridge) + 田 field → *ridge*; *farmland* → *same type/kind* (← continuous farmland) → *category* (group of the same kind of people/objects). As with 壔, 疇 was devised to replace 壽 after 壽 came to indicate "longevity."
tags:[]

tags:[]

___
kanji:冑
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[かぶと]
raw_etymology:Originally, 冃 as described in 冒 (cover) + a variant of 甲 (armor/helmet) → armor, including a *helmet*, running from the head to the waist. Eventually, under the influence of 胄, the top element morphed into the cognate (but etymologically distinct) 由#.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[よつぎ]
raw_etymology:As per 由# (pass/run through) + 肉 flesh → *descendant*; *lineage* (← physical manifestation of heritage running through generations). *Helmet* is a borrowed meaning, via 冑.
tags:[]

kanji:讎
kanji_stroke_count:23
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズ, ジュ, シュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The original form of the doubled 隹 element# showed one bird facing another → confront. 讎 adds 言 words → verbal confrontation between rivals/enemies → *rival*; *enemy* → (take) *revenge*. A variant form 讐 repositions the 言 element.
tags:[]

kanji:糶

kanji:纛
kanji_stroke_count:24
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ, トク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 毒# (stir) + 縣 as described in 県 (hang suspended) → *flag/pennant/banner* tied to a flagpole at both ends, and which rotates around the pole in the breeze (rotation likened to a repeated stirring motion). Compare 斿 and 旋. Also, a large *flag with the emperor's insignia*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:罩

raw_etymology:卓# (rise above) + 罒 net → fish-catching *basket* (pulled high out of the water). *Wrap* and *cover* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kanji:裯
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ, トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:周# circulate + 衣 clothing → billowing *nightwear* wrapped about the body (compare 綢). *Fine silk* is a borrowed meaning via 綢.
tags:[]
___
kanji:輈
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[ながえ]
raw_etymology:As per 舟# (curved) boat (here a shape indicator suggesting a large, curved object) + 車 vehicle → curved *shafts* protruding from a vehicle, to which beasts of burden were linked.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ, トウ]
kunyomi:[とばり]
raw_etymology:壽# (long and curved) + 巾 cloth → long *drop curtain*/*canopy* → *cover*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:怊
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 召# (curve) + 心 heart/emotions → *sadness*; *sorrow* (← warped emotions; compare the aspect of warped emotions in 忉 and in 怨).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 召# (curve) + 車 vehicle → *small, open-air vehicle* with curved shafts.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鞀
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 召# (curve) + 革 leather → *musical instrument* with a small, drum-like attachment at the end of a handle. When swung, a ball at the end of a cord curves in an arc and strikes the leather skin of the "drum," producing sound. Compare 鼗.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兆# (split) + 口 mouth → *ear-splitting cry*; *howl*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:洮
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兆# (split) + 水 water → water splitting off from the object it is cleansing → *clean*; *wash*; *rinse*. The compound 洮水 indicates one tributary of the Yellow River.
tags:[]
___
kanji:祧

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兆# (split) + 示 altar/the supernatural → *building for worshiping ancestors*, set apart from a mausoleum.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兆# (split) + the pennant/banner element described in 旅 → swallow-tailed *pennant/banner*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鼂
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チョウ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:黽 here an abbreviated form# of 鼇 (sea turtle) + 旦 (long and flat) → *turtle* with a shell whose rounded carapace (top portion) rises over the flat plastron (lower portion).
tags:[]
___

___
kanji:慆
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:舀 here an abbreviated form# of 滔 (overflow) + 心 heart/emotions → heart overflowing with *pleasure* → *self-indulgent* (← pleasure taken too far). For "self-indulgent," compare 愓.
tags:[]
___
kanji:壔
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 壽# (ridge) + 土 earth → *furrows/ridges*. Also, long *embankment*. As with 疇, 壔 was devised to replace 壽 after 壽 came to indicate "longevity."
tags:[]
___
kanji:鼗
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 兆# (split) + 鼓 drum → small *drum* attached to a handle, with a cord and ball splitting off from the drum on both sides. When the instrument is swung left or right, the ball curves in an arc and strikes the drum, producing sound. Compare 鞀.
tags:[]
___
kanji:讜
kanji_stroke_count:27
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 黨# (raise supporters) + 言 words → speak to a crowd → *proper/correct words* (← words appropriate for persuading a crowd).
tags:[]
___

raw_etymology:A depiction of a long-necked, rounded *jug* or container. Compare 由 and 酋.

raw_etymology:As per 卣# (long) + 辵 movement → long path (leading to happiness/contentment; compare 迪) → *relaxed*; *happy*.

raw_etymology:久# (long and curved) + 羊 sheep → *lead/direct* sheep along a winding path. Compare 迪 and 逌.

kanji:鯈
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ, チュウ]
kunyomi:[はえ, はや]
raw_etymology:As per 攸# (slender and curved) + 魚 fish → a slender, curved *fish* of the carp family. In Japan the character refers to a *Japanese dace*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:繇
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ, ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 䍃# as described in 搖 (waver) + 系 connection → wavering connection → proximate *cause/reason* (compare 由). Also, *slither at length* (← connect two points indirectly). *Conscription* for public works is a borrowed meaning via 徭.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

raw_etymology:As per 䍃# as described in 搖 (waver) + 風 wind → *waver in the wind*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[い（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 翏# (separate from a main unit) + 疒 illness → *heal* by separating an illness from the body → *treat an illness*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:褎
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ, ユウ]
kunyomi:[そで]
raw_etymology:褏 is as per 由# (pass/run through) + 裒 (collect/gather) → run the arm through *sleeves* (compare 袖) that gather about the arm → *fancy, conspicuous clothing*. In Japan, 褏 has been supplanted by 褎, which replaces 由 with 禾.
tags:[]
___
kanji:韶
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:召 here an abbreviated form# of 昭 brightness + 音 sound → bright, clear notes of music → beautiful sound → *beautiful*. Also, an ancient type of music said to have been created by a legendary Chinese emperor, 舜.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[とり]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long-necked, rounded *alcohol container*. *Bird* (as the *tenth sign of the Chinese zodiac*), *west*, and *5 P.M. to 7 P.M.* are borrowed meanings.

___
kanji:叔
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:尗# shows a pendent, twisted bean vine (compare 弔, 弗, and 弟) + 小 small/slender → slender, hanging vine (compare also 寂). 叔 adds 又 hand/action indicator → pick beans from a slender, hanging vine → end → younger brother of one's father (← younger siblings on a figurative family vine ← beans on a vine; compare 弟 younger brother) → *uncle* (younger or older, either one).
tags:[]
___
kanji:淑

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 叔# (slender and pendent) + 水 water → gentle cascade, likened to water hanging from a cliff → *graceful* → *pure*; *good* (compare 良).
tags:[]
___
kanji:督
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 叔# (slender and pendent) + 目 eye → watch over, the eyes figuratively hanging overhead → *supervise*; *command*. Compare 監 and 臨.
tags:[]
___
kanji:育
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イク]
kunyomi:[そだ（ち・つ・て・てる）, はぐ（くむ）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the top element (now written 𠫓)# is 子 child upside down, indicating a fetus filling then passing through the birth canal → *breeding*. *Raise*, *upbringing* and *growth* are associated meanings, with *foster* (growth) by extension. The addition of 肉 flesh is for emphasis/clarification.
tags:[]
___
kanji:祝
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュク, シュウ]
kunyomi:[いわ（い・う）]
raw_etymology:As per 兄# (extend the arms in prayer) + 示 altar/the supernatural → *offer a prayer at an altar* → *congratulate*; *celebrate*; *commemorate*.
tags:[]

onyomi:[チク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:玄 an abbreviated form# of 幼 young + 田 (here a shape indicator suggesting partitioned pens) → young *livestock* contained in partitioned pens → *domestication*.

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[たくわ（える）]
raw_etymology:As per 畜# (contained) + 艸 grass/plant → preserved plants/vegetables contained in being stored for winter provisions → *store (up)*; *save* → *grow/wear* (a beard/mustache) (← additional provision for winter).
tags:[]
___
kanji:逐
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:豕 pig/boar + 辵# movement → *chase* down a wild pig/boar one careful step at a time, finally tightening a circle about it (compare 狩 and 獸) → *pursue* → *drive off* → *one by one*; *one after another* (← one step at a time).
tags:[]
___
kanji:塾

onyomi:[ジュク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 孰# (an enclosure) + 土 earth → an earthen structure → *private/cram school* (originally, one operated in such a structure).
tags:[]
___
kanji:熟
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュク]
kunyomi:[う（れる）]
raw_etymology:As per 孰# (an enclosure) + 火 fire → stir meat and other ingredients in a cooking vessel (compare 毒 and 融) → soften → *ripen*; *mature*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:毒
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 生 (fresh, slender grass shoots) + 母# (succession of offspring) → stir boiled herbs in a cooking vessel (compare 融 and 熟) for use as an aphrodisiac → *poison* (← stimulant drug) → *damage*; *ruin*; *extreme*.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[きず（く）]
raw_etymology:As per 筑# (strike forcefully) + 木 tree/wood → forcefully strike pieces of wood in constructing → *build/construct*.
