kanji:篤
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:竹# (rigid) bamboo + 馬 horse → startled horse (compare 驚) standing rigid in attention → *be attentive* (← thoroughness) → *cordial*; *kind*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:勺
kanji_stroke_count:3
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a slightly curved *spoon* or *ladle* + a stroke representing the contents of a container rising and becoming evident → *unit of capacity* (approximately 0.018 liters); *unit of area* (approximately 0.033 square meters).
tags:[]
___
kanji:的
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テキ]
kunyomi:[まと]
raw_etymology:As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 白 white (→ color that stands out) → conspicuous *target*; *mark*; *objective* → *obvious*; *hit*; *-like*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:酌
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[く（む）]
raw_etymology:勺# ladle + 酉 alcohol container → ladle (*pour out/serve*) alcohol → *drink*; *take into consideration* (← show consideration toward someone/something, as in pouring a guest a drink).
tags:[]
___
kanji:濯
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 翟# (rise high) + 水 water → pluck an object from the water (compare 釣) in which it has been placed for washing, and raise it high to dry → *wash*; *rinse*; *launder*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:躍
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤク]
kunyomi:[おど（る）]
raw_etymology:As per 翟# (rise high) + 足 leg/foot → *leap/jump* high into the air (compare 跳) → *spring up* → *dance*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:卓
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 早# (rising of the sun) + a variant of 人 person → person who rises above others → *excel*. For the idea of being excellent in the sense of surpassing, compare 特. *Table* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:覿

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:賣# sell + 見 see → (sellers and buyers who) *see* each other in transacting business → *meet* face to face; (have/grant an) *interview*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:翟

onyomi:[タク, ジャク, テキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:隹 here a variant form# of 鳥 bird + 羽 feather/wing → long, feathered tail of a *pheasant* rising high in the air.
tags:[]
___
kanji:擢
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テキ, タク]
kunyomi:[ぬき（んでる）]
raw_etymology:As per 翟# (rise high) + 手 hand/action indicator → raise objects high then *select* from among them → *pull up/out*; *surpass*; *pick out* → *excel* (← select objects of surpassing quality).
tags:[]
___
kanji:孰
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element/ 享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + an abbreviated form of 巩 as described in 恐 (connect objects) → build a (curved) enclosing wall connecting the opposite ends of an enclosure. *Who*, *which*, and *in any case* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:迪
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 由# (pass/run through) + 辵 movement → (actual or figurative) *path/road* running from one point to another → *way* or *teaching* leading to advancement or enlightenment. Also, *lead* and *guide*. Compare 逌.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舳
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 由# (pass/run through) + 舟 boat → *bow/prow* that projects narrowly from the hull of a boat. *Stern* is via a reinterpretation of the character, understanding the projection to be from the rear rather than the front of the vessel. Compare 艫.
tags:[]
___
kanji:竺
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジク, トク, チク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:竹# (rigid) bamboo + 二 two → *bamboo* approximately twice as *thick* as ordinary bamboo. Logically, the classifier for 竺 should be 二, but it is traditionally given as 竹.
tags:[]
___
kanji:菽
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 叔# (bean vine) + 艸 grass/plant → (generic term for) *beans* and *peas*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:妁
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 女 woman → female *matchmaker* or *go-between*. It is likely that the original connection with "rise and become evident" involved the offering of gifts in premarital rituals.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芍
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 勺# (rise and become evident) + 艸 grass/plant → a conspicuous flower. The compound 芍藥 (芍薬) refers to a peony (← flower conspicuous both for its large size and strong fragrance).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[ひしゃく]
raw_etymology:勺# ladle + 木 tree/wood → wooden *ladle* → *ladle handle*.

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シャク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 卓# (rise above) + 糸 thread → raise thread high in weaving → *spacious* → have *margin/leeway*.

___
kanji:浟
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャク, テキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 攸# (water being poured from on high in a slender arc over a bather's back) + 水 water (for emphasis/clarification) → *cleanse*; *wash*; *rinse*. 浟 was devised to replace 攸 following the latter's transformation of meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:滌
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジャク, テキ, デキ, ジョウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 浟 (*cleanse*; *wash*; *rinse*), replacing 攸 with 條.
tags:[]
___
kanji:筑

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:巩 as described in 恐 (connect objects) + 竹# bamboo → ancient, stringed *musical instrument* played by being struck forcefully with a bamboo stick.
tags:[]

kanji:倬
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 卓# (rise above) + 人 person → person of surpassing/outstanding qualities, who rises above others → *outstanding person*; *outstanding*.

___
kanji:倏
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュク]
kunyomi:[たちまち]
raw_etymology:As per 攸# (slender and curved) + 犬 dog/beast → *sudden*/*abrupt* twisting movement of an animal → *quick*.

kanji:沖
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[おき]
raw_etymology:中# center/middle + 水 water → extract flavor from tea by infusing in hot water. In Japan, however, 沖 has been reinterpreted as 中 center/middle + 水 water → point midway between the shore and deep waters of a lake or the open waters of a sea → *offshore*; *offing*; *open sea*.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:中# center/middle + 衣 clothing → wrap *inside* one's clothing → *inner feelings*. For the association between clothes and feelings, compare 褱 as described in 懷.
tags:[]
___
kanji:充
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[あ（てる）]
raw_etymology:As per 𠫓# as described in 育 (fetus filling then passing through the birth canal) + 儿 person (for emphasis/clarification) → fetus filling the birth canal → *fill* → *fulfill*; *satisfy* → *apply*; *allot*; *allocate* (← satisfy a requirement in need of being fulfilled) → *assign* (← allocate).
tags:[]

kanji:蟲
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, a character unrelated to 虫, and indicating a swarm of maggots → *insect*; *bug*; *worm*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:虫
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[むし]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a snake, specifically a pit viper rising to strike. However, 虫 was adopted as a Shinjitai (new character form) to replace 蟲, according to which 虫 bears the meanings *insect*; *bug*; *worm*. Note that 虫 has a much broader sense than the English "insect," and can refer to a wide spectrum of life forms.
tags:[]
___
kanji:冬
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[ふゆ]
raw_etymology:Originally, a depiction# of food tied to a cord that winds about a peg. A seal inscription form adds 氷 ice → *winter* (season when preserved/stored food is consumed). Compare 蓄.
tags:[]
___
kanji:終
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ]
kunyomi:[お（える・わり・わる）]
raw_etymology:As per 冬# (wind about) + 糸 thread → wind a ball of thread (compare 收) → *finish*; *end* (← finish winding) → *the close*; *termination*; *conclusion*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:衆
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュウ, シュ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:眾 combines a variant form of 乑# (run together) + 罒 net → people running together, the formation likened to a net (compare the similar function of 罒 in 署) → *crowd*; *multitude* → *populace*. A bronzeware inscription form substitutes 目 for 日. Later, 血 came to replace 目, creating the form 衆.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:虫 here an abbreviated form# of 蟲 swarm + 鬲 tripod cooking vessel/cauldron → stir a swarm of objects in a cooking vessel (compare 毒 and 熟) → *melt*; *dissolve*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舂
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 臼 mortar + an element# combining 廾 pair of hands and 午 (pound) → *pound* food in a mortar → *sinking/setting of the sun* (← sink ← pound into the bottom of a mortar). Distinguish 舂 from 春.
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[おろ（か）]

___
kanji:主
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュ, ス]
kunyomi:[おも, ぬし]
raw_etymology:丶# lamplight + a massive lamp stand → lamp stand giving off light (compare 灯). Conceptually, 主 represents a stationary object, leading to the meanings *master*, *owner* and *leader* (← person who remains in a certain place) → *main*; *principal* (← main person ← master; owner; leader). Also, *god* (← master).
tags:[]
___

shinjitai:NONE

kunyomi:[す（まい・む）]
raw_etymology:As per 主# (stationary) + 人 person → person remaining stationary → *dwell*; *reside*; *inhabit*; *live* → *remain put*; *house*; *home*; *address*; *dwelling*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:注
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[そそ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:As per 主# (stationary) + 水 water → *pour* liquid into a tubular container, where it becomes and remains stationary → *pour on*; *sprinkle*; *water* (plants); *flow/empty into*; *irrigate*. *Notice*, *pay attention*, *concentrate on*, *affix*, *interpret*, and *write down* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]

kanji:頭
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズ, トウ, ジュウ]
kunyomi:[あたま, かしら]
raw_etymology:豆# bean + 頁 head → bean-shaped *head* → *head* (of a group); *leader*; *top*. Also, *hair* (on the head), *beginning* (compare 元), *brains*, *intellect* and *the mind*, as well as *counter for certain animals* (compare English "head of cattle").
tags:[]
___
kanji:樹
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:尌# is 寸 hand/action indicator + 壴 as described in 鼓 (round drum set on a stand) → set/stand a drum in place → set/stand in place. 樹 adds 木 tree/wood → stand up a sapling in planting it → *set up*; *tree*; *plant* (v.).
tags:[]
___
kanji:鬪
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:闘
shinjitai_stroke_count:18
onyomi:[トウ]
kunyomi:[たたか（う）]
raw_etymology:鬪 is a variant of 鬭 with the same meanings (*fight*; *battle*; *contend* → *strive*). Whether in error or as a simplification, 鬪 replaces 斲 with a variant of 尌 (set/stand in place) as described in 樹.
tags:[]

___
kanji:殳
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally, 又# hand + a stick-shaped tool/weapon → a throwing weapon (later employed with reference to a type of *pike*). 殳 also bears the sense of "stand an object upright" (via the idea of a weapon, thrown in an arc, that stands upright if it misses its target and hits the ground), but 殳 is nearly exclusively used as an *action indicator*.
tags:[]
___

kanji:鍮

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:兪# remove + 金 metal → refined copper (from which impurities are removed). However, most sources define 鍮 as *brass* (mixture of copper and lead), the meaning of the compound 眞鍮.

kanji:蛛
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュ, チュ, チュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:朱# + 虫 insect → *spider*. The conceptual influence lent here by 朱 is uncertain.
tags:[]
___
kanji:誅
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Originally a bladed instrument + 朱# (stump) → *punish* by chopping off the limbs, leaving only stumpy remains (compare the original sense of 殊) → *put to death*; *kill*. The bladed instrument element came to be replaced by 言 (compare the evolution of the 言 element in 設). "Accuse" and "condemn" are borrowed meanings, influenced by the acquired presence of 言 words.
tags:[]
___
kanji:逗
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トウ, ズ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 豎 (stand) (n.) + 辵 movement → shuffle in place (compare 躕) → *stay*; *remain*; *stop*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:廚
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュウ]
kunyomi:[くりや]
raw_etymology:As per 尌# as described in 樹 (set/stand in place) + 广 building → storage closet (for foodstuffs) → *kitchen*. Note a variant form 厨.
tags:[]
___
kanji:豎
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:豆# a stand + 臤 (adhere) → a *vertical/upright* stand adhering to the floor. *Child* slave/servant is a borrowed meaning, likely influenced by the meaning of the 臣 element in 臤 when functioning as an independent character. 竪 is a variant form of 豎.
tags:[]
___

kanji:續
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:続
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[ゾク]
kunyomi:[つづ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:𧶠# combines 貝 commodities + an abbreviated form of 睦 large and cordial gathering → pass along commodities in a large (commercial) gathering. 續 adds 糸 thread → goods passed along like linked threads → *continue*; *occur in succession*; *do/occur afterwards*; *sequel* (← one after another). Also, *lead to* (← continue to a certain place/point) and *resume* (← continue after a pause). (The 四 element represents a variant of the lower portion of 坴.)
tags:[]
___

kanji:重
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュウ, チョウ]
kunyomi:[え, おも（い・さ・たい・み・んじる・んずる）, かさ（なる・ねる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 東# (run through) + a person standing on the ground → the *weight* of a person thrusting down heavily on the earth, as though to run through it → *heavy*; *pile up*; *be piled upon*. Extended meanings include *fold*, *ply*, *occur simultaneously*, *do repeatedly* and *place weight on/attach importance to* → *value highly*; *importance*; *important*. Also, *depressing* and *serious* (← heaviness/weightiness).
tags:[]
___
kanji:動
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドウ]
kunyomi:[うご（かす・き・く）]
raw_etymology:As per 重# (run through) + 力 power/energy → strenuous *work* involving the running through of objects (compare 用 and 同) → *movement* → *go/put into action*, *shift*; *transfer*; *change*; *operate* (a machine); *run* (a machine/an enterprise); *developments*; *activities*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:種
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュ]
kunyomi:[たね]
raw_etymology:As per 重# (run through) + 禾 grain/rice → run seeds/saplings through soil in planting → *seed* → *type*; *kind*; *sort*; *species* (← seed as the type of the plant it will become) → *cause*; *source*. Other extended meanings include (source) *material*, *ingredients*, *breed*, *topic* and (magician's) *trick*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:衝
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 重# (run through) + 行 (straight, crossing roads) → *main road* running through a settlement → *collision* (← collision of objects in the act of running through).
tags:[]
___
kanji:童
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドウ]
kunyomi:[わらべ]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form is an element combining 東 (pierced sack) and 土 earth (suggesting the same idea found in 重 of weight thrusting heavily down upon the earth) + another element combining a needle and an eye → run through a slave-child's eye with a needle (compare 民, 敃 and 僕) → *child* (← child servant ← servant ← slave). The present form amalgamates the top two elements into 立 and the bottom two into 里.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鐘
kanji_stroke_count:20
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ]
kunyomi:[かね]
raw_etymology:As per 童# (run through) + 金 metal → *bell* (metal object struck with a motion as though to run through it; compare 鍾 as well as 鈴).
tags:[]
___
kanji:用
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[もち（いる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character depicts a stick being run through a rectangular board, piercing a hole → *use*; *action* → *have a need* → *go to the toilet* (← have a need to relieve oneself).
tags:[]
___
kanji:勇
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[いさ（ましい・む）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 甬 (run through) + 力 power/energy → stamp the ground energetically, as though to run through it → *spirited*; *lively* → *brave*; *courageous*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:通
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ツウ, ツ]
kunyomi:[かよ（い・う）, とお（す・り・る）, どお（り）]
raw_etymology:As per 甬# (run through) + 辵 movement → run/*pass through*. The many extended meanings include *go back and forth* (to work, school etc.); *commute*; *attend a school*; *frequent* (a particular place); *run between two points*; *street*; *avenue*; *traffic*; *go/run through*; *pass*; *pierce*; *penetrate*; *drainage*; *ventilation* and *conduct*. Also, *cook/heat up food* (← pass food through heat); *look through/over* (← run the eyes over); *do continuously* (← run through); *pass* (a bill); *maintain* (a position) (← be consistent from start to finish ← run through); *understanding* (← know a subject from start to finish ← run through) → *be reasonable/logical*; *reputation*; *be well known* (← reputation for understanding). Further, *as expected* and *in accordance with* (← run in accordance with expectations), *be known as by* and *be regarded as* (← reputation), *accept/admit* (← admit the logic of an argument), *degree* (← degree of completeness ← run from start to finish), and *thus*(ly) (← run in accordance with logic/expectations).
tags:[]
___
kanji:痛
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ツウ]
kunyomi:[いた（い・く・ましい・み・む・める）]
raw_etymology:As per 甬# (run through) + 疒 illness → *pain* running all through the body → *hurt*; *ache*; *sore*; *injure*. Also, *damage*, *trying* (experience), *pitiful*, *miserable*; *tragic* and *horrible* (← painful experience), as well as *thoroughly* and *extremely* (← thoroughgoing/extreme pain).
tags:[]
___
kanji:踊
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[おど（り・る）]
raw_etymology:As per 甬# (run through) + 足 leg/foot → stamp the ground (energetically, as though to run through it) then *jump/spring/rise up* (compare 動 and 勇) → *dance* → *manipulate* (← make another dance to one's tune).
tags:[]
___
kanji:庸
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:用# use + an abbreviated form of 庚 (firm stem) → *use* a stem or similar *ordinary* tool in performing routine *work* (such as constructing an earthen wall; compare 墉) → *common* (← ordinary) → *mediocre*. "Employee" and "reward" are borrowed meanings (compare 傭).
tags:[]

kanji:專

Also, *tradition*, *legend* and *biography*.

kanji:端
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[は, はし, はた]
raw_etymology:As per 耑# (neatly aligned) + 立 stand → stand in neat alignment. This meaning dropped, with 端 acquiring the borrowed meaning *end* via the original sense of 耑 (cloth hanging in neat alignment → the ends of a piece of cloth ) → *edge*; *tip*; *side* → *fraction*; *portion*. Also, *vicinity* (← beside; around ← side) and *rectitude* → *right*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:段
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダン, タン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element# is drawn from the top part of 耑 (neatly aligned). 段 adds 殳 action indicator → descend a (neatly aligned) staircase → *steps*; *stairs*; *stage* → *period*; *demarcation*; *rank*; *ranking*. Also, *method* (← descend steps in order) and *thing/matter* (← demarcation).
tags:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:斷
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:断
shinjitai_stroke_count:11
onyomi:[ダン]
kunyomi:[ことわ（る）, た（つ）]
raw_etymology:斤# ax + the right-hand element of 繼 (sever threads) → *sever* a curving, pendent object → *cut/break* (off); *stop*; *act/do* (resolutely); *disappear* → *decision* (← resolute decision ← decisive cut; compare 判, 裁, 決 and 折) → *refuse*; *reject*; *decline* (a request) (← negative decision on a request) → *prohibit*. Also, *permission* (← favorable decision granting permission) and *ask permission* (← request a decision). *Give notice/warning*, *abstain from* and *quit* (a bad habit) are from the original sense of severance. Also, *make an excuse* (← give reasons for a faulty act ← give reasons for a decision).
tags:[]

kanji:典
kanji_stroke_count:8

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines an abbreviated form# of 侖 (neat, logical assemblage of bound records) + 丌 a stand/table → heavy assemblage of records on a stand/table → *code*; *tome* (← record of weighty rules and laws) → *ceremony* (← ceremony conducted according to written rules).
tags:[]
___
kanji:豚
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トン]
kunyomi:[ぶた]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 彖 (pig) + 肉 flesh → (corpulent) *pig/hog*. 豚 was devised to replace 彖 after 彖 came to refer to divination.
tags:[]
___
kanji:殿
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デン, テン]
kunyomi:[との, どの]
raw_etymology:Variant form# of 展 (place the buttocks atop an object) + 殳 action indicator → place the buttocks on an object in settling upon it → *rear* (← rear end). Also, *palace* and *hall* (← sit on a throne) → *lord*. との refers to a place name, that is, と as in 大和 (やまと) and の as in 名 (な・の), which supplied names for high-ranking families in ancient Japan. *Mr.*, *Ms.*, *Mrs.* and *Miss* are via extension from "lord" in the sense of being honorifics.
tags:[]
___
kanji:盾
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[たて]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 目 eye + a curved visor# → curved *shield* (for the eyes/body) behind which one immediately follows.
tags:[]

kanji:循

onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 盾# (follow) + 彳 movement/action indicator (for emphasis/clarification) → *follow*. *Circulate* is a borrowed meaning.

___
kanji:巡
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[めぐ（らす・る）]
raw_etymology:巛 variant of 川# river + 辵 movement → move in the manner of a river that swirls about sandbanks (compare 州) → *circulate (about)* → *go round*; *surround*; *turn* → *go about*; *concern* (a subject); *think over*.
tags:[]

kanji:順
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:川# river + 頁 head (→ group of people) → people following a winding course traced by a river (compare 馴 and 沿) → *follow* → *sequence*; *order*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:殉
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 旬# (cycle/circle) + 歹 severed bone/death → subordinates who have followed their lord into death, buried in a circle around him → *lay down one's life*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:沿
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[そ（う）]
raw_etymology:As per 水# (long, winding flow of water) + an obsolete character indicating a ravine (compare 谷) → water splitting into branches as it follows/runs along a winding, prescribed course in a ravine → *run along*; *lie along*; *follow* (a custom/rule).
tags:[]
___
kanji:船
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[ふな, ふね]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 沿 (follow/run along a prescribed course) + 舟 boat → *boat* progressing along a prescribed course → *ship*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鉛
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[なまり]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 沿 (follow/run along a prescribed course) + 金 metal → molten *lead* running along a prescribed course in being refined (compare 鑄).
tags:[]
___
kanji:舛
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character shows crossing legs → *go against*; *disobey*; *rebel*. Also, *be mixed (up/together)* and *be mistaken*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:舜
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 舛# crossing legs + an element combining 炎 flame and 匚 shape indicator → move lightly and nimbly around flames enclosed in a hearth, in the manner of a dancing flame. 舜 is associated with the *name of a legendary ruler in ancient China*. Also, via 蕣, the borrowed meaning *Hibiscus syriacus*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:馴
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[な（らす・れる）]
raw_etymology:川# river + 馬 horse → horse following a winding course traced by a river (compare 順 and 沿) → *obedient*; *docile* (← follow). Also, *tame* (v.), *train* (v.) and *domesticate* (← cause to follow/become obedient).
tags:[]
___
kanji:彖
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a large-headed *pig* or hog (→ beast with a drooping belly; compare 豚 and the right-hand element of 遂). *Divination* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:椽
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 彖# (drooping/pendent) + 木 tree/wood → (pendent) *rafter* supporting a roof.
tags:[]
___
kanji:篆
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 彖# (drooping/pendent) + 竹 bamboo (→ bamboo writing brush → writing) → *drooping style for writing Han/Chinese characters* → *seal script*; *seal*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:耑
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 巾 cloth + an element# indicating a cylindrical bar → cloth hanging in neat alignment over both edges of a bar → *special* (← neat).
tags:[]
___
kanji:喘
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゼン]
kunyomi:[あえ（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:耑 here an abbreviated form# of 遄 quick + 口 mouth → *gasp*, *pant* or *breathe hard* (← quick intakes of breath).
tags:[]
___
kanji:椴
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タン, ダン]
kunyomi:[とど]
raw_etymology:As per 段# (neatly aligned) + 木 tree/wood → tree with branches hung in neat intervals → *fir*. Compare 樅.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 段# (neatly aligned) + 糸 thread → satin/*damask* (silk cloth with a neat pattern).
tags:[]

kanji:沌
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 屯# (swollen) + 水 water → swollen/turbid waters → *confusion*; *chaos*. *Stagnate* is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___
kanji:頓
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トン]
kunyomi:[とみ（に）]
raw_etymology:As per 屯# (swollen) + 頁 (group of people) → camp swollen with soldiers (compare 軍 and 營) → *stop*; *settle* (down) (← form a camp) → *arrange*. *Prostrate oneself*, *bow deeply*, *suddenly*, *hastily* and *all at once* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:飩
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドン, トン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 屯# (swollen) + 食 food/eating → meat/vegetable-filled *dumpling* → thick *noodles* (← noodle portion of soup ← noodle soup containing dumplings).
tags:[]
___
kanji:臀
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デン]
kunyomi:[しり]
raw_etymology:As per 殿# (buttocks) + 肉 flesh → *buttocks* → *rear/tail end*; *bottom*. 臀 was devised to replace 殿 after the latter acquired its extended meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:澱
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デン, テン]
kunyomi:[おり, よど, よど（み・む）]
raw_etymology:As per 殿# (settle) + 水 water → *sediment* settled at the bottom of a *stagnant pool* of water → *stagnant*; *dregs*. Compare 淀.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遁
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トン, シュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 盾# (follow behind a shield) + 辵 movement → follow a sheltering object in fleeing/escaping → *flee*; *escape*; *evade*; *avoid*; *hide*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:楯
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[たて]
raw_etymology:As per 盾# (follow behind a shield) + 木 tree/wood → wooden *shield*. 木 was appended to emphasize the object rather than the action involved in 盾. For other meanings of たて、see 盾.
tags:[]
___
kanji:淀
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デン, テン]
kunyomi:[よど, よど（み・む）]
raw_etymology:Originally, 水 water + a variant, abbreviated form# of 旋 rotate → collected water that circulates with no replenishment (compare 淮 as described in 匯) → *stagnant pool* → *stagnant* (situation); *stagnate*. Compare also 澱 and 淟. 淀 replaces the abbreviated 旋 element with 定 (fix in place).
tags:[]
___
kanji:惇
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン, トン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The element# now written 享 originally combined 羊 here an abbreviated form of 群 swarm + a depiction of a wall → swarm within an enclosure. 惇 adds 心 heart/emotions → *considerate*; *sincere* (← inclusive emotions swarming over the breast).
tags:[]
___
kanji:淳
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element/ 享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 水 water → swarming waters (compare 準 and 澱) → *sincere* (← emotional depth; compare 惇). Also, *pure* (← pure, swarming waters) → *simplicity* (← pure/unmixed; compare 醇).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element/ 享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 言 words → swarm of words offered patiently in instructing → *patience*; *courtesy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:醇
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュン, シュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element/ 享# as described in 惇 (swarm within an enclosure) + 酉 alcohol → alcohol swarming with fermenting agents → *pure*; *unmixed* (← pure/unmixed alcohol; compare 淳) → *cordiality* (← sincere affection; compare 惇 and 敦).
tags:[]

___
kanji:惷
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:春# spring + 心 heart/emotions → *foolish* impulses of young people (in the springtime of their lives). Compare the idea of dullness in 鈍 and in 憃. *Squirm* and *wriggle* are borrowed meanings via 蠢.
tags:[]
___
kanji:蠢
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュン]
kunyomi:[うごめ（く）]
raw_etymology:春# spring + 虫 insect (doubled) → *squirming/wriggling insects* (← newly born life forms, likened to the fresh growth of vegetation in spring). *Foolish* is a borrowed meaning via 惷.
tags:[]
___
kanji:掾
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[エン]
kunyomi:[じょう]
raw_etymology:As per 彖# (drooping/pendent) + 手 hand/action indicator → hang heavily from an edge. *Assist*, *aid* and *assistant* are via the idea of assisting/supporting in battle by covering the flanks. じょう refers to the *third of the four ranks* in Japan's Ritsumei system (← assist).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[なまず]
raw_etymology:Abbreviated form# of 澱 (sediment) + 疒 illness → *skin disease*; *erythema* (← skin condition characterized by discoloration).
tags:[]

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュン]
kunyomi:[あさがお, むくげ]
raw_etymology:As per 舜# (flame-like) + 艸 grass/plant → *Hibiscus syriacus*, with a flame-like pattern on its flowers. Japanese あさがお refers however to a *morning glory*.
tags:[]

kanji:髓

shinjitai:髄

kunyomi:[]

tags:[]
___
kanji:垂
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[た（らす・れ・れる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form combines 土 earth + an element# indicating a pendent ear of grain → marker hung in alignment with a pile of earth, the two functioning as a boundary marker → *hang*; *suspend*; *sag*; *droop*; *drop* → *a hanging*; *straw curtain*; *flap*; *dangle*; *drip*; *dribble* → *sauce*; *gravy* (← liquids that drip from the mouth). Also, *confer* (← bestow on one of lower rank).
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:垂# hang + 目 eye → eyelids hung in sleep → *sleep*.

kunyomi:[つむ]
raw_etymology:垂# hang + 金 metal → metal object set to hang, or used to strike down upon another object → *spindle*; *sinker* → *weight*.

kanji:妥
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant form of 垂 hang (compare 朶, another variant of 垂 also composed of etymologically unrelated elements), with the specific nuance "hang in the appropriate way/place" → *contentment* (← be satisfactory ← be appropriate) → *calm*; *peace*.
tags:[]

kanji:炊
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[た（く）]
raw_etymology:欠 here an abbreviated form# of 次 (align) + 火 fire → align pieces of wood for a fire → *burn*; *boil*; *cook*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:替
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ]
kunyomi:[か（え・える・わり・わる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is an element# doubling 夫 and indicating "stand in alignment" (compare 輦) + 曰 say/speech indicator → circular group of people taking turns speaking → *relieve/succeed another*; *replace*; *exchange*; *substitute for* → *alternate*; *change* → *a spare*; *another* (helping of food etc.). Later, 曰 was replaced by 日.
tags:[]
___
kanji:水
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[みず]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long, winding flow of *water*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:追
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ツイ]
kunyomi:[お（う）]
raw_etymology:𠂤 is a tall pile of (heavy) objects exerting downward pressure. 追 adds 辵 movement → pressure an enemy army by pursuing it → *pursue*/*follow*; *drive off/out*; *expel*; *catch up with* → *add*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:遂
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[と（げる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form of the right-hand element# is 豕 pig/boar + 八 split right and left → pig/boar being butchered. 遂 adds 辵 movement → drag a heavy object such as a pig/boar along a winding course all the way to its destination (compare 水) → *carry through* → *accomplish*; *attain*; *achieve*; *wind up* (making/doing). In derivative characters, 遂 also appears in the form seen for example in 隧 and 燧.
tags:[]
___
kanji:隹
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a long-beaked, squat *bird*. In contrast to 鳥 (bird with a long, pendent tail), 隹 suggests a rounded shape exerting downward pressure.
tags:[]
___
kanji:誰
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[たれ, だれ]
raw_etymology:As per 隹# (exert downward pressure) + 言 words → *who* (← demand to know another person's identity) → *whose*; *anyone*; *someone*.
tags:[]

kanji:頽
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ]
kunyomi:[くずお（れる）]
raw_etymology:禿# bald head + 頁 head (for emphasis/clarification) → hair loss → *decline*; *decay*; *sink*; *collapse* (← decline in powers often attending loss of hair).
tags:[]
___
kanji:朶
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タ, ダ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of 垂 hang, consisting of 木 tree/wood + 乃 (cling) → (cling in) hanging → *hang*. Also (via the influence of 木), *branch* (← object that hangs from a tree).
tags:[]
___
kanji:隋
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ズイ, スイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A variant of a character combining 阜 piled earth + an obsolete element consisting of 左 (aligned at an angle) doubled → pile of earth collapsing in alignment on two sides (compare 墜). The *Sui Dynasty* (581 CE-618 CE) is a borrowed meaning.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[タ, ダ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 隋# (collapsing pile) + 木 tree/wood → warped, elliptical wooden frame → *oval*.
tags:[]

kanji:雖
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[スイ]
kunyomi:[いえど（も）]
raw_etymology:The left-hand element combines 虫 insect/creature + an element suggesting a (large) head. The precise original signification of this combined element is obscure. 雖 adds 隹# (exert downward pressure) → lizard of a squashed appearance. *This* is a borrowed meaning (compare 惟), as are *even if* (so) and *although*.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:對
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:対
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[タイ, ツイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:丵 is a depiction of a thick clump of tall grass. 對 is a variant of 丵 + 寸 hand/action indicator → lay clumps of grass out to dry, facing each other → *confront*; *face* → *opposite*; *a pair of*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:隊
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form# of 遂 (heavy object) + 阜 piled earth → heavy pile of earth that collapses to the ground (compare 隋). *Unit* is either via association (e.g. a collapsed earthen structure perceived as the ruins of a single unit) or borrowing → *corps* (← a unit of soldiers).
tags:[]
___
kanji:出
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[シュツ]
kunyomi:[だ（し・す）, で, で（る）]
raw_etymology:The relevant oracle bone form of this character is 屮# grass shoot + 土 earth → grass/bud/sprout protruding from the ground → *protrude*; *emerge*; *appear*; *go/come out* → *proceed*; *depart*; *start/leave*; *set forth*; *begin to*; *origin*; *hold/put out*; *break out*. Extended meanings from these basic ideas include *let out*; *take out*; *present* (for inspection); *turn on*; *give off*; *emit*; *express*; *submit*; *hand/send in*; *send*; *publish*; *issue*; *serve* (food/drinks); *give*; *hang (out)* (a flag); *open* (a business); *pay*; *flow*; *one's turn*; *be on duty*; *come out at*; *reach*; *arrive*; *attend*; *appearance*; *birth*; *be produced*; *be brought up*; *graduate* (from school); and *be in demand*. Also, *pretext* (← present an explanation ← present) and *answer* (a phone) (← appear on the receiving end of a call ← appear). *Soup stock* and *broth* are via the use of だし as an abbreviation of 出し汁 (だしじる). For "protrusion," compare 凸and 突.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拙
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セツ]
kunyomi:[つたな（い）]
raw_etymology:出# protrude + 手 hand/action indicator → arrange objects inexpertly, with some protruding → *inexpert*; *clumsy*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:徹
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is as per 育 (pass through) + 攵 action indicator → pass through. 徹 adds 彳 movement/action indicator (for further emphasis/clarification) → *go/slip through* → *pierce*; *penetrate*.
tags:[]
___

onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per the right-hand element# of 徹 (pass through) + 手 hand/action indicator → *remove* obstacles, allowing easy passage → *withdraw*.
tags:[]

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an object with a protrusion rising from its center → *protrude*; *convex*. For "protrusion," compare 出 and 突.
tags:[]
___
kanji:突
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[トツ]
kunyomi:[つ（く）]
raw_etymology:穴# hole + 犬 dog/beast → hole from which a dog/beast suddenly springs → *thrust*; *protrude*; *frontal assault*; *attack*; *sudden* → *stab*; *prick*; *pierce*; *strike*; *push* → *push through*. For "protrusion," compare 凸and 出.
tags:[]
___
kanji:退
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[タイ]
kunyomi:[しりぞ（く・ける）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 日 sun/day + an element# combining 辵 movement and 夂 leg/foot pointing downward (→ drop) → sun dropping to the western horizon → *retreat*; *withdraw* → *keep at a distance*; *shrink* (from) → *resign*; *decline*; *refuse*; *reject*; *refrain*; *drive off/out* (← keep at a distance). Later, the 日 and 夂 elements were altered to 艮 (adhere), though the bottom-right portion now exhibits a slight distinction.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鐵
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:鉄
shinjitai_stroke_count:13
onyomi:[テツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:戜 combines 呈 (extend) + 戈 here a variant form of 伐 (cut down) → cut an extensive portion → large. In place of 戜, the right-hand element# of 鐵 substitutes 𢦏 as described in 栽 (→ cut; sever). 鐵 adds 金 metal → metal used to cut (large portions of) other objects → *iron*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:述
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュツ]
kunyomi:[の（べる）]
raw_etymology:As per 朮# (pass through) + 辵 movement → pass through → *explain* (← explain in a straightforward manner) → *state*; *express*; *mention*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:術
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 朮# (pass through) + 行 (straight, crossing roads) → *path* through which one passes. *Rule*, *art* and *method* are figurative paths.
tags:[]
___
kanji:聿
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イツ, イチ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant bronzeware inscription form depicts an implement used to carve characters into wood, bamboo and so on. The character was later reinterpreted as indicating a *hand holding a writing brush*. *State* and *relate* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:贅
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セイ, ゼイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:貝# commodities + 敖 ramble; play around → possess commodities sufficient for rambling or playing around → *superfluous*. Also, *wasteful* (← squander plenteous commodities), as well as *wart*, *lump* and *bump* (← superfluous skin; however, unrelated to the original sense of 贅).
tags:[]
___
kanji:矞
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[イチ, イツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:Here, 矛 pike/halberd is a variant of 戉# (scoop out). 矞 adds 冏 bright → use an instrument to scoop out or *bore* a circular hole, allowing *bright* light to penetrate.
tags:[]
___
kanji:朮
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ジュツ, シュツ]
kunyomi:[うけら, おけら]
raw_etymology:A depiction of *foxtail millet* being stripped of its grain right and left in passing through a sieve → (a particular) *herb*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:兌
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ダ, タイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:八# split right and left + 兄 (extend the arms) → extend the arms in stripping away a captive's clothes and *exchange* them for prisoner's garb.
tags:[]
___
kanji:梲
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[セツ, タツ]
kunyomi:[うだつ]
raw_etymology:As per 兌# (strip away) + 木 tree/wood → piece of wood stripped away for use as a *short support pillar for the ridge of a roof*.

onyomi:[ゼイ, セイ, タイ]
kunyomi:[もぬけ]
raw_etymology:As per 兌# (strip away) + 虫 insect → *molt*; *slough* (← stripping away of a body part or covering).

___
kanji:黜
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[チュツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:出# protrude + 黑 black (→ hard to see; invisible) → *dismiss* an ambitious (= protruding) subordinate → *demote*; *drive off/away*.

kanji:鬲
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[レキ, カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *tripod cooking vessel*, or cauldron. The vessel was partitioned by a square board into upper and lower sections. Grain would be placed in the upper section and water in the lower one; the grain was steamed when the vessel was heated over fire. Compare 鼎.

kanji:樂

shinjitai:楽
shinjitai_stroke_count:13

kunyomi:[たの（しい・しむ）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an oak tree with acorns (ground into powder via a lengthy grinding process). *Music* and *enjoyment* are onomatopoeic, borrowed meanings, the pronunciation of the character simulating the din of a crowd → *play* (an instrument); *amuse oneself*; *pleasant*; *fun*; *happy*; *delightful*; *comfort*; *easy*.

kanji:兼
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン]
kunyomi:[か（ねて・ねる）]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form shows two ears of grain + a hand → storehouse encompassing grain that has been gathered then stored/put away → *combine*; *unite*; *serve/perform concurrently*; *simultaneous*. *Unable to do* is a borrowed meaning. In derivative characters, 兼 may also appear in the form seen for example in 嗛, 歉 or 賺.
tags:[]

kanji:監

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 臥 lie face down + an element# combining 皿 dish/plate/bowl and a line above it indicating water → lie face down and observe the reflection of one's face in water contained in a bowl/container → *keep watch over*; *supervise*. Compare 督 and 臨.

onyomi:[ラン]
kunyomi:[あい]
raw_etymology:As per 監# (bowl/container) + 艸 grass/plant → *indigo* dye extracted from plant matter then allowed to run into a bowl or container.
tags:[]

kanji:慊
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケン, キョウ]
kunyomi:[あきた（る）]
raw_etymology:As per the previous form of 兼# (gather then put/store away) + 心 heart/emotions. 慊 bears contradictory meanings: *dissatisfied/unsatisfactory* and *satisfied/satisfactory*. The distinction owes to the quantity and/or quality of that which one has stored away, and whether one is content with the situation or not. 
tags:[]

kanji:獵

___
kanji:來
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:来
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[ライ]
kunyomi:[きた（す・る）, く（る）]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a barley plant, emphasizing the rows of pendent fruits of grain concealed in husks (compare 米). 夂 leg/foot pointed downward was added to yield a new character, 麥, meaning "come" → plant come from Central Asia. However, the meanings of 麥 and 來 were eventually inverted, so that 麥/麦 now means barley and 來/来 *come* → *since*; *until now*; *future*; *next/the coming* (week etc.) → *cause*; *bring about* (← come about).
tags:[]
___
kanji:埋
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マイ]
kunyomi:[う（まる・める・もれる）]
raw_etymology:As per 里# (long strip) + 土 earth → long furrows in which seeds are buried → *bury*; *cover* → *fill* (with).
tags:[]
___
kanji:狸
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[たぬき]
raw_etymology:貍 is 里 here an abbreviated form# of 埋 bury + 豸 animal that ambles along the ground → fox-like animal that shelters in burrows or dens. In Japan however 貍 has been applied to the *raccoon dog* → *sly* (← supposed attribute of a raccoon dog). 狸 replaces 豸 with 犬 dog/beast.
tags:[]
___

kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE

kanji:麥
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:麦
shinjitai_stroke_count:7
onyomi:[バク]
kunyomi:[むぎ]
raw_etymology:來 is a depiction of a barley plant, emphasizing the rows of pendent fruits of grain concealed in husks (compare 米). 夂 leg/foot pointed downward was added to yield a new character, 麥, meaning "come" → plant come from Central Asia. However, the meanings of 麥 and 來 were eventually inverted, so that 麥/麦 now means *barley* and 來/来 come; bring about → *wheat*; *oats*; *rye* → *grain*.
tags:[]

kanji:鳳

raw_etymology:A depiction of a large bird flapping its wings, eventually taken to be a *(male) phoenix*. The female phoenix is 凰. The term attached to 鳳 may have originated in mimesis.

___
kanji:樣
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:様
shinjitai_stroke_count:14
onyomi:[ヨウ]
kunyomi:[さま]
raw_etymology:The right-hand element# is as per 永 (water stretching far into the distance) + 羊 (abundant) → waterway delivering abundant supplies. In 樣, which adds 木 tree/wood, this element suggests a tree (a horse-chestnut or oak) that supplies abundant nuts. 橡 also referred to this tree, and 樣 came to borrow, then extend upon, the "shape/image" meanings of the 象 element of 橡 → *manner*; *condition* → *model*; *pattern*; *fashion*; *method*. *Mr./Mrs./Miss/Ms.* is a borrowed usage, deriving from the old Japanese term そおも → さま, meaning "over there."
tags:[]
___
kanji:象
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ショウ, ゾウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an *elephant* → *tusk*; *ivory* → *shape*; *image*; *appearance* (animal of a conspicuous/remarkable shape etc.) → *liken*; *resemble* (← image resembling the original object) → *imitate* (← image resembling/imitating the original object) . The pronunciation of the character simulates the trumpeting of an elephant.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:象# image + 人 person → *image* of a person → *statue*; *resemble*.
tags:[]

kunyomi:[とち]

___
kanji:母
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[はは]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a woman, with emphasis on the nipples → *mother*. Conceptually, the character suggests that a mother is a curvaceous producer of a succession of offspring from the darkness of the womb. The most ancient pronunciation of this term was MA, a sound comparatively easy for infants to produce. Compare 夫.
tags:[]
___
kanji:毎
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[マイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:The relevant seal inscription form is 屮 grass shoot + 母# (succession of offspring) → succession of grass shoots appearing out of the darkness of the earth → *give rise to continuously* → *every*; *always*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:梅
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[うめ]
raw_etymology:As per 毎# (dark) + 木 tree/wood → *plum* (tree with abundant, dark fruit; compare 某). Note a variant form, 楳.
tags:[]
___
kanji:某
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:木# tree/wood + 甘 (sweet food contained in the mouth) → plum (i.e., a dark fruit that grows in abundance, and is consumed by being savored in the mouth). Compare 梅. *A certain* and *some* are borrowed meanings.
tags:[]
___
kanji:媒
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 某# (abundance) + 女 woman → woman who acts as an *intermediary* between a man and a woman, the goal being to ensure the birth of abundant children.
tags:[]
___
kanji:姆
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:母# mother + 女 woman → *wet nurse* (who takes the place of a mother) → *nanny*; *governess*. Compare 姥.
tags:[]
___
kanji:拇
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:母# mother + 手 hand (→ finger) → *thumb*; *big toe* (digits likened to a mother, the remaining fingers/toes likened to children).
tags:[]
___
kanji:苺
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[いちご]
raw_etymology:As per 母# (succession of offspring) + 艸 grass/plant → berries (voluminous fruit; compare 梅). In Japan, 苺 has been associated specifically with the *strawberry*. Note a variant form, 莓, in which 毎 may be observed as functioning just as 母 (succession of offspring).
tags:[]
___
kanji:晦
kanji_stroke_count:10
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[くら（ます）, つごもり]
raw_etymology:As per 毎# (dark) + 日 sun/day → *dark*, *moonless night* (falling on the last day of a lunar month) → *hide*; *invisible*. 
tags:[]
___
kanji:誨
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 毎# (dark) + 言 words → *instruct*, eliminating the darkness of ignorance.
tags:[]
___
kanji:媽
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボ, モ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:女 woman + 馬# for the sound alone to simulate the nursery term "ma(ma)" → *mother*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:禖
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[バイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 某# (abundance) + 示 altar/the supernatural → *god of childbearing*; (imperial) *ritual/prayers for the conception of a child* (in particular, a male child/heir). The term is also connected with the beneficial effect of plums (the original sense of 某) for pregnant women; compare 梅.
tags:[]
___
kanji:夫
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ, フウ]
kunyomi:[おっと]
raw_etymology:A depiction of an outstretched male (compare 大 stand outstretched) with a topknot → *mature male* → *husband*. The most ancient pronunciation of this term was PA (compare 母).
tags:[]
___
kanji:扶

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 手 hand/action indicator → stretch/hold out the arms to *support* oneself or another person → *help*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:伯
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:人 person + 白# for the sound alone to simulate a monosyllabic term of address children would direct toward an older person of the approximate age of one's father → respected elder male → *eldest brother*; *count*; *earl*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:爸
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:父 father + 巴# for the sound alone to simulate a term of address directed toward a *father*. Compare the conjunction between the sound "pa" and the meaning "father" in many Indo-European languages.
tags:[]
___
kanji:芙
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 艸 grass/plant → *water lily* stretching over the surface of a pond → *lotus*. Compare 蓮.
tags:[]
___
kanji:趺
kanji_stroke_count:11
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 足 leg/foot → stretch the feet upon the thighs in sitting cross-legged → *sit cross-legged* (in the lotus position; compare 跏) → *top of the foot*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:麩
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[フ]
kunyomi:[ふ, ふすま]
raw_etymology:As per 夫# (stretch out/over) + 麥 barley/grain → *bran* spread flat upon a surface → *wheat gluten bread*. A variant form, 麸, substitutes 麦 for 麥.
tags:[]
___
kanji:喜
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[よろこ（ばしい・ばす・び・ぶ）]
raw_etymology:As per 壴# as described in 鼓 (round drum set on a stand) + 口 mouth → joyful voices at a feast with musical accompaniment → *joy*; *gladness*; *like*; *be fond of*; *pleasure*; *happiness* → *good*; *desirable*; *congratulations*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:嘻
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 喜# (emit a joyful voice) + 口 mouth → emit a *joyful voice* → *laugh*. *Interjection* (of lamentation) is a borrowed meaning. 嘻 was devised to replace 喜 after 喜 came to refer to joy and pleasure in general as opposed to joyful voices.
tags:[]
___

tags:[]

kanji:赫
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 赤# red (doubled) (roaring fire) → *flaming red*; *brilliant* → *bright(en)*; *illuminate*. The pronunciation of the character simulates a threatening roar, but the senses of "rage" and "threaten" are now conveyed by 嚇.
tags:[]
___
kanji:嚇
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 赫# (threaten) + 口 mouth → *threaten* as though brilliant flames were being emitted from the mouth. 嚇 was devised to replace 赫.
tags:[]

raw_etymology:A depiction of breath running up through the lungs and producing an *exclamation* as it leaves the mouth → *calling* → *questioning*.

kanji:吽
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウン, イン, コウ, ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:口 mouth + 牛# cow → (the sound made by a) *lowing* cow → *growl*. Later, 吽 was borrowed for a transliteration of the Sanskrit aum.
tags:[]
___
kanji:鴾
kanji_stroke_count:17
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ボウ, ム]
kunyomi:[とき]
raw_etymology:As per 牟# (lowing cow → lowing sound) + 鳥 bird → bird with a song/cry resembling the lowing of a cow. The compound 鴾母 refers to a quail; compare 鶉. In Japan, however, 鴾 can also refer to the crested ibis.
tags:[]
___
kanji:毄
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[キャク, ゲキ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:車# vehicle + an element that originally combined 殳 action indicator and a device connected to a wheel to lock it in position → force a vehicle to a halt → *hit* (← two parts hitting each other). Also, *link* (← connected/linked parts). The pronunciation of the character simulates the noise made by two hard objects in colliding.
tags:[]
___
kanji:擊
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:撃
shinjitai_stroke_count:15
onyomi:[ゲキ]
kunyomi:[う（つ）]
raw_etymology:The top element# is a variant of 毄 hit. 擊 adds 手 hand/action indicator → *hit*; *strike* → *attack*; *shoot/fire* (a gun).
tags:[]
___
kanji:繫
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ケイ]
kunyomi:[か（かる・ける）, つな（がる・ぐ）]
raw_etymology:Variant form# of 毄 link + 糸 thread → link/*connect* with thread, string or rope → *tie/fasten* (an object to) → *hang*; *be connected/involved*. Note a variant form, 繋.
tags:[]

___
kanji:虎
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[とら]
raw_etymology:A depiction of a *tiger*. The pronunciation of the character simulates a tiger's fierce roar. The classifier 虍 simplifies 虎 by eliminating the legs at the bottom. A variant form, 乕, appears in逓, the Shinjitai form of 遞.
tags:[]
___
kanji:琥

shinjitai:NONE

onyomi:[コ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:虎# tiger (→ pattern resembling tiger stripes and coloration) + 玉 jewel → jewel with a coloration and pattern resembling a tiger → *amber*. Also, by reinterpretation, a *jewel or utensil in the shape of a tiger*.
tags:[]

kanji:霍
kanji_stroke_count:16
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カク]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:靃 combines 隹 short, squat bird (doubled) + 雨 rain/natural phenomena → (the sound of) birds hurriedly taking flight in a sudden rainstorm → *quick*; (disappear) *suddenly*. 靃 has been supplanted by 霍, which eliminates one of the 隹 elements.
tags:[]

kanji:号
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ゴウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:丂 is an object that extends before bending (compare 于). 号 is口 mouth + 丂# both for the idea of bending and for the sound to simulate a cry or calling noise produced by bending the throat → *call*; *name* → *number*; *indicator*. In Japan, 号 is a Shinjitai (new character form) replacing 號.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ユウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:口 mouth + 幼# for the sound alone to simulate the *bleating of a deer*.

kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[オチ, オツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:口 mouth + 𥁕# as described in 温 for the sound alone to simulate a *choking* noise. Also, *laugh heartily* (← resemblance between the sound of choking and of unrestrained laughter).

kanji:叭
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ハ, ハツ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 八# (split right and left) + 口 mouth → exhale spurts of breath through both sides of the mouth. The compound 喇叭 refers to a trumpet.
tags:[]

tags:[]

kanji:喃
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ナン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:As per 南# (place inside) + 口 mouth → *speak indistinctly*; *mumble* → *chatter*. A variant form that is graphically unrelated, 娚, appears in the characters 嫐and 嬲 .
tags:[]
___
kanji:喇
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ラツ, ラ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:剌# chop wood (→ intense activity) + 口 mouth → rapid movement of the lips and/or facial muscles in playing a wind instrument (compare 篥) → *rapid speech*. 喇 was also used for transliterating Sanskrit terms.
tags:[]

kanji:欵

shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[ああ]

kanji:僧
kanji_stroke_count:13

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ソウ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:人 person + 曾# for the sound alone to express the initial syllable in the term 僧伽, the Chinese transliteration of the Sanskrit sangha (community of disciples) → (Buddhist) *priest/monk*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:靴
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ]
kunyomi:[くつ]
raw_etymology:化# + 革 leather. 靴 was devised to transliterate a word used by one northern Chinese tribe that referred to leather riding boots → *footwear*; *shoe*.
tags:[]

kanji:伽
kanji_stroke_count:7
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[カ, ガ, キャ]
kunyomi:[とぎ]
raw_etymology:人 + 加# to transliterate the –ga- sound such as in 伽藍 (temple/monastery). *Attend (upon)/keep another company* is via reinterpretation (person + join).
tags:[]

kunyomi:[うた, うた（う）]
raw_etymology:口 mouth + 貝# commodities, a character devised to transliterate the Sanskrit sound bha. (Traditional) *song* and *folksong* are via the compound 梵唄 *chant Buddhist texts*.

kanji:葡
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ブ, ホ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:艸 grass/plant + 匍# for the sound alone to transliterate the first syllable of a term thought to have originated in Persia and meaning grape (vine), transliterated into Chinese as 葡萄. *Portugal* is via the phonetic construction 葡萄牙.
tags:[]

kanji:爺
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヤ]
kunyomi:[じい, じじ, じじい, ちち]
raw_etymology:Originally, 父 father + 多# for the sound alone to transliterate an Altaic language term meaning *father* → *grandfather*; *old man*. Later, 多 was replaced by 耶#.

kanji:璃
kanji_stroke_count:15

onyomi:[リ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:玉 jewel + 离# for the sound alone to transliterate the final syllable of the Sanskrit vaidurya (lapis lazuli: 吠瑠璃). The compound 玻璃 refers to crystal and/or glass.缽 (11)　ハチ；ハツ　 Shinjitai　
tags:[]
___
kanji:鉢
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:缶 bulging earthenware jug/vase + what was originally not 本 but rather the right-hand element# of 肺, here for the sound alone to transliterate the first syllable of Sanskrit patra (bowl: 缽多羅), one traditionally transmitted from a Buddhist priest or monk to his successor → *earthenware bowl*; *alms bowl*. Also *pot* and *skull*, via shape association.
tags:[]
___

kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:風 wind + 具# to supply the sound note in giving written expression to a dialectal term referring to a *typhoon* (originating in the South China Sea).
tags:[]

kanji:瑪
kanji_stroke_count:14
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メ, バ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:馬# horse + 玉 jewel → precious stone the color of a horse's brain. The compound 瑪瑙 refers to agate/cornelian. Compare 碼.
tags:[]
___
kanji:碼
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[メ, バ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:馬# horse + 石 stone → precious stone the color of a horse's brain. The compound 碼碯 refers to agate/cornelian. Compare 瑪. *Yard* (unit of measurement equaling 91.44 cm) is a borrowed meaning.AppendixMade-in-Japan Characters
tags:[]
___
kanji:匁
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[もんめ]
raw_etymology:A hybrid of 文 and the katakana メ. A 文 (もん) was a coin of slight value used in the Edo Period. メ suggests a Japanese term meaning "graduation." 匁 was devised to convey the meaning "a *measure of weight* equivalent to that of a 文 coin" → (approximately 3.75 grams).
tags:[]
___
kanji:込
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[こ（み・む・める）]
raw_etymology:入 enter/put in + 辵 movement → *place inside* → *inclusion*; *mixture*; *crowdedness*. Also, *be intricate* (← mixture of elements), *load* (a gun) and *put one's heart into something*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:枠
kanji_stroke_count:8
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[わく]
raw_etymology:Unlike the use of 卆 in 卒 and in derivative characters based on 卒 that were devised in China, in the Japanese-devised 枠 it is intended to represent a spinning machine. 枠 adds 木 tree/wood → *frame* of a spinning machine → *limit*; *range*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:峠
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[とうげ]
raw_etymology:山 mountain + 上 above + 下 below → point where ascending and descending mountain paths meet → *mountain pass* → *peak*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:畑
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[はた, はたけ]
raw_etymology:火 fire + 田 field → burn off weeds and stalks in fields to render them fertile → *field*; *farm*. Also, *one's field of specialty* (← field in the figurative sense). Compare 畠.
tags:[]
___
kanji:塀
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ヘイ]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:屏 wall + 土 earth → earthen *wall* → *fence*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:働
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ドウ]
kunyomi:[はたら（き・く）]
raw_etymology:動 movement + 人 person → person in motion at *work/labor* → *do*; *workings*; *commit* (an act); *function*; *activity*; *action* → *effect* (← result of an action).
tags:[]
___
kanji:搾
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[サク]
kunyomi:[しぼ（る）]
raw_etymology:窄 narrow + 手 hand/action indicator → tighten narrowly in squeezing or compressing → *squeeze*; *wring*; *press*; *close tightly* → *grill/drill* (a person); *limit* (← narrow the possibilities).
tags:[]
___
kanji:匂
kanji_stroke_count:4
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[にお（う）]
raw_etymology:勹 here suggesting a bent arm + a cursive rendering of 二 (align) → line objects in a neat circle. *Fragrance*, *perfume*, *scent* and *brilliantly colored* are extended meanings (← harmonious ← well-balanced ← neat circle) → *shine brilliantly* (← brilliantly colored).
tags:[]
___
kanji:叺
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[かます]
raw_etymology:口 mouth (→ opening) + 入put in/enter → *straw bag*.
tags:[]

kanji:辷
kanji_stroke_count:5
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[すべ（る）]
raw_etymology:辵 movement + a horizontal line suggesting a level surface → proceed smoothly → *slide*; *glide* → *slip* → *fail* (an exam).
tags:[]

kanji:辻
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[つじ]
raw_etymology:十 here a shape indicator suggesting crossroads + 辵 movement → *crossing*; *crossroads*; *street corner* → *wayside*; *roadside*.
tags:[]

kanji:颪
kanji_stroke_count:12
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[おろし]
raw_etymology:風 wind + 下 down → (cold) *wind that blows down from the mountains*.

raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 風 wind + 巾 cloth → *kite*.

kanji:凩
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[こがらし]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 風 wind + 木 tree → *wintry wind* (that denudes trees of their autumn leaves).
tags:[]
___
kanji:凪
kanji_stroke_count:6
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[なぎ, な（ぐ）]
raw_etymology:An abbreviated form of 風 wind + 止 stop → a *lull* (← no wind); a *calm*.
tags:[]

___
kanji:糎
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[センチメートル]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:米 for the sound of メー as an abbreviated transliteration of the French "metre" (English "meter") + 厘. In the 尺貫法 （シャッカンホウ） measuring system Japan inherited from China 厘 represented 1/100 of a unit, so the combination of elements here creates the meaning *centimeter* (← small fraction of a meter).
tags:[]
___

tags:[]

kanji:瓰
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デシグラム]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:瓦 here an abbreviation for the phonetic construction 瓦蘭姆 (gram) + 分. In the 尺貫法 （シャッカンホウ） measuring system Japan inherited from China 分 represented 1/10 of a unit, so the combination of elements here creates the meaning *one decigram*.
tags:[]
___
kanji:瓱
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミリグラム]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:瓦 here an abbreviation for the phonetic construction 瓦蘭姆 (gram) + 毛. In the 尺貫法 （シャッカンホウ） measuring system Japan inherited from China 毫 (often abbreviated as 毛) represented 1/1000 of a unit, so the combination of elements here creates the meaning *one milligram* (= 0.001 gram).
tags:[]

kanji:縅
kanji_stroke_count:15
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[おどし, おど（す）]
raw_etymology:威 majesty + 糸 thread → *thread plates of armor* with thread or strips of leather; *plated armor* with the plates threaded together. *Majesty* is via both the original signification of 威 and on account of the homonym おどし.
tags:[]
___
kanji:繧
kanji_stroke_count:18
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ウン]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:A character combining 雲 cloud + 糸 thread. 繧 was devised to complement 繝 embroidered pattern in the compound 繧繝, the name for a method of dyeing that produces alternating layers of light and dark-colored fabric (a shading effect likened to cloudiness).
tags:[]
___
kanji:纐
kanji_stroke_count:21
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[コウ]
kunyomi:[はな]
raw_etymology:絞 wring + 頁 head. 纐 was devised to complement 纈 tie-dye in the compound 纐纈 *tie-dyeing* (← produce a tie-dye pattern by wringing the fabric during the dyeing process).
tags:[]
___

kanji:鮗

shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[このしろ]
raw_etymology:冬 winter + 魚 fish → *gizzard shad*, a fish considered (perhaps not entirely correctly) to be at its peak in winter. Compare 鰶.

___
kanji:栃
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[とち]
raw_etymology:栃 is a character with a particularly convoluted etymology. The variant form 杤 combines 木 tree/wood + 万 ten thousand. One element of traditional shrine and farmhouse architecture in Japan is a pair of crossing pieces of timber on the roof atop the respective ends of the ridgepole. This feature is designated ちぎ (千木), 千 and 木 being pronounced with their KUN readings ち and き (here in the voiced consonant form ぎ). As it happened, a shrine now located within the Tochigi castle precincts had such pairs of ちぎ. Appending the native Japanese term for ( と) yields とちぎ, while prefixing the character for ( 十) to 千木 yields 十千木. Read literally, the combination 十千 means "ten thousand," but in Han/Chinese characters ten thousand is written with the single character 万. Thus was devised the Made-in-Japan character 杤, retaining the 木 portion of 十千木 while replacing 十千 with 万. During the Meiji Era, however, 万 was superseded by the element seen in the left-hand side of 励, 栃 becoming the standard form of the character. As for the tree known as とち (short for とちのき), this is the (Japanese) *horse chestnut* (Aesculus turbinata). For horse chestnut, compare 橡, which also has the KUN reading とち.
tags:[]
___

shinjitai_stroke_count:0

kunyomi:[かすり]
raw_etymology:齊 arrange + 糸 thread → (fabric with a) *splashed pattern* (← neatly arranged pattern). 緕 is a variant form.
tags:[]

kanji:鶍
kanji_stroke_count:19
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[いすか]
raw_etymology:易 + 鳥 bird → *crossbill*. Here, 易 is apparently an adaption of the left-hand element of 鶪 (shrike, a bird superficially similar to a crossbill).
tags:[]

kanji:榁
kanji_stroke_count:13
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[]
kunyomi:[むろ]
raw_etymology:室 for the KUN reading むろ + 木 tree/wood → a variety of *Japanese cypress*. Another name for this tree is ねず, and the compound 杜松 can be read either むろ or ねず.

___
kanji:竕
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[デシリットル]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:立 (ON reading: リツ) for the sound of リ(ッ) as an abbreviated transliteration of "liter" ( リットル) + 分. In the 尺貫法 （シャッカンホウ） measuring system Japan inherited from China 分 represented 1/10 of a unit, so the combination of elements here creates the meaning one *deciliter*.
tags:[]
___

tags:[]
___
kanji:竓
kanji_stroke_count:9
shinjitai:NONE
shinjitai_stroke_count:0
onyomi:[ミリリットル]
kunyomi:[]
raw_etymology:立 (ON reading: リツ) for the sound of リ(ッ) as an abbreviated transliteration of "liter" ( リットル) + 毛. In the 尺貫法 （シャッカンホウ） measuring system Japan inherited from China 毫 (often abbreviated as 毛) represented 1/1000 of a unit, so the combination of elements here creates the meaning one *milliliter*.
tags:[]
